product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Nice round finish. The dark notes of caramel and raisins come through nicely.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle i directly got at the restaurant near the abbey, after first trying it there. Drinking on 26/07/2021 best before 18.05.24 according to cap. It pours a deep dark amber body, slightly reddish with large beige head. Aroma of malt, licorice, dried fruits, caramel, flowers, spices, yeast. Taste is elegant, deep and complex with a great sweetness, some cocoa, nuts, dried fruits, plums, spices, vanilla, licorice notes, balanced by a moderate bitter and warming finish, which is where i can mostly feel the high abv, in a fantastic way. Full bodied, gives a creamy mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. Delivers on every possible aspect, after savouring and sipping it for a while you still want more of that unique taste. What a trip and pleasure this beer is. For me, the way this style should be made, and also i don't think I ever tasted such a well made and refined beer in this way.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Light brown, light brown/beige foam, normal carbonation, nuts, nougat, caramel, elegant, alcohol warmth, round bodied, residual sugar. An elegant dark and strong ale. Long after taste.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: This beer is all about aromas. Belgian yeast, dried fruit, ethers. Appearance isn't it's strongest point. Missing some head. Full smooth mouth feel. Dried fruit flavors.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 33 CL bottle bought speciaalbierpakket.nl, shared with family. Cloudy brown color with a fine brown head. Aromas of caramel, yeast, banana, dried fruits. Creamy texture, medium carbonation, alcoholic. Notes of dried fruits, banana, toasted caramel, yeast. Long finish on caramel.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Slightly hazy red-brown with a good and lasting tan head. Great lacing.
Aroma: Malt: Caramel, honey, raisins, milk chokolate. Esters: Pear, ripe apples, fig. As well as a hint of fruity hops. Aroma is complex but not powerful.
Mouth: Sweet with also a dark fruitiness and a delicate bitterness towards the end. Full body, low/medium carbonation.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Look: Pours almost clear coke brown with a medium lasting tan head. Nose: Roasted bread, a little yeast, dark berries, plum. Taste: Caramel, burned sugar, roasted bread, a little overripe fruit,  dry not much bitterness. Alcohol well hidden. Overall: The most interresting of the Westvleteren I've had - a balanced but complex beer, though I miss a little more action in nose.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 2014 version dark amber color essential effervescence. On the nose it presents notes of dates and chinotto with dusty nuances of cellar. On the palate, despite the years, the bitter characteristics alternate with caramelized traits until reaching licorice and leather. It is an experiment, savoring a beer in the evolution of time

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Nervously drinking this a tad, knowing how highly it is thought of - and it is undoubtedly a fine beer, maybe just not quite as stratospheric for me as others. Pours a slightly muddy mahogany with a bubbly off-white / beige head, and an aroma of dark fruit and a hint of molasses. The taste is sweet and malty, with some fruity undertones, all mellowing out in the finish to leave a dry leathery sensation

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330 ml beer poured at home. Poured into my Westvleteren Trappist glass. Pours hazy caramel brown with a sticky off white head. Smells like brown bread, caramel malt, molasses and dark dried fruit. Taste is sweet and sticks around with bready notes, dates, some Belgian yeast and a bit of alcohol. Slight bitter finish. Cost a pretty penny to get this bottle but Iâ€™m glad I did it!  Iâ€™m a Westy now!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: People want to claim that the Sint Bernardus Abt 12 is comparable... I absolutely do NOT agree, tastes differ fortunately, but this beer, unlike the Sint Bernardus, sticks to the inside of your cheeks after every sip and is much fuller in body in taste and smell, which makes it flow out much longer with the characteristic malt, caramel, coffee and toffee flavours. It is the cult status that contributes to the fact that this beer should definitely be drunk by every beer lover at least once, nonsense of course... people who do not like the Quadruppel type will not like this either because it is Westvleteren, and the availability is still RUDE. If it is available, it is sold to third parties for exorbitant prices, which is not allowed by the Cistercians. Those stubborn monks should not whine, just commercialise it, and make a lot of poor people happy with the profit, two birds with one stone... I myself would not call this the best beer in the world, but just good. And that is good enough.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Brown color, ruby â€‹â€‹under strong light. Cloudy. Low foam, fine and medium bubbles, after some time reduced to a large ring.

There are also delicate notes of bread, hops, yeast. Slightly malty.

Complex taste. Perceptible cereal coffee, dried fruit and raisins. Alcohol hidden in the taste, after a few sips it warms up slightly. Quite high carbonation, but it does not bite, does not tire. Low bitterness. Drinkable and feels light for its parameters. It is not one of the best beers in the world, but good.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark red/brown with a light beige full head. Light metallic taste noticeable. But otherwise full aromatic and full of taste. Flavours of caramel, red fruit and coffee. Also candy sugar noticeable. Sweet in attack that subtly ebbs away. Very tasty.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark and burned malt, sweet and smooth. Not the easiest beer to get hold of but worth the wait. Perfect in every possible way!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark yellow-brown with at off white head that remains as a surface till the end. Aroma of burned malt and honny. Creamy moutfeel. Tast dried fruit and honny with  heavy burned malt. Exelent beer, could'nt be better.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Found out of bottle from a store in Rybnik, Poland.  Pours a dark brown/caramel color. Subtle but enjoyable aroma. Flavor has a touch of honey and oak. Certainly delicious.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Ar: honey, sugar, yeast, raisins Ap: dark brown, creamy long lasting head T: med fruity sweetness, long finish P: med/full body, thick texture

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Ruby, burgundy with abundant foam, which quickly disappears.

In the aroma dried fruit, caramel, notes of honey, molasses.

In the taste the same and slightly chocolatey. Alcohol not noticeable at all.

Good, without fireworks. But not at this price.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Does absolutely everything a beer should, and for the quantities it is produced in, and the lengths to get it done consistently, is testament to how every beer lover must make the pilgrimage to Abdij St. Sixtus to acquire a case of this, and subsequently go to one's grave knowing the greatest beer ever produced by a man passed your lips.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown with a red tinge and light beige foam. Aroma bread ground dark fruits. Taste chocolate ground licorice. Well balanced beer that doesn't feel as strong as it is. Good beer.  3000/10000 Hamna o Bier

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma; bread malts, very nice fruit, juiced n moderated hops, yeast. Look; beige head on a veiled dark brown mahoganish body. Taste; fruity malt, grape in da bread, fruity syrup, caramel, roasted n fermented malts, and finish is excellent. Feel; full body n soft coÂ². Overall; it`s top score, no booze, top balance. [thnx2 Mads, bottle T@Hamna&Bier, celebrating 3000 beers for Lmojoh and 10k for DjOeye]

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very good beer.  Smooth, but not as complex as other beers that I enjoy a little more.  Expected more.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
[Tasting - Viborg]

[4 years aged from bottle date]

Aroma: Rich dark fruits, dates, plums, raisins, mild spices, brown sugar and caramel

Appearance: Hazy amber brown with a huge fast disappearing white head

Taste: Moderately sweet and bitter, dates, plums, raisins, mild spices, brown sugar and caramel

Mouthfeel: Watery-oily mouthfeel with moderate carbonation

Overall: The carbonation holds up quite well after 4 years! Nice complex and easy drinking beer! Will make a new rating when get a fresher bottle!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
#StayAtHome. Cloudy, brownish color and a nice off-white head. Creamy, caramel and toffee nose. Wonderful dried fruits and maltyness. Like that boozy touch.

Sensory Session #43: Old against young. bbf 21.4.19. Quick dissapearing, tiny head, nose is sweet, malty honey, molasse. Sweeter than the 2020, less carbonated , caramel and honey-fruity, dryish, bitter herbal hops as is gets warmer. 

Sensory Session #43: Old against young. [Right] bbf 14.8.23. Nose starts restrained, thick off-white head. Red berries, caramel, Biskuit, herbal-malty, nice hops and a good carbonation

[2014, bbf 2017] Herbaceaus, malty-toffe nose faint dried fruits. Taste is strong,malty, caramel, dried fruits, pleasant mouthfeeling. Warming.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: I FINALLY FOUND ONE!  THIS IS IT!!!!!  HERE WE GO!!!!!!!!!!  Appearance: dark with enormous head that lasts and lasts, and leaves huge splotches on the glass that can still be found long afterward.  Wondrous!  Aroma: coca cola, dark fruits, yeast, brown sugar, booze.  Gets more pungent as it sits; let it wait a bit so you can get the full effects.  Taste: don't need to wait here at all -- immediately there's in-your-face malt, booze, dark fruit, bread, sourness.  Brown sugars come in the more it sits.  The taste is really explosive; close to Rochefort, but much more acerbic with more yeast and a little less of the dark fruits.  Easily the strongest of the quads; it hits the mouth hard and leaves long lasting effects.  It is truly a wonder, worth finding and paying the big bucks for.  This and KBS are my only perfect 5 beers among my 1,000+ ratings.  All Belgian beer fans MUST find and try!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
color: dark brown, cloudy
foam: quickly falls to a ring
taste: sweet
aroma: milk chocolate, phenols, alcohol
carbonation: medium
bitterness: low

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Well, Belgiums pride and joy indeed.
It is a very very good beer, but for me not the best ever... Did a head to head once with St.Bernardus abt 12 and they are indeed very similar but not exactly thesame in my opinion.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Festival from start to finish. â‚¬13 per 33 cl bottle, which you don't remember once you've taken the first sip. Ripe fruit and lots of nuances...

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Aroma: Deep, complex, spicy. fruity.

Taste: An arsenal of dried dark fruits, figs, sour cherries, dates, moscovado sugars, everything very well integrated. Nice development. Warming. Rounded.

Taste like it's homemade by someone really passionate about beer.

I cant give it top marks, because it is too expensive for what it can give you, but it's the law of supply and demand, I guess.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Brown in color, with distinct reflections. Quite abundant foam, settles on the glass. In the aroma a lot of honey, dried fruit, you can feel more expensive alcohol and caramel. In the taste also very caramelly and syrupy. These dried fruits also come through. The beer is extremely smooth, immediately warms up strongly in the gullet. You can feel the noble alcohol also in the taste. Very pleasant, for a long evening.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: # 2137; 7/2020. Rich sweet malty aroma, alcohol, sour cherries, light spicy, caramely, fruitty esters (dried plum, sour cherry, raisin). Copper-brown, hazy body; creamy, tany head. Rich, malty, fruitty (dried fruit), spicy, light alcohol warmth; very well balanced and harmonius. Excellent beer, dangerously drinkable... 0,3 l, bottle, beershop, Prague.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Beautiful bottle, probably about 3 years old. Pours dark brown, couple of cm of white head which subsides a bit but lasts the distance. Aroma complex, dark fruit, yeast and a hint of burnt sugar. By now the beer is wonderfully smooth, fruity yeast, vinous notes, rich array of flavours on the tongue. When you are considered one of, if not the, very best accusations that you are overrated are bound to follow. Unfair in this case. Iâ€˜be experienced this beer several times but this was a revelation.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Winter, spring, summer, autumn, whatever the season this beer is a nectar. A very good balance with freshness, hops, mouth feel and length. After one year or three years or more, we discover this beer again. Compote, fig, delicated spices are mainfully what I feel and taste. Very nice Trappist

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle straight from the monastery, thx A.! This definitely was too fresh but after 6-10minthsxminimum cellar aging it finally came together nicely. Classical Belgian flavors full of fruity esters and malty rich backbone, aging integrates the alcohol and itâ€™s not boozy, barely warming, dried apricots, faint figs, feels pretty thick and rich, simply a delicious and rich monastery beer and I just prefer the original over the knockoffs.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma is sweet, dark fruits, plums, liquorice. Taste is sweet, plums, liquorice, booze. Best quad so far, waited 4 hours to order 3 crates on their website. Worth the time!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Sweet malt. Yeasty esters. Lovely Belgian ale that is very humble considering its reputation.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Did not have the occasion to drink this beer for a few years.  But the moment you take a first sip of this nectar... you instantly remember what the taste is like and you know why this beer was voted "best beer of the world"...Period.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
This beer was one dream for me and i try very hard to get one bottle without travel in Belgium. So before tried this unique beer i get the "St bernardus 12" because people said these two beers had the same recipe and are very similar. So i want to say to them :Its not the same beers. The difference are massive.
If we clear that lets go to the review.
When i open the beer one punchy full of flavors aroma fill my roam from nowhere. The aroma cover my entire room for fun. But the most shock thing wasent the aroma but the taste. When the beer touch my mouth, it bites my tongue and cover my entire mouth with insane flavors that i never had again. I had feel the same thing only once from "Rochefort 10" that also bites your tongue and your mouth very aggressive. But "Westvleteren 12" do that more aggressively. The beer has the best mouthfeel i ever get from anything in my life. 
The taste is so complex and so unique. The beer is very sweet and at the same time bitter with a lot of caramel, chocolate, fruity notes. And the finish it has 3 long directions. In the beginning it gives you one aggressive and punchy bitterness and in some secs that become sweet and again it change in some warm bitterness at the end. Really i cant described that. The feeling was mind blowing. The carboration is little high for one "Quadrupel" beer but it stick perfectly here.
Overall the best beer i have get/tried today. No because is the best on paper but because its the best for me. Simply the beer is a real monster. The most complex and unique beer i have tried for sure!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Pours brown, small head.
Nose shows fig, Brown sugar, golden syrup, pears, peppery notes, fairy floss, caramel.
Flavours include more golden syrup, rosewater, Brown sugar, soft booze.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Chestnut, caramel, burnt fudge, light coffee. Malty, sweet, full bodied and complex.So many beautiful flavors in perfect harmony and balance.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330ml (10.2%) at home on 24 Apr 2020, present from Craig Garvie several years ago: woody, caramel, ethanol aroma, deep brown, ruby tint, thin beige head, no lacing, fruity, woody, caramel flavour, viscous, smooth, very sweet, no alcohol burn.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: When I was young I did drink this beer almost every week. You could still buy as many crates as you liked. Now it became a kind of cult, phone the beer line, pay in advance etc. It's a great beer, but not in my top 20. I live the first impression full body, light sweet but not too sweet. I can't really describe it, but the after tastes reminds me vaguely about fermantated/ too ripe banana and that spoils it for me. The banana taste is also present in Stift Engelszell Gregorius Trappistenbier, one of the most disappointing Trappist beers. Most beers in my top 10 are at least 200 years on the market and all new Trappist beers lack something. St. Berbardus Abt 12 is in my opinion a good alternative if you like the aftertaste of Westvleteren 12 and the story that the yeast was stolen could be true. Both beers have a unique after taste...

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Dark garnet to very dark brown in colour, cloudy, almost opaque. Beige foam more than three fingers thick and impeccable retention. Medium-intense aroma, red wine, hay and straw when served, when tempered, plums, grapes and even figs halfway to becoming raisins appear, there are also notes of banana and, to a lesser extent, strawberries, finally, typical spicy notes of the style such as cinnamon and cloves are intuited. Slightly more intense flavour, in the aroma line we start with vinous sensations and slightly smoky wood, move on to liquorice and light dark fruits and finish with spicy and very slightly liquorish notes, medium finish, fruity and slightly herbal bitterness, alcohol slightly present although very well integrated. Semi-oily texture, becoming a little sticky in the last sips. Medium-high carbonation at first, although it calms down quickly until it becomes medium-low. 

A spectacle, complex and full of nuances that evolve throughout the drink, impossible to get tired of. Of course, you have to keep an eye out for offers so you can repeat, the price is prohibitive.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A cool beer, although nothing special stands out. The aroma is caramel, molasses, dried fruit, a bit like cereal coffee. The taste is similar. The only advantage is that you can't taste the alcohol at all. In today's times it's simply good. I recommend it.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
An incredible experience, almost like a smooth dark whiskey.
If your lucky to get your hands on it, I hope you truly understand the small intricate notes of all sorts of flavour.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: I wanted to drink this beer a few years ago at the beginning of entering the world of craft and on the one hand, it had to be done because today it doesn't blow your mind and this is how I imagined the beer that was considered the best in the world for so long, on the other hand, a more intoxicated person has drunk some quadruplet so he knows what to expect, beer is a determinant of style and it's good to pass on it.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Hard to compare to any style, it doesn't resemble any other beer I've had before, slender and smooth, tastes like caramel? no alcohol taste at all, warms up after a while.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle (10/2/15) pour in trade with Johnnnniee--thanks for the opportunity, John! Appearance is murky, opaque dark brown with lots of sediment in suspension, nice sparkle at the edges of the glass, fizzy, ephemeral beige head with no lacing. Aroma is strong mix of sweet fruits including cherry, plum and fig, spice, caramel malts and mild alcohol. Taste follows aroma with mild tart fruit to go along with the sweet. Mouthfeel is light side of light-to-medium bodied with thin, frothy texture, average carbonation, pleasant esophageal alcohol warmth, and finish as taste. Overall, the look and feel do nothing for me but the aroma and taste are both very good. Not the transcendent experience I was anticipating but I enjoyed it.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark, with a smoky look. The smell is sweet, malty. A little chocolatey, sweet, malty. Strong alcohol warms you up.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Great but not life alerting. Chocolate and coffee without being a stout. Not too heavy either.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bought in Oct.2018, opened in Feb, 2020
Aroma: pear, apple, some dark dried fruit, caramel
Appearance: hazy dark amber to copper color with a massive lasting beige to tan head.
Taste: pear, apple, some dried dark fruit, caramel, medium-high sweetness, medium bitterness
Palate: medium-full body, medium consistency, medium dryness, medium alcohol sensation
Overall: Everything is in line with a Belgian quadrupel, don't expect any surprising flavor. But actually, the best part of this beer is its perfect balance and gentleness where non of the Belgian fruity ester, dryness, carbonation, malty character is over-expressing. The drinkability remains good even it returns to room temperature. Great.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown with notes of sweet raisins, caramel, dark fruits. Has some spice and honey flavored raisin notes. Semi sweet, light bitter and warm on the finish.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottle. Dark brown color with medium sized beige head, very creamy, lasting just very thin. Aroma is candied sugar, dark fruits, plum, dates, figs, some licorice, dark malts. Taste is very rich, candied sugar, chocolate, dried fruits, notes reminding maybe Port wine, spices. Finish is more on the sweet side, but the balance is perfect for me. Carbonation is quite low, lower than a St. Bernardus Abt 12. Alcohol very well hidden.
I don't know if it's better than a Rochefort 10, maybe yes because I prefer its lower carbonation. The only negative thing are the prices except at the Abbey. I am waiting to try an older version of it now.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Amazing head. Amazing aroma, sweet biscuits. The flavor is plummy, not too sweet, perfect mix of bitterness and mild astringency at the end. Very complex with lots of yeast notes.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Copenhagen 10/6 2018. 33 cl bottle from Den Belgiske Ã˜lbutik, VanlÃ¸se. Nondescript bottle with no label. All information on the Golden Cap including the ABV and the Shield of St. Sixtus with a Palm Tree. 

Pours murky and hazy deep brown with big off-white head. Settles as 1 cm thick layer of foam sloping gently over the center of the glass. Moderate lacing. 

Aroma is sweetish, potent and with more than a hint of alcohol. Humid basement, light banana, caramel, raisins, hints of vanilla, woody alcoholic oak. Gets even more potent as the beer warms up. 

Soft carbonation. Medium thick smooth texture. A little sticky. 

Flavor has strong sweetness followed by and balanced by rather strong bitterness. Aftertaste is dense and sweet with bitter notes. Light alcoholic burn. 

Very fine elegant Quadrupe. Boozy without being brutal, discrete yet intense. The only thing I can complain about is that the bottle is so small.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Surely One of the Best beers i tried.. Fantastic aftertaste .. Strong Wooden Aromas.. Could be compared too oak matured wine.. Great beer, for the ones who still need to try this unique westie, have a look on: westvleterenshop.com ... Great value for what you get! Enjoye!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Brown head, nice, big bubble head. Aroma of red and dark fruits, caramel, spices, flowers. Sweet, complex and intensive taste. Caramel, spices, red fruits, flowers. Belgian taste. Medium carbonation, medium bitterness. Tasty but overhyped.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Shared 11.2 oz. (2019) bottle poured to a snifter showing a lightly hazed, amber/brown color, with a presentable layer of off white/tan froth. The nose was dried & dark fruit, caramel/malt sweetness, and Belgian spice. Medium+ bodied, with rather lively effervescence, and booze to match, the taste was similar notes, adding appropriate bitterness, resulting in a fairly well balanced Quad. (1/11/20)
Shared another 11.2 oz. bottle that was a 2012 version, with a bit more diversity to the fruit as added fig & date. The body seemed a little lighter, and carbonation was a bit milder, with decent alcohol presence, a touch of vanilla, and some added earthiness to the bitterness. Cellared extremely well. +.2 for consistency & balance.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma nothing. Better in taste than in aroma and better than 6 and 8 a moment ago. Very mild, smooth. I understand why people like it so much globally, but personally I don't know how many years I would have to go back in beer to write with delight. A bit of red wine. Empty and watery. 3.7

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma of caramel, coffee, malt. Beautiful dark chestnut brown color. Nice foam. Great taste of coffee, caramel with a slight bitterness. Nice fullness. My best beer to date.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: In the aroma caramel, nuts, chocolate. Brown color, nice foam. In the taste slim, light chocolate, caramel. Perfect balance between dryness and sweetness. Slightly astringent on the finish. Cool but definitely overhyped.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: So long-awaited and desired... Westvlateren 12. Few are ready to pay more than 1k rubles for a bottle of 0.33.. but the interest to evaluate such an interesting beer turned out to be more expensive. Unfortunately, expectations did not justify themselves... A solid quadrupel, but nothing more... The aftertaste is quite short-lived. The only difference that could distinguish it from competitors is a soft feeling of degree..

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Hazy brown color, beige head, aroma of caramel and dried fruits, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium carbonation, medium body, complex, excellent beer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330ml bottle at home via NL (thanks Vri!).  Excited to finally try this, itâ€™s a three-year old, bottled 11/16.  Deep mahogany with a foamy beige head and good lacing.  Raisins, plums, cherries, nuts, toffee, dark bread, brown sugar, sweet malt.  Medium soft carb, medium-full body, beautifully smooth texture.  With all that, itâ€™s still super-easy drinking with dangerously sneaky ABV.  Just delicious.  First beer of the new decade - itâ€™s all downhill from here.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: What is there to say about this one that hasnâ€™t already been said? This is what Belgian beers should be. Itâ€™s not overrated. Great smell and very smooth on the pallet.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle from 7,000 Jars of Beer, Kingston. Rich earthy nutty dark fruit aroma, with perfume in the tail. Opaque chestnut. Thick foamy beige head. Sweet with a sour edge to it. Spice. The booze then comes through in the finish. Thick bodied. Creamy. Fizzy carbonation. Long astringent. I know this is supposed to be amongst the best of the best but this sory of sweetness and spice does not particularly do it for me. It's an interesting beer but all a bit much and not one to session. Albeit once I'd sat here sipping it and it warmed up it seemed to smooth out. One to contemplate.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Best beer ever. I never discoverd a beer with this kind of taste. Wonderful.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Very strong scent of raisins, accompanied by malty caramel aromas.
Light bodied beer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Extremely distinctly spicy, estery and full of sweet dried fruit. Very intense, with a slight alcohol on the finish, full, practically not saturated. Characteristics of course of typical strong Belgians, especially towards the aforementioned esters. Very strongly working yeast. Clear sweetness, but the beer is at most semi-sweet, or even semi-dry. Very intense, several levels emerge in the taste, complex, interesting and tasty.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330 ml bottle. Dark brown colour, small head with good durability, partly lacing, lively carbonation. Nose is malty, walnuts, chestnuts, dried plums. Flavour is medium sweet, light to medium bitter, caramel, raisins, walnuts. Well balanced, perfect creamy mouthfeel, good drinkability despite the high ABV. A great beer for sure.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Drank one bottle in Belgium, and one in Norway. This beer is impressively well balanced. There is a sweetness to it that is firmly present, but at the same time mild in flavor. The beer hits all the buttons: it is fresh and light, but also full of flavor and has a long aftertaste. The aromas bring thoughts of honey and mead, while the tasting notes are full of cocoa and caramel. The warmth of the alcohol, which is at a notable 10 %, emphasizes the intensity of the sweet aromas. A very pleasant beer that is easy to drink, and which could convert many that are not too fond of darker beers.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 0.33l bottle from armando. Dark brown body, beige head, moderately persistent. Aromas of dried red fruits. Later mild cocoa and a smoky character also appears. Taste is dominantly malty/sweet and very complex. Nuts, dried fruits, a bit of caramel, roasted malt, a hint of smoked malt. Aftertaste is very mild on the bitter side. Moderate carbonation, mouthfeel starts with a fizzy outburst and then softens into mildness. Fairly strong alcohol, but still surprisingly light body for a 10+% ale. Complex, yet harmonic. Surely among the best beers I have ever tasted.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: In the aroma raisins, plums. In the taste also dried fruits, delicate coffee. Unfortunately a bit too alcoholic aftertaste.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A magnificent quadruple! Dark, brown-red color and a modest head. Smell: red fruits with some citric fruits and subtle aromas of laurel and caramel. Taste: liquorice and dark chocolate. Some earthy, ashy notes as wel. Nice, red fruits sweetness, subtle hops but no pronounced bitterness. Full body. Smooth, vanilla and caramel finish, pleasantly lingering in the aftertaste. Very nicely balanced. Absolutely beautiful! It totally lives up to the expectation.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: In the glass, a very dark beer with a thin layer of off-white foam. Intense and very complex aroma, with ripe fruit such as plums, figs and pears, spices such as cinnamon and cloves, cereal grains, straw, yeast, bread, and a hint of chocolate. In the mouth, a thick and slightly oily texture, with low carbonation and almost non-existent bitterness. There are flavours of caramelised cereals, some chocolate, plums, figs, a lot of cinnamon sticks, bread, cake, yeast, and a final alcoholic background. Speechless. It lives up to its name and its fame. Without a doubt, the best Quadrupel there is. Very complex and perfectly integrated aroma and flavour, with an explosion that stimulates both taste and aroma. Although expensive, it is a beer that must be tried at least once in a lifetime.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: There was a lot of beer drunk in its time. historical opinion and assessment from memory.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330ml bottle in 2012. Still one of my favourites (I know - Iâ€™m a walking cliche...). A very deep brown with a dense beige head. Aroma is huge and full with dark fruit, yeasty esters, malt, rye bread, raisins, prunes, dates, cinnamon, cloves and a hint of something almost meaty. Fantastic body. Smooth and incredibly big flavour. Loads of complexity and just so dang moreish!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: The bottle is over 4 years old. The foam falls to zero rather quickly. The aroma is mainly dried fruit, a bit of homemade wine, fresher grapes, a bit of malt of a rather bread-like type. While the aroma seems nice and complex, the beer is rather poor in taste - dry, sour, quite winey, estery. In addition, it warms a bit with alcohol on the finish. A big disappointment, although it may be a matter of over-aging.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Surprise yourself. I'm not a big fan of dark beers. And this one is delicious.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle. Cloudy brown with a beige foam. Aromas of dried fruit, caramel and chocolate. Flavor notes of dried fruit, chocolate, leather, caramelized sugar and spices. Nicely composed and balanced. Medium body.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottle. 5/2/22 date. Appearance:  Dark murky brown with a light hint of ruby red. Minimal light khaki head. 
Aroma:  Alcohol, chocolate, toasted bread, and dark fruit, namely raisin. 
Taste:  Rich, super sweet maltiness, with strong brown sugar and toasted bread notes. Minimal bitterness is just enough to prevent the sweetness from being cloying. Raisin and tobacco notes come through on the back end. 
Mouthfeel:  Medium bodied with a biting carbonation. 
Finish:  Malt forward, but has a surprising amount of bitterness thatâ€™s sticky on the tongue. Brown sugar, molasses, and raisin all linger. 
Overall:  Rarely do beers live up to the hype, but this is truly a world class beer, even within a rich, complex style with plenty of great examples. Drinks surprisingly easy for a beer this complex and rich in maltiness. So many layers of flavor, all well rounded and smooth

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Not going to review this beer. So obvious when you taste this absolute gem. Try it yourself, if you can get it.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A discovery from the bottom of my cellar. BBE 8/2011 so quite appropriately aged. Pours clear chestnut brown. Nose of spice, raisin, dust, herbs, a hint is brown sugar. Herbs, molasses, more of the dust. Medium body with a wife bouquet and just a hint of sourness. Sweet and sticky. Surprisingly better than the ones I had 2 years ago from the same batch.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Well, the hype is real.
Trying to put away the external factors when tasting/evaluating this beer is difficult, because they are an integral part of the experience. Its relative exclusivity, the confirmation bias that comes with the huge undertaking of buying this beer at the abbey, the feel of the place, the low-key bottle (oh, how I love the unblemished trappist bottle where the cap holds all the information), the crate and last but not least, the ratings and reviews - the hype.
 
The appearance is immaculate. The color of the beer and the look and feel of the foam are just... right. In the Westvleteren glass it looks almost understated, yet oh so inviting. 
The smell is understated too, maybe a tad too much, as when I first smelled it my stomach wrenched in worry that it would not deliver as promised. 

Well, it does deliver. It really, really does. 
Trying to describe the taste in detail is a bit meaningless for me, it is too complex. It has many of the tastes you expect from a dark trappist, dark fruits, nuts and all that other nonsense which I am not good at describing, but what sets this one apart from the rest of the trappists, and other belgian triples and quadruples for that matter, is a taste I can best describe as a soft bitterness. But its not really soft either, its there, and it fits so ... again, right. It gives the beer a dimension I have not experienced in other of its kind.

Either way. I realize I could never shake off my aforementioned confirmation bias, but hopefully the description of my experience could convince you to try it, as the hype is most definitely real.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Superb dark amber color, quite alcoholic nose then in the mouth, it's toffee and marzipan, it's round and it's delicious, although originally I don't like this type of beer but here it's very good!!!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: I was expecting more of an aroma, as I feel it's not a particularly intense one. Still quite good anyway, with notes of dried fruit, marzipan, toffee, licorice and liquor. Pours dark brown with a nice, thick, light beige head. Taste is mostly sweet and fills your mouth. Slightly too carbonated in my opinion, but it's still a nice mouthfeel, neither too thick nor too watery. Aftertaste is pretty intense, boozy, with a sweetness that lingers for a while. Pairs well with dried fruit, nuts and chocolate. While I do think it's a very good beer, I also feel like it's not THAT good and it's fame is due mostly to how difficult it used to be to find a bottle (I don't think that's the case anymore). That aside and based only on the quality of the beer, the price I payed is not justified, but as a one time occasion I guess it's worth it.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
A special beer for a special occasion. Drank it on my birthday with my friends alongside some hard old cheese, nice combination.
The beer itself is hard to taste without having in mind that it's supposed to be one of the best beers in the world. It's good for sure, but I don't know if it's the best I've ever had. To sum it up. Looks great, smells OK, tastes great.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown colour with hazy and a bit brownish yellow foam on top.  Great wooden smell. Surprising contrast in your mouth. Great bitterness on the tongue that comes from 10,2 abv and on the other hand strong sweetness. Really strong beer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Tasted at the abbey it always remains an example of excellent Belgian abbey beer

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: No, very nice. Smooth, aromatic, drinkable and in addition you can't feel the alcohol. It only comes out in the gullet. Definitely a plus.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Incredible taste!!! Not quite a coffee taste but close to it. One of these bad boys cost me $30. I would definitely drink this again! I would travel to Belgium just to Drink this again! Awesome beer!!!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle at Au Bon Vieux Temps in Brussels. Very dark with a cream colored head. Dark fruit, toasted caramel, brown sugar. Moderately sweet, well hidden booze, yeasty and a little bitter. Lightly carbonated. Excellent. So many quads are too sweet, too boozy, etc. the beauty here is full flavor with perfect balance.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma is mixed fruits, somewhat sweet. Taste is absolutely incredible. An explosion of complex fruits and flavors. Quite expensive bottle but absolutely worth it (18â‚¬). Westvleteren X12 and Rochefort 10 are both in a tie in my opinion. two of my all time favorites.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown beer with a large Mocha head. A slightly sweet taste of caramel and a slightly bitter aftertaste of roasted coffee beans

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Brown with nice foam. Spices, noble alcohol and some melanoidins in the aroma. Sweet but not heavy. Quite strongly saturated. Alcohol warms a lot, but is well-composed. The taste is dominated by sharp, but not excessive, phenolism. It is a pleasure to drink, but does not impress with exceptional complexity.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Vanilla, salty liquorice, caramel. Long lingering aftertaste, very drinkable, considering the alcohol.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bought this on a restaurant in Copenhagen in 2004.11 dollars. Perfekt experience

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Dark brown with a frothy beige head.
Smell of chocolate and brown rum. In taste a very smooth quadrupel with spicy notes. Medium carbonation. Aftertaste like having drunk a brandy.
An excellent quadrupel, but I prefer the plain blonde from that brewery.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Supertasty, dark delicious and complex quad. Massive maltdrive, lots of caramel/toffee.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: It's hard to believe that such a good beer can be made with just pilsner malt, pale ale and candy sugar!!!!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Sweet dark beer, with notes of caramel. Would definitely recommend, though it is a bit pricey.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 2019.08.23. 2nd approach, 2nd disappointment. Either W12 is not the same, or it is not my style, or I am not mature enough, or W12 is terribly overrated. Four only for the name.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Drank this with my now dead buddy in Gouda. Rest in peace bro. Great beer. Can't remember the exact taste, but it was complex and it was good.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Drunk in the bottle. It is considered one of the best beers in the world. And in fact it is very good.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle from Bierwinkel.  Dark red brown, clear with thick and persistent beige head.  Woody malt aroma.  First honey malt sweetness, some floral and waxy notes.  Smooth finish with plenty of alcohol coming through. Very solid despite the hype and the monastic aura. Glad to get the chance towards the end of my NL run.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Best beer I've ever had! Small bubbles and a full flavor make the beer round and nice without an alcoholic taste.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Rated 4.8 a year ago. Now recently bought 2 containers in December 2020. Was a bit disappointing. Color: dark brown with a red glow when you put it in the light. The foam disappears very quickly. 
Taste: sweet, fruity, slightly spicy and caramel. The taste lingers for a long time. 

I also bought 2 containers the year before and found that the taste was much better then. Big difference with now

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown, clear with a nice beige head. Very delicate red dried fruit and caramel in the aroma. Dried fruit, cherries, caramel in the taste, maybe even a bit of milk chocolate. Very nice body, low carbonation. Alcohol well hidden, warming. Very good, but the legend is too big...

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Fantastic fine foam that lifts the taste. Long, aromatic aftertaste. A spiritual experience. If this is beer, I like beer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Dark brown colour with HUGE tan head.
Malty/bready aroma.
Sweet malty boozy palate.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
A very nice trappist.
Rich smoke aroma chocolate malt.
Licorice fermentation makes it special.
Very bad foam balance.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: It is indeed a wonderful beer. Nice finish - a great trappist ale. A true definition of quadruple.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 0.33l bottle. Aroma: caramel, dried fruit, light chocolate, malty, candy. Dark copper color, long lasting beige head, high carbonation, full body. Taste: honey, caramel, red dried fruit, toasted bread, spicy.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma: sweet toffee, caramel, prunes, red wine. Pours mahogany with a massive frothy head, quite lively carbonation. In taste dark fruit, caramel, wood, nuts, moderate bitterness, hint of alcohol which feels appropriate and I'd call a bit rum-like, some phenols/cloves in finish.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Definitely the best beer I've had in my 50 years of life. An amazing taste, berries, fruits and caramel fill the mouth with pure happiness and joy. Will try it again and again ... and again.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma: sweet toffee, caramel, prunes, red wine. Pours mahogany with a massive frothy head, quite lively carbonation. In taste dark fruit, caramel, wood, nuts, moderate bitterness, hint of alcohol which feels appropriate and I'd call a bit rum-like, some phenols/cloves in finish. Can't possibly live up to it's hype, but it's a good beer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Ugh...I have no idea what people love about this thing, it tastes so damn awful it's puke inducing. was no t worth the trouble .

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Whatâ€™s to be said, complex, nuanced, delicious.  Tough to find but well worth the quest.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: I thank the woman who brought this gem of a beer from her trip to Belgium and allowed me to try one of the best beers in the world!  Dull, very dark amber/red, towards brown. White-brown foam, medium thickness, permanent. Aromas of alcohol, caramel, fruit, dried fruit, wine aromas, earthy aromas, mushrooms, apple cider vinegar and spices. Sweet, slightly bitter, slightly spicy. Long bittersweet finish, more sweet. Creamy-sticky texture, medium carbonation. Alcohol undercover. What can I say, but phenomenal!!!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Appearance: dark chestnut.
Body: dense, consistent, hazy, good carbonation.
Head: white-brown, creamy, two fingers.
Aroma: very rich, barrel, nuts, peanuts, almonds, figs, wine, caramel, burnt sugar, bread, yeast, cinnamon, plums.
Taste: bitter-sweet, roasted malt, caramel, nuts, almonds, burnt sugar, coffee, chocolate, plums, alcohol.
Aftertaste: bitter-sweet, nuts, caramel, alcohol, wine, yeast, barrel, quite intense.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Considered the best beer in the world. Tourists are being ripped off for a six pack at major cities. But the truth is that, personally, there are much better beers at the moment. Being the 12 the best of all 3, like any other gem, when too many people start to want the same gem, it looses quality. Right next to the abbey where itâ€™s being made, u can sit down at taste it. I remember going there 3 years ago and it tasted like heaven. Nowadays itâ€™s just crowded and the taste isnâ€™t the same.
I am no specialist but there has to be more cO2 on it than before. I mean, after one beer, Iâ€™m bloated. Same as with Duvel, but a lot of people love Duvel.
A great beer? Yes, but not the greatest. I can name 10 beers in 5 seconds that are better, and not only Trappist.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Good foam
Lots of flavor, lots of aromas.
Deep and complex 
Slightly bitter but still sweet

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Not really a style I prefer, but is this a real good quad. Aroma is dark fruits, sweetish, phenolic. Flavor is burstig with dark fruits, molasses and a slight hint of roastiness. Highly sweet with moderate bitterness. Moderate body. A lot of Belgian yeast byproducts in the flavor; something I don't always like in combination with high sweetness and deep dark flavors. Defenitly a top tier quad, but I had some other quads before, that I personally found more enjoyable (and cheaper lol). Maybe I drank this one too young?

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: The best Quadrupel without any doubt! Only Quad that comes near to this is Rochefort 10!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: An excellent quad, not as good as Rochefort 10 for my taste buds, but a close second nonetheless. The slightly bitter aftertaste is what puts me off a little, maybe I just need to age it 2-3 years.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Still my favourite beer to date. I was skeptical prior to tasting as I knew of the massive hype behind this beer but I really do understand where it's coming from. Nothing to fault - super easy, very well balanced and has the delicious flavours you'd expect from a world class Abbey Quad. There is never a time where it wouldn't go down a treat!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Great way to end a night.   We had a little beer tasting, sat back with the stragglers and opened this up.   Great little sipper to keep the night going a little longer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Unbelievable. Pours lovely with the famous "rocky head". Aroma is grand with lovely yeast and a promising multitude of flavours. Taste is also unbelievably multi-dimensional with all sorts of chocolate, caramel, dark fruit and roasted shades. There is no discussion about points and ranking. The questions is, why commercial brewers that produce accessible beers can't produce something like that?

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle from brewery. So yeah, it really is the best beer in the world. Point proven.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Beautiful, ruby-brown color, abundant, long-lasting, medium-bubble foam. stays on the glass.
Complex, sweet, intense aroma with notes of dried fruit, peach, malt, toffee, dark bread, honey.
Perfect, complex and perfectly balanced in taste, quite sweet, with low bitterness. Intertwining flavors of sweet fruits - peaches, apricots, figs, pears, further melanoidins, toffee, raisins, notes of sherry. Alcohol imperceptible, high carbonation.
Brilliant beer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Brown, clear. Ruby under the light. Beige foam, stiff, fine, durable. Settles firmly on the glass. 

Sweet, fruity aroma. Peach mainly. There are also delicate notes of bread, hops, yeast. 

Accurate carbonation. Slim, mild, balanced beer. You can't feel a lot of extract. 

Poetry in taste. It is sweet, fruity. Like peach in aroma. Raisins, sponge cake accents. Velvety toffee. Something like molasses, honey. 
In the aftertaste, bitterness like peach skin. Considerable warming at the end. It is difficult to describe individual elements, because the beer is very complex, holistic. The best Belgian I have ever had.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very smooth, beautiful balance, no trace of alcohol, dark fruits, raisins, plum. Great.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
This one was four years old. 
It pour very dark brown color with medium lasting medium sized off white head. It has strong lacing. Aroma is very complex, it smells strongly of molasses, dark bread, raisin and berry like fruits. One of the most complex taste ever! Taste is moderately high sweet and subtle bitter, malt-hop balance tilts toward malt. You can realize different flavors in every sip. Raisin, molasses, licorice, fig, toffee and berry like frutiness... there is a perfect combination of many flavors. Finish is dry and strongly spicy. Great belgian yeast character! Very full bodied and it has moderate carbonation. Abv is well hidden and %10 abv is undetectable. And the best part, this is very easy to drink. Not my favorite beer of all time due to high sweetness, but it really deserves its fame and respect. Great beer. As I always say monks know beer!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: The color of strong tea, light, unstable foam. The aroma is dark fruit, vinegar, wine notes, a little alcohol. The taste is fruit in the first place, grapes, raisins, brown sugar, light alcohol. Very good quadrupel.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Monk's robe color with ruby â€‹â€‹reflections, lots of yeast on the bottom. Ochre foam that quickly disappears and leaves a lace in the glass. Delicately sweet aroma, raisins, plums and caramel. On the palate it is sweet with a very long bitter herbal finish and an alcoholic embrace. Excellent body and easy to drink. Balanced, delicate and fantastic beer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
29.03.19, bottle dated to 02.21
Complex and quite intense aroma, dried fruit, fig, dates, raisins, toffee. Quite sweet. Dried fruit, caramel, maltiness in taste. High carbonation. Low bitterness. Alcohol practically imperceptible.

Awesome.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Long have I waited to try Westvleteren 12.  I purchased a 33 cl bottle two years ago while on a trip to Amsterdam, thanks De Bierkoning. It has been put away for a momentous event.  That event was yesterday and today I celebrate.  I use my Trappistes Rochefort glass and pour most of the bottle to see a deep rich brown body with amber highlights.  The head is a steady, creamy looking, eggshell brown.  The scent is delightful, dark plum, bread, toffee, brown sugar.  And now finally, ultimately, I have a drink.  It was worth the wait.  Dark raisin, fig, malt, sourdough bread.  A bit of sweetness that goes to a nice  finishing bitterness.  Dense, chewy. It warms up, it gets more flavorful. My oh my. Better than Chimay Blue which had been my top rated beer of all.  The king is dead, long live the king.  Now it is time to fire up some Nirvana and finish the bottle. A great day, all in all.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottle 0.33.

And is this the famous Westvleteren XII? Well, this is a completely overhyped beer. Yes, good, composed, balanced like few quads, but it doesn't knock you out of your shoes. Aroma: dried figs, dates, raisins, lightly fried bananas. Taste: sweet for a moment, then dry, ethereal, slightly muddy, strongly saturated. The aftertaste leaves no unpleasantness in the mouth and on the tongue. Top quality, but taste experiences like many other Trappist beers.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Taste: Sweet citrus aroma verbalized in the eastern region of the palate.

palet: takes a full foot on alpine skiing, but listed in the Low Cost region (coincidence?..)

appearance: gentle distant sunrise dazzled my day with its irrefutably substal color.

aroma: to be reviewed

global: globally one could say that the global conclusion described by my eyeballs have globalized my globular mind.

sign robersaoul crusoe

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: ABSOLUTELY the best beer I have ever tasted!!! The price of this beer is a little over the top at $17.95 per .33L bottle.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bought 2 crates of Westvleteren 12 at the abbey and have never regretted it for a moment. It's not for nothing that it's the best beetroot in the world.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A-fucking-MAZING Beer!!!, nothing more to say. You have to try it to feel the all sensations the moment you taste it.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle. Aroma- clear dried fruits, figs, raisins, also candid red fruits and maybe subtle caramel in the background- very pleasant composition. Dark copper, clear, with a medium, good-looking, beige head and a great lacing. Taste- intensive, rich fruity notes. Quite dry, with medium-low, herbal bitterness in the aftertaste, which counters very well the fruitiness. Medium-bodied, with a medium carbonation. Distinct, very solid Belgian beer, but all in all, it doesn't blow off my mind.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Has a great smoothness to it that makes it so drinkable, for such a big body beer it comes out quite dry in the end. The dark belgian raisin, and super dark subtle cherry notes are perfect for the style. Dark, rich, and complex. Great beer. Belgian beer factory online bottle expiry date in 2.5 years.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Really one of the best beers I've ever had. Why? Because everything works together. At 10.2% ABV, it's strong, but you don't notice it. As you drink it, you discover a number of different flavor nuances. I think you could drink this beer 100 times and discover something new and great every time. Just like good music.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Murky, nutty brown colour with a hint of, frothy light tan head. Sweet, malty aroma, earthy. Bitter taste, some sweetness, caramel flavour, feels a bit boozy, great rich flavours. Low medium body and carbonation, light and fluffy mouthfeel.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: I got my hands on a few 33cl bottles. Nice brown colour, the creamy foam doesn't stay for long. Smells strongly of alcohol like other quadrupels. Lots of flavours, a bit bitter at first, with hints of wood, coffee and caramel. Then fruity and sweet. I get the hype, the beer is not mass produced and the exclusivity makes the beer secretly a bit tastier.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330ml bottle courtesy from Johan and his dad!! Cheers to you both as I have been waiting a long time to taste this iconic quad. Sampled on the 10th February 2019, poured into a tulip glass. Slightly opaque dark russet with a thick pale buff head. Strong malty aroma with notes of warm bread along with sweet dark fruit notes of figs and plum. Thick mouthfeel with slight effervescence on the tongue. Good lacing throughout. Complex malt delivers a rich Christmas cake base with strong fruit notes of syrupy dates, raisins, damsons, prunes with barley sugar twist. Earthy, damp note to the subtle hop content delivers a short but balanced flavour to the aftertaste. Finish is malty with Cognac booze notes not overwhelming the malt character but you know the strength is there. Candied fruit notes still continue along with golden syrup, but dates and raisins are the main driver here. An excellent Trappist Quad and well worth the hyperbole! Another ticked off the bucket list.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle from monastery. Nearly 3 years old. Dark brown appearance with medium off white head. Aroma is sweet toffee and caramel with berry. Flavour has a strong cherry taste with caramel and is quite sweet. Top beer

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Dark brown cloudy color. Lots of fine and medium-bubble foam. Foam nicely coats the glass.

Aroma: wine, burnt caramel, dark malt, buckwheat honey.

Flavors and sensations: slightly sweet, low bitterness, highly saturated, a bit alcoholic, a bit burning in the esophagus. Very complex taste, you can feel the noble alcohol. Iconic beer

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma yeast, alcohol, dried fruit, very subtle and delicate, nutmeg, aroma not really intense :) Appearance very dark brown, cloudy opaque, foam quickly falls, decorates the glass nicely and remains as a ring on the surface of the liquid. In taste oooo this is where the magic of this beer begins, dried fruit, dates and raisins, noble alcohol, caramel, candy drops, incredibly smooth and delicate. Nice bitterness with a spicy and peppery finish. Lots of body, sweet and sticky. Incredibly good beer, magic begins in taste. Excellent beer although I think the hype for it is greatly exaggerated. Is it worth it without a doubt yes, but you have to approach it without emotions and then we simply have a good quad and not divine ambrosia :)

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very nice beer with a sweet aroma of the perfect composition of malt, dried fruit. In the taste, there is also a noble alcohol. The composition of flavors of this beer is definitely worth attention

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330ml bottle @ Farees'. Vintage 2011. Pours a hazy brown colour with a thin tan head. Nose is malty and light caramel. Flavour is nutty, some honey, light burnt caramel, toasted malt, and mild alcohol. Medium to light bodied, mild carbonation, and a mild to moderate sweetness with a light bitterness. No oxidation, though I'm not sure I follow the hype on this beer. However it is still quite nice.

product_review: Very nice beer with a beautiful aroma of the perfect composition of malt, molasses, dried fruit and esters. In the taste, there is also a noble alcohol. The composition of flavors of this beer is definitely worth attention-

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: In its style it is the best I have tried, if you are not too greedy and you let it age for 2-3 years it is amazing!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
super tasty and not exaggerated rating, the taste of the sixtus was refined.
top beer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Quite high anticipation for one of the best beers in the world. Dark red color suprised me, very appealing color. Not big foam but steady one. I do not believe that there is 10% alcohol, you do not feel it at all although i can smell it a bit. Very balanced taste. Sweet aftertaste but not sweet when sipping. Some berry in taste and smell.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Rich brown color with beautiful head and nice aroma of caramel, sweet, biscuirts

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Deep brown beer with a generous and long-lasting white foam.
Aromas of raisins, caramels, honey, toasted malts, barrels, wine cellars...
Flavors of toasted malts, caramels, creamy, very round.
Without a doubt a pleasure for the palate.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: The best beer I've ever drank. It is a quad at its Apex of perfection. Rich, almost beyond comparison, with beautiful fruity and floral notes and powerful, malty  finish.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
31.08.20 Aromas of cherries, roasted baked malts, raisins, figs, plums, nice
Foam beige, hazy, brownish copper in color. Bread, caramel, sweet flavors; new flavors emerge as it warms; bitterness low but distinct. High carbonation, medium fullness, not smooth, malty finish. Overall, this beer disappointed me, considering the opinions and ratings, I guess this style is not for me. But seriously, it's a good beer, worth trying, but not at this price

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A beautiful dark bottle of an equally dark and at the same time very tasty and sweet beer that has notes of dried fruit and a very intense caramel flavor.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Brilliant. I've tried many but this is beyond competition. Someone probably does better but I judge what I can try. Fresh beer - brew until 08.2021 - so there is a chance for even greater experiences after aging. Although it already seems composed. WT12 has the advantage of constant brews like many Belgian beers and you can always be sure of its quality.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Been waiting for a couple of years. I drink to celebrate the birth of my daughter. Pours into the glass dark brown, leaving a high foam. The aroma is fruity, toffee, raisiny and slightly yeasty. The mouthfeel is full. The taste is sweet and diverse, following the palette of the fragrance. A great beer, but maybe not quite up to the hype.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330ml bottle. Pours clear brown, medium sized beige head stays nicely. Aroma of molasses, nuts, caramel, raisins, toffee. Taste is sweeter side, malty, toffee, raisins.woody aftertaste. Medium body, over average carbonation. Nice complex brew, sweeter side, but not worth the price and hype.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Yes, very good, but new micro breweries are picking up and overtaking. Still, coffee, full body and. Great beer

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: It's much more than a simple bottle that was standing in front of me that I was about to uncap, it's a real myth... which was born for me a little over 4 years ago when I started to take an interest in the world of beer and discovered the different classifications and which was then fueled by its rarity and the often excessive price that a bottle could reach when I came across one (everything that is rare is expensive... which does not put it within everyone's reach, and for a long time, not mine). The suspense was therefore going to end, and for me the answer to my questions about this famous beer. Visually, nothing to complain about, we are close to the 8 with a clear dark brown topped with a creamy foam of 1.5 cm. The nose is surprisingly, even worryingly, very discreet. We still find an alcohol with accents of cognac, candy and fruits with plum and pear. All being not very intense. Fortunately the tasting is quite different! And, if the intensity of this Westleveren XII is not the most incredible in the world, it shows an exceptional balance that would make it become a saint all devilish (is this a strategy of the monks to evangelize Belgium?). This beer is classy, â€‹â€‹with an assertive alcohol, on airs of cognac, but not aggressive and combining perfectly with the bitterness and a malty base where the prune takes the lead without being predominant. Obtaining such a balance is necessarily the fruit of very long years of experience and an extraordinary mastery of brewing. So thank you to the monks for having worked in this direction and for having protected a unique heritage. But let's get back to the tasting. Compared to the 8, what changes is of course the alcohol, which takes on much more character here while remaining very well integrated, but also the spices, less present here and with more developed prune aromas. The complexity is excellent from the attack which takes up the aromas developed by the nose with in addition notes of candy and pepper. The second mouth takes its ease more and on the back palate, it is the spices and the prune which take the ascendancy. The finish, very long marks a marriage of alcohol and bitterness quite remarkable as is this beer. To know then if it is the best beer in the world, I think finally that this question is meaningless. What do we ask of a beer? First and foremost to be balanced and secondly to give us emotion. And if the first point is factual, the second is very personal. Each of us will be more sensitive to intensity, bitterness, alcohol or complexity. As in the quest for any Grail, the important thing is above all in the path, the beers discovered day after day, the experience acquired but especially in the encounters made throughout this path which are for me a source of incomparable enrichment. And so I thank this Westlevern XII for all this. An emotion is little if it is not shared.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Yes, yes, yes, yes! I feel like going back to my first trip to Belgium in 90's- so ready to soak up everything ad full of suprises. I am suprised that I can still be suprised. Impressive.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Good beer! Fantastic but not what I expected! OK! GOOD! Too much quality but ok I need more! Raisins, choco, honey... but maybe the imperial stout made the feeling of my palate different! 100++ anyway

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Read and heard so much that the St. Bernardus Abt 12 tasted the same, why drive so far, until I was in the area and then decided to buy it in the shop opposite the brewery/monastery. Now, was skeptical at first when tasting, the more I tasted and drank of it, the more I could appreciate it, and yet I taste a difference, in short, rightly a world beer

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Fine and stable mousse. Malt and caramel aromas same in the mouth. Creamy and soft in the mouth. Slight bitterness very good length

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottles. This classic does not need any further empirical description. It is an excellent beer, period!

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Deep deep amber pour with dense cream head. Not much bouquet I could detect. Lovely soft mouth feel brings a complex combination of caramel, dates, christmas pudding (including the brandy!), with vanilla joining the party and lingering to the super long alcohol warm finish that minutes later finally closes with some charcoal bitterness. Exquisite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: I has my third one at a tasting, and realized that I had not rated it before. Pours cloudy amber with small frothy beige head, caramel malt-dried fruits aroma, low carbonation, mildly bitter caramel malt taste with dried fruits and alcohol undertones, smooth body, long caramel finish. Well deserved score.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma caramel weak vanilla caramel weak raisin brown sugar taste raisin caramel dates vanilla brown sugar

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Great beer. Needs no introduction. If you can get hold of a bottle which of actually not that difficult in Belgium itself your enjoy.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown colour, high turbidity. Two fingers of yellowish foam that leave a creamy residue. Floral, sweet aroma, fig bread and honey. Sophisticated taste of dried figs, mistela, ripe grapes, raisins, dried plums and flowers, long-lasting and intense in the mouth. Where are the 10 degrees? Medium/high body. I had read wonders about this beer and the fame that precedes it is 100% justified, a beer from another planet, stratospheric, the evolution of aroma and taste from the first sip to the last is impressive. Clear manifestation of God in the form of beer.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Wow, 330ml purchased from and imported by Beer Cartel. Pours cola brown with medium white bubbles. Aromas of caramel, prune and plum. Palate smooth, rounded by the alcohol but rich with cakey and dried raisin flavours. Amazing beer! Perfect for wrapping Santa Presents.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very good trappiste... Unique taste, long-lasting foam, a beer hard to come by... In a word, a hit... An exceptional beer for exceptional tastings...

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Excellent. Without a doubt the best Trappist I have ever tried. A pleasure from start to finish.

product_name: Westvleteren 12ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
