Big multi dimensional aroma and flavor of sweet chocolate and heavy soy sauce balanced by a cookiedough-like bourbon character which also provides a fine liquer-like fruityness in combination with the thick dark malts. Smooth fat body with a softer and more pleasant carbonation than some of the more fresh BCS bottles I have had.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Saved for two years for my sonâ€™s graduation from law school. Oh the malt, oh the chocolate malt, oh the chocolate malt with toasted marshmallows. Oh the smooth warmth, the silky finish. I am divided between being thrilled and honored to have tasted this beer, and crestfallen that I will never taste it again. I am not divided in saying this is the best beer I have ever tasted.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Sample from a bottle, thanks a ton to Mike (from Zipâ€™s). Nice pitch black color, little brown head. Very nice aromatic rich bourbon and dark malt nose - smell. Just sniffing it is enjoyable on itâ€™s own, even before taking a taste. Excellent rich, sweet and bitter taste. Itâ€™s like a booze-infused chocolate cake, very decadent. Big body, very light carbonation. Dry texture. Nice, long aftertaste to savor all the complexities with. Rich dark chocolate cake aromas. The perfect amount of bourbon barrel. Very smooth. Bit of alcohol warmth, but itâ€™s hidden very nicely. Excellent stout.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Excited to try this and was not let down. Bourbon is very present and i love it! Sweet vanilla with chocolate and malt.  Very well balanced and one of the best beers ive had.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bottle @ The Local Pub (tasting) 
Totally black pour and really small brown head that disappeared immediately the aroma comes strong with bourbon,chocolate,raisins and licorice Taste is strong and complex with the bourbon and the chocolate taking lead the raisins following and hint of vanilla in the immediate aftertaste all surrounded with a well balanced malt flavor and an overall sweetness  
carbonation is almost flat and the mouth feel kind of sticky an excellent beer i felt lucky to have tasted !

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: The best beer I have ever tasted, even the aroma and flavour of the bourbon are special. Roasted flavour, perfectly balanced, intense and round. Perfect.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle shard by BenC at his massive BCS tasting - Pours black with a thin tan head. Nose has a good deal of sharp alcohol--the nail polish kind--and huge butterscotch notes. Surprisingly the maltiness is hidden behind the barrel sweetness and the sharp booze. Taste is big sweet caramel and butterscotch, dark malt, medium roast, a touch of charcoal, and just...smooth. Very warming in the belly, though itâ€™s not particularly hot going down. Thick as hell, and not very carbonated. Just not my thing anymore--Iâ€™m glad I tried it, but if this is the pinnacle of imperial stout, then I guess I really donâ€™t need to have anymore imperial stouts. I feel like Iâ€™ve either moved on from or burned out on the style.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Hands down the best beer I have ever had. Period end of review. Oh well just for fun, the aroma is incredible two years of sitting in a bourbon barrel will do that.  The appearence is pitch black darkness.  The taste is money huge bourbon lots of sweetness. For how boozy it smells it is incredibly smooth. Overall as I said the best beer I have ever had.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Oh boy! Pours black with no head. On the nose I got all the nice stuff you want from a imp stout on bourbon barrels. Lots of coconut, lots of vanilla, woody notes, warming alcohol, chocolate, dark toffee, dark ripe cherries, liquorice, the characteristic dark sweet fruits and burnt figs fresh from the oven! The taste is just big creamy and smooth all over. Along with all the components from the aroma, the taste add that salty quality to the beer, also an actual whiskey taste. Pretty heavy on the boozy side, but I think it "wears it pretty well".

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bourbon County Stout by Goose Inland

Bottled on 10-9-2009 #1936 13% abv


My sister saved this one to share with me I must say it was the best Bourbon barrel aged stout I ever had and I wont more.

Very dark brown or light black color, very little head, Strong notes of caramel, bourbon, and molasses, chocolate, Taste bourbon Carmel sweet malts very smooth diffidently alcohol taste.

Thank You Goose Inland

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Thank you very much @ RasmusOtt. Pours pitch black with an almost non existent brown espresso head. Aroma: Filled chocolates (Anthon Berg style) heaps of bourbon, coconut, toffee, vanilla, oaky, quite boozy, salt liquorice, lakridskonfekt, molasses, butterscotch, woody notes, salty caramel, liquorice, espresso, tiramisu, ovenbaked figs, matroshatte, chocolate, light peppery. Taste: Creamy smooth mouthfeel, Iâ€™m quite suprised how carbonated this is, Quite heavy alcohol burn, loads of bourbon, vanilla, oaky, woody notes, sweet liquorice, matroshatte, loads of dried fruits, prunes, figs, raisins, plums, and some other fruityness, dark berries, cherry sauce, candied orange peel, quite sweet, but never too much, you keep on going back to this finding new aromas and flavors, itâ€™s so complex. thereâ€™s some roasted bitterness, some acidity, long tingly sensation in the aftertaste and some alcohol burn, quite dry palate. this is amazing!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Thanks to Black13 for pulling this out. Bottle #2967

Appearance-No lacing. Black with brown highlights. Pours like oil. 

Smell- Alcohol, vanilla and bits of coffee. Smooth dark chocolate aroma. Very Woody after is warms. Canâ€™t stop smelling it. 

Taste- Very hot. Dark chocolate. Vanilla. Some coffee. 

Mouthfeel- Not as thick as you would think but very good. 

Overall- Very good. Sweet as hell. Sticks to your lips. The aroma is definitely the most interesting part.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
From notes.  First reviewed 11/28/2010.  Served on tap in a Black Friday commemorative tasting glass at the GI brewpub. 5 oz. pour. I think the pours were a bit cold, so I allowed it to warm before getting into the glass.

The pour is a midnight black, with a small coffee colored thick creamy foam head on top. Some retention, but no real lacing to speak of. 

The roasted malt, oakiness, and bourbon from the Pappy barrels come through really nicely. The aroma is more pleasant than the regular bourbon county. It is smoother and the difference in the quality of the bourbon barrels is apparent. 

The dark roasted malt and Pappy-soaked oak flavors really blend well, especially with two years of age on it. The smoothness of the taste over time is what really impresses me about this family of beers. Molasses, some smoked tobacco, coffee, and figs come in after it warms up a little bit. These flavors all combine effortlessly in a tasty aged stout.

The feel of the bourbon county stouts is always nice, and this is no exception. It is very thick and creamy, with the body practically squeezing the carbonation out of it. The alcohol is pretty much hidden, quite a feat at 13%.

I liked this a little bit more than the regular bourbon county (accounting for age differential as well), but the price tag is a bit steep.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Thanks to Enjoyit. Pours black with a small, fast-disappearing brown head. Complex aroma; sweet and dry with notes of nougat, nuts, alcohol, dark fruits and chocolate. Very nice. Flavour is sweet and tart, with dark fruits, nougat and alcohol. The alcohol is a bit overpowering, and I think there might have been more nuances in the flavour if the alcohol hadnâ€™t overshadowed it. Still pretty damn good though. Finish is the same, with a lingering alcohol burn. Overall this was great; complex and well-balanced, and the nougat notes were especially enjoyable, and not the least bit cloying, as could have been expected. 17.02.12.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle into a snifter.  This is an amazing beer.  Sweet coconut, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate pack the aroma.  The flavor follows the aroma.  Words can not do this beer justice.  I thought it would be near impossible to improve on BCS, but this was magnificent.  Amazing!!!!!!!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: From a bomber bottle in SÃ¤tila New Years Evening (Thanks Timo). Black beer with no head. Chocolate, dried dark fruits, vanilla, coconut and bourbon in this amazing palette of aromas and flavour. A lovley beer! :-)

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle at tasting, courtesy of Enjoyit - thanks! Inky black pour, no head to speak of. This beauty has a huge bourbon aroma - lots of coconut and vanilla, lush chocolate, vanilla iced cream, wood, french nougat, sweet figs and dark berries, some alcohol. Basically pretty much like regular BCS, but the bourbon notes are out of this world. The epitome of Bourbon barrel aging. The taste reveals all that I love about BCS. Has the basic BCS things going on malt wise, but again the barrel qualities are through the roof. Coconut, vanilla, wet wood, slightly spicy woody. Everything comes together beautifully. There is quite some alcohol presence, but it doesnâ€™t make it any lesser of a masterpiece. I love this. I love BCS. Fucken hell.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle shared by colonelforbin.  Thanks Mike.  Pours a pitch black with a small light chocolate head settles to a ring and leaves some light lacing on the glass. The aroma is heavenly with big vanilla, oak, chocolate brownie, bourbon,  and some light cherry as well as a bit of nuttiness.  The taste is sweet with hazlenut, cherry, vanilla, bourbon, and chocolate brownie. The finish has quite a bit of alcohol as well as a light astringency and leaves some lingering oak on the palate.  Full bodied, slick mouthfeel with low carbonation.  This is a very good beer, but I find it to be a little be too sweet and boozy for me.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
A: Opaque black with a very small ring of head that drifts away almost immediately.

S: Super rich fudge/brownie batter. I donâ€™t know how else to describe this. Vanilla with some bakers chocolate, great bourbon character on the nose, smells smooth.

T: Almost no carbonation and the alcohol (given the ABV) is almost non existent. Toffee, caramel, bourbon, chocolate, roasted char (subtle), maybe even a bit of fruit in there. Super sweet bourbon and vanilla goodness. This is the "creme de la creme" of bourbon county, or any bourbon barrel aged stout for that matter. Simply excellent.

M: Very thick and slick, it coats the mouth and sticks around for awhile. Leaves a very nice aftertaste that lingers.

O: This is fantastic, and definitely a step up from the regular bourbon county brand stout but I am not sure that the price tag is justified. If I saw this beer on the shelf would I buy it again? YES, and I would save it for a special occasion. A great experience nonetheless!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 12/23/10.  Bomber, first taste care of cbfobes, my main man/lady!  Solid, opaque pour with a small brown head that settles to a ring but lasts forever.  Amazing sweet buttery coconut and vanilla aroma laced with bourbon booze, sweet chocolate, a hint of coffee, and more than I could explain.  Ripe sweet chocolate vanilla flavor loaded with more vanilla, coconut, sweet cherries, dark fruits, brown sugar, and more than I can imagine.  Silky smooth and simply amazing.  This is heaven.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: RBAG 2012. One of the highlights of the night. Pours jet black with a thin brown head that lingered in the glass the entire drink. Aroma is delicious and complex, smacking you in the face with bourbon, vanilla, molasses and oak. The flavor is very smooth with touches of chocolate, toffee and vanilla. The bourbon is very noticeable but not overpowering as in other Bourbon BAs Iâ€™ve had. The wood notes really come through in the finish.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 2010 bomber, from bauermj. Black with a ruby hue, no head. Very smooth bourbon, wood, light vanilla, sweet malts, some soy, anise. Full body, average carbonation, slightly sweet with some alcohol bitterness, coffee, vanilla, oak, very fresh. Finish just keeps on going and going, lots of bourbon, vanilla, coffe and  dried fruit.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle@Home. So complex in the aroma with wood and bourbon. Black, brown head, very nice lace. Sweetish, nice bitterness, wood, bourbon, chocolate. Full and complex.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle pours a dark brown close to black with a nice brown head bubbles not much foam at all. Smells and tastes of caramel, chocolate, roasty, alcohol, soy sauce, vanilla, licorice, bourbon. Really smooth with nice licorice tastes. Mellow. light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, slick feel, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish, very awesome beer. Has mellowed out nicely and tons of different plavores come thru.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: bottle @ "Fionaâ€™s tasting". Almost black with a light brown head. Aroma of sweet alcohol, roasted malt, coffee and vanilla (bourbon). Quite sweet in taste with again vanilla, coffee/mocca, rasins on alcohol. Very nice.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: RBAG 2012. Holy fawking Vishnu what bit of awesomeness just appeared in my glass. Dark blackish brown with a ring of brown bubbles circling my glass. My glass smells like heaven, deep thick milk chocolate, massive vanilla notes, bourbon, smoke, oak. I truly donâ€™t think a beer can smell better than this one this has blown my mind. So thick and viscous tasting this almost has the mouth feel of melted chocolate ice cream.  Ash, vanilla, cherry, mild coffee the list goes onâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦The chocolate is bitter but never harsh bitter. The bourbon is perfectly plate in the beer. This must be what gods cum taste like. Oily brown film is completely coating my empty glass. Best beer of the night by far.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: RBAG 2012. Blackness. Awesome goodness - bourbon, tobacco, molasses, chocolate, coconut, brown sugar, roasty toasty goodness, smells absolutely awesome. I could be saying much more but so many beers.. damn. Tastes awesome. good spice hit, some alcohol, tobacco, chocolate very dark chocolate, dark cherries and dark berries, and some harshness, slick. Another great impy BA stout.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pour is pitch black with a very thin tan head that fades into nothingness almost instantly. Little to no lacing at all on the glass and faint carbonation. Aroma is of strong bourbon (pappy van winkle) with slight notes of roasted barley and molasses. Flavor is sharp on the bourbon with a mild bitter, hoppy finish. Great bourbon flavor in the aftertaste. Some molasses, coffee, and burnt malts. If you are a bourbon fan this will be amazing, if not, its not worth the cost.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle, huge thanks to tkrjukoff. Pitch black beer with a small brown head. Oily whisky aroma, malty, oaky, vanilla, milky notes, figs and raisins, some blanced smoke notes, hops, almond, chocolate and cocoa powder, Malty flavor, oily, roasted, some smoke, chocolate, whiskty, oak, figs, raisins, dades, some hops, some fruits. Some alcohol showing, but in a good way, hay notes, licorice and almond. A beer with a long lovely warming feeling and then it turns into a smooth balanced chocolate finish with whisky oak, and some figs. Huge body and with a perfect mouthfeel. Absolutley wonderful!!!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bomber from a trade. Pours thick pitch black no head, inviting. Aroma is fullbodied alcohol, sweet, dark fruits, vinous, raisins, fidges, vanilla, bourbon. Flavor is fantastic good, alcohol, fullbodied fruity, raisins, fidges, malty, canâ€™t find the words, just enjoying. Finishes with an aftertaste just like flavor. What a fantastic beer.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle from Vas Foremost. Pours like Bourbon County, deep balck with a dark brown head that settles to a ring. Nose is bourbon. Honey and cocoa, vanilla and roasted malt. Burly and fruity but mediated by the burnt sugar notes. Round and full with a savory note as well. Solid. On tasting, big and boozy, barrel character is there but falling a touch. Low tartness and maple syrup notes. Clean and huge, a big BA stout that keeps diving deeper, pulling out more flavored to relieve some of the extra sweetness. Finish is dry and boozy with a light soy finish. Huge and tasty stuff but not insanely better than well aged bourbon county.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: (Bottle) Pours super black and oily with almost no head. The aroma holds fancy bourbon and fat, yet round roast up front with notes of woodshop, fiery whisky, light vanilla, whisper of cocoanut, new baked cocoa-flavored sponge cake, and molasses. Undertones of earth, dark fruits like resins, prunes and dry figs, cigar, light resinous hops, blue- and blackberries. The flavor is medium to heavily sweet, medium bitter and light acidic. Tones of wood, vanilla, butter, cocoa, dark chocolate, molasses/brown sugar, dark fruits, dark bread, cigar/tobacco and earth.  The mouthfeel is sticky, yet creamy, round and oily with light carbonation. The finish holds alcohol, molasses, tomato purÃ©e and something almost floral. Full bodied. Tasty but quite uncomplex â€“ just like Expedition Stout. Still, Expedition makes a better job.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:

Appearance: black, scant tan head

Aroma: sweet bourbon and dark chocolate aroma, caramel and vanilla, dose of roasted malt

Flavor: rich chocolate and roasted flavor, lots of sweet Bourbon, caramel and vanilla



Name: Bourbon County Stout, Rare

Aroma: more of the sweet vanilla coming theough in the aroma

Flavor: sweet chocolate flavor, lots of caramel and vanilla, light roast

Overall: one of the best pappy beers out there



Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 19/20

Rating: 4.3/5.0

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: bottle courtesy of a great trader, thank you! bottle 11,993, to celebrate trader of the year 2011! thanks everyone! great stuff here, of course. nicde pour, lower carb, but consistent, not flat half way through. strange ever bubbling effervesence like champagne.  the pappy barrel is obviously the show stealer here, its so nice. complex, smooth, subtle, no bite at all. nice and warming,the mouthfeel is the same as jagermeister .just tastes so nice the entire way through, nice and complex, big and bold but subtle as well. excellence.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  poured black with a copper head and legs that stained the glass.  aroma and flavor were fudge, bourbon, vanilla, and alcohol.  body was so velvety thick with low carbonation.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: A deep dark stout with a thin brown head. In aroma, a rich and musky chocolate, warming alcohol, smooth powdery Bourbon, quite nice. In mouth, a smooth chocolate with nice mocha coffee, with smooth vanilla and alcohol, well balanced. Bottle from Boutip, shared with GRM, Probstk and Ian, Dec. 2 2011.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bomber shared by Boutip (merci!), served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. Part of a vertical. 02DE11. Bottled 03/26/10. Bottle 692.



App.:  Deep brown-black, no head.
  
Aroma:  Really strong dark chocolate, more than the other versions, lots of soy sauce and black strap molasses, a bit of green spiciness, vanilla, wood, a bit of alcohol, licorice, best of the three.
  
Palate:  Medium-full body, very limited effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Huge coffee, dark chocolate, molasses/licorice, soy sauce, some alcohol, a touch of vanilla and wood, raw cacao, some caramel; sweet with fair bitterness and a long, chocolate, molasses finish.



Rare indeed!  A masterpiece!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Brown bottle, 1 pint 6 ounces, number 692, bottled on 01/19/2010, from Philippe Boutin, savoured on December 2 2011; eye: black, opaque, no head, no lacing; nose: woody, bourbon, roasted malt, alcohol, vanilla, liquorice, dark chocolate; mouth: woody, bourbon, roasted malt, alcohol, vanilla, liquorice, dark chocolate, candied fruits, finish in malt with woody presence, below-average carbonation, rather sweet, oily texture; overall: really, really good

ENGLISH

Brown ... nose: woody, bourbon, roasted malt, alcohol, vanilla, licorice, dark chocolate; palate: woody, bourbon, roasted malt, alcohol, vanilla, licorice, dark chocolate, candied fruit, malty finish with woody presence, full-bodied, below average carbonation, rather sweet, oily texture; in summary: very, very good

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with small foamy head with average retention and not much lacing. Aroma consists of bourbon and vanilla with light dry roasted malt with nice lingering sweet notes and is almost perfect. Taste is a perfectly balanced mix between some bourbon with balanced vanilla notes and some light dry roasted malt that is offset by light lactose notes. Body is quite full with a very nice creamy texture and medium carbonation with no apparent alcohol notes. I must admit that even though my expectations were quite high for this beer, this has exceeded my expectations. The notes of vanilla, bourbon and roasted malt are well integrated and creamy texture is perfect. Now I wish I could find another bottle.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: I have no encountered a imperial stout yet that stacks up to this.  After doing a huge vertical tasting of multiple years of DL, KBS, CBS and many others, this was the hands down winner.  The complexity in this beer is unmatched.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle #1459, generously shared by badnewsbeers, seemingly content with an occasional growler of Harperâ€™s or dusty bottle of Miller High Life in return. Murky charcoal body, thin ochre head. Beautiful nose with vanilla, coconut, and tannic oak backed by molasses, soy, coffee, hints of honey and serious alcohol heat. Potent, boozy body with huge vanilla and molasses, soy, coconut, and plum. Round, soft body, not dry but not too sweet due to the dominance of barrel flavors and warming alcohol. A cigar beer meant for slow, thorough enjoyment.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Courtesy of northernbrews

 
Bottle: The aroma consists of maple syrup, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, and alcohol. It pours a dark brown, with no transparency, and a small tan head that fades to a ring around the edges of the glass. The flavor starts with chocolate and caramel. There is a light fruity sweetness in the background. The finish has maple syrup, bourbon, vanilla, and light alcohol. Medium-full bodied with a somewhat sticky mouthful. Overall, itâ€™s good...very good, but disappointing in the sense that I think regular BCS and Coffee BCS are better. It seems like a more mild version of BCS with a hint of fruit and a thinner mouthful.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Courtesy of northernbrews. Black, oily, ring of film. Aroma is dominated by bourbon, very hot, faint coffee. Flavor, not a whole lot going on. Bourbon, light vanilla, light chocolate, syrup, alcohol and light coffee. Sticky sweet through finish, until alcohol cleans the palate. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Nothing wrong with this, and understand while people like this, but not my thing.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Aroma is charred cured pork, molasses dipped vanilla yellow cake, ruby port that somehow crept out from musty sherry casks and doughy eyed children singing.  The flavor comes from the depths of Vesuvius and even a year later is strongly represented by bourbon characteristics of vanilla and clean singed oak, the middle is highly concentrated toffee candy and the finish burns slow and smokey like a open mesquite fire.  The slick oily mouthfeel accentuates the experience and highlights the richness and feeling of true privilege to taste this liquid expression.  Incredible.  Truly fortunate to be a part of the history of bottle# 2795.  Thank You Goose Island.  22oz. bottle.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle shared by Dosbeerigos. Awesome!! Perfect balance of everything. Chocolate,vanilla,bourbon,caramel. Still a little hot but still amazing. Would love to see this one ages.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
22 oz. bottle shared with my local group.  Pours an oily black color with a small fine tan head.  I am not a bourbon drinker by itself, but appreciate the flavors and aromas in beer when it is well done.  The aroma is a wonderful blend of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, roasted malts and a slight amount of coconut.  The flavor is also something special.  This is an incredible synergy between a well crafted imperial stout and the characteristics of the barrel it was aged in.  Flavors of bourbon, roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, touches of dark fruits mesh extremely well together.  Medium plus body with a smooth mouth feel.  I could sip on this all evening and be happy.

On a side note, we had this along with all of the Fifty Fifty Eclipse treatments including the PVW at RBWG 2011 and Rare was by far the best of the bunch.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 22oz bottle, split with friends. Pours a jet black color with a tan head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, oak. Heavy on palate with soft carbonation. Flavor is sweet, bourbon, chocolate, roasted malt, with a smooth bourbon finish.  Noticeably better then the regular BCBS. Absolutely excellent.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Location/Date: Shared bottle at dbarnoldâ€™s, 10/16/11.



Appearance:Pours a black opaque.
 

Aroma: Aroma bourbony and roasty.
 

Taste: Lots of coffee, bourbon, malt.
   

Palate: Medium body.



Summary: This beer is pretty damn good, and it was nice to split with Ben, Dave and Travis.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Tasted at GTMW.  Very similar to BCS w/ a bit more bourbon and some fusel alcohol notes in the finish that took away a bit.  Nice to try, but Iâ€™d take the vanilla over this any day.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Poured an opaque black color. The head was thin and brown. Bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, and chocolate aromas. Medium to full bodied with warm, almost burning alcohol and lowish carbonation. Anise, vanilla, whiskey, raisin, and chocolate liqueur flavors.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Location: Shared bottle at dbarnoldâ€™s, 10/16/11




Aroma: The nose is rich and malty, lots of bourbon and chocolate to it


Appearance: This one pours a dark brown color with basically no head


Flavor: The taste is super malty, chocolate flavors, some vanilla, rich malts, and coffee


Palate: The mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, it is rather full bodied, and somehow fairly low in heat


Overall Impression: 
What to say, what to say.  Special thanks to Dave and Justin for finding this one, and holding on to it until we could find a good day to sample it.  This stuff was as billed.  Really nice drink for the style.  Iâ€™m surprised at how something of this magnitude can drink so nicely.  Even considering the price tag, this one is pretty damn good.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Thanks Andy! Not much for head on this one. Aroma has cinnamon and tons of raisin rum cake. That sums it up. Plenty of alcohol. The finish comes in with loads of candied, sugary sweetness. You can still taste the full BCS alcohol punch. Caramelly, sugary sweet.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Thanks Paul for sharing this fine beer! Pours black and sticks to the glass with a nice tan head. Smell is of fine bourbon, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, licorice, oak, raisins and tabacco. Taste is much of the same! Bourbon barrel notes vanilla, coffee, tabacco, chocolate, licorice, some booze and a touch of raisins. Coats the palate well and finish with a smooth bourbon and roasted bitterness! Great Beer!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Waited too long to try the rare, thanks Matt for this one opened at a tasting yesterday. Poured a dark colour, not too much of a head, the aroma was of roasted coffee and chocolate, as was the taste, not sure when Iâ€™ll get another taste!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle, courtesy GT2, thank you sir! Pour is pitch black with the smallest tan head which quickly dissipates. Aroma is bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, light roast. Taste is perfect: nice balance of coffee, vanilla, and chocolate, light sweetness. Palate is oily, full-bodied, soft carbonation, slightly bitter finish. Itâ€™s very good but not a significant improvement over regular BCS.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle courtesy of GT2, a huge thanks for this bad boy. Almost black, flat. Aroma of chocolate , coffee and subtle whiskey. Taste is perfectly balanced barrel. Probably the best mouthfeel I have had. Amazing.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: The boldest, yet smoothest example of an imperial stout Iâ€™ve ever had.  Tons of chocolate, some vanilla, not boozy at all, smooth and sweet.  Itâ€™s HUGE flavor and yet completely easy to drink.  Pours black slighty brown coffee head, no bubbles.  To sip and savor, get some if you can!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle shared with my Texas buddy Andy. Poured a pitch black with an aromatic brown head. Nose of serious bourbon and malts. Loads of vanilla, charcoal and dark chocolate. Huge ever present aromas,  Taste of sweet chocolate and a woody bourbon coat the tongue. Big malts and toffee, with all of the aroma flavors added   melds into a nice finish. Viscous body, oily, and soft carbonation. Mmmm - nice stuff....serous buzz.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 65cl, Bottle NÂ°3936, recently retired exclusive American brew, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex sweet Stout, roasted/alcoholic and slightly woody, heavy, yet very balanced, hazy, nearly no head, top class!, yet very expensive!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Iâ€™ll try to be as impartial here as I can possibly beâ€”not taking into account the fact that this beer is probably a once-in-a-lifetime experience. It pours jet black and develops no head, and it immediately assaults you with the most powerful aroma youâ€™ll ever delight your nostrils with. God Almighty! Just opening the bottle confers the air around you that unforgettable smell. Itâ€™s a cannonade of decadent, sweet notes like youâ€™ve never felt them before: fudge, dark and milk chocolates, supertanker-loads of vanilla, unholy amounts of wood, cake, crÃ¨me Chantilly, and plenty of bourbon, all complemented by a nice, rich buttery touch. The barrel notes are so overpowering that thereâ€™s barely any roast coming through, or even alcohol. The taste is very much what the aroma suggests: VERY sweet and bourbony, not boozy at all, and not terribly bitter. The mouthfeel is creamy, buttery, smooth, and extremely elegant. Iâ€™m usually a fan of more bitter, coffee-infused stouts, and this is so sweet that it borders on being a dessert. But as far as desserts in liquid form go, they just donâ€™t get much better. If you have the chance to drink it, do so on a special occasion. Sip it and share it, even though itâ€™s so smooth and delicious that you might actually be physically capable of downing an entire bottle by yourself. Jesus H. Christ!

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bomber. Pours black with thin tan head. Aroma is chocolate, oak and bourbon. Flavor is the same plus some vanilla and cream with a long smooth finish. Biggest difference between this and the original is that this is much smoother and less hot. Delicious.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 22 oz bottle.  Mahogany with a thin ring of tan foam. Nose is chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, toasted coconut and hay.  Wonderfully creamy, woody, boozy and warming with a numbing buzz.  Taste is rich dark chocolate, bourbon, grass and oak.  Touches of grape and coffee bean.  Chocolate pudding with bourbon caramel sauce.  Rare is good.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle 1116 super thanks to 17thfloor fo sharing. Pours black of course with a small creamy dark tan head. Aroma is absolutely perfect, just amazing wood character, vanilla, coconut, just a perfect bourbon character playing against the cocoa and slight roast. Flavor is great as well, so smooth for all the bourbon character, just a rich melange of cocoa, both dark and sweet, vanilla, almond, wood, bourbon, finishing rich and yet still soft. Full body and soft carbonation. Great stuff

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: This one absolutely lives up to the hype! Amazingly smooth and refined aroma and flavor. High price point makes it impossible to drink on a daily basis, but wish I could. One of the best beers I ever had in my life.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bottle #1287, shared with zep9865 to celebrate my recent engagement. Iâ€™ve had this before but this is the proper time to sit down to review and reflect upon this masterpiece.

It pours a lifeless midnight black in color with no head or carbonation. It looks like an â€™08 Bourbon County, perfectly oily and overly viscous. The aromas consist of sweet bourbon, vanilla, molasses, oak, chocolates, and syrupy goodness. You can tell itâ€™s had plenty of time to age and let itâ€™s intricate qualities intermingle. I would like a little more PVW but itâ€™s fine. The beer is already over two and a half years old at this point. The flavors are just wow. You get the silkiest, smoothest chocolates, bourbon, oak, vanilla, toffee, caramel, and earthiness that a beer drinker could ask for. It is so soft and perfect for your palate. It just fits. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever had a beer with a body so perfect. This beer is a masterpiece, a real spectacle to be hold. Well done Goose, well done.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Rare 2010ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: rating #1600  bomber - bottle #1568.  pours a dark black with brown highlights and a very slim tan head.  deep chocolate, coffee, bourbon and vanilla nose.  a bit soft on the bourbon through the aroma.  full body filled with layers of dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, oak, cherry, dark fruit and bourbon.  incredibly soft & smooth throughout with a nice lively and soft carbonation.  perfect palate.  lasting finish with more chocolate, dark fruits, vanilla and bourbon... a bit of heat follows...  with a soft creamy aftertaste... absolutely divine... a true masterpiece.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pitch black colour with a mediumsized beigeish brown head. Aroma is wooden, some apples, rum, biscuits and alcohol along with liquorice as well. Flavour is rum, brandy, some wood, mild biscuits with alcohol and some mild cinnamon elements. On the sweet side of things, but actually pleasantly balanced.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very very good stuff, enjoyed on tap at the brewery.  Nice chocolate and cinnamon, mocha, boozy, delicious

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black with a brown head - Dark malt aroma with a good barrel wood aroma - Dark malt body with a good barrel and some spicy hints as well - The dark malt flavours with spicy wood flavours goes into the finish - This was real good

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From backlog. Taster from bottle at bottleshare, Escondido, Ca. Black with beige head. Roasted malts, coffee, vanilla, cinnamon, nuts, barrel, rum, sweetness, chilli sting.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Batch 2 750ml bottle.  Pours a pitch black color that looks like thick motor oil and capped by a small tan layer of foam that shows good retention before settling into a thin film. Looks as menacing as ever like Hunaphuâ€™s always did.  The aroma shows notes of dark chocolate, cinnamon, toasted nuts, and earthy chili peppers over a very dark roasted malt base with hints of old oak, and spicy rum notes.  Iâ€™m not getting much from the Apple brandy barrel.  The flavor follows suit with the dark chocolate, vanilla, and cinnamon up front and backed up by the earthy chili peppers that adds some heat on the back end. The barrel presence is minimal and there is some oxidation from the age, but the alcohol is fairly restrained.  Full bodied and fairly smooth with subtle carbonation that leads to a dark chocolate, cinnamon, and spicy chili peppers on the finish with some lingering notes of rum and oak.  Interesting enough for sure and the Huna are all still there but the barrels donâ€™t really bring everything together like I was hoping for and the barrel expression isnâ€™t quite as pronounced as I would like.  Nowhere close to the greatness that was Batch 1, but still a good imperial stout that is worth trying if you can finda bottle.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Cigar city is brewing once again a great stout. However I would say that the aroma was a bit off. maybe was due to the transportation or a bottle fault.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Aroma is bold rum, chilies, and just a hint of brandy. After more than 3 years since bottling, the rum shows a large presence. The hint of brandy cannot be found over this rum. Texture is full with a moderate pepper heat after the swallow. Slight warming after the finish. Is this a huge bold stout? Of course it is.

 Was this a huge whale that I could not ever land? â€¦. It was. Is it a tad overhyped?... You can judge for yourself. A buddy of mine paid a ludicrous amount of money so I could sample this. For that I am very grateful.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at Alex's Birthday. Pours a pitch black with a small beige head that dissipates. Barrel-forward nose with rum and brandy alongside chocolate, coffee and cinnamon. Apple and cinnamon and rum, oak and coconut as it warms on the palate. Loads of cacao nib, melted chocolate and cinnamon. Great barrel flavor with everything being noticeable. ABV is there, but not overly boozy. Lingering oak, chocolate and cinnamon on the finish with rum and coconut.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
(Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged) Bottle 750ml at home, served into a snifter.
Pitch black colour on the body, and a pour as thick as used motor oil. A very thin layer of dark brown foam on top, disappearing quickly.
Aroma of roasted malts and chocolate, cardamon, spices. Taste follows, quite sweet with lots of cocoa and chocolate, spices, not much of the chillies. Full body with a velvet-y mouthfeel. Great.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Barrel aroma with notes of vanilla, cane sugar, grapes. Notes of risotto, of course, plus alcohol. Black, opaque color. Dark brown, medium-sized and similarly durable foam. Moderately sweet taste with a distinct barrel note. Lots of vanilla, chocolate, peppers, cocoa, chocolate and alcohol. A bit of spice. Quite a well-balanced taste. Moderate, pleasant bitterness. High fullness, below-average carbonation and vanilla with chocolate on the finish with a distinct alcohol and pepper note.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle at Dougs, thanks man 

Pours black with a small tan head, light lacing. Dark malts, dark fruit, woody, cinnamon, vanilla and chocolate, mild bitterness 

Damn good

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Cigar City Brewing - Double Barrel Hunahpuâ€™s 2016

Imperial Stout With Cacao & Spices Added. 50% Aged In Rum Barrels, 50% Aged In Apple Brandy Barrels.

Alcohol: 11% by volume.

Colour: Black like the eyes of the furious fire god Hun-Hunaphu

Foam: Beige, modest with a finely grained structure.

It hisses loudly and falls to a small stripe. On the edges of the TeKu there are dotted spots.

Smell: There is pulp! The aroma blows to the max. First rum and raisins macerated in this noble drink. Then a whole range of dried fruits, candied apples, plums, apricots and grapes.
Right after that a terrible punch straight in the face from cocoa beans, thick milk chocolate and Belgian pralines.

Knock out provides a range of toffee, coffee, raisins, cane sugar and spices.
Beautiful bouquet!

Taste: Incredible barrel profile. The euphoria of flavors begins with noble rum with its strong and uncompromising taste, full of spices and wood. Then the barrel of apple Brandy (or, I presume, Calvados) enters with great verve, giving the drink a taste of baked apple pie.
The next layers of the bouquet of flavors are an avalanche of chocolate, toffee, Belgian pralines, sugar cane, wood, raisins and toffee.
The final straight belongs to spices, the most distinguished of which is chilli, dotting the "i", stinging in the throat.

Alcohol is present, warms, confuses the head a little, but fortunately it does not have a warm, solvent character and does not step out of line.
Double Barrel Hunaphu's has no shortage of body.
The noble, dignified character of the drink will provide many minutes of successful, fruitful tasting.

Carbonation: Low.

Summary:

Finally!! Hunahpuâ€™s (several vintages) - NO! Bourbon Barrel Aged Hunahpuâ€™s - NO!
And only Double Barrel Hunahpuâ€™s - definitely YES!

A wonderful little beer that gives so much joy and satisfaction from tasting!
Deep flavor and aroma profile, stunning Rum and Calvados barrels.
Balance, depth, variety, class and chic.

The best beer in Cigar City Brewing's portfolio!

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

Double Barrel Hunahpuâ€™s 2016

Bottle Share @ Browariat, Katowice (12.10.2019)

Still a nice, complex beer. Cinnamon combined with chili peppers gives a very spicy finish. A bit of apple, wood, brandy, vanilla.

A bit worse than the first time 4.3

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours Black with a tan head. Aroma of huge cinnamon, licorie, quite alot apple brandy, , cocoa, quite some Dark chocolate. Taste is loads of cinnamon, quite alot heat, chilies, green peppers, licorie and loads of cocoa. Sweet a fine fine sipper but Way to mamy spices

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle 750 ml at Arrogant tasting, courtesy of Italian friends. 2016 version. Fantastic, so intense, chocolate, roasted malts, cocoa, oily, some brandy, dark fruit, apple, very complex. Smooth. Warming. Full bodied. Beautiful.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black color with dark mocha head. Aroma is really spice forward with lots of cinnamon, rum and booze. Taste is desserty with fudge, chili, cinnamon and some heat on the finish. Full bodied, smooth mouthfeel. Quite nice but not such a huge step ahead of the regular.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Rami Rami is drinking a Double Barrel Hunahpu's 2013 by Cigar City Brewing at Warszawski Festiwal Piwa

A great barrel, a great sweetness in the mouth, vanillas to the max, but taste > aroma. A lot of body. Cinnamon candy. 4.6? Finish a bit irritating

Rami Rami is drinking a Double Barrel Hunahpu's (2016) by Cigar City Brewing at garwoliÅ„ska

Cool, tasty, good, interesting, curious, nice. But seriously, it's some kind of very dry roasted vintage, much less barrel than in 2013... 

Rami Rami is drinking a Sun Mosaic by Dugges Bryggeri at Mikkeller Bar Warsaw

Oxidized, malty, caramel-orange... oh come on... and some long, dull bitterness... a little more stars for the company of the mega pork chop ;)

average ratings:

2013 - 4.6, 4.4

2016 - 4.2, 4.0

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Tasted from bottle. Pours black with beige head. Tasted against regular 16 Huna and 17 Bourbon BA Huna. Aroma of cinnamon, rum, almost a little nutty, some fruity notes and apple. Moderate to heavily sweet with mild bitterness. Lots of cinnamon, caramel, toffee, some chocolate and finishes with a moderate chili burn. You do get some rum barrel sweetness and just a hint of brandy. More intense and complex than the Huna and Bourbon Huna. Excellent!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by Wickedestman, many thanks! Pitch black, viscous with beige head. Leathery with booze, apple brandy, cinnamon sticks and coconut shavings. Some chili heat in the finish.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: (bottle, nochmals vielen dank stefan!) deepest black colour with a deep ruby-brown head. aroma of brown sugar and cherry schnaps, with some notes of vanilla icing, dripping sachertorte, walnuts and chocolate liqueur. flavour is toasted malts, yeast slurry and dark doughy malts, with lots of fudge, some earth, chilli, purÃ©ed hazelnuts and a rather dry soy sauce finish. ethanol is wonderfully concealed. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sample. Black, holographic red-brown lace. Extremely rich broad roast, chocolate, chilli, melted praline, peanuts. Still decadent sweets on the palate, dry chocolate, chili, wood, M&M's, almond cream, cinnamon, Apple brandy retronasal. Crazy shit.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle, from a trade with dzudohonor. Pours black with a dark brown head. Aroma is apple brandy, rum, pineapple, coconut, booze. Body is heavy, strong and super spicy as well as boozy. Strong and intense, pineapple, rum and brandy. Feels like a tryhard. Manages quite well but I'm not quite as convinced as a #4 overall should do.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle, many thanks anstei & dzudohonor! Black color with beige head. Aroma is cinnamon, apple brandy funk, cocoa, vanilla, rum. Taste is hot chocolate, cinnamon, chili. Lots of cinnamon stick in the back, pepperoni aftertaste. Silky mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Amazing beer, but I think I like regular Hunahpu better - this is more edgy though. It gets better and better with every sip!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: In the aroma dark chocolate, chocolate box, peppers, barrel notes, rum notes. In the taste semi-sweet, slightly spicy. In the finish pralines, light roastiness, again pleasant peppers and delicate cinnamon. Noble alcohol, smooth, very intense, lots of body, very well composed. Great beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Mega opaque black color, with brown foam. Mega smoked Hungarian peppers in the aroma, a bit of apple barrel rum and pralines. Poetry. Peppers, pralines and dessert chocolate in the taste. Hot peppers at the perfect level. Revelation, poetry body, cinnamon, noble alcohol, low carbonation. Gains a lot after heating. World class and deserved hype.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aromas of cinnamon, vanilla, spice and peppers. Flavors are all that and then some. Cinnamon really pops and the heat is the perfect amount. Nice and viscous. Amazing what the barrel aging does to an already awesome beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Refrigerated 75 cL brown bottle poured into a glass. Aroma is potatoes, thick body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is chocolate, rum, and brandy,

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark beer with a brown slick for a head. Really earthy nose with barrel notes. Very complex beer. Sitting here the back of my throat is simmering with the pepper. Sweet caramel and brown sugar, sweet rum, dried fruit, pepper flavor and heat, milk chocolate and warming alcohol. Really nice beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a thick, oily pitch black coloration with a small, creamy head. The beer downright sticks to the glass as you swirl it, leaving a short-lived film of dark beer and white lace. Smell is somewwhat subdued, pretty underwheming compared to the taste. Cinnamon is most noticeable, with a sort of odd earthy, musty, woody aroma being pretty dominant as well. Perhaps a hint of coconut there. Taste is quite complex, lots of chocolate and rum noticeable at first, with a decent bit of cinnamon and vanilla coming through as well. The chili really grows as you drink and the beer warms. Quite noticeable in the aftertaste in a really pleasant way. Quite a bit of warm boozyness there as well, but very smooth and mellow at the same time. Mouthfeel really is fantastic, very thick, sticky, almost oily and very smooth. I was considering waiting for CBS for my 100th review, but I think this one will do nicely.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Full of roasted malts, toffee, molasses, very rich and extremely well balanced. Nice cinnamon profile. The chili profile is slightly accented in the end. Taste is sweet for the whole of degustation. Full body. This, velvety and creamy texture.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Little to no foam, pitch black. Smells spicy, sweet, apple, sweet liquor, roasted. Tastes thick, sweet, spicy, apple. Delicious.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beautiful black color with a small, but good collar. Smells full, vanilla, rum, apple, autumn fruit. Tastes full, sweet, apple, fruity, alcohol. Different than usual, but delicious.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Super black, no foam. Smells delicious barrel aged. Thick, syrupy, very sweet, a bit of apple indeed. Very tasty!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Chilli, wood, rum, brandy, fruits, extremely complicated, earthy, barrel, very plesant to sniff. Nicely balanced, smooth. Overall extreme good beer, but i don't think that it will be in my TOP 10.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Aroma: earthiness, wet wood, cinnamon less noticeable than in the unaged version (really slight), pleasant oxidation in the type of slightly dried fruit, slightly noticeable chocolate, brandy.
Taste: slightly irritating sharpness more noticeable (not necessarily from the peppers, perhaps the barrel after rum has a greater influence here), pleasant dryness, bitterness like rum-sharp. Apart from that, the same is noticeable in the taste as in the aroma.
The foam is better than in the unaged version.
The beer is demanding, not easy. As for me, it is very good, but not brilliant.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Powerful aroma, hits with chocolate pralines with nuts. After cooling down, you can catch rum and candied sugar, cocoa and light paprika. Powerful, very chocolatey in taste. It is like a thick, bitter chocolate for drinking. Bitter cocoa, vanilla, nuances of coconut and strong chili heat - clearly stronger than in the base.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Fruity, plums, spicy finish. Very complex, just a hint of alcohol, lots of plums and nuts. Barrels made great work.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Batch 2. Thanks Virby44 for sharing the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing pitch black with very thin translucent brown rims and very sparse latte colored foam. 

The nose shows strong rum influence with moderately intense fruit forward notes of apple and cinnamon. 

The palate is oily, slick, and well carbonated. Cinnamon forward spiciness with a strong rum background throughout. Mid-palate warms up with chilies, followed by light notes of baked apple, finished by more apple, cinnamon, and a moderate coffee bitterness to tie it off. Moderate spiciness throughout.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Hopishop 2017. Black pour. Aroma of spicey herbal chili, fruity brandy, rum and lots of booze. Taste has cherry, smooth chili heat, apples, red fruit, caramel and a spicey finish. Quite the experience.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Oxford tastings; vintage 2016
Pitch black. Dark chocolate, hot spices and booze; pretty much what you are looking at.
Vanilla, roasted nuts, maple and pecan ice cream, then more waves of chili pepper; moderately sweet, but full bodied.
Extreme, not elegant, just extreme.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle @ Alex's. Pours an opaque black with a small brown head. Nose is barrels, wood, and molasses. Flavour is molasses, leather, slight ashtray, spices, Worcestershire. It's a bit rough with booze and then the chili spice lingers on the palate quite a bit.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle at Alex's (thx, Hugo V.!). Pours a very dark brown with a weak brown head. Aroma (first nose was sundried tomatoes with chocolate!) is cinnamon, sweet. Kind of similar to regular Huna. Taste is veeery spicy, woody, with some brandy notes. Not really a my style, but it is good.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very dark brown. No head. On the nose, strong and sugary, the rum notes seeming more evident. On the palate, a whack of cinnamon, extra sweet sugars, toffee, molasses, and then there's a cinnamon, nutmeg, touch of anchoish chile...so rich and delicious. Here, the barrel shows with a touch of rum, but aside from some late heat I'm not sure there's much of the brandy barrel. The spicy chile and cinnamon still comes through in the finish.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
What can you say? It's the pinnacle of saisons. The slightly tangy, slightly fruity, but so refreshing. It's definitely the standard. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: PAKK 2017 - PAKK 2017 - In the aroma, plum in chocolate, very bitter chocolate, Christmas spices for gingerbread. After warming, a pleasant barrel is revealed. After pouring, the foam fell very quickly. Surprisingly, the beer was not very thick. In taste, again, chocolate, coffee, spices, quite dry. At the very end, a very delicate note of soy sauce appeared. Beer drunk to the accompaniment of crackling logs in the campfire introduces a very pleasant state of relaxation

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2016. Awesome work of the two barrels. Apple, rum, cinnamon, sweet choco, harsh hot peppers (in a good way). Med to full body. Rich and complexed. Not heavy but definitely demanding one. A small dose is enough. Worth trying.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
02.05.2014, tap @ CBC:

Nice dark brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, dark sugar, dark malts, vanilla, mild sweet bourbon, cinnamon, chili, chocolate, raisins, grass. Taste is very sweet syrupy, dark sugar, oak, dark malts, alcohol, chili, cocoa, grass, coffee, vanilla, cinnamon, mild sweet bourbon, raisins, hay. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry mouthfeel, nice warming chili touch. Very nice!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Rating #5000... Bottle courtesy of Wilkes and Lynn: black pour, tan head that leaves a ring. aroma of chocolate, vanilla, woody. tastes are apple butter, cinnamon, light chili spice, molasses, bitter dark chocolate, barrel woody, remarkably low booziness, caramel, background bourbon/brandy. crazy complex sipper.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Friends gift@ pours black color with creamy brown dissipating head. Aroma: intense roasted grain, dark malts, vanillin/ vanilla, lots of cinnamon some chilli notes, cacao nibs, apple brandy & sweet rum. Flavour follows aroma: (IMO!: too) intense cinnamon, decent vanilla (vanillin) chilli burnt, perfectly blended with booze of a sweet rum and apple brandy. Body is full almost thick, texture velvetly, creamy, carbonation is low to moderate. It would be perfect to taste it head to head with Perennial BA Abraxas & Prairie Pirate Paradise.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pour is super rich viscous black with a thin tan head. Aroma is sweeter than expected with lots cinnamon and light heat. Flavor is similar with cinnamon toast crunch and vanilla with notable heat in The finish. Real nice.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pours thick motor oil, creamy tan head. 
Aroma is huge apple brandy, cinnamon, milk chocolate, oak, 
Taste: big mouth fell, full of apple brandy, rum sweetness, coconut, lots of peppers in the finish. Amazing beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2016 bottle. 
Nose is almost shockingly vegetal. Spices and coffee take a back seat. 
Body, look and flavor are more like expected, though I prefer just apple brandy to the double. Cinnamon and peppers and coffee more evident, decent amounts of chocolate and barrel. Boody is smooth even with the back end heat, and it pours like motor oil with deep cocoa head. If it werenâ€™t for the nose, this would be a favorite. Too expensive to get again.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
750 ML bottle 
Thanks to Owen for providing

Oil black pour. Signature CCB head of dark brown and dark chocolate color. Menacing color. Does fade to a thin collar quickly. 
Nose is cinnamon, chilies, oak, rum and brandy. Sensory explosion. combination of barrels work well with the base beer very well. 
taste is still the base beer and even more chocolate and ancho chilies with a good mix of rum and brandy sweetness. really works well with the base beer.
Thick and sludgy body but with enough sweetness from the barrels to smooth this out well. Complex and just plain fun

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle shared with Julien. Pours black with a dark brown foamy head. Beautiful bubbles dissipating slowly. Leaves strong lacing and a boozy rim when stirred. Smells veryyyy strong. It hits me as I pour it out into the glass. Sweet barrel with spicy chilli peppers. Some spiced rum as well round it out. Some roast and dark chocolate notes and a boozy finish on the nose. Tastes extremely smooth. Hot and sweet chilli peppers with cinnamon all over. The barrel wood is pronounced and delicious. Rum sweetness and earthy roastiness. Spice, roast, booziness and a little sweet apple. The barrel finish is unreal. This body is second to none. So full and enveloping. Amazing. Love it.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is big bourbon barrel vanilla booze roast malts chocolate. Taste is more of the nice big bourbon barrel booze and plenty cinnamon.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Starts off rum then transitions to brandy. Side by side with regular. Cinnamon. Seems a bit thinner then regular. A lot more going on with double barrel. Delicious. Subtle anchos.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Damn was this good. Dark as heck with a super brown head. All the flavors melted together wonderfully. It doesnâ€™t get better than this.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by Alex thx mate. Drank with the boys on Alexâ€™s birthday session A: rum, dark chocolate, cacao, raisins, light tobacco. Spices. App: pitch back sparing beige head. T/p: Full body with med bitter finish. Soft carbonation. Nice bite from the spiciness. O: a wonderful creation. Really enjoy the hotness from the spice at the end. An excellent beer, perfect for this time of year. The barrel aging really gives a nice feels to the brew itâ€™s a master piece I dought I would be able to put this in my mouth again and canâ€™t thx my buddy Alex for giving me this opportunity.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle shared with Ben, Seb, Jo and Edith. Aroma: anice, apples, spices, oak, light milk chocolate. App: dark brown, minimal brown head but good retention and nice lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, nice apple touch in mouth, great spicy and bitter finish. Overall: much prefer this version over the regular version. Really enjoy the apples and those spices burning my throat. This is really complex. Awesome!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Shared at the December THT at deansoâ€™s. 


2016 vintage: Pitch black pour with a thin tan head. Tons of cinnamon, vanilla, toasted coconut, cocoa, spices, brandy, light tequila spiciness and chillies. Full body, medium to low carbonation and a bitter-sweet finish. A very complex bouquet of flavours, but does feel a bit rough sometimes. 4.5


2012 vintage: the same taste notes as the 2016 vintage, much better balanced, no chilli burn, no extreme cinnamon, super-smooth texture, more chocolate, the rum barrel is working a bit better, I find. Just perfect!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Original version. Poured deep dark reddish brown with a tan ring. Aroma of chocolate and light chili. Full body, flavour as the aroma, smooth,. Excellent balance.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at the December THT. Poured a clear dark brown with a round tan head. The aroma is sweet roasty malt, molasses, chocolate, alcohol liquorice. The flavour is moderate sweet with a sweet chilli spice oily malt palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2016 version at THT, thanks to RandomstrangerNL. Black with short lasting brown head. Massive cinnamon and spicy peppers, chocolate, bourbon, coconut, string spices, cognac, strong alcohol, sugary, coffee, sweet malts, calvados,lots of roasted notes. Very sweet, medium bitter. Full bodied with alcoholic and light spicy finish. 4.3



Original version, also at THT thanks to RandomstrangerNL. Much more chocolate, less peppers but still a bit of heat. Less alcohol, massive sweet chocolate, peppers and cinnamon. Amazing. Way better than the fresh bottle.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottled, 2016 version. Thanks for sharing kermis. Pours massively dark without much of a head. Aroma is big chillies, cinnamon, dark chocolate, oak and some rum. Flavour is sweet, spices are pretty overpowering. Pretty spicy too. It feels a bit raw, but tastes so good. Does not really feel like a beer anymore, but I love it. Very viscous, definitely a slow sipper.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma is of bittersweet fudge and booze. Flavor has nice amount of booze paired with chocolate and mild roast. Finishes with lots of alcohol and chocolate. Nice and smooth on the palate.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black like oil with no head. Cinnamon, cocoa, rum barrels and apple. Viscous mouthfeel. Small heat from the alcohol on the finish. This is phenomenal but needs to sit for a couple years.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared thanks to kermis. Pours a thick pitch black oily beer with a small mocha head. Aroma is big on the dark chocolate, coconut, coffee, vanilla, rum, bell peppers, chilliâ€™s and a bit of smoke. Taste is heavy sweet, medium bitter. Full body with low carbonation. An amazing beer, this bottle is very fresh and would do well with a bit of age to lose some of the vegetal green notes from the chilliâ€™s. Killer!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Shared bottle at kermisâ€™ courtesy of Kermis. Vintage 2016.  Black with almond st no head. Deep roasted chocolate malts. Dense black roast, chocolate, coffee and ash. Coconut and rum. Intensely sweet and moderate roasty bitter. Full body and low carb. 

Still here, THT December at deansoâ€™s! Vintage 2016 courtesy of RandomStrangerNL. Canâ€™t believe Iâ€™m having this twice within a few weeks. Such a dense dark roast and crazy coco sweet, powered by spiciness and roasted paprika. Burnt to ash coconut and paprika. Me loves. 

Vinyage 2012 courtesy of RandomStrangerNL. Big roasty with paprika and everything. Nice mild palate. Love.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Rich black color with tan thin head. Aroma of molasses and barrel. Taste is motor oil thick, subtle spice and a nice mix of the rum and slight apple tang.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sample at Denver Rare Beer Tasting VIII on 10/07/2016. Pitch black pour with a thin light brown head that recedes gradually to a film. Patchy lacing. Coffee, rum, malt and chocolate aroma. Full-bodied with flavors of rum, cinnamon-infused brandy, chocolate malt, vanilla and apple. Just a touch of chili pepper. The finish is spiced rum and chocolate. Very good all around.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pitch black pour, with a tan head. Milk chocolate, rich, sweet, apple brandy, vanilla, dark chocolate, notes of chili pepper, and wood. Tasty.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: My favorite stout of all time......hands down. I have had this over 10 times and people are saying it has falling off, but I think it is still drink VERY well.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at dunder. Very dark colour, taste of chocolate and lots of spices..

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Probably the best Imperial Stout Iâ€™ve ever had! Chocolate and coffee on the palate with a little additional sweetness from the Apple Brandy.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Well-balanced chocolatey-boozy aroma with some light coconut notes. Poured black in color with a dark tan head. Flavor was rich chocolatey, boozy with a strong roast character, mild vanilla notes, and touch of booze on the finish. Palate was excellent, great body, not syrupy, and the flavors really linger.

Notes: On tap at the Denver Rare Beer Tasting 8, during GABF Week 2016.  This was my favorite stout at the event!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: I wasnâ€™t a huge fan of regular Huna. But this DBH is outstanding. Wow. Cinnamon chocolate fudge with Apple Brandy, Rum, and spice. Very drinkable, no booze. Thick ass mouthfeel is in its own league. Not even DL or TG stouts can surpass DBH in terms of mouthfeel.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
I managed to snag a bottle of this to enjoy with a friend the night before his wedding and I must say that it is worth all the hype. Just an outstandingly complex imperial stout

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at CBC 2014. Pours an opaque black with a beige head. Smells of rye. Very sweet with a moderate bitterness. Malty aromas of caramel withave hints of toasted malts. Also aromas of tobacco, cinnamon and cask wood with hints of honey. Very full bodied! Creamy palate. No carbonation. Bitter finish.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black with a magohany head. Aroma; Dark chocolate, molasses, roasted malt, coconut, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg and a touch of chili, bourbon and rum. Flavour; Dark chocolate, vanilla, a pinch of chili, cinnamon, bourbon, rum, oak and nutmeg

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A: Pitch black with a thin brown lacing N: Coffee, vanilla, soy sauce, cocoa, cinnamon T: Cinnamon, roasted coconut, vanilla, coffee, cocoa, cayenne pepper O: Very nice cocoa nib flavour! Sweet and very much from the spice. Big up!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
[ bottle ][ 6oz ][ @tasting ][ $ ? ][ snifter ][ 10.24.15 ]
black, thin CCB cardboard head dies fast, tepid soon after. Olive-green nose blows off after 10 minutes, sweet milk chocolate, playdoh and light spice. Flabby body brings heavy sweetness up front, chocolate milk sugar with light pepper heat, some cardboard mid in gritty body, finish bringing faint roast, more lactose/sugar, stale finish. No interplay or depth, lacking bitterness of any kind, simple and straightforward and all after the 10 minute green air-out. CCB is still CCB and the Mexican Cakes destroyed it.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 25.4 oz bottle. Huge thanks to Beerlando for his amazing generosity! I never would have had the guns to trade for this one. Inky brown with tan fuzz then a slick. Nose is fudge brownie, musty basement, chili, raisin, cinnamon and coconut with brandy and rum emerging. Coating medium body with a soft, warming buzz. Taste is spicy chocolate, brandy, cinnamon and sweet rum. Not as extravagant as the aroma but still incredibly lush and balanced. Probably my favorite beer ever.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Going from memory of a bottle share. Lots of booze, oak, rum, sweetness. Huna spices were mellowed compared to the regular version, but lots of complex barrel notes.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from Sylvain opened at the Big "Deck" Tasting. Black with no head, thick and viscous pour. Mixed fruit and dark chocolate, very thick, smooth, oak, rum raisin, booze, light cinnamon, chilli flakes, booze, oak, molasses, full body, mild+ carbonation, smooth and long complex finish.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
