Aroma is apple brandy liquer, warm spice cake, thick decadent chocolate, a touch of rum, and some barrel and pepper heat. The taste is just incredible. Smooth apple brandy, chocolate fudge, vanilla wafers, cinnamon, spice, and some pepper heat on the finish. This beer is just fucking decadent as hell. Iâ€™m drinking the whole thing to my face. Cheers!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bomber courtesy of and shared with Kermis, big thanks.
Thin tan head. Clear black pour. Lots of coconut and cinnamon. Awesome

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: tap@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014 - black pour with tan head. Roasted dark malty, chocolate, vanilla, slightly burned caramel, brown sugar, rum wooden nuance on palate, great mouthfeel. Amazing stout this.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by dexter. Nose is fruity with some apples and pears. Pitch black pour minimal head. Taste is amaze balls. Very thick mouthfeel. Sticky. A very nice blend if barrel and booze with the base beer. A little boosty but the main stout is very evident. A very light lingering heat. Solid. Trust me bro. Trust me.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle, 05/23/2014. Pours pitch black, dark mocha tan head, creamy, dies to a haze over half the surface, small ring of lacing. Aroma is nutty cocoa, earthy chili and spice, coffee roast base, with vanilla graham cracker, dark chocolate ganache, with brown sugar, fruity brandy barrel elements floating in the finish. Taste is creamy round chocolate, caramel, moderate heat from the chili builds over time, cinnamon and earthy roast, mildly sweet barrel notes add nice accent, heat and cocoa lingering in the finish. Velvety smooth, thick body. Very nice.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft at Rustico Ballston. Beautiful, ink black pour with ridiculous lacing that slowly seeps down the glass as you sip (and try not to gulp because good lord is this good). Nose and flavor are breathtakingly marvelous, with profound and layered notes of mild chili pepper, rich red zinfandel, Cointreau, chocolate ganache and bitter dark chocolate, good roasted bitterness, overripe plum, and smooth coffee. Gloriously rich and decadent, but not overdone; an instant 5 on palate. This is an absolute masterpiece; CCB deserves the hype for this one.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap sample at CBC 2014. Jet black body, small caramel head. Aroma is cocoa, brown sugar, rum, mild brandy tones, coffee, vanilla, hints of baked bread, wood, nuts, mild burnt sugar, caramel and toffee. Taste is an amazing explosion of coffee, cocoa, vanilla, coconut, roasted apples, wood, licorice, dark chocolate, syrup and hints of chili, cinnamon and caramel. Wow. Breathtaking in conplexity and balance alike. Smooth, oily body, soft carbonation. A really amazing treat, glad I got to try this splendid masterpiece of an ale. :-)

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 1st Session. Pours black with a brown head, aroma of chocolate, caramel, toffee, flavor of caramel, to, barrel, brandy, hot with chilli and cocoa, full bodied, amazing.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 ml bottle poured into a mini snifter. Pours a thick black to brown with a khaki colored head of foam. The aroma has chocolate cake, cinnamon, cayenne, cocao, marshmallow, and vanilla beans. Sweet and spicy dark chocolate. Thick mouthfeel and low to medium carbonation. An awesome beer!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle share thanks to DrewFace. Black, thick, booze, no head. Aroma is mix of pepper, cinnamon, and chocolate. Taste is strong barrel, a tad sweet, chocolate, cinnamon. Pretty dam tasty. Better than I remember from hunaphu day. Great beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: [5/2/14] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. 1st session. Black with a brown head. Amazing aroma with chocolate, cinnamon, a bit of coffee, a bit of coconut, vanilla and some brandy fruitiness. Sweet flavor with chocolate, vanilla, wood, some spiciness, some fruity notes and some hot chili in the finish. Full-bodied and thick. Great.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: CBC. Black with a small dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, bourbon and vanilla. Flavor is extremely sweet and very bitter. Extremely sweet and very bitter finish with alcohol. Oily and smooth. 020514

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Black with only a trace of brown head. So much going on in the aroma. With everything coming together it smells almost minty. Taste is equally complex. The barrels are swarming around, pulling it in different ways, and beneath it all pepper heat and cinnamon manage to rise up to the surface occasionally. Very difficult to make sense of it all in the small sample size but clearly an incredibly complex feast for the senses.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draught at CBC 2014. Pitch black - brown head. Lots of coconut in the aroma, sweetness, sweet malty, bitterness, high wooden (american oak), chocolate, dark chocolate, sharpness, light acid, tannins, fruity, light notes, of grapes.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at CBC 2014. Black with small brown head. Roasted malty aroma with chocolate, spicy notes like cinnamon, vanilla, rum. Sweet taste which is almost the same as the aroma with some coffee and coconut. Medium to full body, creamy with soft carbonation. Great!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
On CBC, early in the morningâ€¦
Apple strudel with custard in the aroma. Lead heavy imperial on crazy too early in the day. Massive and thick. 

Will come back to this one again I think when I've had breakfast first at least.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. black pour, reddish-purple head. Beautiful. Nose is peppers, sweetness from barrels, chocolate, everything so well integrated. Rich double chocolate cake to the taste, pepper heat, sweet rum, a touch of apple, chocolate syrup on mouthfeel, only issue is this was a really spicy bottle. When I had it on tap at Huna Day I thought the chiles were much better balanced. Still, itâ€™s easily one of the best beers Iâ€™ve had.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap @ CBC, 14. #10000. Black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, wood and coconut. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, coconut, wood, little liquorice, thick, rum and sweet.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12oz pour at Rustico Ballston. Pours a very inky black with a ring of red head. Nose has a ton of molasses, big cinnamon stick, black pepper, malt, heavy raisin, some booze, some burnt caramel, some caramel apple, dried cherry, port. Flavors are nice, super smooth and very well blended, sweet, sticky molasses, brown sugar, malt, Kahlua, some maple sap, soy, black pepper, some condensed cola, indiscriminate wood, mild sherry. The peppery heat comes through at the end. Warming and not offensive. Super smooth.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft @ CBC 2014. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty woody chocolate aroma. Roasted malty woody thick chocolate flavor with some weak hints of rum. Has a roasted malty smooth woody chocolate finish with weak hints of rum in the aftertaste.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Well itâ€™s come to this. I didnâ€™t get a whole lot of this beer, but thanks to generous people, I was able to sample their beers at Rustico Ballston for a Hardywood/Cigar City event. Aroma is cinnamon, roasted malts, pepper and some light cocoa. Vanilla notes, though a lot of this base beer is masked by plenty of rum, brandy, barrel notes. Interesting beer - perhaps not as complex as the regular version - but something worth checking out. Lots of heat on the finish of this one, booze, barrel, booze. Light chili heat. Interesting.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 10 ounces on draft at Rustico Ballston during the SAVOR Hardywood/Cigar City event, poured into a snifter. Jet black with tan head. Aromas of cinnamon, dark chocolate, vanilla, brandy, rum. Tasting notes of dark chocolate, fudge, vanilla, rum, brandy, cinnamon, coconut, light chili peppers. Full body with a dry and warm slightly peppery finish. Full and light syrupy mouthfeel, low carbonation, Smooth for the ABV. Delicious.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at rustico. Pours thick black with low dark tan head. Aroma is big sweet booze roast with light spice. Taste is very rich roast and chocolate with big port barrel notes and a light cinnamon and pepper finish.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at Rustico Ballston. Pours a still black with a ring of bubbles at the glass. Aroma is sweet and complex: coconut sweetness, cinnamon, molasses, bourbon, and many notes of dark fruits. Flavor is massive and overpowering. Roast, spice, mole, chocolate. Creamy mouthfeel. Outstanding. Note: was served the first pour, and tried it next to one of the last pours. The latter was noticeably more spicy, as though the peppers had settled out of solution. Still amazing.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
On draft at Rustico in Arlington. I very excite!

The beer appears pitch black with a thin, oily beige cap. The aroma brings a grandiose helping of cinnamon, roast, brandy. What a flavor! Ample cinnamon at first followed by a perfect compliment of chilis. Silly smooth brandy notes with a delicate sweetness from the rum barrels. A lovely concoction. Wonderfully smooth on the palate. World class.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
10 November 2023. At Billie's Craft Beer Fest. Thanks to tderoeck for sharing today's beers - cheers to so many more!

Vintage 2023. Jet black, beige head. Lots and lots and lots of maple syrup, maple syrup on pancake, almond, pralinÃ©, flavoured cappuccino, tobacco, hazelnut. Intense sweet maple syrup, cookies, pancake, chocolate sauce & nuts. Extremely long finish of peppery hops, bitter coffee, maple, maple, etc. Potent whisky & coffee liqueur alcohol warmth. Full body, oily/viscous texture, soft carbonation. An amazing surprise to find this at the festival. Savoured until the last drop. Now there's only hoping to encounter it again sometime...

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draught at Pita Kabob in Visalia.  Pours oily black with brown highlights.  Medium brown head slowly fades.  Massive coffee and maple on the aroma.  Flavor is smooth chocolate, maple syrup and vanilla, with coffee in the back.  Viscous mouthfeel.  Alcohol is well hidden in this beer.  Such a great beer.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_review: World class. Super heavy on the maple syrup. The coffee balanced it all out. Great. __ Billies Craft Beer Festival 2023__

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
65cl Bottle @ Hopbuds, Nagoya, Japan.
Black colour with a thin tan head.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle.

A- Maple, espresso, mocha, fudge, slightly sweet.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head. 

T- Espresso, bitter, fudge, maple syrup.

P- Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, bitter finish.

O- What a treat for #5,000 and thanks to Ozzy70 for helping me secure it! Sorta wish I would have gotten two! Dang near perfect. The best maple flavor I've ever had in a beer. Shockingly not nearly as sweet as I expected. In fact, the level of bitterness was the only thing keeping me from giving this a perfect score. Tone that down and the maple alone could wow anyone.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tons of maple and milk chocolate in the aroma. Jet black with no head. Taste also has heavy maple and chocolate notes with no booze burn. The palate is a little thin but the aftertaste lasts a long time. Excellent. Worthy of its ratings.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from TG, 2020. Black with creamy khaki crown. Rich with maple syrup and coffee in the aroma. The maple syrup in the foreground, the coffee well integrated with the taste picture. Big, sticky body. Maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, coconut, bounty, vanilla wafers, biscuits. Substantial sweetness, balanced somewhat by the coffee and bitterness. Very good, great taste. Well done. Maybe not the most complex beer. Possibly somewhat high sweetness that becomes a bit much after a while. But still amazingly good.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma of maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, alcohol. Black, opaque color. Beige foam, finely bubbled, moderate in size and similarly durable. Sweet taste, reflecting the aroma. Nicely balanced. Malt-alcohol bitterness, pleasant. High fullness, medium-high carbonation and ice cream wafers on the finish and alcohol warming the esophagus.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle in Sydney - thanks, Owen! Black with a lasting tan head. Aroma is very nice with huge maple, coffee, dark chocolate, roast. Flavor is extremely well balanced, medium maple syrup sweetness with a great roasty bitterness, espresso, dark chocolate. Feel is not too heavy at all, very drinkable with good carbonation. Did not disappoint.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 3000th rating! Bottle at home, 2019 ed, beautifully waxed. Very dark brown, quite a thick pour, foamy brown head. Huge coffee beans, mocha, maple, toffee, caramel, vanilla, cinnamon, clove, as it warms it gets some porto vinous character, light bitterness - incredible flavors, pastry stout avant-la-lettre. Beautiful long linger with complex coffee and maple tones. Big body, smooth, sticky mouthfeel, low prickly carbonation.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Deep dark brown with a dense, dark tan head. Aromas of rich syrup, along with dark coffee, toffee, cinnamon, dark cocoa and mild roasted malt. Flavors start sweet and rich. The pure maple syrup pours through the malt and coffee. Smooth and slightly oily.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Vintage 2019

Appearance: Pours opaque dark brown to black with lasting creamy brown head, with some lacing.
Appearance: dark brown-black, opaque. Long lasting fine brown lather with some cupping.
5/5

Aroma: Toasted malt, espresso, dark chocolate, toffee, cinnamon, vanilla, maple syrup and molasses, with slight hints of smoke.
Nose: Roasted malt, espresso, dark chocolate, toffee, cinnamon, vanilla, maple syrup and molasses with a hint of smoke.
9/10

Taste: Pronounced coffee flavor with dark chocolate, maple syrup and toasted malts. Heavy sweetness balanced by same bitterness and sourness. Lingering bitter tart finish with hints of espresso.
Taste: Prominent coffee flavor, accompanied by dark chocolate, maple syrup and roasted malt. Heavy sweetness is balanced by equal amounts of bitterness and acidity. The finish is long, sour and bitter, showing the taste of espresso.
8/10

Mouthfeel: Full bodied, soft carbonated. Oily texture, smooth.
Taste: The wine is full-bodied and soft. The texture is oily and smooth.
5/5

Overall
Espresso-like bitterness and tartness can last for dozens of minutes. Highly balanced and drinkable. Unlike KBBS, it's necessary to serve it slightly chilled.
The acidity and bitterness of espresso can linger in your mouth for dozens of minutes. Very balanced and drinkable. Unlike KBBS, this wine needs to be served slightly chilled.
16/20

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
On tap in Madison, WI

Toppling Goliath has a reputation for excellence which made this the main draw for a night out at one of Madison's best bars. Worth every penny of the cost, it delivers an experience unrivalled by all but the best of the best. Despite the lines I may have to make a detour to their booth at the Great Taste this year to get another pour.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
A deep oily black core permeates the glass and stains everything it touches. A minimal head tracks the long icy legs which melt like sheets of snow on a warm spring day. Plums, raspberry, anise, and coffee hang in the air with a glowing warmth that feels mellow and dense. There's no mistaking the ABV but even so it feels very approachable.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Warm espresso, dark chocolate, plums, and blackberries coat the palate with layers of boozy sediment. The dense flavors complement each other so well that it is nearly effortless to follow each sip with another. The mildly bitter finish continues to warm the throat well after the glass is empty. Overall there is only one complaint - that I did not order a full pour when offered the opportunity.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very dark beer out of the bottle with a short foamy brown head. Big alcohol and maple nose. Huge sweet maple syrup flavor with some chocolate, vanilla and sweetened coffee. Really rich dessert beer. Balanced enough to handle everything in here.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at the December Ratebeer DC Tasting. Poured a deep, dark brown color with a small tan head. Smells awesome. Aroma of pancakes, coffee. Maple syrup. Sweet, with enough roast from the malts and coffee to keep it balanced, at least balanced enough for a pastry stout.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

There's a clear pancake thing happening - clearly pancake.  Smooth finish.  A real treat.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Randomly on tap at Champps in Brookfield.  Continually amazed by Tony's ability to get top brews! A random walk-in has this beauty freshly tapped ... Very dark brown pour with a brown head. Aroma has maple, chocolate, and roast. Strong, super smoothly blended, with very solid identifiable contributors. Taste is of sweet maple, dark chocolate, sweet malts, a barrel component, and roast. This leans sweet, with the roast just not being enough to battle all that sweet. Smooth. Very tasty. Just sweet. About full bodied, with a subtle alcohol presence, the blend is very, very good. Finishes to the sweet side, with the bitter parts losing the balance battle. This was excellent, very enjoyable, and properly rated. 17.8

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at Grizzlys Plymouth, pours a dark brown black with  large tan head. Potent aroma of espresso, sweet maple syrup, chocolate and vanilla. Very sweet, thick slick palate, sweet sticky maple syrup, butterscotch, coffee, with a light earthy bitterness on the finish. Very tasty!!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: My 2000th rating! Pours a thick, dark, oily black, with minimal head that dissipates rapidly. Aromas of maple syrup, coffee, wood, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, roasted malt. Flavor is quite sweet, with maple syrup in the forefront, followed by coffee, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, just the slightest touch of booze flavor.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Opaque black beer with a slight/medium dark brown head. Heavy aroma; taste starts heavy sweet and ends slightly bitter and dry. Wood, vanilla, maple syrup, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts and coffee. 10/5/10/5

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black appearance with a light brown head. Big aroma of espresso, roasted malt, chocolate/cocoa, mild maple syrup and light vanilla. Similar flavor, rich, dark and complex with pleasant sweetness, a full body and a warming finish. Amazing.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 650ml bottle, thanks martjoobolut. Pours dark black brown, olily and without much of the foam, just light brown bubbles. Nose has freshly baked waffles with maple syrup and chocolate spread on the top, served with a nice cup of freshly brewed coffee. Serve me this with a scoop of vanilla ice-cream. Tastes more like a beer, oily, roast bitterness comes out at first, then maple sweetness comes with chocolate. Coffee beans, lightly drier finish, maple also present in the linger. Sweet pastry stout, I do like this, feels somewhat more real than Omnipollo's Gideon's Pancake for example.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black with a khaki head. Nose is maple syrup, pancakes, chocolate and light alcohol. Chewy palate, heavy maple syrup, light earth, roasted malts and Chocolate.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Pitch black color. Small size, brown head, stays. Maple syrup, sweet, woody, oily, cold pressed coffee in aroma and in taste. Solid brew.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle, batch 5 (from trade with Brandon, thanks!). Pours black with beige head. Aroma and flavor are sweet, maple, coffee, syrupy, roasty, malty, some booze, some dryness. Overall: great, very maple syrup heavy, but I like maple syrup!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
650ml bottle - thanks tiong! (4:4:5:2:8=2.3)
Black, some red glints. Crazily sweet maple syrup aroma, some beans, some dust. Crazy slick sweet palate. Disgustingly sweet taste, maple syrup, stale beany coffee. So sugary it gives me a headache instantly. No beer detected here, it's just adjuncts.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at FatPhil's, Tallinn. Thanks to Mart! Color is dark brown with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, some milk chocolate and roasted malts. Surprisingly simple, not some sweet as expected but... just great.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: One of the most interesting beers I've ever had. The taste of coffee combined with caramel notes is something completely new to me. When you take a sip of this wonder, it's like drinking your morning coffee before a successful day. I definitely recommend it.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours oily black and settles with no head. Very shiny surface and thick lacing. Aroma has espresso roast, maple, vanilla, chocolate and licorice. Taste is very pungent with layers and layers of green coffee and chocolate and and underlying maple sweetness. Mouthfeel is oily, carbonation very low. Finish is roasty but with sweetness. Bitter coffee. Long aftertaste.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
b5: Black color, brown foam. Intense, sweet aroma, espresso coffee, sweet maple syrup, chocolate pudding, chocolate with nuts. 

In taste, more coffee dominance, slightly sour, dark chocolate, roasted notes and maple finish with a hint of vanilla. 

b4: slightly poorer, less chocolate, vanilla, more dry.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beer combined with the taste, smell and aroma of coffee with light caramel. For me, quite an unusual but very good mix. It is very nice to drink and I recommend it

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From a bomber shared at Thai Me Up in Jackson, WY, courtesy of Clark L., founder and owner of Toppling Goliath.  The beer pours a clear cola brown with a thin tan head.  Aromas are dominated by maple and secondarily coffee and cocoa.  The flavors are sweet maple syrup and chocolate.  Smooth, complex, and absolutely delicious.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Lots of maple, and lots of coffee, but its nicely connected with the rest of flavours. Awesome coffee note, reminding fresh espresso.
2018 has bit more coffee notes than 2017, and its bit more bitter

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Poured from 2018 bottle at DeMont's birthday tasting. Black with a minimal mocha head. Aroma is maple, chocolate, vanilla, light coffee. Taste is thick, sweet and follows aroma. Glad to have the opportunity to try this.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beer that in a way can replace our morning with its taste very similar to the aroma of Coffee. I definitely recommend it to all who like this type of drink

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by Pilsnertest, many thanks! Insane coffee aroma somewhere in between newly grounded coffee beans and the most aromatic fresh brewed cup of black gold imaginable. Velvety smooth chocolate accompanying together with balanced maple and vanilla. Some light very light berry notes in taste and a bit of licorice. Rich and full with a coffee presence that really is the benchmark.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at Jason's. A big dark pour with a good amount of chocolate and a lot of maple big

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: In the aroma very pleasant coffee, maple syrup light notes of cocoa. In the taste semi-sweet. bitter chocolate, delicate acidity from coffee, which disappears after heating. Alcohol very well hidden, a lot of body, very intense, lacking a bit of barrel, but as a base it is very good.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12/23/18. 2018 bomber from the brewery shared with Mrs. Owl, cbfobes, and Mrs. cbfobes. We did a side by side with 2018 KBBS and I think we actually liked MD a touch more. Black pour with a lovely tan head that sticks. Great aroma, chocolate, coffee, maple, vanilla. Great flavor, smooth maple and vanilla, some chocolate, plentiful coffee, touches of dark fruits. Delicious.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Backlog. Had batch 2, 3 & 4. Pours thick black with a dark tan head. Biiiiiig maple syrup, molasses, vanilla, roasted chocolate malts, appelstroop, fresh coffee, mocha, creamy chocolate. Very sweet but loaded with flavor, thick chewy goodness.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Wonderful intense aroma. From the bottle, a mix of maple syrup and coffee dominates, plus roasted notes, chocolate, caramel, nuts, dried fruit. From the snifter, you can feel the coffee the most in the background, other notes. After pouring the dark brown, practically black liquid, a not very high dark beige foam is created, which slowly falls without decorating the glass. Intense taste dominated by essential coffee, in the background pralines, dried fruit, a bit of maple syrup, of course you can feel the roasted malts. Dry, coffee, pleasant finish. A legend of beer, hence high expectations. Fantastic aroma, which promises a lot, very good taste, but I have the feeling that it does not give everything that the aroma announced. Despite this, a great beer

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very pleasant aroma of coffee and maple syrup which immediately affects the senses. Notes of nuts bitterness add the whole aroma and unique taste. I definitely recommend it because it tastes delicious.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at Ned Kelley's.  Smelled like maple syrup and coffee.  Super rich and extremely sweet. Has a boozy latte flavor. A ton of depth with layers of flavor. Overall a damn fine Imperial Stout!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355 ml bottle, batch 4. Pours black with the most beautiful foam I've ever seen, brown and big and fine and smooth, also perfectly matched to the MD glass. Aroma is maple, walnut, vanilla, caramel, coffee. Body is heavy and strong, but pure maple syrup, coffee, caramel, booze. Intense and strong. Next to a Rye BA Vietnamese Speedway, it feels plain. Still outstanding, but I'm enjoying the other one more.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: b4 Bottle, many thanks to anstei and dzudohonor. Poured into a Mornin Delight glass, amazing appearance! Black color with huge beige head. Aroma is super walnuts, nutmeg, maple. Taste is maple, walnuts, fresh coffee. Extremely soft mouthfeel with fine-bubbled carbonation. Superbly mapley, and really really great.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft: pours dark black, huge coffee aroma, taste is coffee, malt, vanilla, maple, full bodied and delicious.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Had it at the event and on draft. Friends have said the draft is far superior to the bottle. Haven't tried the bottle - yet. Draft was incredibly rich, yet smooth and relatively balanced.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: b2 bomber. great stout. tons of maple, a good amount of coffee. quite the thick mouthfeel. very much enjoyed. thanks for sharing jeff quinn.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Dark pitch black in color... Aroma is immediately coffee and maple in the face... Flavor is maple for days, super sweet rich maple syrup for days that lingers on palate for what seems like forever... coffee bitterness, rich coffee notes... mouthfeel could be a bit thicker but canâ€™t expect more for non-BA stout... Amazing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: For a non barrel aged stout was just awesome, a strong and perfect mix of coffee and maple that create an awesome smokey note, chocolate, black with no head, full body, oily, a cup of smokey coffee, again sweet maple and an infinite aftertaste,,,,just awesome, i'm happy to discover that is not just hype, the nose is unique!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The combination of morning coffee and barley as well as the strongly noticeable scent and taste of maple syrup and cinnamon fuels it all perfectly.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very intense and pleasant aroma of coffee and maple syrup that immediately affects the senses. Notes of nuts, bitterness and delicate acidity add aroma and unique taste to the whole

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours like motor oil. Very viscous, with dark brown head. Once the bottle opens, Maple fills up the room. Massive cold coffee, vanilla, maple, dark chocolate, vanilla and roasted malt in the nose that is bloody amazing. Low carbonation, thick syrupy mouth, tons of coffee, maple syrup, roasted malt and dark chocolate. Very full bodied. Very rich. A sample is enough. Itâ€™s a great beer and alcohol well hidden. Itâ€™s fantastic. Worth the price or the high rating, I donâ€™t think so.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Draft at Luna Valley Farm. Aroma was thick roasted malt, booze, and maple syrup. Flavor was such a perfect balance of malt and maple syrup. This was truly incredible and exceeded my expectations.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sampled from the tap at GTMW 2018. Pours near black with a very dark brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma is full of maple, roasted malts, coffee and dark grains with a bit of vanilla underlying. Flavor has dark grains, chocolate, roasted malts, strong maple, vanilla and coffee supporting.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap black with a tan head. Aroma is maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, dark fruit and alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet, heavy bitter and very light sour. Palate is thick, oily with soft carbonation.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours an intense black with a moderate tan head. Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, maple syrup, caramel, roasted malt, roasted nuts. Incredibly well balanced on the nose. Taste is chocolatey and roasted with vanilla and caramel notes and quite pronounced maple syrup notes. While not reaching the same heights that the nose promised it's still very very good. Mouthfeel is perfect: medium bodied and perfect in its slight viscous feel and a subtly dry finish. Stellar.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black with low brown head. Aromas brilliant with subtle notes of vanilla, coffee, cocoa nibs, maple syrup, hazelnut, caramel, fudge. Taste has once again subtle notes of maple syrup, vanilla, cocoa nibs, coffee, chocolate, caramel, rum soaked raisins. Mouthfeel has an outerwordly viscosity, creamyness and balance. Full bodied, average carbonation, low bitterness, mid sweet

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2015 bottle in 2018, thanks Fredrik. Black colour, brownish head. taste of coffee, maple and vanilla

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black color with mocha head. Aroma has smoked maple, coffee beans, fried bacon, earthy notes, dried tree bark and a bit of cinnamon. Taste is bittersweet, coffee forward, a bit acidic, maple but no sweetness, a hint of umami, roasty bitterness on the finish. Medium plus body, soft carbonation. Really good but still a bit overhyped.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle poured, foiled up and presented blind as a gift from Prufrockstar. Thanks! Don't know what this is, but I know it's delicious! A waxed bottle that basically took a chainsaw to get through. A dense coffee black pour with a thick, espresso brown foam head. First initial response is the maple content. Lots of it. And it's delicious. The ultimate breakfast brew here with a coffee and maple pairing. Really thick body. Thick milk chocolate, caramel, maple, and low bitter coffee follow up. Reminds me a bit of the Evil Twin Michigan Jesus. Boozy indications on the aroma, but the flavor couldn't get much more smooth. Premier dessert stout here. 859417

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle in Seattle. Thanks Chris for this foil-wrapped, instructed to be drunk blind, treat. Thick, oily dark brown head dissipating to yellow brown ring. Thick and dark body. Nose is distinctly maple, with some tomato sweetness, and chewy and bitter coffee and cocoa. Moderately thick sip, doesnâ€™t feel too hot, with a nice chewy bitterness at the end to cut up he sweetness. Coffee, cocoa, maple. Lots of dark caramel and Herseyâ€™s syrup. Sticky edges. Tastes well aged. Tomato like notes are the only spoiler, but this is rather tasty overall. Lingering bitter finish is fantastic. (Note: Iâ€™m leaving my blind rating intact but Iâ€™m tempted to add .1 for the remarkable balance of alcohol in this, I had no idea tasting this blind that it was 12%).

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355ml bottle, thanks Tide! Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of dry roasted coffee beans, maple syrup, espresso, mocha, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is very dry, heavy with coffee notes, mocha, espresso, vanilla, some hints of maple syrup and roastiness. Finish is dry, roasty and earthy with loads of coffee, espresso, mocha and vanilla. A total coffee overdose. Quite different than what I expected, the maple syrup notes are really subtle here and it's not very sweet but really dry and heavy with coffee notes. Pretty good. 8-4-9-4-17. Re-rated from batch 5, 650ml bottle. Much more maple syrup notes and sweetness than in the smaller bottle. Quite different than the previous batch.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle with friends. Maple syrup, lots of coffee. Espresso, roast coffee, chocolate. Syrupy finish, bitter and thick.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from a friend. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, espresso, maple suryp, nuts, chocolate, a bit of dark fruits and licorice. Bitter finish with roasted malts, espresso, maple syrup, licorice, chocolate, a bit of dark fruits and nuts. Exquisite imperial stout.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz batch 4 bottle opened during Wakefest weekend. Pours nearly pitch black in color and topped by a thin, tan layer of foam that settles in quickly and rejoins the body below and leaves some sudsy lace behind. The aroma shows notes of dark chocolate, huge maple syrup, dark, over roasted coffee, espresso, toasted caramel, and hints of vanilla. The flavor follows suit the dark chocolate and over roasted coffee right up front which turns into a green pepper flavor from over roasting the coffee beans, and then followed by notes of sweet maple, toasted vanilla, and caramel. The maple component isn't as prevalent in the flavor and its hard to get the green pepper flavors from the coffee. Medium bodied and smooth with soft carbonation that leads to a dark chocolate, roasted coffee, and sweet maple finish that lingers on for a bit. I was really excited to try this, but this unfortunately fell way short of the hype and my expectations. Maybe one day I'll get to try an earlier batch that everyone raves about.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very pleasant coffee in the aroma, maple syrup at the level of autosuggestion, light notes of cocoa. Semi-sweet in taste. In the finish, instant coffee, dark chocolate, delicate acidity from coffee, which disappears after heating. Alcohol very well hidden, a lot of body, very intense, a bit of barrel missing, but as a base it is very good.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Batch 3:

Opaque black color with nice brown foam. The aroma does not have ideal intensity but there is a lot of freshly ground coffee, real maple syrup, such pleasant praline atmospheres. In the taste, after heating, the acidity disappears and there is mega intense Italian espresso, maybe even something from green coffee. The finish is ultra coffee, a bit of maple syrup atmosphere. Smooth with a brilliant body. Very simple and at the same time great beer.

Batch 4:
Much more intense aroma, huge amount of maple syrup, acidity and character of Italian espresso, a bit of walnut. In the taste, a lot of sourness of dessert chocolate and some herbalism. The aroma beats the 3rd batch hands down but the taste is too sour.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Color black with medium head. Aroma roasted, coffee, chocolate, vanilla. Taste roasted, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, maple.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: cereal, chocolate, coffee, roasty, leather, brownish black with caramel colored frothy head. Had this after a long day at Side Project the day before NYE. thanks again to Ryan for sharing with me. til next time!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: I'm rating batch 2 since b3 and b4 were not very good IMO. Another TG maple bomb. Aromas of maple and coffee are super prevalent. Flavors are maple and smooth roasted coffee. This blend is so smooth it's like drinking a maple coffee frappe. Feel is spot on. Overall, this is outstanding.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz. bottle from the brewery. (Really damn expensive. Plus you needed to win a raffle to buy and be present with the proper email notification) flavor and aroma are a mirror. Flavor is maple syrup, roasted coffee, weak chocolate, and is almost sticky sweet. The maple syrup comes through really strong. Brownie batter in waves. Really makes this overly sweet. Gosh, talk about an over hyped stout! Yikes !

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Top 5 bottle from AFH! Thanks d000d! 12oz bottle, 3 ways in stemware at 45F. Alcohol legs for days, looks like marmalade in the glass. Smells like maple syrup and kahlua! Whoa, very sweet. LOADS of maple syrup, kahlua for sure. it's very sweet, maybe even akin to a little bit of soy sauce. This beer is so intense with flavor. It's good. not hiding any of the adjuncts.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared with brother& his two friends. Black opaque with foamy brown head. Smooth texture, full almost thick body, coffee/chocolate-ish malt flavors, huge maple aroma & mellow flavor.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of maple syrup, coffee, very rich coffee, it's really maple and coffee at this point. Taste is overbearing maple and coffee. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sampled at Hunahpu day 2017, just found some old notes. My notes say solid imperial stout with lots of vanilla and roast, but doesn't seem like it should be as hyped as it is. Maybe its about rarity, but nothing special.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Batch 4. I thought it would be a maple dominated but it is a coffee dominated one. Quite enjoyable but it is not a balanced one. It is sort of "pow pow - tons of coffee, sweetness etc." good one though.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: What can I say? A marvel of a beer, round, full, tasty, exaggerated but at the same time linear, you would never want it to end because you know that you will hardly be able to drink it again. And the essence of what you would like from a beer. To be tasted at least once, good life and if you get the second time... lucky you

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Toppling Goliath Brewing Co. - Mornin' Delight b4 (2017) 
Imperial Stout Brewed With Maple Syrup & Coffee. 

Alcohol: 12% vol. 

IBU: 50 

Color: Black, opaque. 

Foam: You can't find fault with anything here. Beige, high, lush, compact foam. 
It stands in one place for a long time as if enchanted. 
After emptying the glass, it still remains on its walls. 

Smell: The aroma is massive! It spreads in a wide arc over the entire room and fills it with its intensity. 
You don't have to put your nose to the bottle to feel the gigantic scent of maple syrup supported by the best quality coffee. 
Only minimal roastiness combined with notes of Belgian pralines, caramel and leading vanilla. 
Despite the fact that the beer is a classic Imperial, the aroma crushes most of the best barrel RISs I've had.
I think that they should invent an additional aroma scale for beers like this.
Poetry!

Taste: Pleasant maple syrup dominates the tongue.
Thick, fragrant, fresh.
It brings to mind the best pancakes covered in maple syrup that I once ate in Las Vegas in

one of the American breakfast bars.

After a while, coffee comes to the fore, which starts to dominate after the second sip.

A light roastiness and low acidity immediately place this beer among the best coffee RISs in my portfolio.

The taste is complemented by accents of dark and milk chocolate, molasses, vanilla, Belgian pralines, caramel, cinnamon and marzipan.
Thick, oily and whipped like pudding texture. Percentages masterfully swept under the carpet.
Full, sweet, silky and creamy on the tongue. At the end of the tasting, after a solid warming in the hands, a minimal coffee sourness appears on the tip of the tongue. It does not affect the final reception of the drink in any way.

Excellent work! 

Carbonation: Low. 

Summary: 

Mornin' Delight - the beer with which I enter 2018. 

2nd best Imperial Stout in the world. 

Perfection, excellence and a masterful understanding of the subject. 

This is truly an Imperial Stout that reflects the American climate in 100s. 

The additives added to the beer: maple syrup and coffee perfectly emphasize what is an important element of their lives for Americans. 
The balance of the individual components is simply incredible. 
Pampered to the limits of possibility, from the packaging, through appearance, and ending with taste. 
Rich, multi-layered, it will remain in my memory for a long time. 
It's not my No. 1,
but it will definitely be in my Top 10 Imperials.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Warka 4. Extremely thick, oily. Minimal foam - brown, practically zero saturation. In the aroma a lot of maple syrup and coffee - such a fresh Colombian espresso. Vanilla practically covered by the rest of the ingredients. After heating, maple syrup comes out clearly. In taste, this coffee is clearly marked - it hits with its acidity. In taste sweet from start to finish, in addition this coffee acidity. Full, exemplary body, oily texture like engine oil. A beer with the appearance and texture 100%, which squeezes the maximum content from maple syrup and coffee.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Oxford tasting; batch 4, 2017
Pitch black with medium sized dark brown head. The aroma is very strong, coffee, maple, wood, dark caramel, light smoke, cake, then traces of dark fruits. Good body structure, but only moderate residual sweetness, and very high acidity from the malts; the coffee dominates, some maple syrup, also too much liquorice in the final.
Great aroma, uncoordinated flavor; beast of beer, with no elegance.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355ml bottle (thx, David G.!) shared at Alex's with Jamey. Batch #4, 2017. Pours a very dark brown with a dark beige head. Aroma is maple syrup, coffee, some fruity character, toffee and chocolate. Similar taste. Very nice. But it is definitely overrated.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Batch 4 Bottle shared with friends.After the cap was removed an amazing aroma of maple and coffee filled the room.Pours as thick and deep black as it should be.Wonderful mouthfeel.It is sticky and chewy, but not overwhelmingly thick like other similar stouts.The taste...maple, biscuit, coffee, roasted malts, all amazingly balanced.Everything is just in the right place.The ingredients are shinning in this one.Spent some days just smelling the empty bottle just to get a fix.I wouldn't mind waking up every mornin' with this delight for sure!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle via local trade shared with Tmoney99 and drsordr from notes. Pours an oily black color with a medium sized tan head. The aroma has big maple and coffee, this is as solid a start as I've had in a while. The flavor has roasted malt, big maple syrup, big roasted coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, a hint of smoke, big thick mouth feel, one of the best Imperial Stouts I have had.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sample @ GABF 2017. Pours a black color with a tan head. Has a roasted malty coffee chocolate aroma with hints of vanilla and licorice. Roasted malty coffee chocolate maple vanilla flavor. Has a roasted malty coffee chocolate maple finish with hints of licorice and vanilla.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: It's hard to describe the perfection that is mornin delight. It's SUPER rich in malty roasty toasty chocolate goodness. The intensity of coffee, butterscotch, and maple syrup makes this beer all the more impressive being as balanced as it is. Dark brown in color. Creamy tan head.... It's hard to focus on this review. In short, this is the best beer I've ever tasted.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: THANKS to Kraddel! #11.000! Very happy to have actually tried this one. Bomber split by 4 people. Batch # 2. Totally black, head doesnâ€™t last. Looks even thick upon poor, this beer is insanely thick. Nose is hazelnut paste sweet but also bit bitter, herbal nuts, walnuts pure mocha syrup, bitter molasses, syrup, very big coffee, espresso with some roast, pecan, maple is way lower than you would expect. This is not the pasty stout that I expected this to be, maple is quite low, barely there but this is way more about the coffee, espresso, coffee roast, even roasted malts & it is insanely thick, easily one the thickest beers that I have ever had, tastes of hazelnut ,more roast than expected, pure thick syrup, more molasses than maple almost pure malt syrup, heavy coffee bitter finish, expresso, decent roast, lingering nuts & inanely thick. Surprisingly balanced, surprisingly coffee forward. Liked it more & more the more I drank it, surprisingly drinkable despite the thickness. Really great beer, not the beer to end all beer as many have proclaimed it but is any beer? Would love to try the BA version at some point but that one is in ultra-high demand.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Huge thanks to Dylan for sharing this personal whale! ðŸ™Œ Batch 2.
Nose is full on roasted coffee. Bit grainy. Huge chocolate truffle. The body is so thick, almost syrupy. very sweet too but never annoying. Immediately had sticky lips and tong from the intense sugary sweetnes. This is just straight alcoholic milk chocolate. Also reminds me of creamy high quality cappuccino. Aftertaste is a Bit burnt fruit. Like fruit compote which is nice. 
Only fault is I expected more maple. But that could have something to do with age. Love to compare this with other batches as there seems to be some differences.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark black color with beige head. Smell is sweet, coffee and a touch of hazelnut. Taste is creamy coffee with mayplesyrup, a touch of chocolate, sweet with a little coffee bitterness.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sampled at GABF 2017. Pours a rich brownish black body with thin ring of lace. Mouthfeel is medium bodied - palate is met with an enormous amount of sugar at first; a bit too sweet; notes of melted fudge, maple syrup, caramel candy and vanilla frosting.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
23-09-17 // bottle shared at Zwanze Day 2017 @ Mon Petit CafÃ© Stuttgart. Thanks for sharing! This beer is definitely worth the Hype. Such a great experience to try it. Deep black. Great boozy sweet malty nose with coffee. Taste is heavy sweet, Espresso, roasted coffee beans, maple sweetness, vanilla. Oily texture. Long Lasting bitter coffee sweet maple mouthfeel.

26-09-20 // Happy Zwanze Day 2020 at Mon Petit CafÃ©, Stuttgart. Bottle, shared. Thanks! 2020delivers as well.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Third batch... Black, opaque. Brown, fine foam. In the aroma maple syrup, tobacco, marzipan, tiramisu, nuts, milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee. In the taste a lot of sour coffee, marzipan, tiramisu, maple syrup, some dark fruit. Medium carbonation, low bitterness, nutty aftertaste, marzipan, tiramisu.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
(bottle)
Aroma: tiramisu for DAYZ !!!!, sweet coffee, intensive note of dried dark fruits.
Appearance: black, small dense head.
Taste: sweet, flavour of cacao, hazelnuts, earthy coffee, tiramisu, nutty chocolate.
Palate: full body, medium carbonation.
Overall: DAMN ! That's what I call a superb beer, I's sooo tiramisu-driven, taste is not as sweet as aroma indicated but still it brings to my mind a tiramisu made with super bitter earthy coffee with hazelnutty powder on it .

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The best part of breakfast in a bottle. The maple syrup is heavily pronounced with a subtle background of coffee and chocolate.  It lives up to the hype.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: (2017) Intense, sweet coffee, dark chocolate, cacao, caramel, dark, toasted malts Hazy, very dark brown, medium, creamy, beige head. Light bitter. More dark roast coffee, citrus fruits, lemon, dark, bitter, toasted malts, soft carbonation, full bodied. Beautiful Impy, intense and complex, well-balanced. Keg at GABF17, Denver. 4.1 (2023) 07Mar2024 Dark roast malts, cacao, chocolate, intense coffee, massive maple. Hazy, very dark brown, small, frothy, beige head. Heavy sweet. Intense, dark roast, sweet coffee, molasses, chocolate, maple, soft carb, full bod. Outstanding, rich and so balanced. Draft at Other Half Brewing Co., Brooklyn. 4.4

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: So here we are then: one of these hugely hyped Toppling Goliath stouts and the third highest ranking beer on this website at the time of writing this review, I've been looking forward to this for a long time. American-style imperial stout with coffee and maple syrup, 2016 vintage. Yellowish beige, creamy head, thin and open in the middle but retaining around the edge, on a black beer with warm mahogany edges. Very intense, concentrated, beguiling bouquet of chocolate fondant, chocolate liqueur, strong maple syrup, dried figs drenched in whisky, cappuccino and coffee liqueur, fudge, toasted chestnuts, dry leather, toffee, cognac, hazelnut oil, madera, subtle but clear glue-ish and solvent-like effects. The mouthwatering promises made by the aroma are perfectly met by the flavour, kicking off with thick sweet maple syrup embellished with dried fruit notes and a thin sourish accent, blending in well with the caramelly, toffeeish and profoundly nutty, big, oily malt body, perfectly (i.e. softly) carbonated fit for this style. The nuttiness shifts colours to a darker, bitter black 'chocolateness', bitterly toasty yet not overly roasted: the creaminess of the maple syrup lies a perfectly measured layer of soothing sweetness on top of it, and the no doubt copious amounts of coffee that went in here, provide delightful retronasal aromas and a refined, spicy, delicate and warm roastedness that is more expressive and vivid than the actual roasted barley. Ends with vanilla- and cinnamon-like accents, very rich, a coffee dessert with alcohol - which takes on a long, heating, brandy-like quality, yet at the same time completely avoids obnoxious wryness. Tasted this next to a 2015 vintage as well, which was just as rich and ravishingly beautiful, yet a tad softer and more rounded, a bit less sharp in terms of solvents and a little bit less aromatically coffee-ish - but these were 'microscopic' differences due to age alone, presumably. Well, now that I finally had a taste of this nectar of the gods: not sure if this is the single best stout I ever had - but it comes very, very close. Then again, the whole hype surrounding this beer, one of these artificially mystified beers (admittedly largely due to geeks like ourselves here, ironically perhaps), should not matter in judging this: any experienced taster with a basic technical knowledge will be able to assess that this is a work of great beauty, class and craftmanship. A huge, detailed and completely flawless construction of flavours, the essence of American-style RIS with maple syrup and coffee dosed in such a way that they actually accentuate the features of this beer in a tastefully balanced way rather than overpowering them.  Unforgettable, and I was over the moon when given the chance to sample it again - from tap - at Billie's Craft Beer Fest 2023, when it was oddly much smoother, more caramelly and more milk-chocolatey - yet still utterly delicious.  My rating here is an average of both encounters with this highly coveted stout.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pure black beer with mocha head. Sweet aroma and taste. Coffee, roasted nuts, lots and lots of maple. Thick, syrupy. Long aftertaste.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Hopishop 2017. Batch 3 and 4. Thick black pour. Aroma of maple, vanilla, roasted malt, caramel fudge, booze and coffee. Flavor has lots of maple, caramel fudge and vanilla, and sweet roasted malt, coffee, booze, umami, raisin and an endlessly evolving finish. Worth of the hype, amazing.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Great coffee nose and taste upfront, amazing maple back end. Awesome beer!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Mon Petit Cafe, Stuttgart. Outstanding aroma: maple syrup and coffee perfectly matched together, roasted but composed to perfection. Sweet taste, medium body, again lots of coffee and maple, dark chocolate, pumpernickel. Long warming aftertaste.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle via trade. MDb4. Pours pitch black, gorgeous mocha tan head. Aroma bursts with coffee and maple syrup. They say explosive espresso and damn are they right. Lots of coffee beans, maple syrup, some vanilla, chocolate. Nice. Flavor is intense coffee bitterness, maple syrup sweetness, notes of vanilla, again, chocolate. Coffee predominates here. The balance of the intense coffee bitterness and the intense sweetness of the syrup is very interesting. Not bad, but I won't be seeking this one again.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by alexsdad06 pour opaque black with minimal head. Nose huge maple syrup and coffee, vanilla, smells sweet. Taste if there is such a thing as maple flavored coffee, or coffee flavored maple syrup this is it. Some vanilla overtones. Coffee vanilla aftertaste. Giant flavors throughout. Super thick mouth feel. Outstanding.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by alexasdad06. BC AFRTANHMLGL CBSMTFC MHDTSMMF MHDTMSF MLD. Standout beer.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Thanks Jay for sharing the bottle! Poured into a Morning Delight espresso cup (inside joke for those who know my alcohol tolerance) showing pitch black with no head. 

The nose shows a pronounced maple syrup forwardness with an equally strong and balancing roast coffee background. 

The palate is full bodied, oily, slick and lightly carbonated. Maple syrup forward but still with a restrained moderate sweetness. Strong roasted coffee background throughout with a very light coffee tartness and more strong black coffee bitterness on the finish. Interplay and balance between maple syrup and coffee is incredible.

B2 - 10/20/2017
Bottle into a wineglass showing pitch black and thin coffee colored rims.

The nose shows pronounced maple syrup with light notes of coffee.

The palate is oily, slick, and fully carbonated. Strong maple syrup in the background throughout with a coffee forwardness and a light coffee tartness. Strong alcoholic spiciness throughout. Dry milk chocolate and maple syrup on the finish.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sticky. Maple is amazing. Cold brewed coffee. Vanilla. Thx chris! Hard to beat this gem.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 6oz pour at The Courtyard & Cellar on 8/18/17. Pours black with a thick light brown head. Strong nose of malt, maple syrup, coffee, chocolate and slight dark fruit. Very in your face. Maple and malt flavor giving way to smooth coffee, then transitioning to chocolate and heavy dark fruit before a roasty coffee finish. Perfection on the nose, but I would like a little more chocolate than dark fruit in the flavor. Great coffee and maple presence though. From what I hear, folks are liking it better than the 2016 batch.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2.75oz pour at 2017 release. Black pour with dark brown head. Aroma is crazy, lots of espresso, coffee, maple. Very slick palate, loads of coffee up front then the maple syrup comes through to balance it out. A bit too much coffee for my liking but this is really well done.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: PAKK 2017 - For lovers of freshly ground coffee. Opinions are divided, a partial disappointment in relation to expectations. Not much in aroma, in taste great coffee coffee coffee, smooth, noticeable spices, maple syrup, a hint of cinnamon.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2016. Maple syrup and espresso. Green peppers. Long roasty bitter finish. Low body like in regular stout. A failure for the hype and price. Weak batch or at least a bottle. 

// Intense maple syrup and espresso. Green peppers. Long, roasty, bitter finish. Low body like in regular stout. A failure.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle 2016 vintage. Pours a pitch black beer with a medium sized beige head on top. Aroma has lots of espresso,darker roasted coffee, dark chocolate. The coffee is very strong in this one, with a lot of roast in there. Flavor has lots coffee in there, basically only coffee in there, Lots of sweet syrup in there, dark chocolate and some vanilla in there. Awesome balance, very strong and overall great beer. Doesnâ€™t live up to the hype though. but still amazing.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Finally. Wonderful aroma! Powerful maple syrup, coffee, roastiness. Brilliant balance - sweet, coffee-bitter, beautiful maple syrup, chocolate. Mega long, intense finish, remaining in the entire mouth for long minutes. Excellent beer, definitely living up to its reputation.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle sample in Chmielarnia. Batch 3. Beautiful aroma of coffee and syrup, but it's only in the taste that it blows away. Epic balance, roasted, but at the same time sweet and smooth, without coffee bitterness or acidity. It's like velvet, like a little Jesus dancing on the tongue, delicate but also fucking complex. Everything is perfectly matched together, nothing stands out too much, it works together and strives for harmony. In addition, it's mega drinkable, where you can drink the whole bottle yourself and in 15 minutes. This is the genesis of the name Mornin Delight, I would drink it every morning and every day would be beautiful then.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:

product_review: Bottle at tads ( thank you thank you thank you) ...Dark black.. No real head.. Massive rich coffee.. Heavy rich roast... Heavy chocolate roast malts.. Dark sweet chocolate roast.. Big coffee... Rich thick body... Massive maple.. Heavy sweet maple coffee.

product_review: Bottle at tads. Pours black, nose is chocolate, coffee, caramel, roasted, coconut, taste is sweet, bitter coffee, roasted, chocolate, smoky, maple syrup.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours black with a medium brown head. Aroma is coffee, maple, vanilla. Taste is coffee bitter, vanilla sweet, vanilla bitter, maple syrup sweet, cocoa bitter, chocolate sweet. Syrupy mouthfeel. Fucking intense!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle thanks to Craig. Pours black with a chocolate brown head. huge maple syrup nose, viscous mouthfeel. Mild bitterness from the coffee.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared bottle. Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, maple, and malt. Taste is coffee, maple, roasted malt, vanilla, and some chocolate. Excellent.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: No comment I can write here will do it justice. One of my favorite beers ever, tons of coffee, maple, and vanilla... delicious

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A huge thank you to Yan for sharing this great bottle for this New Yearâ€™s Eve dinner! Vintage 2016. Between the braised lamb shoulder and the cheeses. As soon as the cap is lifted from the bottle, a real explosion of maple aromas invades the room. Maple syrup, maple taffy on snow, uncooked chocolate chip cookie dough... Real madness! Once in my glass, however, the aromas fade curiously quickly. Much more maple vapor escapes from my glass than from Marc-AndrÃ©â€™s glass. I still smell a lot of chocolate but especially coffee. A green base, however, makes me raise my eyebrows because the latter was the last thing I expected. Coffee remains at the center of all the action - on the nose as well as in the mouth. Aromas of heated Ethiopian coffee beans accentuated by exceptional quality milk chocolate chips. And that texture!!! The liquid is light as a feather, even airy. A satiny lightness, soft as I have never felt anything like it. The maple greets me as it passes by as a reminder, leaving the chocolate and coffee to compete for the leading role. Don't leave me alone with a bomber jacket because I will have drunk it without even realizing it. A Superior elixir.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared thanks to Charule. WTF? Top 5 beer? No. Top 50? No. Itâ€™s good but basically can get this on the shelf and make yourself with some maple syrup. Just take Wake n Bake and add maple = MD. Huge letdown. Green pepper coffee too.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ DB #25. Batch 3. Pitch black pour with a dense dark tan head. Notes of heavy roast, euro malts, light peat, roasted coffee, sweet bitter chocolate, caramel, vanilla and maple on the finish. Quite good!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Batch 3. Pours Pitch black with a brown head. Aroma of fresh ground coffee, maple, vanilla, roasted malts, slight weak smoke, slight "green" coffee as well. fruity espresso, caramel and brown sugar. Taste is much more roasted than the aroma. Some maple syrup, ground coffee, vanilla, green bitter coffee, dry cocoa beans and weak caramel. Itâ€™s overall a very good beer I think it is safe to say that I was let down by this beer. It smells amazing but I donâ€™t follow the extreme hype on this one. Maybe I got the wrong batch?

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From bottle. Batch #3. Finally got to try this! Pours a pitch black with a nice, tan head. Aroma has a complete shit ton of coffee! Nice, toasty maple syrup, super roasty, light hop presence, green coffee. Taste is surprisingly unsweet. Lots of bitter roast, bitter coffee, intense lakritol-like licorice. Pretty spicy, lots of maple flavor but very little of the sweetness. Bitter, roasty after taste. Makes me realize that i didnâ€™t really knew what to expect from this beer, haha! Somewhat full body and a medium low carbonation. Really good stout, but donâ€™t get the hype on this one.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Batch 3 on tap at release in Decorah. Poured black with tan head. Aroma mega smooth coffee. Light carb med bod. Taste again with the smooth fresh brewed espresso light choc. Lil dry.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared, batch two. Pitch black with short lasting dark brown head that leaves an oily film. Massive molasses, apple juice spread (applesirop), coffee, maple, pecan, brown sugar, light tart roasted barley. Thereâ€™s actually a lot of coffee but it takes some time to come to the forefront. Taste is thick sweet with coffee bitterness and a light fruity/ashy sourness in the background. Full bodied with crazy thick syrupy feel, this needs a spoon! Very good, not the best beer in the world but its unique, interesting and very good.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sampled from bottle shared by Maakun at his place. Big thanks! Black pour. Big sweet vanilla, deep roasted chocolate malts, cocoa, maple syrup, apples, coffee, molasses, roasted red paprika. Big sweet, mild bitter. Supple full bodied, very soft carbonation. Big sweet roasty finish. Crazy feel, crazy sweet. Nice roast. Like!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft at RB Best Fest 16: Poured a dark thick black with brown head. Aroma was strong with molasses and vanilla. Taste was coffee, sticky booze, molasses, and vanilla.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap and from a bottle. Pours out black topped with a small tan head. Nose is massive sweetness maple syrup roast malts vanilla coffee and plenty other adjuncts. Taste is more of the heavy sweetness a dark barrel notes. Good yes over hyped yes.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
To be honest I hoped this wouldnâ€™t deliver, but it just blew me away in every way. 

Complex as hell with layer upon layer of awesomeness. Chocolate, licorice, coconut, maple syrup, vanilla and some gentle roasty notes that makes for a perfect finish.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
May 28, 2016. Bottle. Shared by _angst_, thanks!

Black with a small brown head, some nice legs on the glass. Aroma is lots of sweet maple syrup backed up by fresh roasted ground coffee, some toffee, vanilla, light earthy notes. 
Taste is sweet, malty, roasted bitterness. Finish is quite bitter with roasted coffee and dark chocolate, some salty notes with hints of soy, licorice. Full bodied, soft carbonation, oily texture with a very light dry finish. 


Great, slightly too salty finish, but on the other hand that increases the drinkability.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bomber received in trade. Thank you trogenmi. Pours oily pitch black with a creamy dark mocha head that leaves some lacing and trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty, roasty and slightly woody with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, high quality dark roast coffee, high quality dark chocolate, maple syrup, moist soil, leather and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, salty, malty and roasty. Mouthfeel is thick, viscous, creamy, round, slightly roasted astringent, tiny boozy and full bodied. Finish is sweet, bitter and salty with a heft delicious roasty malts, sea salt sprinkled dark chocolate, dark roast coffee and maple syrup. While itâ€™s possibly a tiny bit salty this is just plain delicious. Complex and crazy rich. Love it!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Wailin Whales in Linus apartment 160528. Opaque black beer with a beautiful brownish head. Lovely chocolate and coffee aroma, maple syrup, vanilla, milk chocolate, licorice notes, cocoa powder, ice coffee, tar notes, some raisins and figs. Chocolate flavor, maple syrup, cocoa powder, raisins, caramel, raisins, figs, kinda well hidden alcohol, salty, some dark chocolate. Great chocolate and coffee finish with licorice, salt and some raisins. Am-fuckin-azing!!!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A: Pitch black with a brown head N: Maple, coffee, chocolate, soy sauce, milk chocolate T: Maple syrup, coffee, salmiak, sea salt O: Extremly well balanced! Super nice coffee and maple! I love it!

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
This beer definitely lives up to hype. All you need is some patience. Shared a whole bottle with my lady. 
The first few sips were disappointing. Very much coffee forward, could taste some yummy caramel malt, just a hint of maple and chocolate at the end, extremely sticky and thick mouthfeel. But did it deserve the title of "one of the best imperial stouts" in the world? Hell nah. 
But it gets better. Much better. As the beer warms up, maple and chocolate flavor becomes much more dominant. On the other hand, coffee flavor mellows out. The best part is that the flavor lasts on your tongue forever. Orgasm in my mouth. Perhaps the best beer Iâ€™ve ever tasted.
For those who were disappointed, Iâ€™m telling you, wait until this beer warms up! I chilled on this bottle for 3 hours, and the flavor just kept on getting better and better... canâ€™t wait to try Kentucky Brunch.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Taproom tap poured motor oil dark brown with a thin tan head and oily lacing. Aromas of cocoa, vanilla, liquorice, vanilla, and coffee, with hints of boozy oak. Flavor has mild cocoa bitterness with a sweet chocolate finish. Amazing.

product_name: Toppling Goliath Mornin' DelightðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
