Compared to Pliny the Elder, I found the lack of citrus notes suprising. Appearance: no head, clear copper/resin color. Mild carbonation. The aroma is akin to a refreshing pine cone. The taste midly sweet up front. The mouthfeel was smooth, very smooth, with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Sublime.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: 10 oz pours on tap @ HopYard in Pleasanton for SF Beer Week.  The best beer I have ever tasted (yes, I am a DIPA fan) - the hype is warranted!  Color is clear, orange, perfect small head.  No alcohol taste for a 10.5% - perfection.  Citrus, pine, but compared to Pliny the Elder it is more balanced, with a bit more fruity sweetness.  Easily my fav beer.  Only giving a 4.9 because Iâ€™m hoping Vinnie/RR could somehow tweak this and inexplicably make it better (haha...nope, itâ€™s really a 5.0).

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
This beer is niiiiiiice. After drinking about 7-8 it still tasted great. Smooth and refreshing, rare in even a double IPA. 

At Russian River brewpub

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
Makes me think every other brewery in the country doesnâ€™t know how to make an IPA. Absolute balance. No overwhelming ingredient. Golden color. Sharp grapefruit palate, with a citrus carbonated kick. Finish isnâ€™t that long. Tried it side-by-side with The Elder. The  Younger has more malt, thicker mouthfeel. Alcohol completely hidden. This is what all beer should taste like. Absolute pleasure, even at 4oz. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy App

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: 8 oz pour at TBC secret tasting. Amazing, unbelievable are the best words to describe it. Totally smooth, no alcohol burn, grapefruit, pine, delicious.  Worth the hype!

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
Itâ€™s been a couple of hours since I had a 10oz pour at the Russian River Brewpub on Valentineâ€™s Day, last day of the Younger.  Iâ€™m going to compare this to the Elder, because if youâ€™ve had the Younger, youâ€™ve probably had the Elder.
Thereâ€™s no doubt that the Younger beats the bottled Elder hands down, but Elder on tap is a different story.  The bouquets are very similar, but the Younger is a little more hoppy and a little drier in the finish.
Personally, I think I prefer the Elder (just barely).  It strikes me as more balanced and a little more drinkable (which could be a bad thing).  Either way, itâ€™s a damn fine beer you should not hesitate to try if given the chance.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
Golden, orange color, dry, citrusy nose. Huge hop flavor, mild citrus notes. Very, very good, but glad I didn't have to wait in line for an hour to try this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: wow. a huge hop bomb. exactly what i was after! big notes and complexity. very resiny in the aftertaste. maybe a touch sharp for alot of people but suited me fine. going to be hard to go back to another beer after this. worth all the hype!

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Tap at anchor and hope best of the bay sf beer week.... Pour is a clear orange gold with a small thin white ring of head with moderate lacing. Smell is orange peel, pine, grapefruit, passion fruit, cut grass. Taste upfront is bitter citrus.. Orange peel, grapefruit rind... With a pine follow and lasting bitter grass and passion fruit finish. Mouthfeel is oily and slightly sticky. Taste was a bit hotter than expected.. Could taste all the abv. A great triple but not the loric taste I had been anticipated. Luckily I waited 3 minutes for this one. Its an overhopped and hot  elder. No complaints there.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Tap at the RateBeer event at Anchor and Hope. Finally a taste of the elusive younger!  Pours clear golden amber, small white head, nice lacing. Aroma is that perfect mix of Grapefruit, Passionfruit. Flavor its the same, light sweet, light bitter. Medium body, oily, light warming finish sure to the otherwise well masked ABV. Worth the wait.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: One of the two to three best beers I have ever drank in my life.  This is a perfect IPA in every imaginable sense of the word.  If you find yourself with a chance to drink this you should take advantage early and often.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: On tap, five ounce sample at Anchor and Hope Ratebeer event.  A great beer nonetheless. Boozy on the finish.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: On tap for RateBeer best of the bay. Aroma is very hoppy. Citrus and earth hops. Flavor is bitter. The hop resin kind of dominates any other flavor. Very earthy and grassy flavour. Might be overhyped, but itâ€™s tasty! Very smooth, finishes dry and oily. Color was light straw color with a nice head.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
Amazingly complex but still rounded and balanced. Seems to be a little more harsh on the palate than last year. Also maybe a bit more on the grapefruit flavors. It still really doesn't taste like a 10% beer. Worth the 90 minute wait.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Served on tap at Russian River Brew Pub, Santa Rosa, California Thursday night.  It glows a beautiful, deep, clear, orange color and produces no head, just a thin, white ring around its surface.  I usually like seeing more of a head on this style of beer, but there was something so enticing about its stunning, solid color.  Swirling the glass would immediately bring a white film to the surface, and it would dissipate just as fast as it had appeared.  The aroma is an amazing blast of pine and fresh orange peel ... though not as overpowering as I had anticipated (feared) it would be having never had a triple IPA until now.  On the palate it was full bodied, very slightly sticky, and itâ€™s carbonation danced perfectly in my mouth.  The taste sealed it with a perfect bitter.  This is an intense beer that makes so many bold statements, and yet remains incredibly well balanced and so easy to drink.  Iâ€™ve been a fan of Pliny the Elder for years now, but itâ€™s ultimately the impeccable balance of the Younger, and that equally amazing color thatâ€™s sets it apart.  Itâ€™s nothing short of a brewerâ€™s masterpiece.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Got to drink this @ the Bistro. Amber in color minimal head. Very nice floral hoppy aroma the taste is citrus, prevalent bitternness on the hops. Nice but again I ham not that into IPAs

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Pliney the Younger is literally 50% hoppier than Pliney the Elder. At 10.8% ABV, it has a much stronger aroma and taste and is slightly unbalanced in taste. Letâ€™s just say, the taste pushes the limits of alcohol to hop ratio. Out of the two, I think I like the Elder a little better based on flavor. That said, I would never turn down a glass of Pliney the Younger because itâ€™s still amazingly good and so rare!

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: No beer is perfect...except perhaps this one. I sat down to my first glass yesterday at the brewery in Santa Rosa and was prepared to be underwhelmed. I mean the hype alone, it just couldnâ€™t be that good. Well, itâ€™s that good. I am a sour/wild ale kinda guy but the grace and structure of this highly crafted brew seduced me to the hop side. After the first glass and a slice of pizza I was really enjoying life...I mean at a whopping 10% ABV, whoa! 2 glass limit for me. Is it my new favorite? No. But I will never forget it and will make it a point to stand in line again next year to get a couple glasses of perfection in a glass.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
Intense hop aroma. Tastes of pine and grapefruit. Not as malty as the Elder which I like. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Lingers on the lips, not as piny as I expected. For a triple IPA, I found the ABV to be just a tiny bit masked, does not indicate anything less about this beer. Little head, barely skims the outside of the glass. Swirling puts some lacing that dissipates immediately. Clear, more than cloudy. Orange/light brown hardy in color. Dried leathery citrus/piny aroma. Alcohol presence on both the roof of the palate and the tongue.  2013 first day of release. Waited about 4- 5 hours, happened to be within an hour or so from the brewery for that weekend, and knew Iâ€™d be worth it. I look forward  to going to the brewery and enjoying my time when crowds are not abound. Love all Russian River brews I have had so far and super happy that Pliny the Younger is now one of them.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
At brewery, after 7 hour wait. Beautiful orange color. Fresh hops in taste and aroma. Surprisingly muted in bitterness. Satisfyingly prominent pine flavor, which is the brew's predominant trait -- unique among IPAs I think in its predominance. Otherwise very balanced. Overall, a superb triple IPA. Worth a 7-hour wait? You live just once!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Its friggen pliny.. very good trip IPA.. Yup. Nice hop that last all the way through the taste.. very bitter in a good way. This stuff is very good.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
Taken from my BA account, reviewed on 2/19/12

Live tasting, on tap @ Barley and Hops Olde Worlde Family Tavern... 10oz. Pour into a mini pint glass..

Appearance; pours a gorgeous, crisp clear golden color, head non-existent but that could be due to the line and be fact that they are preparing the beers in advance... The gold color of this beer is perfect, as if Younger knows itâ€™s the #1 beer in the world... 

Smell; grapefruit, orange rinds, citrus in general... Not as heavy on the tropical fruit as Pliny the Elder.. 

Taste; exceptionally smooth, launches right into grapefruit and citrus rinds.. Quite bitter on the finish, moreso than Elder, but certainly not comically so... Good resins and a nice bitter finish. Hides 11% exceptionally well... Smooth and no hints of alcohol or alcohol burn.

Mouthfeel; this is where younger exceeds... Perfect amount of carbonation, but you can definitely sink your teeth into this one... On the lighter side of full bodied... Bitterness plays into the finish beautifully...

Overall; a great beer, and certainly one that I am glad to have experienced, although I donâ€™t know that it was worth $1/ounce and a 45 minute wait... I can easily get Pliny the Elder and I feel like Elder is every bit as solid of a beer, and given the price and accessibility is even more enjoyable although I certainly had a great ... I feel like Younger is a great beer, but I am certainly spoiled by the availability of Elder in my area... The experience is awesome, definitely glad i tried it, had some amazing times with friends in line however I donâ€™t know Iâ€™d endure the madness to try this again...

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: On tap at Toronado in San Francisco during San Francisco Beer Week, served in a tasting glass. Pours clear pale golden with a moderate white head that remains and leaves a good amount of fine lace. The aroma literally fills the room with citric, floral and spicy hops. It is reminiscent of its Elder cousin, but much more impressive with added notes that evoke a hop bin. The flavour is surprisingly well balanced, with complex citric hoppy bitterness matched with pale malts and a touch of caramel. The finish is long, peppery and spicy with beautiful hop notes. On the palate, it is medium in body with a dry, acidic texture and moderate carbonation that is slightly biting. While I was mindful of the hype surrounding this beer, it is clearly the best imperial IPA on the market. It takes that beautiful PTE aroma and kicks it up a notch and adds a couple of new dimensions of hoppy complexity. Truly amazing! 2012-02-16

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: First rate, light, refreshing, complex flavors.  Citrix hits your nose, then transfers to your mouth.  Lemon, grapefruit high notes, then finished with slight caramel tones with just enough sour bite to bind everything together.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
2/28/11 - 8oz pour in to a tulip glass

The color was exceptional, a clear shiny copper color with a thin white head that was only about 1 finger or so that dissipated quickly.

The aroma was full of citrusy & floral hops. A very intense aroma for a beer, but had the perfect blend of hops in the nose that work very well with each other.

Taste was amazing. It was sweeter and maltier than I expected, possibly to better balance out the loads of hops this beer has. Full of grapefruit and sweet like honey. The finish has a nice piney note on the end as well.

Mouthfeel was perfect, not too heavy or light, the carbonation was a bit lower than most IPAs, but suited this beer just right. It really brought out the smoothness and balance between the malts & hops on the tongue without the bringing out the bitterness.

This is quite possibly the best balanced IPA Iâ€™ve had even though itâ€™s a TIPA. I love the Blind Pig and Pliny the Elder, this is just one step beyond and much more refined. Excellent beer, well worth the wait, only wish it was more readily available.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
From notes: Sampled at EBF 2010.
Pours a murky pale golden color with a stingy off white head that dissipates quickly. Wonderfully complex hop aroma, lots of citrus grapefruit and orange being in the forefront. The flavor is big with lots of caramel offset with plenty of hop flavor mostly of the peach/grapefruit/orange vein. Medium body with a light level of carbonation and a sweet resinous mouthfeel. Very nice big IPA that I waited much to long in line to taste. Iâ€™m glad I got to try this its a great beer, but I think I prefer the elder.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
2011 on tap at Khyber Pass Pub

Poured into a tulip. Deep dark golden, possibly a little orange. Solid two fingers of frothy head. Beautiful lace floated down the glass as I drank.

Big resinous hop aroma; pine and a little bit of the sweet citrus aroma.

Flavor was quite sweet as expected, but I felt it couldâ€™ve used a bit more. Honey and caramel were there, but balanced by the sharp astringent bitter finish. I wouldâ€™ve liked more hop flavor, not just the bitterness.

Perfect carbonation and medium mouth feel -- pretty full-bodied for the style. 

Insanely drinkable for the style. Was easy to put away this bad boy and a struggle to actually try to savor it. An amazing beer, but there are also other great double IPAs out there much easier to get. Glad I had the chance to try it, though.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 03-01-2011 03:21:21

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
A huge thanks to Matt (drabmuh) for sharing his growler with me!

Served in my Russian River pint glass.

A: Remarkably clear, beautifully light in color, effervescent, white fluffy head that leaves generous amounts of sticky lacing

S: Huge hop aroma with grapefruit, citrus, floral notes. Alcohol virtually non-detectable in the nose.

T: This beer is worth all the hype. Wow! Unbelievably smooth. Huge hops, no astringency, the bitterness and sweetness walk a tightrope of perfection. The taste hits you initially with smooth hops, then transitions to a sweet, sticky deliciousness that coats the palate, and finishes with a wonderful bitterness that begs to begin the sequence again.

M: Everything is perfect here - carbonation, freshness, this beer is phenomenal.

D: At 11%, this beer kicked my ass, and I loved it. I finished three pints, and wouldâ€™ve hurt myself even worse if we didnâ€™t run out.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Tried PtY for the first time this year after much anticipation. Tannic bitterness throws the balance far off. Great color and aroma, short egg shell colored head served in half pints. PtE remains king of the hops in my book.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Bit of bitter hoppy taste, orange color with minimal head, nice finish with the bourbon barrel aging; nice light beer for hot summer days

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Amazing...the aroma of this beer is like stepping into a pine forest, and it tastes like one too! This beer is hard to find for a reason.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: pours straight up copper with thick white head and leaves an INCREDIBLE lacing pattern behind. scent is actually more muted than i expected, VERY citrus with grapefruit being dominant. taste is so balanced for what this is. smooth hop flavor that is bitter like a red grapefruit concentrate. the carbonation quickly releases the flavors. starts out smooth and ends with a sharp bitterness that quickly fades into red grapefruit. i even caught what appeared to be white pepper for a few seconds. very full bodied, thick, oily, with a medium to moderate carbonation. this is VERY drinkable however at 11%, be wary! Serving type: growler. Reviewed on: 02-15-2009

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Finally got to try this bad boy! On tap at The Horse Brass Pub. Served in a 5 oz. taster. Appearance is clear, light amber in color, with a thin white head that leaves minimal lacing around the glass.  Aroma is bursting with grapefruit and hops, with notes of sweet honey, caramel & fruit. Taste is sweet caramel malt upfront, mildly piney in the mid-palate, with a slightly bitter hop finish. Not too hoppy though. Very rich & well balanced. Mouthfeel is light in body, smooth, & again slightly bitter in the finish. Overall, is it the best Imperial IPA in the world? Thatâ€™s subjective; I see how people could think so. I think itâ€™s pretty damn good, but I tried it in a blind tasting among other DIPAâ€™s, and it certainly wasnâ€™t my favorite. The hype plays a lot into this. Still, extremely glad I got to try this!

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: Draft - Hoppy grapefruit nose.  Clear gold with a thin head.  Long persistent bitterness is present throughout and lingers.  Grapefruit hops with hints of caramel give it a nice rich taste.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
Tap into a goblet
This beer has an intense grapefruity aroma. It pours a clear orangey yellow with a small head and great lacing. It's so smooth, much more than I was suspecting. The hoppy bitterness starts strong and lasts and lasts. An amazing IPA, I can see why it has consistently high ratings.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: It has been a while (3 months) since I tasted this so details are lacking. What I remember is that it tasted very very similar to the Elder. The difference was not apparent until I tasted them side by side. Basically, bigger hops, bigger alcohol. So iâ€™m torn: on one hand it is a very impressive piece of craft to balance all that alcohol and hops into something drinkable. On the other I can essentially get the same experience for less than half the price (and no waiting in line) with the Elder. So fantastic beer but overrated in a way.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review:
The most amazing beer I've had so far. Smoother then you'd think but still contains all the great hop flavors and bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: True to the hop-forward roots of California, this one lives up to my expectations of what a "triple IPA" should be.  It had the big hop citrus-grapefruit kick at first with a nice and bubbly palate feel as it swirls around on the tastebuds, and finishes off with some smooth maltiness.  Sometimes the supposed double or imperial IPAs are imbalanced with lots of hops along with an ugly, synthetic side, as if itâ€™s the cost of brewing extremes.  Not this one though.  Itâ€™s a great, well rounded beverage with big IBUs and some soothing malts too.

product_name: Russian River Pliny the YoungerðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸IIPA DIPA - Imperial / Double IPA
product_review: The best. To bad it isnâ€™t available year round. Although it varies slightly in flavor every year it is always a beautifully balanced hop forward beer. Smooth mouth feel and a strong oily floral nose. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
As Three Floyds Dark Lord Marsmallows Handjee
65cl Bottle @ Beerhive, Edinburgh, United Kingdom.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Appearance: Pours opaque dark brown to black, almost no head, no lacing.

Appearance: Dark brown and black, opaque. Almost no foam, no cup.

4/5

Aroma: Huge soy sauce and preserved plum, with toasted malt, cassis, clove, cinnamon, tobacco, dark chocolate, caramel and toast wood, leaves a seductive grilled meat in the empty glass.

Aroma: Huge soy sauce and preserved plum, with toasted malt, cassis, clove, cinnamon, tobacco, dark chocolate, caramel and toast wood, leaves a seductive grilled meat in the empty glass.
10/10

Taste: Soy sauce, sweet and pungent spices, chocolate and dried fruits with solid bourbon oak. Super heavy sweetness with equally salty and oaky to counterbalance that. Perfect alcohol hide. Lingering salty savory finish with cocoa, bourbon oak and spices.

Taste: Soy sauce, sweet and pungent spices, chocolate and dried fruits with solid bourbon oak. Super heavy sweetness with equally salty and oaky to counterbalance that. Perfect alcohol hide. Lingering salty savory finish with cocoa, bourbon oak and spices.

9/10

Mouthfeel: Full bodied, almost flat carbonated. Thick, oily and smooth.

Taste: Full bodied, almost flat carbonated. Thick, oily and smooth. 5/5

Overall
The beer came as a complete surprise to me. It's more of an old bourbon-barrel aged Imperial Stout, or even Barleywine and Shaoxingwine, instead of a young Pastry Stout... With almost insanely salty, soy sauce-y and plumy, it reminds me of Goose Island Proprietor's Bourbon County Brand Stout 2014. No trace of common vanilla adjuncts (but it seems that vanilla beans can also have prune-like smell?), neither do marshmallow. Exactly match my palate, however I was expecting something totally different from this bottle. Hard to rate such...
This beer came as a complete surprise to me. It's more of an old bourbon-barrel aged Imperial Stout, or even Barleywine and Shaoxingwine, instead of a young Pastry Stout... With almost insanely salty, soy sauce-y and plumy, it reminds me of Goose Island Proprietor's Bourbon County Brand Stout 2014. No trace of common vanilla adjuncts (but it seems that vanilla beans can also have prune-like smell?), neither do marshmallow. Exactly match my palate, however I was expecting something totally different from this bottle. Hard to rate such... There is no vanilla flavor that is common in other wines (but it is said that the vanilla pod itself has a prune flavor?), and there is no marshmallow. Not to mention that it is really suitable for my taste, but the problem is that I expected something completely different before opening the bottle. It is really a headache to score this wine. . .
17/20

Tasted: 2022-11-30

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Score: 9 / 4 / 9 / 4 / 17

Draught at MBCC 2018, yellow session. Many thanks to Werckmeister!
Black body, with a tiny, coffee-colored head.
Wonderful aroma of bourbon, vanilla, wood, creamy chocolate, toffee, some coconut, dark fruits. 
Tastes similar, with more booze. 
Full, oily mouthfeel, with a low carbonation. 
Finishes boozy, dry, wooden, a bit sweet, with chocolate, bourbon, vanilla. 

Delicious! Heavy and boozy, but so rich, with layers of dark chocolate, bourbon and some vanilla. Not my very favourite style example, but surely worth the hype.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: In the aroma, huge layers of natural vanilla, molasses, milk chocolate, chocolate box, cherries, dried fruit, oak, noble notes of bourbon. In the taste, very sweet, liquid pralines with mega vanilla. On the finish, sticky sweetness, lots of milk chocolate. Alcohol perfectly arranged, lots of body, thick as oil, incredibly intense, tasting. One of the best beers I've had the opportunity to drink.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Served at the Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen during a tap takeover a few years back. The line stretched out the door. Pitty the fools that thought it best to start light and finish with this bad boy, only to be disappointed the keg had kicked after 20 or 30 minutes. This one share the same black pour and tan head as the other Dark Lords, and also the basic flavor profile. The extra vanilla kick is what sets this one apart. Incredibly delicious.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Massing thanks to Compton25! Obtained in a trade. This one has been an absolute top want of mine since I got into beer, I managed (or thanks to the kindness of others I manged) to try almost every dream beer since then. This one kept eluding & I am the only one since basically almost everyone but seem to have tried this one. I have had several version of Dark Lord since then including the bourbon one in 2013 (perfection) & in 2015 or so, disappointment (too soy sauce / messy). I realize that people hate on these beers, I adored many BA version, I actually thought that the regular one was fair way back in 2012 but apparently it has been going downhill ever since or that is just perception. Anyway sparkling green wax, waxing is so old school now, modern Dark Lord special label. Pours black, head is amazing very deep, deepest coffee but sadly doesnâ€™t last. No head very quickly. Nose is old school RIS syrup, pure molasses, treacle, syrup, so sweet thick syrupy with bourbon, candlewax vanilla mixed in, maple, insanely sweet molasses RIS syrup. Taste is chocolate desert pudding molasses, felts crazy strong pure sugar, maple, treacle, dark honey, bourbon concentrate syrup sugar, candy, butterscotch, unbelievably thick, syrupy & sweet,â€¦ Vanilla is not as big as hoped. Pure syrup, soft carbonation. Once you get into some ultra-sweet coffee in the back, melted chocolate. Pure insane sweet syrup, this kids is how rare special BA stouts used to taste like, even sweeter. Crazy sweet but tasty brew, pure candy syrup and sugar. Worked great with Thai food, it could bear the spices, strong flavours etc. Fight fire with fire.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Amazing vanilla flavor. Full body and thick. One of the best beers I've had.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sampled at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. 2016 vintage. Pitch black pour with a small tan head. Notes of vanilla, dark chocolate, milk chocolate, light roast, sugar. A bit too sweet.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle 0.75l release 2017 green wax, known as Marshmallow Handjee with 15%. 
Pours like motor oil black with tiny brown head that dissipate away immediately.
Aroma: roasted grain, dark malt with notes of chocolate, coffee, intense, huge marshmallow, vanilla, when it warms up steps forward bourbon, wood notes.
Flavour perfectly following aroma in all elements and details: roasted grain, dark malts, vanilla, marshmallow, bourbon, oak, vanilla...finish is dry, sticky.
Body is perfectly thick, texture syrupy, carbonation is low.
No words needed. Gimme one more bottle for aging!

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Barrel at MBCC 2017. Vintage 2016. Spent my spare first 20 minutes from the silver pass queuing for this one. Carbon black with a fancy cover of brown, creamy foam. Magnificent aroma with incredible amounts of toffee, leather, maple syrup, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, liqueur praline, dark dried fruit, whiskey-soaked berries and marzipan. Super big, oily and thick body. Really solid in the mouth. Sticky so you sit and smack afterwards. Super sweet and really big in taste. The alcohol warms up, but I can't say that the 15% is noticeable that significantly. Well integrated into the blissful hodgepodge of goodness that takes place. Dark syrup, chocolate praline, vanilla, bourbon, oak and sauna wood, some leather and charcuterie further back. Insanely good. Not daring to give my first 5 yet, but may have to think again later...

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Thnx to verbalessence !!! Pours black, not much head. Smell is super intense, as to be expected. Roasted malts, bourbon, vanilla, brown sugar. Almost a milky character to it as well. Taste is very sweet. Sharp booze. Some vanilla. Intense bourbon. Some oak. Vanilla builds up. Has a sharp (almost metallic) sidenote. This is better than expected. I dont like dark lord, guess I never will, bit this is the second version I like.

Swirling the glass does not help much either, and itâ€™s really dark and black in the glass. Lovely aroma of, yeah you guessed it, VANILLA. Sweet and tons of it. Dark sweet chocolate also, and itâ€™s heavy roasted. The sweetness and the vanilla us what sticks in this. Smooth! Oh, my.. As smooth as smooth gets, and the vanilla is just out of this world. Almost like my CrÃ©me BrÃ»lÃ©e only liquefied and added tons of strong sweet chocolate. What a lovely flavor. Itâ€™s a bit far out there on the sweet side, but itâ€™s something about that vanilla thatâ€™s just like heaven. Ends light dry with a lingering chocolaty aftertaste thatâ€™s again filled with vanilla and a little bit of mouthdrying wood. World class! 04.05.2013

product_review: Bottle shared during Marksâ€™ 4K tasting, and last dutch whale share. Finally! One of my biggest wants since i started trading! Shared with 4 close beer friends. 2016 marshmallow handjee version. Poured a pitch black colour with a slight tanned head. Nose is so intense. product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From notes. Enjoyed this during the 2nd Annual Kellyâ€™s Island Bottle Share on September 18. 750 mL bottle. 2016 vintage. Holy hell, I never thought Iâ€™d get to try one of these! The pour is a jet black motor oil with a thin ring of brown head that dissipates. This looks like a tar pit. The aroma is heavy on the dark chocolate, sweet molasses, light bourbon, and bitter roast. The vanilla isnâ€™tâ€™ as heavy as I wouldâ€™ve liked it on the nose. The alcohol is a little heavy on the finish. The flavor has a little more vanilla in it, but some of the other flavors intensify as well. The chocolate and molasses really explode. The bourbon takes on a thing of its own. The barrel even offers a little more. Itâ€™s complex, good, complete, but the vanilla isnâ€™t as prominent as it should be. The mouth feel is thick and chewy with a soft carbonation and a bright vanilla on the aftertaste. The chocolate, bourbon, and maltiness are there, but the vanilla really comes through here. Itâ€™s by far the best Dark Lord anything Iâ€™ve had to date. This is a beautiful beer.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared bottle. Not much in a way of appearance - dark brown thick liquid with virtually no foam, something you would expect from such a big beer. Rich and complex aroma dominated by vanilla and bourbon over the black chocolate and coffee notes common to imperial stouts in general. Tastes as complex as it smells, with vanilla, bourbon, wood, chocolate, caramel and coffee nuances playing in tandem and changing one another with every moment passing since the first sip. A truly magnificent dessert beer that provokes deep introspection and will make you think about the meaning of life while trying to get to the end of the aftertaste.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Sample, 2014 vintage, gift from a stranger, during Dark Lord Day, trip with Philippe Boutin, Luc BourbonniÃ¨re and Ian GuÃ©nard, savoured on April 30 2016; eye: black, opaque, no head, no lacing; nose: roasted barley, vanilla, chocolate, burnt barley; mouth: roasted barley, vanilla, chocolate, burnt barley, finish in vanilla with presence of roasted barley, full body, average carbonation, mildly bitter, mildly sweet, syrupy texture; overall: quite fine

ENGLISH

Sample ... palate: roasted barley, vanilla, chocolate, burnt barley, vanilla finish with roasted barley, full-bodied, medium carbonation, medium bitter, medium sweet, syrupy texture, nice balance; in summary: very good

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft at RB Best Fest 16: Didnâ€™t think I would ever get a chance to try this one, even at the event it was a secret as to when it would go on. Sure enough as soon as they tapped it the line was a mile long. I was lucky to finally get this walz harpoonâ€™d off my wants list. Poured a deep motor oil from my car black with a brown head. Aroma was super vanilla with a rich and booziness to it. Taste is amazing vanilla mixed with caramel and rich malts, just enough big booze to keep it from being sweet mess. The best Dark Lord I have tried since the â€™07 and by far exceeded that!

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle thanks to Marshall. Pours pitch black with no head. Single note thick mouthfeel soy sauce chocolate vanilla. High sweetness.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2016 vintage. Pitch black color with mocha head. Aroma is really complex with smooth bourbon, vanilla, brown sugar, chocolate and dark cherries. Taste starts really sweet at first with molasses and chocolate malt but smooths out towards the finish, even delivering a slight bitter and roasty flavor. Really heavy body with soft carbonation. Much better than last yearâ€™s version, now I get the hype.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared BOTTLE. Inky black. Super rich molasses and dark chocolate, cocoa powder, no sugary sweetness of the plan Dark Lord. Strong but not over the top vanilla oak. The finish has some alcohol heat, dark fruit blending into the malts. The ultimate desert beer.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: ok ok ok, this one was good, the barrel aging was excellent, tons of brownie batter and great vanilla flavors. Im a big fan of this one.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sample at CBC. Thick aroma of vanilla. Also lots of it in the taste. Good but could tone down the vanilla a bit

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
DLD taster... Thank you kind stranger... 2014 vintage. A dark elixir, unbelievable aroma. So smooth subtle and delicious... Lives up to the hype... A holy grail of RIS beers. Fantastic!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a nice large dark brown foamy head. Aroma of rich black chocolates notes with some vanilla and bourbon notes. Taste is a fantastic mix of rich black chocolate notes with some vanilla notes, some residuals sugar notes and some nice bourbon notes that smooth out any rough edges from this beer. Body is full with nice creamy texture and good carbonation and alcohol is not overly apparent. Fantastic complex mix while still keeping an excellent level of drinkability. 

Re-rate 2018: Still as enjoyable and the original pastry stout. This one tastes like smores.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2014 vintage. Extremely sweet, and this sweetness gets somewhat unpleasant after drinking too much. By too much I mean about 15oz. The flavor is completely out of balance. This lack of balance is usually a huge minus, but in this case, not necessarily. Loads of vanilla, bourbon, molasses, coffee, marshmallow, brown sugar, chocolate, and syrup in a bottle! Holy hell. Flavor is not overly complex, mouthfeel is thick, and the marshmallow flavor lingers on for a long long time. The flavor develops as the beer warms up. Guys, let this beer chill for at least a couple hours. I donâ€™t know if this beer is "the best stout ever" but it surely is unique and worth trying.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Holy crap I wasnâ€™t expecting this. Lucky enough to get this on tap at DLD 2016. Right place right time. Pours a deep dark black brown. No head. Aromas of big vanilla, vanilla, vanilla. Light coffee and coconut and fudge. Light booziness in the aroma. Taste is super sweet but it totally works. Long time want. Glad to have this one. Wooo.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On Tap at RateBeer Best in Santa Rosa. Believe the hype. This was a straight up marshmallow bomb. Tons of vanilla, super thick mouthfeel, light bourbon and barrel. The vanilla takes the forefront. Super rich and delicious. Psyched to finally try this hard to come by beer.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bourbon Vanilla Dark Lord â€™15 vintage 

Pours a brown-black color with a dark brown, small head to it, leaving back sheets of thin lacing atop the surface of the beer. Reveals its decadent viscosity after swirling, by revealing alcohol legs and tiny, dark brown bubbles at the glass.

Intense aromas of fudge, bakers chocolate and burned malts, tied together by a ridiculously rich Bourbon appearance, featuring flowery vanilla, a whiff of cinnamon, apple piths and a ton of scentened oak. Vanilla is easily detectable, while well entangled into the Bourbon, adding a organic, sweet, flowery freshness to the chocolate decadence. Mousse au chocolate, moldy earth, toffee and brownie batter round out this monster on the nose, so far truly a masterpiece, which I actually find hard to compare to the regular Dark Lord.

Has a supersmooth mouthfeel, due to its very low carbonation, next to a silk, omnipresent creaminess, coating the tongue and soothing the pleasantly integrated Bourbon effectivly.

Tastes of a spice soaked, earth coated oakiness, featuring the beers velvet mouthfeel from the start. Develops an enjoyable warmth, as the Bourbon unfolds its spice profile, together with vanilla, licorice, molasses and fudge. Vanilla certainly deserves an additional mentioning as it not only stands out from the Bourbon, but directly blends into the beers smooth cream quality, producing a heavenly, well accentuated sweetness, from which the profound spices benefit big times during the finish. Ends with cinnamon, red apple, fudge, molasses and a long lasting, silk, vanilla coke quality, smoothing out the Bourbon oak entirely.

Wow, what a behemoth of a beer. I guess it would be almost impossible to drink more of a few couple of oz of this, if it wasnâ€™t for the soothing combination of cream and vanilla. This doesnâ€™t turn overly roasty, but fudgy smooth with a ton of sweet chocolate to it, amped up by the spicy Bourbon. The different flavors come beautifully together, while this is still being best enjoyed in small sips, as for its profound sweetness.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Vanilla stout shake, what a powerful aroma. Smokey, bubblegum, licorice, the only issue it is a bit hard to drink, otherwise a real treat.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft - Believe all the hype. Vanilla, sweet bourbon, marshmallow and nice sweet roast. Viscous as they all are and incredibly rich on the pallet. Sticky and sweet, but quite tasty.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at RateBeer Best. It pours dark brown with a brown head. The aroma is full with chocolate syrup and vanilla ice cream. Massively sweet to the point of being sugary. The flavor is the same with a good dose of chocolate and vanilla. The alcohol notes are strong, but it serves this kind of beer well by cutting the huge sweetness. Very thick bodied and somewhat port-like. It goes down warming and satisfying. One of the sweeter beers at this festival, but it was ultimately very fun stuff to drink. Hardly any roasted malt or bitterness.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft sample at 2015 RateBeer Best festival. This may have had the largest lines of the day. At one point right after tapping it was 45 minutes. I decided not to wait, but about an hour later they were still pouring with 5 minute waits, so I got myself a couple of samples. Pours is inky black with a very small dark brown head and minimal lacing. Aroma is over the top marshmallow, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate. Its like a desert topping. Flavor is light bitter, fully sweet, hella marshmallow again. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. This is pretty grate in small doses. Holy hell.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft. Black beer with a tan head. Sweet vanilla aroma with caramel/toffee and bourbon. Bourbon and vanilla flavor with light chocolate and rich malt. Fuller bodied. Vanilla and bourbon linger with toffee, light marshmallow, and rich malt.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Had this from the bottle a few years back and again at rbwg festival. pours out with oil black topped with a small tan head. nose is crazy sweetness vanilla marshmallow fluff bourbon barrel roast malts rich chocolate wow. Taste is more of the heavy sweetness vanilla roast malts bourbon barrel roast this was great.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at ratebeer beerfest 2016. Pours syrup thick an black. Aroma is vanilla oak and roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts lots of vanilla, marshmallows and bourbon. Amazing beer. And best of show at the festival

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: At Ratebeer Best. Pours near black with a modest tan head and a chocolate and vanilla aroma. There is a full-bodied dark molasses flavor with some chocolate, vanilla and marshmallow. The bourbon accentuates the vanilla, making this a delightful version of DL.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap at RBBest2016. Pours black with a tan rim. Aroma of vanilla; chocolate; dark treacle. Very full bodied. Flavor is really smooth brown sugar/dark treacle/vanilla. Not dry, mildly bitter. To f..king die for.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at rbwg. Finally a dark lord I like. Heavy vanilla in nose. Thick marshmallow and stout taste. This coats your mouth heavy lingers for awhile.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
75cl bottle. 
APPEARANCE : pitch black beer. Almost no head. 
NOSE : vanilla, chocolate, molasses. 
TASTE : lots of alcohol, molasses, mocha, vanilla. Overwhelming taste

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This is probably the best of the DL variants. Big flavors of the bourbon barrels with that strong vanilla flavor that balances out the heat of the bourbon. Dark and strong tasting but not overwhelming to the palate. A must try. Cheers!

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at The Bullerup Pubben reopening/Solar Eclipse pt. 2 tasting. This huge beer pours jet black with a brown head. Huge vanilla aroma with chocolate and oak notes. Sweet berries and some coffee. Super complex and powerful. Extremely smooth body. The flavour is quite sweet with lots of cocoa, coconuts, hazelnuts, oak, vanilla and sweet ripe berries. Tons going on here. Crazy stuff!

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Poured from a 2015 bottle. 
Aroma is marshmallow and chocolate. Some light roast and bourbon notes. Hints of alcohol. Very sweet. 
Pours a viscous black with almost no head, but light head on the edges. Light lacing and moderately long legs. 
Flavor is fairly sweet with some moderate chocolate notes. Tons of toasted marshmallow with some vanilla. Light alcohol spice. Light oak and medium light bourbon. 
Mouthfeel is full bodied with medium low to low carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, so much vanilla! Very sweet with some light bourbon notes. Light dark fruit notes. Pretty torn on how I feel about this beer.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle generously shared by kermis. Pours pitch black. Aroma is huge vanilla, chocolate, sweet toasty, port and a bit of coffee. Huge body. Very full flavoured. All extremes can be used in this one. Light carbonation. Very sweet. Amazing!

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at THT massive thanks to kermis. Black with short lasting light brown head. Marshmallow, vanilla, bourbon, massive chocolate, Rum, loads of sweet high end chocolate, sugared coffee, molasses, syrup, loads of sugar and different kinds of chocolate. Super sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Massive stuff. Extremely sweet, which takes away slightly from the insane desert aroma, but one of the most insane imperial stouts Iâ€™ve ever had. Incredible.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The stuff of legends. Expect unicorns and centaurs. Incredibly complex, like differential equations. Enough vanilla to keep it scented even after it passes.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: I am not a huge fan of regular Dark Lord, but this variant was amazing. Dark brownish-black pour with no head. The aroma has a ton of vanilla plus some chocolate and roasted malt. The flavor is very similar. The vanilla is right up front with some big barrel character coming through. I get some good whiskey that goes well with the chocolate and heavily roasted malt. The oak and maple go very well with the other notes and make this an outstanding beer. Thick mouthfeel and no discernible carbonation.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Holy hell. Bourbon vanilla sweetness for days! Incredible mouthfeel. Thanks Sean for sharing.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
More than worthy of the hype. There is literally nothing I can think of to change that would improve this beer. It even maintains a half-inch thick mocha head. 

Thereâ€™s a depth of flavor and complexity thatâ€™s richer than any other barrel aged beer Iâ€™ve had... including BCBS Vanilla, Rare, Parabola, BA Vietnamese Speedway, etc... This is just more enjoyable. At 15% you taste no alcohol and only get a slight, but pleasing warming sensation as it goes down, with massive marshmallow, chocolate and vanilla-oak goodness forever lingering. 

I canâ€™t do it justice by attempting to analyze and explain. It really is the Dark Lord of barrel aged beers. I need more

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Originally reviewed 3/9/2013. On tap at Hunahpu Day. Served in a taster.
 Jet black. No head. Small island of foam.

Smells ofvVanilla and bourbon. Bit surprise. Lots of sweet malts. Some traditional Dark Lord soy sauce.

Tastes of chocolate, vanilla, bourbon. No real barrel character beyond the bourbon flavor. Lots of bourbon and vanilla though. Lots of fudgy chocolate. Big soy sauce flavor and booze hinder it.
 Boozy but very tasty. Low in carbonation and huge in body.

Itâ€™s over the top, but the bourbon and vanilla mask what I donâ€™t like about Dark Lord. Itâ€™s delicious only because of adjuncts.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Holy shit!!! I have no words..... 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: backlog.draft. Pitch black, small head. Waited a long time for this. Aroma is huge vanilla, cocoa, small tiny hint of bourbon. Mouthfeel is velvety, creamy, incredibly sweet. Very tasty but extremely sweet.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottleshare thanks to homer for #899. Bottle 537 of 934. Pour is black, tan head. Aroma is super sugary, strong, mild bourbon, more sugar, vanilla in the sweetness, but not super present. Taste is much more mild than I expected. But after a few sips, I get the waing in the chest. It really does taste like a marshmallow.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Nose is aggressively boozy with a moderate to firm marshmallow. Some heat in the nose. Pitch black pour. Small brown head. Some diabetes underneath the nose. Residual sugar dominates. Taste is velvet smooth elixir of the gods. A harmonious blend of alcohol and cake frosting. Warming in finish but is always smooth. Wowsers.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Keg at the 4th Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Session 4, 02/05/2015.
Black with a dirty tan swirl.
Nose is rich roast, chocolate, vanilla, toffee fudge, bourbon tunes.
Taste comprises rich dark fruit, vanilla essence, sweet licks, muscavado sugar, chocolate souffle, sherry notes, bourbon barrel.
Medium + body, oily complection, sweet close.
Decent enough impy but as with other DLâ€™s to sweet for me, needs some more bitterness/charring to balance out.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Green session. Dark brown body with a small light brown head. Roasted malt, molasses, chocolate, oak, vanilla pod, maple syrup, light alcohol. Iâ€™m very glad that I have a bottle in my cellar, so I can taste more than the 2-3 cl they poured at CBC. 9,4,9,4,17

Bottle @ Bullerup Pubbenâ€™s , Re-Opening/Solar eclipse pt. 2. Black body with a small offwhite head. Bourbon, vanilla, chocloate, oak, haselnut, pecannut, smooth, soft, very drinkable.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark brown-black body, thin tan lacing, traces of lacing. Rich brownie, fudge, caramel, vanilla, light boozy bourbon, cream, and light earth. Full bodied with silky carbonation, a ton of residual sweetness, and a lingering finish.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by Mike, pours sticky brown black color with small head. Notes of caramel, vanilla, chocolate, syrup, and molasses. Pretty sticky and sweet. Aroma is awesome but maybe a touch too rich with Bourbon. Residual sugars left behind in mouth.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at bills courtesy of Mike. Pours a deep brown body with bright tan lacing. Mouthfeel is aggressive and sweet with notes of melted fudge brownie, tons of sugar and marshmallow. Vanilla syrup and candy. Not a ton of bourbon actually. Too sweet, but still a delightful punch to the face.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Draught @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017 - Green Session
 
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, alcohol, vanilla and oak. Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, boozy, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and oak finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat.


Draught @ CBC 2015, Green Session, KÃ¸benhavn

Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, alcohol, vanilla, coffee, cocoa and oak. Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, roasted, oak, vanilla, chocolate and cocoa finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [9 4 9 4 17 - 4.3 5/19/2015]

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap @ CBC 2015, green session. Black with a light tan head. Nose has vanilla, soy sauce and some caramel. Taste is sweet, vanilla fudge, caramel ice cream, dark dried fruits, molasses and some cinnamon.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap at CBC 2015, Copenhagen. Originally rated 20150502. Colour is black with slightly brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Vanilla, coffee, some sweetness, chocolate and roasted malts. Very soft and drinkable.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
@green cbc 2015
alcohol, coffee, chocolate, ridiculous sweet, unbalanced. intense. highly overrtated

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draught sample at CBC 2015. Pitch black with a thin, tanned head. Roasted aroma with dark malts, vanilla, chocolate, coffee and bourbon barrel. Taste is sweet and roasted. Full body with an oily texture, Finishes lasting bitter-roasted with dark malts, fruits, vanilla and bourbon barrel. Some alcohol dense notes. Excellent, rich Stout.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap @CBC15. Valiantly foraged by MrOrla. Oily black, small light tan head. Thick cocoa and vanilla aroma. Sweetish cocoa and vanilla flavor, piercing coffee like bitterness. Lovely boozy. Long, sticky sweet finish. Good stuff.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Wow this was great. Still a nice sweetness. Lots of vanilla and oak. What an easy drinking beer. 
First drank: DLD 2014
Vintage: 2014
Second drink: DLD 2015
Vintage: 2015

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Thx you friendly Americans at CBC 2015. Black with low Brown head. Vanilla, Dark Chcolate, Intense . Sweet, Vanilla, Dark chocolate. Thick oily body. Better than regluar DL.

product_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord - Bourbon Vanilla BeanðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:

product_review:
