Overall, the barrel quality is remarkable and the beer in total is a must try.
Earlier Rating: 11/25/2019 Total Score: 4
Aroma: vanilla coconut chocolate roasted barley roasted malts nougat alcohol sugars barrel wood oak malted barley raisins figs and licorice. Taste: creamy chocolate syrup wort syrup toffee roasted black coffee roasted barley licorice star anise toasted alcohol sugars heavy vanilla coconut oak barrel wood corkscrew and sawdust. Overall: decadent and barrel forward. Beautiful harmony.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Good bodied beer, solid poor. Head settled well. Coffee, bourbon, vanilla notes. Pretty tasty

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle.Pitch black colour with small beige head.Aroma chocolate,coffee,vanilla,bourbon,wood and oily,nice smooth warming taste with creamy finish one of the best beers I taste.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Shared bottle at tasting. Deep brown color with beige head. Aroma of Dark malt, cocoa, coffee, chocolate, Bourbon. Taste, chocolate, coffee, Bourbon, cocoa, light vanilla, coconut from wood. Alcohol is dangerously hidden. Nice. 
Earlier Rating: 8/16/2019 Total Score: 4.8
Bottle, kindly shared by MisoW, many thanks. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of dark malt, nougat, wood, Taste, dark malt, nougat, chocolate, vanilla, wood, coconut. Nice chocolate and coffee finish. Nice.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
C: opaque dark brown
N: coffee, muscovado sugar, brown sugar, treacle, sweet
P: high viscosity, cocoa, chocolate, dried fruit, coffee, very mellow despite the alcohol, light char, bourbon, vanilla, cask influence. Yum.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2022 bottle, 13.3%, $6.49 TWF. Black with a small brown head. Nose is chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, wood, soy sauce. Vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, caramel, wood. A little boozy, but that's expected.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at share: pours black with beige head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, butterscotch, chocolate, hints of soy sauce. Taste is dry, chocolatey. Nice vanilla and butterscotch aftertaste. Good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Roast and plenty of bourbon. Nicely done, though I feel this is something that would have been more novel and groundbreaking 15 years ago. Props for being a forefather though. Rated in that sense it's pretty damn superior. Compared to the plethora of bourbon barrel aged stouts now, perhaps less novel. Bourbon and roast. Oak. Coffee less evident than base beer. Black pour with decent mocha head. Bitter finish. Bottle.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12oz bottle 2022 vintage - 13.3% - pours thick black with a quickly receding puffy orange tan head and no lacing â€¦.. aroma of vanilla, dark fruits, cocoa, fudge, light bourbon and oak notes, caramel - toffee, roasted coffee and chocolate malts â€¦â€¦ taste is of roasted malts, dry cocoa, some oak, vanilla, toffee, coffee, fudge, dark fruits and some bourbon â€¦. More dry oak and depth are added by the barrel aging â€¦. Abv Is hidden well â€¦. A classic throwback imperial stout â€¦ thick bodied, dry and oily mouthfeel â€¦. Finish is of vanilla, dry oak, dark fruits, coffee and cocoa â€¦. Lovely brew

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Tap @ Our table, Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 20220513.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap @ Our table Mikkeller bar 12/5-22. Roasted malty with coffee, chocolate, wood and bourbon. Body is full, roasted finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from the system company. Black beer with rich beige foam. Pleasant beer with fine notes of chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Dry nice finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Nearly black with a brown head. Aroma is coffee, fudge, brownies, wood, smoke, caramel, and dark fruit. Taste is heavy sweet, heavy bitter, and very light coffee sourness.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 10 ounce sniffer glass,  at Lizardville in Copley, Ohio. Sweet bourbon aromas. Black in color with thin tan head. 2020 vintage. Taste the bourbon, malt, and an incredible sweetness to this wonderful beer. Heavy bodied and smooth for the high percentage beer. Does have bourbon burn aftertaste. This beer is just delightful. Cheers!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2019 edition. Appearance- oily midnight black, a small tan fizzy head. Aroma is amazing- chocolate, caramel, fudge cake, oaky woody barrel, boozy dark fruit, treacle, pecan pie, ashy roast malt, pipe smoke hints, leather, tarmac, rich coffee, earthy roast dark malts. Taste is thick chocolate, brownie, caramel swirl ice cream, toffee fudge, sticky dark malt, vanilla, oak barrel, tiramisu, espresso, bourbon, roast malt, ashy hints, treacle toffee. Bourbon in the finish. An amazing array of flavours and the mouthfeel is perfect. Lengthy sweet boozy finish. What a beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 330ml bottle. Black with tan head. Deep aroma full of coffee bean, fudge, tar, oak. Taste is well balanced, complex, great depth to it. Impressive.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black liquid with very short and white foam. Nose coffee bourbon vanilla oak licorice. In the mouth, it is a powerful coffee attack immediately followed by the contribution of bourbon, vanilla, caramelized sugar and licorice! Truly exceptional!!!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: (Bottle) Black colour with brief, foamy, pale brown head. Malty, roasted nose with espresso, dark chocolate, cacao, bourbon, vanilla, wood, burnt sugar and raisins. Malty, roasted, slightly vinous taste with notes of dark chocolate, liquorice, black coffee, bourbon, vanilla, wood, raisins, molasses and a balanced coffee bitterness in a finish with a warming bourbon touch. Full body, quite sweet. Rich and powerful, with a mellow and rounded mouthfeel and great balance. Generous bourbon presence. You can sense the alcohol, but it just adds another layer. Lovely beer!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tan head quickly dissipates to barely cover a still black beer. Big aroma of bourbon and coffee apparent as soon as you open the bottle. Taste is beautifully blended coffee, bourbon and dark fruit, some sweetness from burnt brown sugar. Last beer of 2020 and a great way to end a dog of a year.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Tight tan head left a cover on a black still body.
Huge aroma of coffee & malt.
Full bodied, super smooth with a sticky back.
Coffee, malt, boozy, raisins, toffee & caramel.
Banging!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From bottle to tulip glass.  The aroma on this one wafts across the table before you can sit down to enjoy it!  Massive bourbon along all fronts.  Black with deep brown highlights and a large, chocolate brown head that fades.  Aroma is booze and chocolate.  Flavor leans into the barrel with full whiskey.  Back half is baker's chocolate.  Chewy cocoa on the mouthfeel and flavor ends with a slight roast that is wonderful.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: We're in the dark department of Mi2 now, and after Kingpin Turbo Geezer and Brooklyn Black Ops, the master of ceremonies has found this one from Cardinal's innermost hiding place: almost completely black with ok foam. O blessed one, here we are talking about a superb depth and richness of taste, elegantly balanced. The barrel aging contributes vanilla. Dark and powerful.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
[Tasting - Viborg]

Aroma: Dark chocolate, coffee, bourbon, sweet liqourice, fudge, coconut and roasted malt

Appearance: Pitch black with no head

Taste: Moderately sweet and bitter, dark chocolate, bitter coffee, bourbon, slight alcoholic, sweet liqourice, slight vanilla, fudge and coconut

Mouthfeel: Creamy texture with soft carbonation

Overall: Delicious BA masterpiece from Alesmith!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pitch black with minimal brown head. Aroma of bourbon with vanilla. Taste has intense coffee with bourbon and vanilla notes. Full body, average carbonation. Overall this is an excellent beer but i was expecting more. Still great beer

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 0,15l on tap @ Pien Brewpub. Pours very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is dry roasted malts with oak and bourbon. Flavor is dry roasted malts, bourbon, oak, hops. Good, but not as good as the normal version.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black with light brown foam. Smells barrels, bourbon, coffee, marzipan and some citrus peel. Full. Tastes of bourbon, coffee, salty licorice, oak and grape skin. Long.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: In the aroma, dark chocolate, coffee, almonds, barrel and noble alcohol. In the taste, very rich: chocolate and pralines countered by espresso, notes of barrel and almonds in the background. The combination is harmonious - no flavor drowns out the rest. The beer is very well composed - the alcohol is completely imperceptible

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 330 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 13.0%. Pitch black colour, minimal brown head. Aroma of roast malts,  bourbon whiskey, oak, chocolate and vanilla, a hint of fusel alcohols. Very moderate carbonation, but not lifeless. Rich and warming mouthfeel. The flavour has the same elements as the aroma, but is not too sweet. A very good beer, but personally I prefer the "ordinary" Speedway Stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dish. One of my whales. Jet black beer with a nice head of foam. The aroma is bourbon, vanilla and chocolate. The taste is extremely balanced and fantastic. Great beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours pitch black with medium beige head. Roasted malts, chocolate, prunes, coffee, vanilla, dark fruits, bourbon, warming alcohol. Full body, oily texture and flat carbonation.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by Benzai. Black syrupy beer with little foam that quickly disappears. Aroma of Bourbon, coffee and caramel. The beer has the taste of coffee and Bourbon and is sticky in the mouth. Aftertaste with a kick of alcohol.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Alesmith Barrel Aged Speedway Stout (BBA), 13%, 11 fl oz bottle, 2019 ed. This beer essentially cost me Â£35 which is pretty outrageous, let's be honest. In saying that, it is a great beer that lives up to the hype for me. Meaty vanilla oak and chocolate aroma with peanut brittle and coffee cake. Has a touch too much of that BBA meatiness for me but it's nice. Body is rounded and oily. Taste is where this takes off. Not too sweet, which is important for my tastes. Coffee, charred wood, enduring bitterness with a touch of alcohol spice. Spicy and woody yet with chocolate and sweetened coffee. Exceptional taste and body. Yep this is worthy of being differentiated from other imperial stouts but of course it's never going to be 4x better as the price would suggest. I'm not disappointed with the purchase but it's certainly a one-off. (8-4-10-5-17=4.4)

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 33cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck in Vichte. U: Black with a thin brown head. G: Wood, roasted, molasses, dried fruit, chocolate and bourbon. S: Sweet with a light bitterness. Lots of molasses, bourbon, some dried fruit, vanilla and coffee. Alcohol warmth. M: Full-bodied with a light carbonation. Slightly sticky.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at home from Ghost Whale. Pours jet black with a dirty tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coconut, marshmallow, boozy bourbon and coffee. Taste is chocolate, coffee, coconut, marshmallow, boozy bourbon zing. Lovely and balanced. Smooth and boozy. Fantastic.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A pitch-black beer with brown, quickly reducing foam to a ring that adheres to the walls of the glass. In the aroma, coffee, chocolate cake, coconut, wet wood, chocolate liqueur, pralines, relatively little vanilla (but you can feel it too). After a while, a distinct nuttiness also comes out. This nuttiness is also distinct in the taste. In addition, you can feel coffee, chocolate, pralines, almonds, a bit of wet wood, coconut, vanilla. It tastes like a chocolate cake doused with bourbon and washed down with espresso. The beer is rather sweet, but not overly so. A lot of body, alcohol in the taste in the form of warming, carbonation could be lower. I was a little afraid that this beer would be overrated, but I was positively surprised. If it weren't for the carbonation, it would be perfect.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap at Kultainen Apina. Abbey 13%. Pours black with beige head. Aroma and taste have roasted malts, bourbon barrel, coffee, chocolate, dried fruits. licorice. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, roasted finish with warming alcohol. Just excellent.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
The color is pitch black, the head is brown, it appears for a short time and quickly disappears. 

Intense and complex aroma. Dark chocolate (a shitload of % cocoa), dried oak, port notes, coffee (sweetened strong espresso) and a very distinct barrel - vanilla, marzipan. 
Full, oily in taste. Sweetness of chocolate, molasses. Dark chocolate, roasted, ash notes, red fruits, port, vanilla. Slightly alcoholic, warming finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Vintage 2019
Appearance: Pours opaque dark brown to black with little creamy brown head, no lacing.
Appearance: Dark brown-black, opaque. A small amount of fine brown foam, no cup.
4/5
Aroma: Strong flavors of coffee and dark chocolate, with molten chocolate cake, toasted malt, liquorice, vanilla, caramel and soy sauce.
8/10
Taste: Savory soy sauce with oaky spices and dark chocolate Mild sweetness and bitterness with distinct alcohol burn. Lingering warming bitter finish with oaky spices and dark chocolate.
Taste: Savory soy sauce with oaky spices and dark chocolate Mild sweetness and bitterness with distinct alcohol burn. Lingering warming bitter finish with oaky spices and dark chocolate.
Taste: Savory soy sauce with oaky spices and dark chocolate. Soft sweetness and bitterness with obvious alcohol burn. The finish is long-lasting, warm and bitter, showing the spices and dark chocolate flavors brought by the barrel.
9/10

Mouthfeel: Full bodied, mild carbonated. Oily texture.

5/5

Overall
A great imperial stout with extreme concentration, however there's too much vanilla and alcohol right now. Need time for all those flavors to melt up.

A great imperial stout with extreme concentration, however there's too much vanilla and alcohol right now. Need time for all those flavors to melt up.

15/20

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at a tasting, shared by MisoW. Thanks! Black colour, small head. Raw intensity and complexity of character. Full body and moderate carbonation. Shitloads of chocolate, cocoa, focused on soft roast, soft warming alcohol, very well hidden considering the ABV. Barrels and bourbon manifestinv softly too, yet uncompromisingly. Great one.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at tasting, thanks MisoW. Malty aroma and taste, chocolate, raisins, light coffee notes, vanilla notes, medium bitter, light sweet. Full body, malty bitter finish with vanilla notes.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from my Secret Santa 2014, StefanSD. Pours black color, beige head. Aroma of vanilla, cocoa, chocolate, plums. Taste is sweet, coffe, cocoa, vanilla, sherry, plums, bourbon, chocolate. What a great beer!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Poured from a 2012 vintage, 750 ml bottle. 
Aroma is a bit oxidized with some light wet cardboard and more raisin, fig, prune and date than when fresher. Medium light roast notes with light chocolate and lighter caramel and toffee. Faint bourbon and oak notes. Not much coffee at all. 
Pours black with a medium sized, thick, dark mocha head that recedes steadily to a small film that lingers on the edges. Faint lacing and fairly long legs. 
Flavor is less oxidized with more chocolate notes. Lighter roast, caramel and toffee. Light coffee notes that linger a bit in the finish. Medium light bourbon and light oak with a bit of alcohol spice. Light raisin and faint fig, prune and date notes. 
Mouthfeel is full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, this much age isn't good for this beer. I have had it plenty of times fresh or with a couple years and it's much better than this old bottle. But as I was drinking this bottle I went to check my rating and realized I never rated this before. I'd say it's best to drink within 2 or 3 years of bottling. Rating is for what I feel this beer deserves when fresh. This particular bottle would get a 6, 4, 7, 4, 14 for a 3.5.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
May 10th, 2016 -  Rounding up the trio of Alesmith Stouts and their different flavor variants is the Barrel Aged version of the OG, with a high price, an ABV and my high expectations. The smell is potent, even from a 4 oz. taster glass, and shows off the barrel aging and oak nicely. The flavor is also exceptionally smooth, strong and potent, with a solid hit of alcohol, and a good bourbon taste. Solid, meaty and strong, it's a triple threat, and definitely worth of following the other Speedway styles.

September 3rd, 2015 - The Alesmith Vietnamese Coffee stout is a premier beer, but the Bourbon Barrel Aged version is no slouch. With a smooth, opalescent look it offers classic and classy alcohol and oak notes, smoldering with ethanol. The taste is much gentler, both sweet and delicate, but also bold and robust. A licorice sweetness mixes with the taste of Japanese whisky, and a thinner palate let's everything shine through.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
On tap. 

Top tier aroma, full of oak barrel and vanilla scent, along with strong cocoa, coffee, roasted malt and bread crust. 

Flavor-wise, well-rounded balanced flavor combining the roasty and malty flavor with bourbon flavor. Nothing really stands out, but all are in one sip, expressing themselves in so many levels. 

Rich and heavy body with a caramel sweetness. I am very impressed with this beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Cask of 2016 barrel at brewery. Pours jet black. Bourbon aroma, coffee, roasted malts. Taste follows, big bourbon brew. Thick, big body. Noce but the no co2, warmer and bourbon wasnt a plus for me on the perfect original.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draught @ MBCC 2018. Pours black with a brown head, lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, rich coffee, expresso, oak, dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon. Flavor is sweet and light bitter, roasted malt, rich coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, vanilla, oak, bourbon, light alcohol. product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Score: 8 / 4 / 9 / 4 / 17

Draught at MBCC 2018, green session. 
Pitch black body, with a medium, creamy, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of bourbon, wood, tobacco, cocoa powder, liquorice, dark chocolate, some soy sauce. 
Tastes similar, very creamy, with more chocolate. 
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation. 
Finishes medium boozy, moderate sweet, a bit roasty, with cocoa powder, chocolate, tobacco, wood, bourbon, some liquorice. 

Very tasty! Quite smooth for the strength, with very well integrated bourbon barrel and a creamy character throughout. Alcohol is noticeable, but well moderated. Really lovely stuff, while I have to say, after trying a couple of variants now, the straight, regular Speedway Stout clearly remains my favourite one.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap @MBCC2018, Green Session. Black, tan head. Bourbon and coffee aroma. Sweet flavour, syrupy coffe, roasted malt, sweet bourbon. Very drinkable. Rock solid.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Barrel at MBCC 2018, green pass. Black with dark brown foam. Aroma of caramel straps, chocolate, marzipan, bourbon, liqueur praline with a little breast caramel. The only thing that may be missing is the coffee, which seems to have disappeared or ended up in the background of the cask storage. Still very, very good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at Grizzley's Ode to Winter event. Dark pour with ring of light brown head. Aroma is mostly oak and bourbon with a hint of vanilla. Taste.....wow, world class, chocolate, little coffee blended with the bourbon. Sweet but hot with the booze, right there with BCBS (the good years). Dynamite.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Tasted from 2013 bottle. Pours jet black with tan head. Not much head. Lots of caramel, molasses, maple, bourbon on the nose. Thick and chewy mouthfeel with a little alcohol heat. Flavors of bourbon, brown sugar, molasses, caramel, cocoa, coffee, vanilla. Huge complex beer that is incredibly well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A bit old for the coffee, but bourbon is so intense, vanilla, molasses, toasted coconut, almond, roasted notes, dark fruits and cocoa, blacck with a very thin tan head, medium/full body, carbonation is very soft, taste is similar, very complex, bourbon is so present and elegant, good warming and sweet final with a pleasant acidity from the coffee....this is a bourbon bomb!!!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2016 vintage. Pours jet black. Aromas of bourbon, fudge and vanilla. Taste is excellent barrel, fudge, vanilla and toffee. Really nice. Viscosity is spot on. Overall, excellent brew.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark black color with small beige head. Smell is coffee, chocolate notes and bourbon. Taste is sweet, chocolate, coffee and bourbon.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Jet black pour with a thin espresso colored head. Aroma of chocolate, oak, a hint of fudge. Thick, viscous mouth. Taste is very chocolate forward with a slight honeyed note (I think there is some oxidation going on here). Reminds me of a mocha with a dry finish, but it is still sweet. Finish is sweet, but there is a dryness in there that balances things out. Nice beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Viscous black with a brief tan head. Oak, dill, smooth chocolate, bourbon and vanilla. Smooth and full.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap at Bottlecraft North Park, San Diego, 22nd November 17. Drank this is a hurry followed by a Parabola, as I browsed the store for take away bottles ahead of the final call at 10pm. Pours black, aroma is coffee, bourbon barrel, wood, vanilla. Taste is smooth and rich, not sweet though, bourbon, vanilla, barrel, coffee, lovely if a bit rushed.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Anvil and Stave, San Diego. Heavy sip, lots of lovely peat flavors highlighted by extra bourbon vanilla barrel. This is a special treat. Thick soap head, nicely poured back in this special room. Woody stain appearance. Touch of oxidation on nose. Sip is boozy, thick and heavy, sweet malt with dark fruit notes. Spicy booze. Thick and delicious. Decadent treat.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 23-09-17 // bottle shared at Zwanze Day 2017 @ Mon Petit CafÃ© Stuttgart. Thanks for sharing! Perfect. Roasted coffee, chocolate, Bourbon, sweet malts, caramel, soem vanilla, oak. Great.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Gushing greeted me at the opening! Aroma: vanilla, bourbon, cocoa, chocolate, liqueur and a light alcohol note. Taste: chocolate, cocoa, coffee, liqueur, roasted, towards dry, slightly noticeable alcohol, I miss a bit of body. A beer that definitely does not deserve such a high place in the ranking - the RVBASS and BAVSS versions were definitely better.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pleasantly sweet aroma, coffee, a bit chocolate, after warming you can feel the barrel in the background. Slightly sweet, slightly roasted, you can feel the barrel in the taste. Not too thick, but still a lot of body and substance. Sweet finish, slightly roasted, woody. Alcohol warms the throat slightly, but it is composed and noble... such a sharp bourbon. Great aroma after warming. Great beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Mon Petit Cafe, Stuttgart. Very classic BBA RIS, there is coffee, some roast and ash, dark fruits, strong barrel notes, really good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: It is not thick enough. It is great on roast to coffee to barrel ratio but it seems too watery. Definitely classic in composition, but the mouthfeel is not sufficient.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Absolutely gorgeous, dark chocolate and coffee and the barrel takes your pants down. Must drink if you can.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours dark brown/black with lasting brown lacing. My favorite beer. Super smooth just a touch of bourbon. This is how a barrel aged stout is supposed to taste.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From the cask at the brewery aroma coffee chocolate roasted malt taste sweet vanilla chocolate edge raisin chocolate caramel malt

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Edit: Tried 2018 version at MBCC 2018 and it left better impression. Better aroma, more thickness. 
Old rating: 8/4/9/5/17 = 4.3 On tap at Alesmith Brewing/Anvil & Stave. Pours black with small brownish head. Roasted malts, chocolate, molasses, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, some wood. Sweet. Oily, bit sticky, thick. Full bodied.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared bottle. Dark blackish pour, thick, tan head. Nose is roasty dark malt, oak, bourbon, vanilla, molasses, chocolate. Complex flavor, huge palate density, notes of oak, vanilla, molasses, chocolate, bourbon, well hidden alcohol. Delicious!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From the cask into a snifter. Black with a light brown head. Very complex aroma of roasted coffee and malts, dark fruit. Full body, smooth, warmth of oaky bourbon in the background. Very nice long bitter finish. Did I say complex?! This is a masterpiece.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from a friend. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, nuts, coffee, bourbon, oak, chocolate, licorice and a bit of dark fruits. Bitter finish with roasted malts, nuts, coffee, licorice, bourbon, oak and chocolate. Exquisite imperial stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 75cl Bottle sample at Potjepalooza. Black colour, dense beige-brown head. Aroma of hard-roasted malts, bourbon, soft coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla/oak, sounds generic but this one stands out with a touch more roast than others. Flavour is sweet with roast, roasted malts, coffee, bourbon, dark chocolate, alcohol, hint of dark fruits, bittersweet finish with more roast. Full bodied, smooth. Superb stuff, love the fact itâ€™s not coffee-forward.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza. Thanks @PotjeBier for the hospitality and the great beers, this was the last beer of the evening as i had to catch the train back home.
I had a great day with all you guys!.

love these thick and sweet bourbon stouts. !

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza, from an IP trade with richiesd. Black color. Light brown head, not too much. Aromaâ€™s: bourbon, alcohol, roasty. Retronasal itâ€™s alcohol, chocolate, fruity, sweet. Flavor is moderate sweet, roasty, alcoholic. Above medium bodied. Roasty, light bitter finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared from bottle at Potjepalooza. Black with tan head. Big sweet roasted chocolate malts, bourbon, vanilla. Big sweet sugar rush, moderate roasted bitterness. Over medium body and active soft carbonation. Big sweet stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at Potjepalooza. Black with beige head. Lots of coffee and roasted malts, vanilla, dark chocolate, some booze, cinnamon, light spices, marzipan. Quite sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied with alcoholic finish. Very nice but still a bit hot.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Big stout butt not as big as i thougt it would be. Nice bourbon notes in the tast and great smooth finish

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black color with dark brown head. Aroma has slightly acidic coffee, even a bit green with some bourbon in the background. Taste is sweet at first, fudgy, continues with sweetened coffee and bourbon, a hint of green coffee bitterness on the finish. Full bodied, medium carbonation. Really nice variation of the base beer, adds a nice flavor complexity.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at a tasting. Very dark brown pour with a tan head. Easily identifiable as a speedway stout, with notes of brewed coffee, molasses, light licorice, chocolate, toffee and a ton of bourbon notes and vanilla on top of a light cherry bitterness. Well balanced flavours, a bit too boozy, though.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap from the source (cask) - Aroma was nice, raisin heavy, rye, wood, bourbon, tobacco chaw. Pours black with a rich, deep tan head. Somewhat flat, too mellow on the tongue. Creamy as all get out but too soft. Cherry, chocolate, fudge and bourbon.....just came across as imbalanced and disconnected to me. Maybe this isnâ€™t as good on cask...not sure, but I was not impressed.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bought in Vermont, shared with my great friend Simon. Well balanced beer, does justice to its alcohol level. Slightly overrated reputation in my opinion...

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Really great mild bourbon flavor. Does exactly what it should do- excellent execution. The bottle is from 2012, tried it in February 2017. Really nice. Really drinkable. Solid!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black with little brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, slight candle wax, phenols, rum like aromas, slight smoke. Taste is sweet dark chocolate with little smokey touch and bitter finish. Only a very very little spicy in the finish. It is so incredibly smooth and drinkable, like hot chocolate or something with a little carbonation. This is it! New top 1 for me!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 75cl bottle. Pours almost black with a small tan head. Aroma of strong dark malt, alcohol, red fruits, wood, some vanilla. Taste of strong sweet dark malt, chocolate, vanilla, wood, bourbon, really nice, enjoy it!

product_review: Bottle. Pours black with medium tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast, wood, chocolate, vanilla. Thick body, chewy, roast, dark chocolate, wood, vanilla, nice barrel character, smooth yet complex, can always count on this beer to be amazing.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2016 bottle, many thank Max! Black color with small beige head. Aroma is green apples, phenolic, ethanol, oak sugar, chocolate. Taste is again green apples and phenols, oak sugar, light tartness. Higher carbonation than the other Speedways today. Not as good as expected, it?s a bit too phenolic. A slight disappointment for Alesmith standards. Maybe this year was not as great as previous ones? Or maybe I?m becoming a BA grump now as well.



Opens up after a half hour of decanting. Still, not on par with what it should be. 8-5-8-4-16

Black color with tan head. Aroma is bourbon sugar, molasses, coffee. Taste is caramel, vanilla, coffee, wood sugar, molasses again. Oily mouthfeel. Viscous body, very delicious.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beautiful, perfectly black. Smells perfect. Tastes perfect too: nice and thick, full, you taste the barrel, alcoholic (but you expect that with 12%). Topper!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Note from a share at Proof in Tally, November â€™16 (sorry, didnâ€™t get down who brought it, but thanks!): inky black pour, brown head. aroma of vanilla, coffee, sugar, bourbon. tastes are weak in the knees amazing - dark chocolatey, light whiskey, sweet-boozy mix, vanilla, coffee, oak. Wish I had better notes. Iâ€™ve had the base and several coffee variations and like them just fine, but the bbl is insane and maybe my favorite imp stout. Perfectly balanced. Will actively seek out.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle poured into a snifter showing pitch black with latte colored lacing. 

The nose shows bourbon with notes of caramel without any alcoholic heat or intensity. This is very surprising given the ABV. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Bourbon forward with flavors of charred wood and a complementing moderate alcoholic heat. Finish is roasted coffee as with the normal Speedway. Flavors are all well balanced and harmonious. Itâ€™s a very good beer but I have trouble calling it great.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottled. Pours black with a small, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, wood, bourbon, alcohol and caramel. Medium to full bodied, flat carbonation and creamy to oily texture. A great Impy. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Poured very dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of roast malt and dark chocolate. Full body, flavour as the aroma with some bourbon hints from the barrel.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle shared with Sam and Julien. Pours jet black, dark cappuccino foamy head. Smells of sweet bourbon and roasty coffee with dark chocolate notes as well. Tastes really delicious. Roasty coffee and a lot of bourbon sweetness and heat. Small vanilla and great dark chocolate flavors. Exactly what I look for in a top stout. Great complexity in the 3-4 flavors you get and straight to the point. Full mouthfeel leaving a lasting flavor all over. Amazing. Really deserving of any hype.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Vintage 2015, served in a Tulip Spiegelau at 55F.

APPEARANCE: Completely black in color, just a few brown sparkles on top; brown foam crown with little retention, compact and open bubbles, some alcohol legs in the glass.

AROMA: Sweet and liquor-like, the character of the barrel predominates with notes of sweet bourbon, wood and vanilla, as well as semi-sweet chocolate, fudgie like brownie, caramel, the alcohol is perceived intensely.

FLAVOR: Again sweet and liquor-like followed by an explosion of flavors, from the beginning the characteristics of the barrel are well present, notes of bourbon, vanilla and charred wood, followed by intense predominance of vanilla and caramel flavor, behind this notes of semi-sweet chocolate, fudgie like brownie, caramel and sometimes you can perceive some toasted coffee but very lightly. The aftertaste is a light/medium-low bitterness, with a long persistence of notes of sweet bourbon, vanilla, wood and caramel.

Sensation: Full body, silky mouthfeel, low carbonation. The alcohol is noticeable in the mouth but is not aggressive, a warm sensation remains in the throat when the liquid is swallowed.

SUMMARY: World class beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black pour, tan head, good lace/retention. Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, light coffee and roast, moderate alcohol. The coffee comes off as more muted relative to regular Speedway. Full bodied, creamy, vanilla with chocolate, light coffee flavors. I wouldnâ€™t label this as the 4th (at the time) best rated imperial stout, but itâ€™s still really good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Update: Drank this beer a few times now and this beer definitely deserves my top 10. The aroma is to die same for the palate. So updating this accordingly. 

Old rating: (750ml bottle shared with brother. Aroma: intense boozy bourbon aroma, vanilla, milk chocolate, really subtle smokiness. App: dark brown, minimal mocha head leaving little lacing. Taste and palate: full body, creamy, alcohol warming feeling and light roastiness finish. Overall: as expected this is really awesome. The bourbon takes a big place but thatâ€™s fine, thatâ€™s what I was looking for. Really good. Sweet but well balanced with the burning alcohol so it doesnâ€™t feel too much. Excellent. Glad I have another bottle arriving soon.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This will probably be the pinnacle of beer drinking, I thought to myself after pouring the drink into the glass, and then I sat a little further back to find shelter from the aroma clouds hitting my face. I've never heard of such scents before, and you can't prepare for this, especially if you're expecting beer. Some bourbon might be able to produce something like that, but I don't trust it anymore. Whiskey-soaked wooden barrel slices, vanilla, coconut, coffee frenzy, dance of heavenly aromas. There is nothing like this in a fairy tale... Armed with light lines, its elegant structure retains the behemothly rich structure like an engineering miracle, in which everything that its scents foreshadow is compressed. Lightened version of melted chocolate-vanilla-coconut ice cream, turned into alcohol, coffee stream sprinkled with raisins, sprinkled with whiskey, heavenly malt liqueur. It's not an everyday drink, but there aren't many occasions in an average person's life to match it. Writing a description is not enough here, you just have to feel it.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_review: Bottle. Black beer with yellowish foam. Aromas of hazelnut, chocolate, coffee and alcohol. Flavor notes of coffee, wood, vanilla, roasted malt and chocolate. The alcohol is constantly present. Full body, dry finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black with a small frothy brown head that fizzes away leaving an oily spotty cap, small ring and minimal lacing. AROMA: loads of bourbon, dark rich malt, coffee, chocolate, roasty, spices, herbal hops, molasses, brown sugar, dark dry fruit, slight raisin, vanilla, smoke, herbs, earthy, boozy and black peppercorn. TASTE: boozy, Oak barrel char, dark rich malt, coffee, chocolate, roasty, spices, hop spice, molasses, brown sugar, soy sauce, dark dry fruit, slight raisin, vanilla, smoke, herbs, earthy and black peppercorn. AFTER TASTE: rich roasty malt, bourbon notes, chocolate, coffee, spices and hop resin with a medium-thick rich boozy sweet finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle courtesy of Lukas and Mads. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and heavy bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with a warming alcohol. Oily, soft and smooth. 270616

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
750ml bottle @Himmeriget. Vintage 2012.

Had turned quite dry. Ashy, woody, some bourbon notes. Medicine notes, vanilla in finish. Heavy stuff.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle 0.66l at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Vintage 2012. Colour is black with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Coffee, some bourbon, dryness, softness and roasted malts.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Type: 12-oz. draft (was supposed to be eight ounces)
Glass: Clear snifter glass
From: Alpine Beer Company Pub in Alpine, Calif.
Price: $8.00
Purchased: Feb. 23, 2016
Consumed: Feb. 23, 2016
Misc.: AleSmith Tap Takeover night

First time reviewing this, but third time tasting it. Picked this over Vietnamese Coffee variant, assuming I would get to have that next (this did not happen). Loved it the last two times I tasted it and expecting at least a 4.50.

Poured a black color with one finger of khaki tan head when I got it. Minima lacing on the sides of the glass. Average retention. (Sight - 3.75)

Smelled toffee, smooth milk chocolate, buttery bourbon syrup, caramel, roasty malts and wet cocoa powder. (Smell - 4.50)

Tasted much boozier than the smell. Super hot from the get-go. Bourbon heavy, chocolate, toffee, caramel and smooth dark milk chocolate. Bourbon was just overwhelming. (Taste - 4.25)

Full body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Boozy, warming finish. (Feel - 4.25)

Not quite as good as the last few times I had this at AleSmith. Not sure what it was, but picked a bad time to review this. Will have it again for sure though. (Overall - 4.25)

4.28 95 A

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle thanks to Rob! Pours opaque black with a medium brown head. Aroma is coconut, caramel, coffee, cocoa, fudge, molasses and chocolate brownies. Taste is thick maple syrup, caramel, cocoa bitter, cocoa sweet, vanilla, oaky bourbon, coconut, molasses. Thick as fudge. Coats the mouth and glass.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: # 2500 2006 750 ml bottle. #62/235. Pours a pitch black oily color with a tiny brown top. Aroma of dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, coffee beans, barley, prunes, plums and soy sauce. Taste of dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, coffee beans, roasted dark malt, barley, prunes and soy sauce.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
RELEASE 2015: pours oily black color, slightly haze, with foamy brown head. Visually low carbonation. Aroma is rich and complex: where to start? Dark and roasted malts aroma, with notes of dark chocolate, toffee, molasses, coffee, cocoa beans, hazelnuts, then esters with notes of dark, stone fruits, like cherries, berries, plums, prunes; then bourbon, vanilla, wood, etc....
Flavor: complex and rich as aroma or even more: prevailing notes of coffee, bourbon, dark malts, hops...they takes on all ingredients, which I mentioned by aroma, but they are perfectly blended in one unit. Body is full,  thick, texture silky smooth, carbonation is low to moderate. Finish is slightly sticky, dry, slightly bitter. Alcohol warmth is gentle noticeable, bourbon slightly boozy Incredible! For sure one of the very best imperial stouts! But 45$ is too high.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Oh boy just filled my bath tub trick or treat this baby ooooooooooh boy. Puts hair on my chest.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Roasted aromas of whiskey and wood. Deep dark beer with creamy brown head. The creamy roasted flavor is thick and carry the vanilla bourbon softly. Really good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Smells real boozy, but doesnâ€™t taste boozy. A lot of chocolate. Smooth. Vanilla. Thick. Bourbon at the end. Thx ibrew2or3. Totally lives up to hype, i want more. Shared w chris, miley, and goof.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Top marks to Benny H for this wan... 

Thick black and a cushion of brassy tan head. Nose is rich sweet strums of melted toffee and booze, very little choc unless youâ€™re reaching for it. All in this was a big steam ash of soft coconut, lightest drying choc and the best boozy sweetness Iâ€™ve had in a long time. A real hug of a mouthfeel, prices of bourbon on the linger. Came and went too quickly. Would have loved a cheeky blend of this and the Hawawawain.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at the hanging bat. Pours black, nose is toffee, vanilla, coconut, chocolate, taste is similar, sweet, chewy toffee.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Vintage 2012. New Yearâ€™s Eve beer shared with my wife. Appearance is thick black with mocha head. Aroma charred oak, vanilla, and coffee. Taste is vanilla, fudge, followed by oak, with a bitter coffee finish. Medium mouthfeel. Tons of barrel character in this, lots of coffee flavour also, but the barrel is very prominent in this. Itâ€™s a much bolder version compared to the original. Very good, but a bit much for my lady.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: incredible aroma! molasses, wood (smoke?) vanilla, wood, bourbon. 5 for app and palate. Taste was velvet. this was bottled 10/13.... bourbon notes, chocolate, malt. warming alcohol burn at end. one of the finest beers ever! Thank you to a wonderful trader who sent this to me!!!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Well I more or less feel they have destroyed a very good beer. This must be heaven for barrel aged lovers. Because the barrel aging had destroyed most of the other flavors. And it have become an two dimensional beer. Whisky and chocolate. Ok. Nothing wrong with the beer. Just a bit boring. I have more of these bottles and will surely trade them for something more complex than this.
[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This is a big bourbon barrel aged stout that has been good consistently one of the best. Deep dark colors and tastes right on point with not too much bourbon and the addition of coffee brings out some vanilla and chocolate flavors. Really great taste on the palate and a BA Bourbon beer that everyone should try. Cheers!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A MASSIVE thanks to Matt for this awesome bottle! Much appreciated man! Tasted in the company of Yan and Mademoiselle Irina. During this long tasting, the words spoken were rare and the papillary orgasms numerous. Is this the best imperial stout I have ever drunk in my life? Maybe not, but it sits proudly on the immense podium of formidability! The black beer suddenly darkened the terrace on this precise day of the lunar eclipse. The liquid is topped with a magnificent and light white foam that I never tire of contemplating. Lace, lacing, various and irregular geometric shapes... A great complexity on the nose where all these aromas are skillfully balanced: anise, bourbon, coffee, molasses, brown sugar burnt with a blowtorch, vanilla and roasted pecans. It is prodigious! The signs of a subtle aging are felt but no matter, it is wonderful! Milky texture; brown and warm alcohol. The liquid flows along my tongue with a sensuality barely punctuated by a faint sparkle reminding me that this is a beer. I go from marzipan to pastry cream to chocolate Ã©clair. Admirable and measured length letting the caramelized flavors stretch out long and gently. Lord Jesus, make this moment of Happiness that we share on this terrace never end!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Huge bourbon notes. Followed by sweet chocolate cake with a bit of coffee roast notes and hints of dark fruit, raw oak, vanilla, a touch of roasted malt. This is decadent, complex, and luscious. The most prominent aromas as bourbon and rich chocolate, and they intermingle perfectly. Itâ€™s got a perfect level of carbonation that decreases to a nice smooth, silky satin as the beer warms.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Originally reviewed on 7/18/2012. 750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. 2009 vintage. Pours with a nice head. Black and viscous. Good retention. Boozy smell. Subdued coffee, especially compared to regular Speedway. Decent barrel notes of bourbon and vanilla.

Awesome flavor. Coffee comes through much more. Good chocolate and a great barrel flavor. Tingly bourbon is especially evident in the finish. Hot from the barrel, not necessarily the beer.

Thick and boozy, even if from the barrel, itâ€™s a little harsh. Decent carbonation.

 Nice. Really nice. Maybe not any better than regular Speedway, but the barrel adds a nice dimension.

Chopped like a stick but as a dessert beer where the little extra sweetness and bourbon come into their own, the Eclipse probably wins this battle of the giants. amazingly good either way.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Speedway BA â€™14 vintage, many thanks to Marcel.

Poura a completely black color, with nearly no head at all.

Has the most distinctive Bourbon barrel presence, I have yet experienced. Despite the Bourbon dominance, coffee cuts through easily among a huge amount of wood, as well as scorched, earthy malts. Hints of molasses remind me of this being a stout, setting the balance, but nothing more, this beer is focused on its warming coffee Bourbon blend. 

Drinks throughout smooth, perfectly fitting for the full body of the beer to unfold.

Not only becomes the Bourbon recognizable on the palate very early, the oaky barrel quality seemingly stands out on itself, blending perfectly into earthy, pleasantly bitter coffee beans. As on the nose, there is a certain, almost sticky sweetness detectable in the beer, but only as a neccesary counterpart to the fiery Bourbon coffee melange, adding toffee, cocoa nibs and fudge to the blend. Liquor heat gets perfectly wrapped up by the coffee, with a sweeter, slick finish, turning into a chocolate direction at the very end, accompanied by vanilla, booze and earthy ground coffee - revealing throughout a fantastic flavour variety.

Impressive beer, huge, bold, focused, while leaving enough space on the palate to exhibit an intriguing depth. Pretty much focused on coffee and Bourbon, with a mousse au chocolate creamy nouthfeel to it, providing oak, heat, fudge and gourmet coffee.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
750 mL bottle shared with ebone1988 for his 300th rating because I'm "fucking awesome." The pour is a viscous oily black with a dark khaki colored head and a few clingy spots of excellent lace. The aroma is really something else. The bourbon and the vanilla really dominate up front. But the complexity that falls in with the chocolate and the toasted malt and coffee are just incredible. There is a mild pakiness going on with a touch of smoke on the back end. Just everything is hope for. The flavor is really good. There is a beautiful bourbon heat up front and it rolls through a plethora of pleasing flavors. Vanilla and chocolate, roasted coffee and smoked oak. The levels of complexity are great. The mouth feel is a touch thin. I like the soft carbonation and the syrupy clinginess of the beer, but I think the bourbon takes a little away from the thickness of the mouth feel. The aftertaste is incredible. Lingeringly laced with coffee, oak, and bourbon. AleSmith kills it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beer #300, shared with koleminer20 because heâ€™s fucking awesome. Aroma is unbelievable, vanilla and chocolate dominate, then barrel, then coffee and roast. Appearance is jet black, thick, tan head. Taste is roasted malt, some booze, coffee, barrel, chocolate, vanilla. Mouthfeel is smoky aftertaste, very thick, viscous, great carbonation and only a touch boozy. Overall, this is an unbelievable beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Heavy smell of cocoa and dark coffee. The taste is dry, cocoa, coffee, sweetness, oak barrels and soy. Strong bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the mouth forever. As I have longed to taste this beer. High expectations I had too. And I was not disappointed. Celestial good beer. A beer you can sit for hours and enjoy. Follow me @ Kung av Ã¶l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beautiful bottle that falls into my hands in Portland. Courtesy of tom10101. Thank you generous comrade. I owe you a damn good one. Superb dark beer tasted with rodenbach99. Very happy to have drunk so many sublime beers with you over the last few years my friend! Seal, we are really lucky! The brown head is sublime and it sticks in small diamond points on the wall of my glass. When I turn it towards the light, I realize the viscosity of this rare potion and I like it enormously. So I hasten to plunge my big nose into it and the shock is brutal. It is simply sublime. It is profoundly rich. A tangle of coffee, chocolate, caramelized bourbon, vanilla, toasted coconut and dark maple syrup like a molecular whole that reminds me of the aphrodisiac scent of the female sex. Siboire, it smells of unicorns and Karen Oâ€™s smile, Mila Kunisâ€™ voice, Giseleâ€™s legs, Bar Refaeliâ€™s ass and Scarlettâ€™s perfect imperfection. I suddenly secrete phenylethylamine. Thatâ€™s an understatement. Itâ€™s like a sudden passion. I could spend hours over my glass without moving, without being able to stop dreaming, talking and writing. But hey, I have to go. I wet my lips. A real feeling of well-being and appeasement. Emily Hainesâ€™ legs curling around my tongue. Jane Birkin who is still 26 years old. Debbie Harry burping her last bourbon. Iman parading at the sugar shack. Binoche spitting chocolate and me who is not surprised by this concoction and its salacious flavors that evaporate from my mouth when I type this sentence on my phoneâ€™s keyboard: â€œEach beer is a sex.â€ Did you think about that when you breathed into my glass?

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A bottle shared with SlovakSniper. A brown color with a long-lasting foam, an almost perfect visual. A nose of a depth and complexity rarely equaled. A mixture of whiskey, bourbon, vanilla, coffee, spicy chocolate. A warm mouth, a little hot, an almost oily texture. Complex flavors of chocolate, coffee, noble spices. Hard to believe that it is made with grain, hops and coffee.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: (Bottle sample @ VilleValla Pub, LinkÃ¶ping, Mar 21 2015) Pours pitch black with a decent tan head and some lace. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, toasted coconut, raw sugar, dark bittersweet chocolate, some sweet black coffee. On the palate it is similar, heavily barrel influenced with wood and whiskey, coconut, cocoa and coffee grounds, fading into a woody, earthy, bitter chocolate/coffee finish with pervasive notes of bourbon lingering, touch of hops and faint but noticeable alcohol heat. Medium-full oily/creamy body with soft carbonation. Rich and unctuous, maybe a little heavy on the barrel characters vs. coffee, especially compared to the regular version, coming across a little sweeter and less bitter. Feels great in the mouth and not at all boozy. I really like this but will leave my bottle for a little while, think it will improve with a bit of time.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared a bottle with a friend. Black beer, medium brown head. Aroma of milk chocolate, coffee, vanilla, bourbon, juniper berries. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Sticky oily texture. Alcohol is noticeable. Great beer, great quality but I prefer the non barrel aged version.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
March 13, 2015. Bottle at home. (Rating #1900)

Black with small dense brown head. Aroma is lots of bourbon and coffee, vanilla, chocolate, alcohol, wood. Taste is sweet and bitter chocolate, coffee, warming alcohol. Finish has coffee, some bourbon notes, bitter chocolate. Medium to full bodied, creamy texture and average carbonation.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A solid black color. Bubbly dark mocha head. A strong aroma of chocolate. Extremely creamy. A touch of alcohol strength in the end. Really good. Very smooth.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft at the brewery. Pours very dark brown with a fizzy bubbly light brown head. Tastes like strong alcohol, slightly sweet and slightly astringent, woody, earthy, nutty roasted malt. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like booze, woody, earthy, and dark fruits.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap at brewery. Pours opaque black with creamy tan head. Aroma is bourbon, oak, vanilla, chocolate, earthy notes, and some dark fruit notes. Flavor is dry and malty with rich chocolate and roast character, tons of bourbon and vanilla, some oak, and faint hops. Full body and medium carbonation.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottled:
Black with a mid sized head.
Aroma is coffee, soy sauce, ash and Bourbon.
Taste is toffee, soy sauce, Bourbon, chocolate and some alcohol. Warming finish.
Over rated.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: chocolate, coffee, alcohol, vanilla, woody, black, black, hazy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pours black with low brown head
Aromas are brilliant! Loads of bourbon, vanilla, coconuts, coffee, chocolate, alcohol
Taste is a dream as well. Muscavado, vanilla, bourbon, coffee, chocolate, alcohol
Warming and creamy body with a nice medium bitter moderately burning alcohol finish. Brilliant!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: First off, absolutely amazing beer to try been looking for this one for a wile. Thanks Andrew for splitting it with me. Found this beer at engine house #9 in Tacoma, black pour thin head, Bourbon aroma, great flavor of chocolate some coffee still taste a little hop, cinnamon, licorice, and definitely the bourbon flavor, you can taste the ABV but itâ€™s not overwhelming, this beer can only get better with some more age, hope I get the opportunity to try one with some age some time.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2014, beautifully dressed foiled black bottle, poured and split with Tcon. Purchased at Engine House No. 9, Tacoma. I just love it when Iâ€™m out and about and run in to a bottle by complete accident. This situation surely is one of those. Pours black with a light bubbly tan head. Flavor is cocoa nibs, coffee grounds, bold vanilla and spicy chocolate. Some booze sneaks into the aroma as well, but weâ€™ll expected. Doesnâ€™t ruin things for me. Iâ€™ve said it before, but I absolutely love it when a beer lives up to its hype. Flavor seems initially boozy, as it is. However it smooths out very nicely. Nice smooth chocolate and coffee flavors with some vanilla and sweet butterscotch. A solid, must try beer with the make up of a perfect stout. Very happy to try such a storied beer. Awesome stuff to say the least.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Three year old bottle, but with black neckfoil (the print on the bottle says "with coffee and aged in bourbon barrels", so I assume it is the same thing). One of the most expensive beers I ever bought, delivered to me by my dear former colleague Maaike. I taste this a little above cellar temperature from an old port wine snifter. Black colour (but in fact an extremely dark ochre brown), thin deep beige head, a little more â€™looseâ€™ than I had expected and breaking open after a short while but retaining well around the edges, with a delicate, silky lacing. The aroma is heavenly: a dense, thick, strong and intoxicating perfume of all the good things you would expect in a big stout, and more. Impressions of freshly roasted coffee beans, kahlua, orange liqueur, warm chocolate sauce, cognac, liquorice, vanilla beans, peat, leather, oaky tannins and even moist wood, gingerbread, hints of soy sauce, cooked meat, cloves and butterscotch. This liquid commands respect, nothing in the nose reveals even the faintest flaw; Iâ€™m beginning to understand why this beer scores so high on this site. Taste is... well, intense, to say the least: an overpowering symphony of candied fruits, espresso beans, fondant chocolate, vanilla, oak, candi syrup, dried orange peel... Difficult to point out which comes first. Carbonation is sharpish, even a bit fizzy at first; mouthfeel is thick and smooth, somewhat cloyingly sweet at first but drying more and more towards the end, over a big yet refined, oily, multi-layered maltiness. Spiciness, bitterness and intensity increase in the finish, where a strong bourbon presence takes the lead along with strong woody tannins, with a drying, even somewhat burning effect which can be felt from the tip of the tongue till deep in the throat; peppery hops are quite strong as well, and so is the remaining syrupy maltiness. The bourbon alcohol and the strong, coffeeish roasted bitterness keep struggling for dominance but remain matched. How sweet the onset may have been, the ending of this complex ale is bone dry.  This is a powerful, demanding form of liquid gastronomy in which many things are happening at the same time. Still: this is, contrary to what I had expected, probably not quite the best stout I tasted so far - the alcohol burn is just a little bit too much over the top for me, the mouth and throat keep sticking a bit with the initial candied sugariness and it is, for this particular style, a bit overcarbonated. Nevertheless: hugely complex, hugely enjoyable, very impressive with a formidable balance between sweet and bitter, both present in their most â€™compressedâ€™ and intense form. Something to be reckoned with and enjoyed carefully, concentratedly - and sip by sip. Wow, what an experience... Big cheers to Maaike!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black with tan head foam. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla oak, brownie batter. Taste is bourbon forward, strong roast, oak alongside plenty of barrel tannins. Quite rich! Medium full palate. This didnâ€™t blow me away like I thought it would but still enjoyed it. Maybe wouldnâ€™t pay the same price next time though.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From a 75 cl bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of prunes and dark. Berries. Flavors of bourbon, oak and vanilla. Velvety mouthfeel. Boozy finish. Superb.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle split 5 ways as part of Dangerous Bottleshare 5.0. Pitch black pour with a tiny tan head. Nose is bourbon forwarded but still with the ground coffee notes and light chocolate. Taste is super smooth, sweet notes from the barrel that blends perfectly with the bitter coffee notes. Super tasty stuff!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bomber from a trade. Pitch black color. Aroma of molasses, coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, licorice, vanilla, oak, brown sugar, almost port wine like. Very complex aromas. Very full bodied with an almost oily thick texture and a flat carbonation. Moderated sweet malty flavor with light bitterness. Sweet thick warming bourbon like finish. Happy to have tried this but not nearly as good as GI Bourbon County Stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bomber from Woodmans in Waukesha, cellar aged 8 months. On Christmas night. Shared by many. Best one of the night. Best in a while, in Austinâ€™s honor. The solid bittersweetness of the base beer - excellent in its own right - amplified with some tangy vanilla sweetness. Somehow the barrel aging added its smoothness, and was a definite plus. 17.8

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2013 bottle, 750mL. Pours nearly black with a medium brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, vanilla, spent coffee grinds, and whiskey. Flavor is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla oak. Finishes strong whiskey.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Poured from bottle dark chocolate color with minimal white head. Aromas of chocolate and smoky malt. Very smooth silky mouth feel with a nice taste of chocolate and vanilla. After taste is a nice warm lingering bourbon heat. This is a super beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared with the crew. On a night of many highlights, this was perhaps the best. Big beer, but came off very smooth for the ABV. Smooth coffiee, good bourbon, vanilla, bit of barrel, dark chocolate, roast. Super thick sipper, decadent.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2012 Bottle. Big nose of vanilla, oak, coffee. Really smooth and rich for something at 12%. Lots of coffee, vanilla, and booze, that finishes nice and clean. Itâ€™s good, but I still have other favorites.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Good god this is amazing. Pitch black, no light seeping through even when put up to a lamp. Nose is vanilla, chocolate liqueur, wood. Flavor is flourless chocolate cake, moderate bourbon presence, prune, raisin, coffee is present but very much subdued relative to the normal speedway. Mouthfeel steers away from being too syrupy. Warming and pretty strong tannins encourage slow enjoyment.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Bourbon Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by Eric at Capitol Beer from his 2013 beer run. Pours dark brown/black with a slight dark tan head. Aromas of bourbon, coffee, arguably chocolate. Wonderful aroma. Full bodied. Flavor is chocolate, bourbon, very smooth dark malt. Super delicious.

product_name: Cantillon Don QuijoteðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªLambic - Flavored
product_review: 20K rating. 750 bottle thanks to JMFP. Pours a cloudy orange pink with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is strong funk, oak, grape skin. Medium body, welchs grape juice, nice funk, light oak, was a treat to finally tick this. As Charlie says in Always Sunny after beating Boggs, â€œwhat do now?â€

product_name: Cantillon Don QuijoteðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªLambic - Flavored
product_review:
Bottle shared by Brad, (thank you!) on 10/8/16.
High clarity leaving behind the sediment and revealing a sunset-hued golden body with a surprisingly large, white head showing strong retention for the style.
The nose is quite grape-forward, showing what definitely smells very Concord-esque. Many say Welchâ€™s grape jelly, and while I donâ€™t think itâ€™s that uncouth, thereâ€™s no denying the similarities. Thereâ€™s definitely some light powdered sugar evident but the sourness/acidity is quite nicely controlled and it smells soft, mild, even, etc....No alcohol or flaws and not exactly a study in funk, but certainly some mineral, very light horseblanket and light grapeseed suggestions.
Flavor is surprisingly acidic with lots of grapeseed and grapeskin character. These types of grapes are very tannic and it shows here. Itâ€™s pretty nicely integrated with the lambic, though itâ€™s still quite prominent. Tart acidity and a very tight, engaging carbonation keep it zesty, bright and refreshing, with soft, malt and wheat backing it. Dry, of course with interesting flavors arising from the combination of grape and lambic, as per usual. Still, I wouldnâ€™t call this terribly funky, certainly not by Cantillon standards. Is that why itâ€™s liked by so many?? Thatâ€™s definitely not why I like Cantillon....

product_name: Cantillon Don QuijoteðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªLambic - Flavored
product_review: Bottle. Amber golden pour with white head. A decent amount of carbonation. Jammy grape, funky, wine, sweet aromas. Flavors are sweet, grape jelly, mild tart fruit, wine and funk.

product_name: Cantillon Don QuijoteðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªLambic - Flavored
product_review: Dark red wine. Sour grape. Sweet & sour slushie. Hard to tell the age. Lightly tannic. Oak. Outstanding.

product_name: Cantillon Don QuijoteðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªLambic - Flavored
product_review: This is an amazing beer. It pours a deep purple and has a nose that smells like freshly made grape juice with slightly leathery lambic notes. The mouthfeel and balance are perfect.

product_name: Cantillon Don QuijoteðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªLambic - Flavored
product_review:
Poured from a 750 ml bottle. 
Aroma is beautiful with great, sweet grape notes. Some leathery funk notes with a light herbal character. Light oak and lemon notes. 
Pours a slightly hazy, light red with some orange and brownish hues. Small, thick, white head with decent retention as it lingers on the edges. No lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is fairly acidic with some medium light lemon notes. Moderate grape flavor with a bit of sweetness. Some medium light oak notes. Light leather, herbal and barnyard funk. Some lingering tart grape and oak notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an amazing beer with great grape notes. Sweet and tart with nice oak and leathery, barnyard funk notes.

product_name: Cantillon Don QuijoteðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªLambic - Flavored
product_review: 750 ml. Hazy reddish pour. Nose is cheesy, passionfruit, red grapes. Taste is very jammy, berries, vinous, very tart. Full mouthfeel. Lingering tart jammy finish. Taste isnâ€™t as complex as the nose but still probably the best fruited lambic Iâ€™ve had.

product_name: Cantillon Don QuijoteðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªLambic - Flavored
product_review: Bottle at tasting. Very unique beer with a musty candy fruitiness to both aroma and flavor. The acidity and sourness complements the semi-sweet grape flavors. So complex yet so straightforward. Gentle as an Italian lover but rough like a bearded horse farmer.

product_name: Cantillon Don QuijoteðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªLambic - Flavored
product_review:
Bottle shared at Mikeyâ€™s - 2011 - Murky off-purple pour into cantillon tulip, this is perfection in a glass. Dank aroma of musty grapes, faint funky profile ultimately overpowered by the robust fruit. Extremely heady taste..musky and tart, though not bracing. Like a blended vignerrone and st. Lamvinus with some cobweb and equestrian essence to mellow things out. Big thank you to Franco for the expedited shipping and the opportunity to try this. Thanks also to the kind FedEx customs rep who said she would "see what she could do" after it was flagged. Canâ€™t wait to see how this develops over the next decade.
