Touches of rich and dacent sweetness as the spirit comes a touch more into the backend, cooconut milk and sweet condensed milk, "Hello Dollyâ€™s" as my mother would say, her favorite holiday dessert. Sheâ€™d enjoy this. And she hates stuff like this. Finish is a bit sticky, touches of vanilla and lingering sweetness. Nice stuff. Powerful nose, intense flavors, a bit unbalanced and sweet. The barrel compliments but really never takes over, sitting in the passenger sweet and frequently melding into the sweeter flavors and their dominance. But nice stuff and stuff Iâ€™d like to have a few more times, keep some bottles of.

product_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Proprietor's 2013ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This beer is simply outstanding, beer of the year, right up there with Pirate Bomb. Drink this beer now its perfectly aged and ready to go. The explosion of coconut is perfectly sweet and not overbearing. The aroma is a sweet bomb but you come back for more. The taste is balanced expertly with the coconut melding with barrel, and dark chocolate. I hate the hype train, but damn this lives up to it.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

Flavor is sweet, light tart fruity, honey, rich sweet and tart red berries, strawberry, white chocolate, alcohol. Full body, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 111123

product_review: MBCC 2023 Copenhagen, Green Session.  Clear dark purple red colour. Aroma and Taste of intense sweet dark red berries, honey, warming finish.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

Nose is herb, red berry compote, honey, sugars, vanilla.

Solid.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Tap @ Beer festival w friends/ Maltkings & Chef. Appearance: pours clear red with ok off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: Honey, strawberries, light rhubard, light berries, light straw, light chocolate, light alcohol and light funky notes. palette: strong berry aroma, full body, medium to notable sweetness, balanced by a medium acidity, low carbonization, average to long duration, light sweet finish and an oily texture. Overall: highly enjoyable smoth berry mead

product_review: From tap at MBCC. It pours dark ruby brown. Huge strawberry nose. Sweet honey. Light acidic. Super creamy. Stunning.

product_review:

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: MBCC. Hazy red brown with a tiny beige head. Aroma is sweet, honey and heavy strawberry. Flavor is very sweet and light acidic. Sweet and light acidic finish with warming alcohol. Oily, soft and smooth. 221021

product_review: Tap at MBCC 2021, Copenhagen. Color is reddish Brown with very small head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, strawberries, honey, sweetness....

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Taster at MBCC 21. Red with little head. Strawberry, honey, sweetness, Smooth.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle. Dark purple pour, no head of course. Intense strawberry flavor, strawberry jam, very sweet, honey, notes of white chocolate/vanilla, some booze. Very intense and sweet like the other whites. Tasty, but it's hard to believe this flavor came from real strawberries.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Both times at MalmÃ¶ Brewing. Clear red colour, intense strawberry aroma. Taste is sweet with lots of strawberry.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 5oz taster from bottle at out of the barrel.  Wow what great flavor: 10/10.  Very sweet.  Light strawberry tartness.  Deep red almost black color.    Hints at a higher ABV, but well hidden with the sweetness.  Almost like 10x eating a real strawberry.  Lots of coconut barrel aroma.  No bitterness of course.  $20, but worth it.  Excellent!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle at Levi's mead tasting. This was unbelievable. Strawberry, honey, sweet, and rich. So good!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle shared by Andrew, thanks! Pours a clear purple red with no head whatsoever. Aroma has sweet and tart strawberry with sweet and dry honey supporting. Flavor has sweet strawberry with a touch tartness and sweet honey supporting.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle sample at The Draft Room for Berry White Day on 12/7/19. Dark purple pour with sticky legs. Aroma of strawberry, raspberry, honey and vanilla. Honey and strawberry flavor with vanilla accents giving way to an oaky and leathery finish.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Taster from a friend. Deep crimson color, no head.  Sweet taste with strawberry, honey, berries, tart, cherry, oak and sugar. Sweet finish with strawberry, honey, tart, cherry and sugar. Exquisite mead.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle.  Pours murky mahogany,  flat.  Aroma is cocoa,  honey,  strawberries,  vanilla.  Flavor is dessert,  boozy chocolate covered cherries.  Full body.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle shared at Berry White tasting. Deep reddish brownish. Strawberry jam, sugary honey, soft vanilla and a bit of the white chocolate, soft raspberries, more jammy notes. Very very sweet, light sour, very light bitter. Full bodied, soft booze. Like liquid strawberry jam. Good though.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Berry white tasting. Bottle 2. Clear dark red. Massive sweet strawberry jam, honey, meringue crust. Massive sugar rush. Big sweet and again sour around the edges. Full body and soft carbonation. Wijnbal snoepjes.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Rami Rami is drinking a Straw Berry White by Superstition Meadery at Mikkeller Bar Warsaw

Too sweet and I'm not a fan of strawberries. It has sour aftertastes. Such a very natural compote with a ton of citrus... less for me than the previous ones but still class, 4..1?

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Bottle pour at Mikkeller Tokyo. Crimson red 
smell-huge jammy strawberries 
taste-strawberries, jam, vanilla 
medium body. Delicious

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Brick red pour.  Aroma and flavor are both sweeter than the blackberry without the tartness to cut it, but good GOD it works.  So smooth.  So delicious.  Jammy strawberry, honey and white chocolate in near perfect harmony.  Velvet.  4.7+  Best mead I've had to date and probably a top 10 of any style.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Refrigerated tall skinny clear 0.5 L bottle poured into a snifter.  Opaque dark brown.  Aroma is strawberry, thick body, and syrupy texture.  Taste is rich strawberry.  Not as magical as the Superstition Blueberry for me.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 500 ml bottle shared by phaleslu. Pours a dark reddish brown color with no head. The aroma and flavor have some alcohol, strawberries, strawberry preserves, honey, vanilla, additional berry character, medium plus body, even with the abv this is too easy to drink, solid.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle shared by seeswo - thanks again, Chris! Batch 2, so it's a more conventional bottle than the ceramic one originally pictured here. Pours a deep, dark, and clear burnt red amber with a few bubbles forming at the edge .Notes of strawberry - layers of it, and super jammy - with vanilla, honey, tannins, and blueberry. Medium-plus bodied, with low carbonation and a sweet, tangy mouthfeel. Delicious.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 500ml bottle. Thanks kopula! Heavy, sweet and slightly syrupy with loads of honey, strawberries, vanilla and toffee. Quite complex and massive. Nice.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle @ RateBeer Best 2017. Thanks, Jeff. Pours a clear copper sort of color. Liquid strawberry jam with some vanilla, cream, and sweet honey. Actually kind of reminds me of a strawberry cheesecake. Hints of chocolate and some acidity just barely making it through. Mission accomplished with this one.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Deep red with no head. Aroma is honey, berries, strawberries, earthy and a little perfume. Flavour is honey, sweet, rich, berries, strawberries, earthy, complex and warming.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
9-4-8-4-16

Sample from bottle, courtesy of and @ MjÃ¸deriet. Pours deep dark mahogany, with no head. Aroma is strawberries and jam, as well as blue grapes, forest berries, tannins and wooden barrels. Creamy body, with no carbonation. Flavour is strawberries, jam and sweet chocolatey notes, as well as tannins, musty fruit peel and heather. Fairly dry finish.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Taster. Pours brown oil. Aroma is strawberry, ice cream, vanilla, white chocolate. Body is heavy and strong, quite sour, actually too much. Pure strawberry with vanilla. Gets super booze on the palate. Good, but vastly overpowered.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Sample from bottle, many thanks Nische! Deep ruby color with no head. Aroma is strawberry jam, white chocolate and vanilla. Taste is intense strawberry jam, light vine, white chocolate. Thick viscous mouthfeel, flat. Lovely!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Earlier Rating: 9/30/2018 Total Score: 4
Earlier Rating: 9/30/2018 Total Score: 4

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Maroon body with a light head. Vanilla aroma with a citrus bite. Taste like sweet strawberryâ€™s.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: MBCC 2017 Red session. Dark red body. Aroma of sweet strawberry cake and vanilla, taste of chocolate, berries and a thick sweet finish. Extremely well done.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Flight sample at the source. The mead is a clear purple. Still. Sweet, ripe strawberry notes overflow the glass. That typically sweetness of the series from vanilla creamy notes and rich white chocolate. Thicker body. Great mead.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Dark red with no head. Aroma of strawberry and vanilla. Sweet fruity flavour with heavy strawberry and a touch of mead

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Thanks Steffen. Mosstef. Bang. Vanilla, strawberry, caramel, Wood and vanilla. Bang........

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle at Bottlecraft - San Diego. Pours clear burnished golden-brown. Lots of ripe strawberry on the nose, jammy, almost rotten. Medium to heavy sweet flavour with lots of super ripe, meaty and chewy strawberry, some oily honey, brown bread. Full bodied, oily, chewy. Warming finish, more dense ripe strawberries, bread, toasted honey. Really rich. Very good.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: B1 at Hatten. Deep crimson red, viscous. Concentrated strawberries, some vanilla. Slightly warming. Delicious stuff.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Clear red deep pour. Flat. Nose is just amazing, pure strawberry, fresh jam, no alcohol at all. Sweet but not really too much. Like freshly picked wild strawberries, their jam on top of vanilla icecream. Wow. Smooth and drinkable, warming too. Wow again. Wordless.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Inky purple color. Itâ€™s like strawberry white cake that is popular in Japan but much more insanely sweet. Nice balance, but a diabetic nightmare. I just canâ€™t groove on this though I understand itâ€™s good. Itâ€™s for the North American palate that dumps chocolate syrup and M&Ms on top of ice cream in a sugar cone.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Pours a clear crimson red. Strawberry jam aroma, vanilla, light wood. Taste is sweet strawberry, light acidic with a sugary sweet aftertaste. Definitely feeling black Agnes, Endovelicus and Blue Berry White more than this.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 500 ml bottle at Omnipollo GBG. Copper burgundy color. Strawberry jam, honey. Thick mouthfeel, very very sweet but a fantastic feeling. Top notch

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 500 mL bottle. Deep brown body. Smells jammy. Nice strawberry aroma. White chocolate. A little bit peanut butter and jelly like. Tastes more of honey, but again strawberry dominates. White chocolate behind it. Sweet, of course, but equally delicious.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Sample Haket 2021-06-05 GÃ¶teborg
Rich Strawberries juice, vanilla, very sweet, 

Superstition Berry White - Strawberry 
Bottle at Omnipollo GÃ¶teborg cons 2018-03-04 GÃ¶teborg 
AR: strawberry juice
AP: dark ruby/bourbon, no head
F: strawberry juice, warming feeling, strawberry seeds roughness, wee vanilla 
4,2

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: (From bottle @ Omnipollos Hatt, Feb 24/18) Pours a deep red-brown without head. Aroma is massively bright jammy strawberry soaked in liqueur along with sweet honey, white chocolate bar, vanilla, so vibrantly fruity. Flavour is channeling the same vibe, loads of strawberry jam and liqueur, vibrant slightly floral honey, white chocolate, vanilla, soft oak. Long jammy sweet finish with a bare touch of tartness, lots more white chocolate in the finish than the other versions. Quite full bodied and a touch syrupy, basically no alcohol. Wow, this is just amazing. The strawberry comes through beautifully, it's a bit brighter than the other versions and the white chocolate seems to play best here. Sublime.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Pours a very dark brown with slight red tints. No head. Aromas of intense spirits marinated strawberries with honey and oak notes and slight burnt noted. Taste is intensely fruity with white chocolate, barrel character and honey. Mouthfeel is viscous and thick with a slight oiliness. No carbonation.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle pour at Bottlecraft, pours a deep dark ruby / mahogany. Aroma is intense, full of liqueur-covered strawberries, with vanilla and treacly syrup. Flavour follows suit, with intense, liqueur-coated strawberries, vanilla, white chocolate and honey. Very sweet, but tastefully so. Wonderful incorporation of the strawberries. Phenomenal.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
27.10.2018, 0,5l bottle sampled @ MjÃ¸deriet during MjÃ¸deriet voluntary party:

31.01.2018, 0,5l bottle sampled @ Apollon:

Flat, deep reddish color. Aroma is slightly concentrated sweet sour-ish fruity, sour strawberries, strawberry jam, minerals, alcohol, dark berry syrup, dark honey, oak, grass, hints of white chocolate. Taste is concentrated sweet sour-ish fruity, strawberry jam, sour strawberries, dark berry syrup, dark sugar, honey, berry skin, minerals, alcohol, burnt sugar, oak, grass, hints of white chocolate. Sweet concentrated fruity mouthfeel. Lovely.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle shared at Matt's. Strawberry nose and taste with some chocolate and light jam.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle thanks to the Boise crew. Pours a reddish hue with some legs. A huge, maybe one of the best noses ever; pure strawberry. Sweet, slick, big berries, some oak, light chocolate. Wow. Just amazing.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Bottle at Doug's Christmas party 

Pours clear dark ruby, small off-white head. Strawberry and chocolate. Strawberry, chocolate, sugar and honey 

Smooth and tasty

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Bottle. Thanks!

A: Dark red bordering on brown. Light lacing.

N: White chocolate and strawberry. Some raspberry. Honey. More of the berries. Like a sweet dessert.

T: Very sweet and tart and fruity. Not at all cloying.

M: sticky medium body, no alcohol, soft carb.

O: Quite delicious. A regular dessert.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Bottle. Batch 4. Aroma of strawberry, vanille, chocolate. Reddish brown. Taste is moderate sweet, strong strawberry, vanilla, light strawberry seeds. Sweet, thick oily feel and strawberry white chocolate finish.

Batch 5. Lower strawberry than I remember. Still pretty crazy!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle bought @ the source through a proxy. 2016 vintage. Extremely deep red pour leaving plenty of sticky legs on the glass. Intense smell of the strawberry jam grandma made when I was young (going to her funeral this Thursday so that hit close to home), light floral honey, vanilla, oak, minerals & alcohol. Sweet, sour & heavy fruity taste. Viscous & oily mouthfeel. Simple but perfect.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Plain amazing! I love the strawberry flavours in this one and super well balanced with the honey sweetness... LOVELY!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Thnx to erik for the leftover share !!! Pours very dark brownred, rather clear. Smell is hugely chocolate-covered strawberry. Very intense. Almost like a syrup / liquor like intensity. Taste is very full, silky smooth, intense strawberry. Of course its sweet, its a mead, but not overly sweet , sugary nor chemical. This is just an amped up, very intense strawberry flavored mead with an intense thick body, aka all the great stuff you could imagine. A real sipper, but a true pleasurefull one. Still more of a fan off the natural ( oak aged ) meads more than the fruit infused american variants, but this def is up the very high end of all the meads iâ€™ve had from the US of A. Nice !

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Colour red intensive. Flavour red berry very intensive prevalent the strawberry the taste is creamy strawberry . I think the best combination is with a cake and add in a cream fantastic

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Sweet and intense strawberry, with strong vanilla overtones. Thick body with a creamy/silky texture.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Intense strawberries, jammy, ripe, rich fruits, white chocolate, molasses. Clear brown, no head. Heavy sweet. More sweet chocolate, strawberry jam, honey, vanilla, soft carbonation, full bodied, creamy texture. Overpowering sweetness, rich, highly complex, beautiful, but a bit too much. Bottle at MBCC Red Session, Copenhagen.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: [1/27/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at a bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Deep red. Big strawberries, cookies, honey, sweet, rich, rounded.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Damn that awesome. Thick and viscous. Smells like straight up strawberries. Tastes mimics the smell, and you can even get some taste of the seeds. I donâ€™t get much barrel though.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Beautiful dark red mead. Notes of strawberry, white chocolate, honey. Super sweet. Great fruit - easily the best strawberry beverage Iâ€™ve had. Super jammy. Some white chocolate midway through. Super sweet. Liked it but didnâ€™t love it. For my money, the elite Schrammâ€™s stuff is more nuanced and flavorful.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Great aroma, great mouthfeel, almost too cloying. Canâ€™t drink too much of this in a night, itâ€™s just too intense.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 500 mL bottle. Oh my holy fuck. The pour is a dark redddish purple color with a bubble on the edge. The aroma is spectacular. The aroma is tart strawberry honey and lovely sweet and a touch of chocolate. This is just lovely. The flavor is perfect. Tart strawberry, light chocolate, and itâ€™s like a melted strawberry smoothie. This is fantastic. I love this. The mouth feel is really good. Itâ€™s coating and lovely strawberry and sexy. This is fucking great.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle shared with koleminer20 and Gus, and Benny for the reunion of Meat Cloud and the Bird Dicks. Aroma is strawberry, skins, chocolate, booze, fucking awesome. Appearance is red and brown, deep, fuck. Taste is fucking awesome. Strawberry smoothie. Deep strawberry, chocolate, sweet, delicious, booze, honey, wonderful. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, strawberry cream aftertaste. Overall, holy fuck. This is amazing.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: b2/b3 - both very jammy, much fruitier than the others. Some astringency on the end. B2 had more chocolate and a little bit more mouthfeel.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: So glad i tracked this one down, but man Iâ€™m really disappointed. Hoping I just got a bad bottle or maybe something changed in transit, idk. The aroma was really strange, very strong jammy strawberry, but also a yogurt smell and even oddly like olives? The taste was slightly better, but it still tasted oddly like olive juice. Overripe strawberry, white chocolate, velvetty smooth with a good finish. Sweet and pretty well balanced, but would like a little more acidity. Not bad overall, but didnt live up to the hype for me

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Sample from bottle. Thanks to Lukas.Pours still brownish red. Tons of juicy strawberries, vanilla en masse, light chocolate, caramel, honey and more strawberries. Lacks some tartness but still top tier!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Itâ€™s like a liquid cake, chocolatey and fruity with cherries, cranberries, raspberries, grenadine, jam. My nose could well get lost for long minutes in this enormous liquid. On my taste buds, an impression of richness: something quite unique between a dark mead and a cheesecake with a coulis of small red berries. Yum! On the palate, this concoction is slightly sticky and syrupy. In the finish, the diabetic catastrophe is avoided by the work of oak and alcohol. Very very good dessert.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Ceramic bottle shared with a friend. Poured a murky chesnut dark Amber thick colour. Nose is thick organic strawberries, vanilla sweetness, sweet milk chocolate, chocolate strawberry cake, raisins, soft oak. Taste is fresh strawberries, sweet chocolate and honey sweetness. Incredible thick mouthfeel, slight hot finish. Strawberry delight

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Sample (2 oz), thanks to kbudd19 for this one! Brown-ish red like a few months old natural raspberry jam leaving intense legs on the glass. Like the other from the White series, the aroma is really intense offering loads of fruits presence (here strawberrries / strawberry jam) and tons of white chocolate as well. Other components are a bit hidden by the intensity of fruits and white chocolate, but thereâ€™s honey, oak, red wine notes, vanilla and herbal notes as well. Taste is super sweet with medium acidity to balance a bit with again loads of strawberry jam and white chocolate alongside honey, oak, mild herbalness, alcohol and vanilla. Full body. Still. Really jammy and thick mouthfeel with tannic notes. Warming finish. Like the others from the series, I think itâ€™s an awesome mead and a flavor bomb - itâ€™s really really good - but itâ€™s a mead that I could not drink in "large" quantity (6 to 8 oz would be the upper limit I think) and it doesnâ€™t have the balance and fruit depth of the best Schrammâ€™s meads despite their score on RB being similar. Wait a minute, am I complaining while I give a 4.2 to this mead?

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle. Appearance is still red jam with nice lacing. Aroma is dense strawberry jam, white chocolate, oak, and rhubarb. Taste is sweet strawberry jam, light acid, oak, and wine like undertones. This is one intense mead, that kind of punches you in the face when you first take a sip. Once you settle into it though you start to get the full picture of how good this is. My favourite of the series thus far. Take your time with this and enjoy it as itâ€™s really one to be savoured.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
From bottle thanks a BUNCH Lukas! Pours a pretty brown, dark, oily red. Aroma has straaaaaaaawberry!!!!! Jammy af, vanilla, waffles soaked in jam and that's it! So balanced, so Nice! Taste is sweet, light tartness, slight spicy booze, just tons of fruit and jam and vanilla beans and fffuuuuuuuuucccxkkkkk!!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle thanks to Lukas. Pours deep dark blood red with no head. Aroma of sweet strawberry, raspberry, vanilla, candy and syrup. Taste of raspberries, vanilla, syrup, candy and awesomeness. Truly insane!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle thanks to Lukasmh. Pours deep dark red. Aromas of jammy strawberry, vanilla, fudge, waffles, honey. Taste is jammy, vanilla, milk chocolate, honey, subtle tartness. Fuck

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: My favorite White! Jammy sttawberry, insane chocolate flavor, sweet inviting honey, caramel, deep oak, and luring sweetness!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle 303 of 410 thanks to Steve. Flat light brown pour. aroma is big full chocolate and strawberries. Taste is exactly that strawberries and chocolate, coupled with a nice silkt texture. Truly sublime.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Sweet bottle 303 of 410 thanks to Steve. Pours out a brown no head. Nose is amazing wow strawberry white chocolate honey sweetness. Taste is more of the heavy sweetness rich berries white chocolate wow this crazy.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 50cl ceramic swing top bottle pours with a brown to mahogany colored body that leaves behind some nice legginess. The aroma offers up sweet honey, rich deep berry fruitiness, soft thin vanilla and then a nice fig to date sensation. The taste delivers smooth sweetness leading to berry rich fruitiness that has a clear nectar sweet edge to it. It just gets vanilla and rich berry and strawberry and pure yum! Wow. This is amazing.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Ceramic flip-top bottle shared at Woodshop 10. This mead was out of control. Clear amber red, deep hue. Nose is absolutely ridiculous with the thickest strawberry jam imaginable. In taste, it has outstanding sweet and sour interplay with tannins for balance. Itâ€™s super jammy and juicy. Clean finish. This one left me speechless.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Copper brownish red pour. Super still. Thick syrupy pour. Aromas of raspberry jam and white chocolate with some alcohol in the back. Super sweet and decedent. A dessert mead for sure.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Rhubarb pour, super still. Thick and jammy. Legs clinging to the inside of the glass. Flavor and aroma are fresh picked strawberries, caramel, honey, and a touch of white chocolate.  Get some green leafiness in it also. Slightly tart which offsets the inherent sweetness nicely. Even after a few sips, you feel like you need a toothpick to pick the seeds out of your teeth.  Incredible depth of flavor. The alcohol is present but not at all distracting. Pour this stuff over waffles or pancakes, and wow...you have something special!  Top it with whipped cream...hint of oak, vanilla, and wood.  YUM!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 2oz sample from a trade with greenh0rn. Thanks! Pours brownish dark red. Still. Leaves legs. Aroma is strawberry jam, white chocolate, oak. Flavor follows. Jammy strawberry, white chocolate, a touch of oak.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle - Pours dark red - nose/taste of strong strawberry jam and jelly and white chocolate with hints of oak and honey - Tongue coating full bodied. I was shocked how good this was.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle. Amber with white lacing. Super sweet strawberry aromas. Vanilla and strawberry sweet Flavors, pretty amazing.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: beautiful deep ruddy ruby red/brown pour. Legs for days on the glass. Nose of sweet strawberry licquer, jammy, caramel, honey, alcohol, vanilla .Taste is sweet, jammy, strawberry, honey, touch alcohol, complex, vanilla. Lacking some of the spices of the â€™berry whiteâ€™ but still exceptionally delicious. Thick and viscous body, long finish.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: What an amazing Beverage! Straw Berry White is in a class of its own. There just isnâ€™t anything else close. All jam, and easily the least chocolate flavor of any of the white series. A slight evolution 6 months past release has made this even better than when it first came out. If you are a fan of world class meads, this is a must have.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Ceramic bottle to taster (thanks Dak!). Looks good; a still, translucent dark red berry. Smells and tastes outstanding! An incredible blend of white chocolate, berries, and honey alongside a bit of oak. Mouthfeel is full-bodied and pleasant with a bit of tartness. Stunning!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Like Strawberry cheesecake in liquid form... possibly the best of the White Series. One of the best Strawberry alcohol beverages Iâ€™ve had. Track this down and try it if you can.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Pours Amber, aroma is full on strawberry assault. Loads of Berry flavor, jammy with that green flavor found in most strawberry meads. The chocolate is subtle but there and helps to bring it all together. World class stuff here.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: The name says it all. Color, flavor, palate, nose, and medium to full body of a perfectly ripe strawberry... With enough prominent alcohol (on the palate, not the nose) to remind you its not just fruit juice.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: strawberry has its day! the most beautiful rusty deep pink color. sweet, delicious strawberry goodness.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 500ml bottle from the meadery. Everything about this is strawberry jam in a glass. Least chocolate of any of the white series, but no less decadent. Best strawberry melomel around.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle thanks to Shad. Mostly clear bronze body, sick legs. Pretty hefty viscosity. Huge jammy aromas, dark fruit, strawberry, port, vinous, light alcohol sweet. Quite decadent, chocolate truffle. Flavors are intense. Yes this is a sweet mead, but well balanced with acid. Strong jammy fruity beers, chocolatey, vanilla, port wine. Mouthcoating, velvety texture. Like all the meads in the Berry White series, this is an exceptional sweet mead.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Poured a deep amber almost purple, aromas of strawberry, light honey and some chocolate. Flavors are the same rich honey and saw berry with chocolate sweet and nice. A great dessert mead that I could drink a lot of this.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 500ml bottle - one of 410 made. Aged strawberry nose. Beautiful strawberry jam & white chocolate taste. Heavy body. Amazing desert in a bottle!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Wow!! I tried this as a part of the 'white series' and I could believed the complete package! From start to finish this mead delivered a crisp, sweet but refined flavor that lingered well passed the bottom of the glass!!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 1 oz taster at berrry white day. Hmmm... this is one of the top strawberry beverage out there. Very intense strawberry jam followed by very thick white chocolate. Your standard intense flavor explosion from superstition. Well done, these guys are real flavor artists.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle thanks to Jeff. Pours a clear ruby copper with no head. The aroma is strong strawberry seed, jam, and honey. Thick mouth, so jammy, strawberry cheesecake, white chocolate,great balance of sweetness, wow this is amazing.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Smells like alcohol and tart strawberry. Super deep strawberry flavor with an intense amount of both sweetness and tartness. Not getting any chocolate when cold, but it does come through at room temperature. Thick syrupy mouthfeel.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Here we go again with another addition to the "berry white" collection. This is a thick, beautiful, silky mead. Fresh strawberry jam coated your mouth and lingers. Extremely smooth and wonderful!

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Purple redfish pour. Simply put this tastes like an alcoholic strawberry jam liquified. Sweet, juicy and vibrant. Just a hint of tartness. Awesome. Stunning.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Taster at the meadery. Wow, the sumptuous aroma is bursting with fresh strawberry preserves that deliver a huge jammy punch, wet soil, a lot of sugar, and ground-up seeds. Pours crystal-clear deep amber color with a copper tinge. The taste â€“ damn! â€“ features thick strawberry that completely coats the mouth and is backed by warming alcohol. Rich honey, a faint cheesecake flavor, and hints of oak peek through after a bit. The booze becomes more apparent late but itâ€™s never too hot. Slightly oily palate with a semi-dry fruity finish. These guys continue to amaze with world-class meads. I didnâ€™t think Iâ€™d enjoy a Superstition mead more than Blue Berry White, but it is their best yet. Iâ€™m now kicking myself for not buying a White Series box.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Amazing strawberry aroma with mild alcohol undertone. Tastes of ripe strawberry balance on the edge of overpowering but are subdued with flavors of vanilla, honey and booze. Bright bold flavors even when tasting with a cold. Another great mead from Superstition.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: This mead is one of my favorites. Itâ€™s aromas are amazing. You definitely smell the strawberries and canâ€™t get enough of the taste. Itâ€™s more sweet than tart. Itâ€™s light and has a lingering smell.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: I donâ€™t know how they did it but my search for the perfect beverage is over. Canâ€™t say enough about this mead. Beautiful melding of berries and chocolate. The white series is a phenomenal experience that anyone would remember for a lifetime. Achievement to say the least.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Wow. Big fruit on the nose, dives into a super rich glass of strawberry jam, smooth, complex, finishes with a bit of cotton candy. Superb.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Rich strawberry nose, good balance of sweet and tart, lingering hint of white chocolate. Impressive addition to the White family.

product_name: Superstition Straw Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Lighter than the blackberry white, still warming and wonderful. Very easy pleasant

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: From backlog. Taster, from Bottle, in The park outside of Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. (As 2018 Vintage) Black with some brown head. Roasted Malts, Chocolate, coffee, bourbon, barrel.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Sample from the bottle in front of Mikkeller Friends, Copenhagen. Color is very dark brown with very small head. Aromas and flavors: Soy, chocolate, Cacao ..

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 22 oz. waxed bottle sampled at Listermann thanks to a kind soul, from recent notes. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small khaki head. The aroma has roasted malts, molasses, chocolate, caramel, whiskey barrel, dark fruits favoring dates, raisins, and figs. The flavor had roasted malts, molasses, caramel, whiskey with a little bite, raisins, figs, dates, chocolate, fudge, alcohol is warming, medium to full bodied, very good to solid.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle from a friend. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, bourbon, chocolate, nuts, licorice, oak, a bit of dark fruits and spices. Bitter finish with roasted malts, licorice, bourbon, chocolate, nuts, oak, dark fruits and nuts. Exquisite imperial stout.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 650ml bottle. 2015 vintage. Smooth, thick and roasty with loads of oak, wood, vanilla, cocoa, toffee, syrup, bourbon, molasses, rye and chocolate. Awesome, super well balanced barrel aged imperial stout.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bottle shared by Clark L, founder of Toppling Goliath. Pours an opaque and viscous black with a thin tan. 
Aromas are boozy and dark fudge. Flavors are layers of chocolate and dark pit fruits.  Perfection

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: B2 - Assassin on steroids, barrel, vanilla, chocolate, delicate cherries, powerful body. Firecracker!

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Rami Rami is drinking a SR-71 by Toppling Goliath Brewing Co. at Mikkeller Bar Warsaw

Coffee, chocolate, barrel, oil consistency, not so sweet, sour aftertastes. The balance, equilibrium and cosmic body are striking.

generally, the top five lacked an approach to taste. Because in most respects, such as body, balance, alcohol concealment, intensity - it can be a reference beer. But at the same time, for me, too little barrel, too little #teamslodyczka and maybe slightly too sour aftertastes (this disappeared after breathing in the glass).

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: In the aroma, dark chocolate, pralines, light coffee, intense oak scent, notes of vanilla, light roasted coconut, dried fruit, molasses, noble distillate. In the taste, sweet, slightly sour coffee, dissolved pralines. In the finish, coffee, creamy aftertaste. Noble alcohol, incredibly deep body, thick, oily, terribly intense beer in aroma, strongly tasting. Next to KBBS, a truly brilliant beer.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours black with a brown head, aroma of vanilla, wood, bourbon, chocolate, brandy, flavor of chocolate, bourbon, coffee, wood, sticky, smooth, full bodied, amazing

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bottle 22fl.oz. shared at [ A Day To Sink All Sea Shepards tasting. ], Brussels, Belgium.

 [ As Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird ].
 [ Gold wax - Vintage 2015 ].Clear dark dark brown black color with a small to average, open and fizzy, fair lacing, mostly to fully diminishing, off-white to beige head. Aroma is light heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, vanilla, coconut, coffee, alcohol - buzzy. Flavor is heavy sweet and bitter with a long long duration, sweet malt, vanilla, coconut, chocolate, coffee, buzzy, caramel. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft to flat, finish is light alcoholic. [20160917]

 9-3-9-5-18

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: From notes. Enjoyed this as part of the long-anticipated Toppling Goliath Brouhaha with Travis, Chris, Doug, and Ryan at Travisâ€™s house on September 24. Gold-waxed, 2015 vintage, 22 oz bottle shared by me. The pour on these TG stouts is crazy. Dark black, thick and viscous with a thin brown ring of head that dissipates without leaving a trace. The aroma is excellent. Chocolate, fudge, vanilla, heavy roast, a ton of molasses, light hints of dark fruits, tons of bourbon. Itâ€™s just as good as Assassin, but the flavor is where it separates itself. The molasses is huge. The chocolate and vanilla fudge are incredible. The thick roast and light charred oak balance incredibly. The booze is lighter than the nose and adds just a subtle offering. This is spectacular. The mouth feel is thick and heavy with a soft carbonation and a lingeringly sweet molasses and chocolate and vanilla fudge with a hint of bourbon. Fuck this is good.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle at Linus tasting 161015. Opaque black beer with a nice lasting beige/brownish head. Chocolate aroma, cocoa, woody, dark fruits, caramel, figs, some dades. Cocoa powder and chocolate flavor, warming alcohol, woody, vanilla, figs, some dades. Extremely full bodied, delicious!

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
October 15, 2016. Bottle, courtesy of linusb, thanks!

Black with a small creamy brown head. Aroma is intense and complex with bourbon, vanilla, smooth roasted coffee, toffee, dark berries, some licorice, charred wood and coconut. Taste is intense, sweet, smooth bitter, roasted and warming bourbon. Finish is rich, sweet, bitter and warming with caramel, vanilla, black berries, cocoa, vanilla, toasted coconut. 
Full bodied, slight sticky texture, smooth carbonation. 

Great, intense and complex.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle courtesy of linusb. Thanks man, huge want! Pours viscous oily pitch black with a small creamy goldenish mocha head that doesnâ€™t leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is intense to say the least, malty and nutty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, toasted coconut, caramelized pecans, dark roast coffee, high quality dark chocolate, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and nutty. Mouthfeel is thick viscous, velvety, round, oily, tiny astringent, slightly boozy and full bodied. Finish is insanely rich with all the components mentioned in the taste. As insane as expected from this brewery. Crazy decadent and crazy delicious. Tried side-by-side with Assassin 2014 and this definitely holds more bourbon barrel character. Insanely rich!

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: A: Pitch black with a thin light brown lacing N: Bourbon, coffee, chocolate, fudge T: Toffee, caramel, coffee, bourbon, coffee O: This is so beautyful... Very thick and complex! Lovely!!

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 650 ml bottle (gold wax) shared at the original Chez Moeder Lambicâ€™s cellar. Black color with beige to light brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, cocoa, chocolate, caramel, toffee, mild coffee, vanilla, coconut, wood, alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Full silky creamy body with soft carbonation.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle graciously shared by Brandon, enjoyed along side 2014 Assassin - Awesome. Pour is outrageously viscous with a small tan head - look is incredible. Aroma is insane roasted toffee, maple, vanilla, and rich malt. Flavor is so huge but smooth. Loads of toffee, maple, toasted malt, vanilla, and just an incredible silky palate. Huge but not overwhelming. I preferred this to Assassin.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle @ RBWG 2016. Black in color with a very thin khaki head. A lot of sugar, bourbon, and toasted marshmallow. Somewhat heavy on the chocolate milk and brown sugar. Quite a bit of vanilla to it as well. Some sweetness of dark fruits and licorice candies. I seem to recall liking Assassin better than this, even though theyâ€™re pretty much the same.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pour from a 22 oz. bottle at the RB Best Awards - thanks, djd07, for getting me a chance to try this. Pours a cloudy deep brown color with a small tan head. Notes of fudge, caramel, molasses, oak, vanilla, cocoa, whiskey, coconut, and brown sugar. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, gritty, warming mouthfeel. Good, but not at the level of the other TG stouts. Re-Rate: Had this again in 2019 and it was awesome. Thick, rich, sweet, and coating. Way better than I remembered.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle to taster. Looks good; a mostly opaque very dark cola with beige lacing. Smells and tastes of dark malt, chocolate, and roast, with a slightly hot full-bodied mouthfeel. Good stuff.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: At ratebeer awards bottle share. Pours Near black with a tiny tan head and a huge treacle aroma. There is a full-bodied dark molasses flavor with a lovely pappy finish.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle at RBWG. Big thanks to djd07 for getting me a taste. Black appearance with a dark brown head. This has a rich chocolate flavor with some whiskey, caramel, and coconut. Super smooth and drinkable. I like.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: bottle shared with a friend. gold wax bottle for what itâ€™s worth. poured a deep thick oily black colour with a slight dark beige ring on top. a wonderful aroma of sweet bourbon, a lot of charred oak, vanilla, roast, vanilla, and thick molasses. a lot of dark bitter chocolate, tobacco, raisins, and campfire ash. very sweet aroma, with even some sticky maple syrup. the flavor is very thick and viscous. a thick fudgy mouthfeel. a delicate sweetness, with strong sweet bourbon, and a lot of charred bitter oak. very thick, chewy, and amazing!. for me this was better compared to assassin. my friend however prefered the assassin. iâ€™m more a fan of the more bitter charred oak bourbon in this one. however.. itâ€™s clear that the hype of this brewery is real. this was simply amazing. and a great way to start the new year!

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 22oz bottle with a big thank to darrel. Pours out pitch black with a tan ring. Nose is brown sugar hot chocolate bourbon barrel notes lots of sweetness vanilla. Taste is great thick rich brown sugar roast malts lots of sweetness plenty barrel and great end. I really want to hate these guys but shit this is great.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Seriously has zero flaws. Pours out jet black with almost no head. Aroma is maple, bourbon, vanilla, and amazing. Flavor is rich and viscous. Full body with maple, molasses, dark fruit, and and supe sweet. It lived up to the hype.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Fortunate to try this during Dark Lord Day. This is like Assassin both great barrel aged big stouts. Appearance is that dark thick and black. The taste is arguably better than Assassin as you can tell it has more barrel that didnâ€™t do any damage to this beer. You canâ€™t taste the 14% as it is well hidden. Overall one of the better BA stouts on the market. Cheers!

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours pitch black with no real head. Haevy lacing. Huge and glorious bourbon nose. Taste has heavy vanilla bourbon, chocolate cake, sticky licorice, big sweet roast. Heavy, rich mouthfeel with good heat from the alc. to control the sticky sweetness. Mouthcoating qualities are insane here. An intense drinking experience for sure. Thanks motherbrother for splitting this in two!

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: So excited to try this. A recent trade acquisition, Iâ€™m opening this with a couple good buddies. Viscous black body with a small beige head. Wonderful aroma full of bourbon, oak, vanilla. Rich and chocolate. Oh my. The flavor brings a delicate sweetness and a hint of maple syrup. Thick and viscous, soft carbonation. An amazing beer. Simply world class.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares 14. Thanks to Al for this. Gold waxed. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aromas of boozy, bourbon, sweet fudgey vanilla, milk chocolate, dark chocolate, cocoa, light minty thing going on (what the fuck? I was the only one getting this. Almost like minty chocolate), burned wood, roast, liquor cake. Taste has lots of rich dark chocolate, cocoa, dry, malt, vanilla, fudge, caramel, roasted coffee, milky sweet notes, nuts, dark fruits, brownie. Holy shit this is good.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Thanks Stefan from Germany for sending me this. Big olâ€™ thanks boii. 
Pour a pitch black, dark brownish hue, with a very small khaki head. 
Aroma id pretty darn complex, with plenty of deliciousness going on. Much vanilla up front, with plenty og barrel, followed by some cacao powder, caramel, dark choco, some coconut comes through from the middle. Dark fruits, faint licorice, roasted malts, wet barrel. Pretty Damn complex indeed. 
Taste is faintly bitter up front, from the roast, but is dominantly sweet that lingeres. Faint alcohol burn in the throat, just as a feminiser that this isnâ€™t kids stuff. 
Full bodied, with a very flat carbonation. Just the Way I wanted this to be. Delicious. Did I ever say chocolate fudge and brownie? Oh yes.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare 14 feat. Emma & Aaron. Pitch black with a tiny head. Nose has bourbon, vanilla, licorice, soy and some savoury notes. Taste has bourbon, malty sweet, figs, licorice, dark chocolates, vanilla and some dark dried fruits.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare 14. So yeah, pretty excited to try this one. Pours pitch black with a red hue and almost no head - though the head you get is very dark. Aroma is big and bourbon forward oh gee... Lots of vanilla, extremely dark chocolate, fudge, chocolate cake, liquor filled chocolates, raisins, and almost a weak note of sweet dessert cherries. The taste is sweet and barrel dominated with notes of very dark chocolate, vanilla, chocolate cake, dark dried fruits, lots of sweet bourbon notes, cocoa, and a dry end. Body is full and oily. I understand this whole thing.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Huge thanks for sharing Couch! Aromas are cookie dough, caramel, chocolate syrup, maple, soy and light bourbon. Tastes moderate to strong sweetness. Sugar cookies, caramel, tobacco, soy, rum, bourbon, cinnamon, and maple. Thin to medium body. Great beer but I liked Assassin better. This seems thinner and I donâ€™t like the soy sauce taste that shows up when warmed.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: RATING NUMBER 1000!!!! Gold Wax Bottle thanks to Darrin. Dangerous Bottleshares #14 Feat Aaron and Emma! Pours a pitch black with a small reddish hue, and a small, slow tan head. Aroma has strong boozy, very nice bourbon, sweet vanilla, almost some cognac or sherry. Lots of spirit character, deep, dark chocolate, nuts. I can actually recognize the pappy from when i had it. Just a whole lot going on! Taste: Wow, this is a thick fellaâ€™! Sweet and boozy up front, Deep, rich chocolate, bourbon sweetness, massive taste, but the body is just crazy! Slight coffee roast in the finish. There is so much brownie in this. Nuts, raisins, cognac. Very complex. Craaazy, oily mouth feel, very low carbonation. Boozy and mad chocolaty! Boom, nice to finally try this!

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 22 ounce shared bottle. Pours black with a decent tan head. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, malt, and wood. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, coffee, and wood. Thought it well balanced. Delicious.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
22 oz bottle poured into a snifter. Inky black. No head. Leggy and thick.
Smells of intense roasted malt. Bourbon. Really fudgy. I donâ€™t smell a lot of coffee. Taste is Bourbon up front. Then intense heavy roasted malts. Very sweet. Heavy fudge and dark chocolate. Molasses lingers in the finish.
Super heavy. Low carbonation. Boozy as hell. I would love to have this next to 2014 Assassin. Itâ€™s just from memory, but this really doesnâ€™t seem like the same. This is much fudgier and there seems to be less coffee.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Pours thick black with no head. Nose is rich bourbon. Taste adds some vanilla and spice. Delicious!

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bottle, shared by kind souls, in a location remote of my dining room. 

Pours pitch black with a small but well retained head. 



The aroma is a bit overly woody at first, but as it opens up itâ€™s really got a nice chocolate & raisin thing going on. The light booze, big raisin, super rich and nicely woody thing remind me a lot of Pedro XimÃ©nez, in fact blindfolded I might think this was PX going strictly on aroma. 



The flavor is big on woodiness and booze, but there are some nice toasted marshmallow, caramel, and vanilla things going on. As it warms it gets a little more fudge like and gets a nice little bit of raisin in there too. 



The mouthfeel is heavy, as it should be.... 


 
Enjoyable on all accounts, and really exceeding in my expectations for it.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle pour sample from a poker night. Thick and rich, awesome appearance and complexity.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle at VT campground, platinum wax, pours dark as night color. Rich notes of dark cacao, vanilla bean, coffee, and molasses. Medium to fuller mouth. Nose is killer on this dark treat.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: On draft at Hunahpu Day 2015. Pours a deep obsidian color with a tan head. Nose is chocolate syrup, oaky vanilla, sweetness all over, some sweet coffee, and hints of earth. Flavor is similar with vanilla, chocolate, sweet coffee, and a magical bourbony goodness that ties everything together. Medium to full in body with lingering bourbony chocolate into the finish.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Draft sample at Dexters courtesy of a kind soul from Chicago who queued at 4 am. Completely black colo, thick beige head with good retention for a BA beer. Beautiful aroma of rich vanilla, toasted coconut, burnt espresso. Taste is silky smooth rich burnt cocoa and vanilla.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: on tap at huna day pours a dark black with a thin tan head. big bourbon oak chocolate vanilla and sweet caramel taste

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Draught after Mikkeller beer run. Opaque black liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of vanilla, licorice, coffee, chocolate, light wood, light booze and raw sugar. Itâ€™s big. Itâ€™s chewy. Itâ€™s like a milkshake. Sweet finish, some barrel but honestly not overpowering.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: [5/3/15] Draught after Mikkeller Beer Run in Copenhagen. Black with a brown, coffee crema-like foam. Huge aroma of chocolate, liqueur, coconut, bourbon, vanilla. Sweet flavor with lots of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, coconut and liqueur. Really full thick mouthfeel. Wonderful.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Update: Had a bottle, found it to be pretty much the same. Overly sweet lacking the rich malt needed to balance. Wood is strong and doesnâ€™t mesh with all the sweetness well.

Had on tap at hunah day. pour is jet black with a small amount of dark mahogany head. Nose is heavy wood, very little malt, decent bit of bourbon. Gets a bit acrid and boozy in the nose. Taste has a bit more malt, also some residual sugar in the back. Heavy charred wood, strong bourbon, slightly boozy. Rich malt mid palate, cake like, finish is very sweet and sugary. Itâ€™s like a sweeter woodier bcs. Full bodied, moderate carb. Virtually the same beer as assassin, overly sweet and barrel poorly integrated. This one is overly woody and charred as well..

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Draught @ Warpigs Brewpub, KÃ¸benhavn

[Courtesy of Theydon_Bois] Pours pitch black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, vanilla and oak. Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, chocolate, cocoa, vanilla oak and roasted finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle share time! Split among 4 of us. Pours a deep dark black. Small fast dissipating dark cream head. Very thick beer. Might be the thickest beer Iâ€™ve ever had. Holy crap is this beer good. Dark chocolate with tons of fudge taste. Liking it more than 2014 Assassin. My only complaint is this mild faint fruity tart taste Iâ€™m getting. Almost unnoticeable though. Still, one of the best beers Iâ€™ve ever had the pleasure of imbibing in.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle I shared at Dark Lord Day 2015 (Munster, IN). A thick viscuous inky black pour from the bottle with sizable starkly chocolate dark head. A good layer dies down to a thicker film with good retention and lacing. Aromas are cocoa and earth, barrel and roast. Touches of vanilla, spirit and faint coconut intermix with caramel, biscuit and earth. Jabs of coffee, cocoa and deeper decadent sweetness come on. Lovely and rich. Initial is offers a firmer body, caramel and oak meet toffee, cocoa and roast. Coffee and espresso come on with jabs of vanilla, nice warming barrel that doesnâ€™t interfere. Lushious, fudgey and a nice coffee element as we keep moving. The barrel is well integrated here, offering some mellow warmth, firmer vanillin and oak elements. The thick big body beneath is properly thinned, offering a complex mÃ©lange of rich flavors. Mocha, caramel, and fudge with a richer coffee element as we hit the backend. Great flow, flavor, good body and barrel ratio. Opened this with some friends who had indulged at Hunah Day in Tampa and said this was a completely different beer compared to the stuff they offered on tap in Florida, an offering at the time they thought was pretty lacking. So note for variance between those? Lovely stuff on par with the stouts Iâ€™m accustomed to from Toppling Goliath, perhaps even better than this last yearâ€™s Assassin. Great job here.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Sample at Hunahpuâ€™s. A jet black oily pour. Lots of chocolate bourbon sweetness is nice a bit boozy and roasted malts. Flavor follows the aroma, good longlived finish.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bottle, Thanks :) xoxo
Dark velvety colour. Wet earth, lots of chocolate, blackberries, vanilla, wet wood aroma. Prune, a hint pf rye dryness, berries, dark chocolate taste. full body, thick, almost sticky, long, prune finish. Heavenly.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Thanks to Alum for this one. Draft was forgettable at Hunahpu, but bottle was amazing at DLD. Rich, but drinkable.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Keg, 03/05/15. Pitch black with a dirty tan swirl.
Nose is rich roast, chocoalte, light spice, toffee fudge, raisens, subtle enough Bourbon.
Taste comprises rich chocolate fudge, bourbon wood licks, dark fruit rinds, raisens, toasted brown sugar, light spice, faint coffee, toffee.
Full bodied, oily feel, light warming booze in the close.
Solid Impy stout, great balance between sweet and bitter, but appears to suffer from hype a little too much !

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: keg... Deep black.. Thin tan lacing... Soft meaty chocolate malts roast nose.. Dark heavy chocolate.. Dark. Chocolate malts.. Sweet roast... Soft. Meaty too.. Silky

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
bottle at The Ultimate Imperial Stout Tasting 2015 - all props to Kevin. Side-by-side tasting of the Morning Delight, Assassin , KBBS (all 2013) and SR-71 (freshest).
All of the beers have a good dose of silky smooth and rich sweetness, molasses and roasted barley malts in them. All of them are great beers.
- Morning Delight: more on the freshly roasted coffee, some green paprica too, sometimes a bit too rich. 4.1/5
- Assassin: my personal favourite: very balanced aroma: slight alcohol that accentuates the subtle roasted coffee notes and chocolate, together with some oak and vanilla touch. 4.5/5
- KBBS: very thick and rich, loads of molasses. Nice barrel touch. 4.3/5
- SR-71: a lot more alcohol in the aroma, as well as peanuts and roasted nuts. 4.0/5

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Wow, just wow - but first things first. Pours black with small brown head. Roasty and sweet aroma. Taste is primarily of dark chocolate - and LOTS of it, coffee, dark sugars, vanilla and bourbon. Thick and creamy body with soft carbonation. This is almost like liquid chocolate - so full and tasty. I wanted to rate it 5.0 but thought better of it to leave room for Assassin. ;-) Anyway, pretty fucking awesome beer.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial

thin tan head. Clear black pour. Lovely barrel notes. Complex aftertaste. Great.

product_name: Toppling Goliath SR-71 Blackbird (2015 Bottling / Draft)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle, pours a jet black with a deep rising mocha brown head. Leaves beautiful swirls of lacing and a nice ring around the glass. Pretty oily in appearance with legs up the glass and more lacing clinging to the sides. Aromas give off big initial notes of bourbon followed by fudge, caramel and BIG vanilla notes. Taste is quite a bit sweeter than Assassin. Initial fudge and caramel gives way to a note of soy sauce and molasses that is not detected in the Assassin either. Some coffee notes follow closely behind even more vanilla sweetness. Some final notes of hop bitterness and oak emerge before a harmony of bourbon, molasses and more vanilla sweetness. Not nearly as hot as the nose would suggest. This tasted quite a bit sweeter than Assassin with soy sauce and molasses that I do not get in the other TG stouts. Still a very tasty beer none the less.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Finally - Beer #11 of my 10,00th Beer Milestone Celebration, and RATING #10,000 itself!!!!!
2017 Vintage Bottle (A Mounted Police Officer on the Horse)
Ridiculously dark brown coloured body, almost an oily black coloured body without much transparency at all (some at the edges when tilted) and a nice three centimetre tall rich light brown and deep tan head on top that stays afloat for a while and leaves a nice lace on the side as it fades. Aroma of very strong chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, oatmeal, molasses, alcohol and the strongest here - maple syrup (just as it should be) with a great finish of warm alcohol and sugars in the nose - very strong smelling, indeed. Full-bodied; Rich, super sweet and decadent maple syrup, woodsie, bourbon and roasted malt notes dominate up front with a lot of residual sugars from pitted fruits, molasses and toffee with a pungent malt backbone that really brings out the oats and grainy notes with some slight nutty and woodsie flavours, but the roasted oatmeal and rich coffee notes really penetrate the sugars here with a nice balance to bring out the strong sugars at the end and some alcohol warmth at the finale to make this FEEL nice as well. Aftertaste is super potent and rich a lot of alcohol, a ton of roasted malts and oatmeal here, but the pitted fruits, cream, coffee, molasses and especially maple syrup sweetness notes are the strongest on the end, which they should be for the style and for how long this has been aged. Overall, a great beer of course and one that should be sampled if you can get your hands on it (it seems much easier than when I bought this one originally [this is my original bottle, but I have many in my cellar right now] from the store) and especially to buy a couple and age some of them for a longer period of time (in optimal conditions, of course), as I have another bottle from this same purchase that I might have in another 5 or 10 years on a special occasion. Great to sample of course and as a Michigander and as someone who loves real Maple Syrup, this was only fitting to have as my BEER #10,000 and for such a special occasion after aging it for almost six years myself. Great to sample and while I like writing so much for each beer, this one finally ushers in a change for me to simplify my ratings entirely and post much less 'wordie' ratings and verbose typings as I have been doing for my FIRST 10,000! I sampled this 75 cL bottle as Beer #11 (BEER #10000 itself!) [of 21 - 10 (for 10,000) of Each side of the 10,000 Beer Milestone and the 10,000th itself!] of my 10,000th Beer Milestone, purchased from The Food Emporium (randomly was able to find this crazy hard-to-find (at the time) stash in New York, New York on 02-December-2017 for US$35,99 (I didn't care how much it was at the time - I was so happy that I found it in the first place!), bottled in 2017 and sampled at my house here in Washington on 17-May-2023.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2017 bottle at home. Pours black with a brownish hue and quickly dissipating head. Nose is chocolate, coffee and bourbon. Taste is chocolate with underlying coffee, bourbon and light maple notes, extremely smooth and drinkable, barely any oxidation is present, the coffee also holds up surprisingly good. The body is medium on it, the carbonation is low to average. I can see how this was an epic beer 10+ years ago.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Wow. Beer from the absolute top shelf. Lots of fullness and flavour. Adjust bitterness, Inviting aroma

product_review:

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black color, light veil of foam not very persistent. On the nose chocolate, barrel, earth. On the palate chocolate, vanilla, black cherry, maple syrup. Decidedly sweet taste. A beer in which the barrique notes are felt, the aromas are well distinct and well blended, the drinkability is high and the alcohol is not felt, in the long run it could tire but still excellent.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
(bottle 0,355l from online shop americanbeer.cz; Barrel-Aged Series 2019, bottled 10.04.19, 11.3%) Overall: Wonderful. Complex. Tasty.
 Aroma: Strong chocolate, alcohol (bourbon), caramel, spicy.
 Appearance: Deep black. Medium, brown head.
 Taste: Medium sweet, alcohol (bourbon), spicy, chocolate, roast, dried fruits, later some maple syrup.
 Palate: Full body. Long warm, roasty-astringent finish.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Draught @ Bootleggers Fbg, Copenhagen. Soft, super sweet and syrupy with some maple notes, coffee, cocoa, vanilla and sugar. Too sweet.
Earlier Rating: 2/17/2018 Total Score: 4.1
355ml bottle from Boxbeers. 2017 release. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, coffee, bourbon, oak, vanilla, hints of maple syrup and toffee. Taste is sweet, slightly syrupy and roasty with loads of bourbon, vanilla, oak, toffee, hints of maple syrup, chocolate and coffee. Finish is smooth, slick and slightly warming with loads of bourbon, oak, wood, coffee, hints of maple syrup, chocolate and vanilla. Not quite as perfectly balanced as KBS, but still pretty good.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This bottle is coming from the sterk, Amsterdam. Opening it on the last saturday, at home, Epalinges, preparing thd meal for Guillaume and family. The body is black and opaque, regular carbonation for the style, white and brown foam. A dream with your open eyes, even the fact that it is a commercial brewery. A nectar for the eternety, complex stout or rather imperial stout, boozy and subtle, full and smooth aromas of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, oak, fruity with notes of cherry, a bit liquorice, syrupy and creamy with a touch of dryness due to the hop at the final, great!!!!!
