product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared with Wim at his home. Brown colored beer with small off-white head and no carbonation. Malty coffee mucca aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is malty coffee mucca chocolate roasted bitter.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 ml bottle. Vintage 2017. Procured from Bottle King in East Windsor, NJ in 2017. Rating number 5,000! Opaque black pour. Small creamy tan cap. Earthy roasted malt aroma has notes of bourbon and treacle. Right out of the gate, a rush of warming alcohol buoys big notes of bittersweet chocolate, bourbon, maple syrup, oak and espresso. Silky mouthfeel makes you sip and savor this like you're taking tiny bites of the most indulgent chocolate mousse. Luxurious to say the least. Impeccably crafted and truly worthy of saving for my 5,000th beer rating.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Release 2019. Bottled on: 10.04.19 Drink: 19.03.21 
Appearance: Black, opaque. Brown foam, medium height, mainly fine-bubble, falls to a small ring, leaves a light lacing. A thick texture is noticeable when pouring and when swirling the glass. 
Aroma: Pleasant, complex, medium volatile. The bourbon barrel comes to the fore - bourbon, oak, light vanilla at a medium level. The barrel is supported by dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, molasses, dark bread and maple syrup, toffee and light caramel. 
Taste: Medium intensity, less complex than the aroma, a bit empty and sugary. At the medium-low level, slightly diluted maple syrup, brown sugar, dark bread, toffee, caramel, chocolate, cocoa and notes of coffee complemented by bourbon alcohol and accents of oak and vanilla. Sweet in the mouth, medium-low body, surprisingly airy, low carbonation. Low bitterness, dark chocolate and alcohol, short. Sweet finish, light dark chocolate with bourbon, cocoa and a hint of coffee.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle thanks to wombat23 and darbeer75. A toast to the good ole days when meeting up and trading such things was possible. Black with a dirty, beige head. Aroma of maple syrup over coffee grounds with roasted grains in the background. Taste is sweet up front with dark chocolate and some mild roasted bitterness at the finish. Afterwards, lingering maple syrup. Big, full body, mild carbonation, sticky with decent chewiness.  Overall, very nice balance and sweet, but not overly so. Great.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: We had this for dessert, fitting since it is rich in chocolate with coffe and bourbon

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Opened a bottle last night, 2019 version.
Full creamy, sweet from the maple syrup, thick flavors of coffee, mocha, chocolate, butterscotch, Haags Hopje, coffee liqueur with a nice boozy, but without coming across as too alcoholic. This is a perfect Barrel Aged Stout, the flavors blend nicely and because of the softness it melts away in your mouth.
I recently read on the internet that the 2019 Batch would probably be the last, and that would be a shame. At the end of January I bought a large quantity just to be sure when they were heavily discounted.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beautiful brown almost black color. Smells full of vanilla. Tastes full of vanilla alcohol.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: DATE: February 1, 2021... OCCASION: having just posted my father's obituary while three feet of snow fall, I feel the night deserves something aged a few years... GLASSWARE: Lindemans stemmed tulip... pours a viscous jet black body that rolls out a a number of upward-cascading rivulets of effervescence... its head continues the show, stabilized as a thick half-finger's worth of light tan, creamy foam approximating a latte's froth... rich vanilla, maple syrup, mellow bourbon sweetness, a hint of smoke, some alcoholic heat... then heavy coffee bean and roasted malts arrive, and the profile is quite a celebration.... the first sip is frothy at the start, turning to velvet-smooth satin past the tongue and a warm entrancing finish that fires well after... the teeth pulse--the hops are in here--and the mouth holds its presence... the alcohol draws in and around, but like the best, it isn't tasted, but rather, appreciated... rich is the word--each sip is a dessert in itself, a settling, centering mood boost that makes one appreciate.... a massive collision of syrup and coffee initially arrest with intensity, before the sweet bourbon, charcoal smokiness, chocolate, and lactic acids round the experience into a drink worth mulling over... I especially like how they ignored the bacon temptation--this works so well featuring the original KBS with a worthwhile variation... it's a compliment this urges me to finish and pour a dram of the Jack Daniels Barrel Select I bought a while back, thought that introduces banana--eh, another story for another time... speaking of stories: I had a bomber waiting to be consumed on my forty-second birthday while staying with my in-laws in between houses, and my son unwittingly smashed it while opening the refrigerator...the dog loved it, but we all cried a bit. Fortunately, CBS returned not long after, and maybe it's better I drink it in 12oz. offerings... well, this was worth waiting for, and though it could be straight shot if only for its ABV, its sweetness makes each sip require a caesura before its next one...

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Hopt bottle Version 2019. Delicious IS. Silky, very well integrated alcohol. Chocolate, coffee, points of vanilla and soft liquorice notes from the barrel

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle picked up from Saveur-Biere webshop, Lille, France and consumed at home Friday 29th January 2021, listening to Iggy Confidential on 6Music and chatting with Nick and Anna, after a Thai Masamman Curry. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma nods towards vanilla but of course plenty of coffee also, a little woodiness to. Super, super smooth, soft, indulgent mouthfeel, some chocolate coffee liqueurs melt on the tongue, wonderful rich but hugely more'ish'beer, bourbon very well integrated, this is wonderful.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Exactly what I expected, a bourbon barrel that was filled with maple syrup and then KBS, that's it, I hope the info about the last batch (2019) is a fake. In the nose right after opening, pleasant vanilla with chocolate, after some time notes of maple syrup (which I often use and like), cocoa, the aroma itself somehow didn't blow me away, but the taste - it's sweet but what a smooth, velvety and coffee-alcoholic (bourbon) finish. I'll gladly repeat if I manage to find it somewhere else. Written after drinking 150ml it keeps opening...

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very dark stout, little foam, a very sweet aroma, a taste with notes of coffee. Very interesting taste which ends up being sickening.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355ml bottle brewed in Michigan at 11.3% (2019). Ebony with a good-sized sandy-brown head, decent duration. Light caramel, smoky creamy cocoa, a little wood and maple leafiness, giving suggestions of apple skin, and a little porridge oat base. Superb aroma, with rich notes harmonising flawlessly. Lowish carbonation, rich velvet texture with decent dryness in the finish. Again, judged perfectly. Flavours are lightly woody, a little smoke, some leafy apple from the maple syrup, mellow caramel not dominating, a little oat and lots of rich cocoa coming through in the aftertaste. Some 'top' beers are overrated - this isn't one of them. Luxury craft beer par excellence, rich flavours perfectly integrated. Stonking ABV gives no more than a nice warmth. Founders at their absolute best (although I may have found the previous year's version to be even better), it's a shame they stopped making this, I wonder why? Treasure any bottles you have left!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Dark brown, clear, low foam, not very durable.
Liqueur aroma with notes of chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, coffee, cocoa.
Slightly sweet in taste with a strong influence of barrel and coffee. There is also dark chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, even a bit of maple syrup.
Intense, very nicely composed, smooth with a long finish and light, warming alcohol.
Great beer, such a high average rating is not surprising.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black, pours two fingers of compact beige foam. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and a hint of bourbon. A very complex beer on the palate, with notes of chocolate, caramel, coffee, roasted malt, dark fruits, maple syrup and bourbon. Spicy and slightly alcoholic finish with notes of bourbon in evidence. Full body and enveloping mouthfeel. Excellent.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Adds complexity on top of an already very good beer, kentucky breakfast stout : a subtle sweetness. Maybe my fav Stout. Nice one.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black color with a modest brown head. Aromas start with the bourbon, though it is fairly subdued, at least in comparison with her sister KBS. There are clear maple aromas, but again not so strong. Mellow aromas of maple and red soft fruits. Plum, cocoa aromas are apparent, also coffee but again little less than KBS. Taste is a nice mix by sweet and bitter. The vanilla and maple provide a mellowness that balance out any original bitterness of the KBS, so the beer is more balanced and less rough. The body is full, there's a distinct alcohol warmness. The texture is a bit creamy, more so than KBS, thanx to the impact of the maple and vanilla from the oak barrels and the maple syrup. A great beer but I prefer the KBS's strongness than this wonderful "soft" maple syrup version.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black beer. Pours deep. Low notes of  barrel. This beer has the famous balance

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2019 (and supposedly final) bottling.  Pours deep, opaque black with a 2-finger dark tan head.  Notable bubbling on the glass.  Aromas of vanilla oak and maple mixed with coffee.  Full-bodied and thick, lightly syrupy.  Finish is long, with a mild boozy astringency.    Flavor of coffee mixed with vanilla oak.  This gives way to sweet notes of bourbon and maple.  The latter, along with a wood note, lingers at the back with a bit of coffee too.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A black beer, a head is quite small and brown. Aroma has strong coffee, richness of malts and sweetness, some barrel, chocolate, hint of strength of alcohol. Taste has strong and smooth maltyness, coffee, chocolate, sweetness of caramel (or maple syrup), low notes of barrel, quite sweet, but nice. Full bodied, smooth, not stickyness. This beer has the famous great balance, it's more fashinating than the individual nuancees.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The aroma is not strong but quite noticeable, complex. First of all, a lot of cocoa and coffee beans, there is a barrel but not much, pleasant chocolate, something between black and Belgian, there are notes of syrup, but a little. The color is black, a little oily in structure, the foam is surprisingly very good, finely bubbled, coffee, but not very persistent. The taste at first is just good and nothing more, also a lot of cocoa beans, again less coffee but more chocolate with vanilla notes. But after the beer has completely warmed up, there are pleasant velvety notes of malt and a barrel that do not give out an iota of alcohol or anything else nasty. The aftertaste is steep and complex, already much more notes of a barrel and sweet caramel notes of bourbon, also almost for the first time the taste of syrup manifests itself, although its sharpness is still a little lacking. Overall a very balanced stout, I realized why this beer is so cool, although is it better than the top pastry stouts? That's a good question.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Draft. Poured a dark brown color with a large frothy brown head that lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy roasted dark chocolate, vanilla, woody and alcohol aroma. Medium to heavy bittersweet roasted sweet malty flavor with a medium to heavy rich sweet and small alcohol bite finish of long duration. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. This is a solid version of a standout beer.
Earlier Rating: 5/4/2009 Total Score: 4.3
Draft at Founders.

Poured a dark brown color with a large frothy brown head that lasted with excellent lacing.

Moderate to heavy roasted dark chocolate, vanilla, woody and alcohol aroma.

Heavy bittersweet roasted sweet malty flavor with a heavy bittersweet and small alcohol bite finish of long duration.

Full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation.

This is a standout beer.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Strong...very strong, this Canadian Breakfast Stout, which incorporates chocolate, coffee, maple syrup in its recipe and which is aged in bourbon barrels. Beers with strong aromatic intensities and a strong presence in the mouth require a flawless balance to be successful. And this is the case here with a warm and powerful alcohol, while remaining supple, with a sugar that is very present without being too much, and aromas of coffee, chocolate, bourbon maple syrup with light spices of all beauty. Very good control. In the glass we are on a total black with a fine brown foam. The nose is on coffee and bourbon in dominance with in addition chocolate, maple syrup and light spices. When tasting, it sends from the attack, with a warm and punchy alcohol without being too loaded for a whole that remains refined. Superb second mouth both silky and racy. The aftertaste, where the coffee and bourbon duo is dominant, is punchy with a lot of temperament. The long and sober finale ends the tasting in a very elegant way. We feel the experience behind this very well-made Imperial stout.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Aroma: the aroma may not kill you but it is very pleasant, heavy, sweet, complex and comprehensive. High-class coffee, chocolate, unbeatable maple syrup, lots of vanilla, I didn't feel the noble notes of bourbon, only vanilla. In addition, raisins and dried fruit, pralines. It smells nice but the barrel itself could be more pronounced.

Appearance: black tarry, quite good, coffee foam, fine bubbles.

Taste: very intense, aggressive, sharp taste, coffee and dark chocolate in the foreground, maple syrup, notes of vanilla and bourbon stronger than in the aroma, plus a lot of woody, rough notes from the barrel. But there is a real invasion of coffee and chocolate on the taste buds here. Very sweet in total, although there is a counter here in the form of bitter coffee and chocolate.

Feel: I drank thicker and fuller, I think the alcohol burns the tongue slightly, smooth, dark chocolate and coffee on the finish.
Overall: very good, sweet, complex and intense beer but in my opinion it does not deserve such a high mark because first of all the body, secondly the barrel, thirdly too sweet. I really prefer to buy e.g. one of the Gates from Maltgarden, in a larger bottle and for less money and I have much greater pleasure from interesting Gates from Maltgarden than from CBS. But I do not regret that I tried it in total.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Liquid is black as night, small, brown head. Aroma of chocolate, sweet, a bit smoky. Heavy body, strong carbonation. Taste is bitter, sweet, chocolate.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black beer with limited Mocha head. Smells like wood, alcoholic. Tastes sweet, without being overpowering. Maple syrup.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: My 10,000th rating!!!  12oz bottle from Dublin.  Black with a beige head.  Beautiful aroma of oak, vanilla, espresso, treacle, bourbon and then the maple syrup.  Really not as sweet as I expected; the maple flavour is there, but not the sweetness.  Immensely smooth and really complex.  This is incredibly balanced and surprisingly quaffable.  Lovely stuff.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The aroma is sweet and boozie with lots of roasted malt, caramel, coffee, whiskey, and chocolate milk. The appearance is dark brown with a large tan head. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is typical for the style if not a little bit thin. Overall good.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Nose is coffee, dark chocolate, oak and ligtht smoked
Pours dark brown with creamy top, mouth feel is medium to thick and goes smoothly
Taste is chocolate, vanilla, coffee, maple sirup and wood with a hint of bourbon
Enjoyed in wooden trinket

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Impressive work. Strong notes of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee with a syrupy feel and look. Maple was pleasantly defined.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at a tasting, many thanks to Cuso. The only thing distracting me from this drinking experience is coffee - there is too much in my opinion, and it has that sharp spent coffee character, not really delicious. Other than that, all is great. Maple marries well with deep chocolatey cocoa roast. Full body, moderate carbonation. Subtle bourbon woody undertones. Only light touch of warming alcohol, tickling my tongue. Great beer.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by Cuso, many thanks. Malty aroma and taste, chocolate, coffee, light sweet, medium bitter. Full body, malty chocolate bitter sweet finish. Amazing.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Very dark brown color with huge beige head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate. Taste, chocolate,  coffee, nougat,  maple syrup. Long coffee, chocolatey finish. Perfect.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle kindly shared by cuso, many thanks. Pours nearly black color beige head. Aroma of coffee, cocoa, blackberries. Taste is sweet, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, blackberries, shery, cherries.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black liquid with very compact brown foam. Chocolate, coffee and bourbon nose. In the mouth, it is a slightly sweet chocolate attack then the presence of bourbon appears which warms the body of the beer and brings out the maple syrup! Absolutely superbly balanced!!!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On approach the coffee aroma is every bit as enjoyable as the introduction of chocolate to the palate and remains forward through the entire experience. Maple fades in througb the chocolaye overtones only to finish with the pleasant, but not overbearing bourbon notes.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black with thick caramel colored foam. Smells sweet of toffee, chocolate. The feel is smooth with a gentle and pleasant bubbly tone. Tastes a lot of chocolate, toffee, crackle which after a while blossoms into coffee tones. Highly recommended!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Strong coffee and chocolate in the cannon. It smells dry, bitter. Light sour notes. In addition, a distinct barrel note, wood, slightly tannic. It is associated with strong alcohol. And everything on the basis of chocolate. 
Slightly dry in taste. Clear barrel notes. 
It is sour and astringent. 
The whole thing works very well. It is a bit like the aroma and taste of a cigar. 
Maple syrup and sweetness come out only in the aftertaste. 
A very decent beer. Complex and aromatic.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Not a fan. Too sweet. Donâ€™t taste the chocolate/coffee flavor. Only the maple syrup

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Nice Rocky Brown head and jet black body. Notes og chocolate and toasted malts on the nose. Sweet followed by a nice bitterness and Maple syrup om the finish. Syrupy and very filling

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Copenhagen 30/4 2020. 35,5 cl bottle from Meny, Rotunden Hellerup. A rearing horse on the label (seems to have lost his Canadian Mountie).

Pours opaque, dark brown with a small beige head. Settles as thin layer of foam struggling to cover the surface of the beer. Clinging to the sides of the glass. Moderate lacing.  

Aroma is intense with a strong sweet, sugary, odor with a woody, boozy touch. Chocolate, brown sugar, molasses, syrup. Sharp odor of dark booze bending in. Hints of light bitter coffee odor.

Medium strong carbonation Thick, viscous, smooth, tingling texture.

Favor is intense with a strong sweetness followed by a medium strong bitterness. Aftertaste is sweet with a light bitter undercurrent. interring. Finish has a boozy burn. 

Tasty, sweet boozer. Apparently the Canadians start out the day in a delicious buzz.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Black color and light dark foam. Very intertwined chocolate and coffee aroma, with a slight hint of vanilla. The taste is not incredibly powerful, but develops for a long time, and the sugar remains in the mouth for a very long time. It warms well, which is not surprising given the alcohol content.
A little too sweet, but this is apparently a classic characteristic of Founders.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 33cl bottle at home. Dark brown, almost black colour, beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, maple - heavy malty, roasted. Though this mix doesn't feel that special to me, the taste is something else, because of its long duration; it's sweet when filling the mouth but leaves a light bitter finish which just stays there, like, forever.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Delicious stout full of coffee and chocolate flavors.  Thick rich flavor.  Molasses flavor.  Dark. Complex.  Best of class!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The aromas of chocolate, vanilla, licorice and booze all get scrambled by the maple syrup, yet the maple syrup doesn't mess with the taste and, surprisingly, does not create an overly sweet beer. From a 12-oz glass container bottled 9-26-2019 (settled for six months) at 11.3%. Appreciate the non-bomber choice this year, for a night (like this) where I didn't want to feel guilty for popping a big boy.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 11.5% abv, on draft at Lucky's with a breakfast burrito at 9am, the way the good lord intended. Poured opaque dark brown, thin but persistent beige head, lots of lace. Intensely malty, boozy, coffee, toasty, roasty, but SMOOTH no harshness, astringency, nor fusel heat. Hint of grapefruity hop bitterness, perhaps a little of their maple syrup claim. Lasting sweet stout aftertaste. Too sweet for my personal taste, but easy to see why it's popular.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pours black wtih brown head.
Aroma of maple, wood, lots of vanilla and dark chocolate.
Taste is dominated by deep espresso with vanilla, finished with maple and wood notes, quite enjoyable, espresso with maple syrop and whiskey on the side.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ Wika tasting. Appearance: pours clear black with good beige soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, coffee, nuts, chocolate, honey, light alcohol, light dried fruit, light soy sauce, oak, bourbon, light tar, maple, light vanilla and light earthy notes. palette: strong roasted malty and barrel aroma, average carbonation, full body, notable sweetness, balanced by a medium to notable bitterness, long duration and an oily texture. Overall: Excellent and highly recommendable barrel aged stout

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle. Smells of chocolate, coffee beans, toffee. Color is black, did find a gooey glob that floated on top after the pour, just tossed that out. Sweet, chocolaty, touch of coffee, bit of the maple syrup as well. Finish is like a sweet coffee or cappuccino, makes an excellent post dinner treat. Thick and rich, not crushable, but something to enjoy when the mood hits.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle 0.355 l, edition 2018. Beer pitch black, opaque. Foam light brown, very thick and very abundant, durable, with beautiful lace. Intense aroma, opens up even more after warming, notes of coffee, roasted, cuckoo, cocoa, dark chocolate, wood, distillate, vanilla, chocolate cookies, candy. Sweet, deep and complex in taste, pralines, dessert chocolate, bourbon, wood, roastiness, coffee, chocolate liqueur, maple syrup, noble alcohol. Cocoa-roasted finish. High fullness, medium-low carbonation, medium-intense bitterness, roasted-cocoa, noble alcohol, warming, bourbon. Well-deserved reputation, this beer takes something away, is very complex and perfectly balanced. I put it on par with Expedition Stout and Bible Belt.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Dark black brown color, foam quickly leaves.
Nose. Chocolate, caramel, maple syrup, even bourbon is felt.
Taste. The texture is oily, soft carbonation, the taste is very rich. Sweetish, with notes of chocolate, caramel, dark malt syrup, again bourbon. Very tasty.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
This is excellent. A little sweeter than regular CBS. I love any nitro stout but a nitro version of an all time great is even better. 
Earlier Rating: 2/4/2018 Total Score: 4.5
One of the best beers I've ever had. I had to trade some pretty good beers away to get this one, but I would do it again in a heartbeat. So complex. When you can find it in stores here (which is very difficult), it retails for $40. Amazingly, this is worth every penny. Go get yourself a bottle of CBS.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

Earlier Rating: 1/1/2015 Total Score: 4.6
Draft (canâ€™t believe I got to start 2015 with this). Whiskey, coffee, chocolate malt and hay aroma. Black with thin tan head. Sweet light maple syrup, smooth whiskey, chocolate malt, and moderately bitter hay flavor. Coffee and alcohol in the finish. Glorious. / (12-21-18) - 2018 bottle. Really the best of its kind.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very complex aroma with vanilla, herbs and heavy chocolate malt. The smallest drop fills the entire mouth with a predominantly sweet taste of vanilla and chocolate, but some bitterness and breadiness seep through as time goes on, killing the sweetness that can otherwise be a bit suffocating in these types of beer styles. Might be one of the best I've tried so far. 700 beers later.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours very black, thick. Lacing mahogany foam head. Nice vanilla, toast aroma. Great taste, bourbon hints. (Velp 202002)

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bomber from Don G - A rare beauty - Deep, dark and viscous in the pour, with dark dense head. Rich, toasted aromas emanating from glass. Complex yet balanced flavors. The oats make it creamy, the bourbon barrels give it vanilla and roast, the maple adds a hint of sweet and, chocolate and coffee add depth, nuance, flourishes. Pleasantly boozy like a well aged brandy.This is a treat.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Appearance: Pours opaque dark brown to black with lasting creamy brown head, with lacing.

5/5

8/10

Taste: Oaky spices and coffee chocolate flavors with luscious maple syrup. Heavy sweetness and bitterness, balanced. Lingering bitter finish with coffee and bourbon maple.
Taste: The spices brought by the barrel, as well as the taste of coffee and chocolate, are accompanied by sweet maple syrup. The heavy sweetness balances the heavy bitterness. The aftertaste is long-lasting and slightly bitter, showing the taste of coffee, bourbon barrels and maple syrup. 9/10

Mouthfeel: Full bodied, moderate carbonated. Oily texture.

Taste: Full body, moderate carbonation. Oily texture.

5/5

Overall

A sweeter, but by no means more oaky version of KBS, with good alcohol hiding. My type.

It is a sweeter KBS, but the barrel flavor is not aggravated, and the alcohol is well hidden. It is my type.

16/20

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap at yard house San Antonio. Pitch black color. Brown head. Opaque. Vibrant aroma. Coffee beans, maple syrup, dark chocolate. Flavor is dark chocolate, coffee beans, maple sweetness. Alcohol warmth is felt. Sweet finish. Wonderful.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

Taste: Quite sweet with only a hint of bitterness. Long sweet bourbon, vanilla and maple syrup finish. Thick oily mouthfeel. Really nice, but KBS is just slightly better IMO

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pitch black colour, creamy greyish brown head.
Aroma: bourbon, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, roasted malt, molasses, oak, maple syrup, liquorice.
Taste: chocolate, vanilla, maple syrup, coffee, bourbon, liquorice, roasted malt. Really well balanced. Maple syrup without being too sweet. Nice liquorice finish and some stingy sweet bourbon.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black in appearance with copper highlights, fairly evanescent cappuccino-colored foam. On the nose, coffee, milk chocolate, something similar to dulce de lece, toasted coconut and bourbon. In the mouth it is oily, round. Aromas of coffee and cocoa first, but also soft fruit and dark caramel, vanilla well in evidence. The finish is long, slightly acidic, like dark chocolate. The alcohol is very well hidden.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark pour. Tan thin foam. Strong nose of coffee and bourbon. Taste is coffee and strong bourbon. Coffee bourbon palate.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: (Draft Albany Taproom) - Nitro - Nice creamy head. Dark opaque body. Silky on the tongue. Toasted coconut. A little bit of booze. But, not a lot. Slight peppery.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2018 RELEASE
What a wonderful sofa beer! Pours black and creamy, lasting tan head with excellent lacing. Powerful to the nose with a blend of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, bourbon and maple. Tastes sweet, very boozy, fantastic and intense flavour as detected on the nose with roasted barley, caramel, maple, coffee, vanilla, bourbon, oak, chocolate. Long and intense, lingering flavours through a smooth and creamy thick body. Fantastic.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle served in a shaker- poured a solid black color, dark brown head formed one finger in height, laced nicely along the vessel.  Aroma of a darkened malt, and a note of vanilla and bourbon.  Hits the mouth with a wide body, malt was roasted to near perfection, a mixture of maple, coffee, and bourbon comes in the middle- but it works, finish has a great warming sensation and lingers.  Beer- Hooray!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle from Windsor Hy-Vee, 2017 release, in a Sam Smith pint glass. Deep, rich, complex aromas of nougat, brown sugar, caramel, toffee, malted milk balls and medium-roast coffee with hints of wood smoke and green herbs. Pours inky black with two fingers of creamy chocolate head that laces gorgeously. Sweet and creamy on the entry with a distinctive maple character, turning malty and a bit fruity on the mid-palate with a long, sweet and roasty well-balanced finish, terminating with a flicker of heat as that 11.7% ABV hits bottom. Much more unique and less roast-focused than the original recipe. Ever so slightly sticky-sweet in the back of the throat. Completely satisfying and easy to drink for such a boozy full-bodied brew. Fantastic. Lives up to all the hype in spite of everything. Who doesn't love that? Founders certainly knows something about brewing beer. Thanks a million. Well done!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle 12 fl oz. Black with a creamy brown head. Complex aroma, roasted malt, bourbon and something I couldnâ€™t define. Extreme rich taste of everything you would categorize as â€œstout tasteâ€, with a sweet touch and a surprising bitter finish. Nice one, but prefer the KBS.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pours pitch black with a creamy tan head. Aroma is heavy in chocolate, roasted malts, bourbon, slight coffee and maple. 
Taste is very rich and sweet with some dry bitterness throughout. Full body, good carbonation, and creamy on the palate. Longggg finish, good mouthfeel.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
[Tasting - Beder]

[Vintage - 2019]

Aroma: Moderate sweet, dominating smooth coffee, bourbon and maple
