product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black with sparse tan head that dissipates quickly but leaves ample lacing; tobacco and dark chocolate on the nose; rich, syrupy palate. I recognize itâ€™s a superb brew but itâ€™s a bit too cloying and rich for me.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Hundholmen, BodÃ¸. Vintage 2017. Pours a black colour with a small beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate, soy sauce, licorice, port, coffee and raisins. Flavour of coffee, bourbon, vanilla, ash and dark chocolate. Has a slick and silky mouth feel, full-bodied and a light to medium bitterness. Rich, tasteful and well balanced.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle 35,5cl home. 2019 batch. 11,3%. Heavy, full and fat, bourbon, sweet, chocolate, coffee tones, roasted malts, maple syrup, boozy, caramel. (26-1-2020).

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Deep black, thick pour. Tan foam crown. Smoky, sweet nose. Emergence of big bourbon notes. Molasses, maple syrup, anise, pepper, dark roast coffee come to mind. First sip is cloying sweetness, followed by undisguised alcohol burn and then culminating in a potent bourbon finish. Some coffee grinds and maple flavors. At over 11% this beer retains a lot of nice flavor and locks in a tasty balance of sweetness and booziness. Unfortunately the alcohol content is not well concealed. Nonetheless, this one is well worth picking up if you see it out in the wild.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Had on draught at UNOs.  Rich dark pour.  Smells of chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, coffee.  Taste is robust - maple chocolate bourbon. A delight.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
What a beer. Oh my God this beer is insane.. I was expecting something less from the famous and classic "KBS" but this for me is simple a better beer all around.
First of all the aroma is great like usual.. You smell coffe and chocolate notes very much.. But the mouthfeel is the best i have get from any beer out there in my life. The beer embrace your mouth with such a pleasand and smooth aura and make the whole thing so good.. The taste is sweet with more chocolate notes this time because "KBS" has more coffe than chocolate. Here the taste is what i want from any beer out there. Also slightly alcohol taste in the finish..
Overall one insane beer to drink and for sure one of the best in this world.. All here is Godlike!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Heard this was the last time they were ever gonna make this old school white whale type brew. I would have killed for this back in the 2012-2013 era. Finally saw it collecting dust in a grocery store so figured, fuck it. Time for a go at the old hag. I poured it into a tulip and chugged the shit out of it. Tasted like liquid ice cream. Great beer. Probably never buy it again, but fuck it YOLO.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: I poured it from the bottle into a tulip.  It pours black with a tan head and lacing.  The aroma is great.  You get maple syrup, bourbon, wood, chocolate, and coffee.  The taste is the same.  This is dangerously smooth and delicious.  This is a great sipping beer.  Everything is done nicely.  Nothing is over the top.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Will, Jared and Nick reviewed this beer on episode 70 of the Peaceful Treason Podcast for our weekly "Cerveza of the Week" segment.  This is the first beer that we and our guest all gave a perfect "10/10" score.  

The mouthfeel and the taste of this beer are the crown jewels.  It's one of the most pleasant stouts available on the market, if you are lucky enough to find one.  The aging process in barrels that had stored both whiskey and syrup makes for one of the most unique flavors ever achieved in a stout.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Earlier Rating: 1/28/2015 Total Score: 4.5
Aromas of bourbon, maple, vanilla,caramel. Black with a mostly lasting chocolate brown head. Somewhat sweet upfront, nice subtle roasty elements, maple comes through more prominently in the flavor profile. Full bodied, very smooth.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A rather expensive bottle found in Guadeloupe, but what the hey, this thing is hyped and I'm on vacation. Poured slightly chilled it has okay dark beige foam and brownish black body. Smells of deep and heavy maple and coffee, the coffee takes centre stage but the maple helps immensely to tone it down a bit. Some vague wood notes and coffee liqueur is showing. Taste is deep syrupy coffee liqueur in a good way, maple is helping to smooth and balance everything out. Mouthfeel is  smooth and chewy, warming, the alcohol is nowhere to be seen, I'm not sure how it could get better than this. Nonetheless this is very good, heavy but extremely balanced. It also works very well with the 22 month aged comtÃ© cheese I somehow found here in Guadeloupe.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Strong coffee and chocolate flavor and taste.
Very rich, mellow and deep.
Sweet like chocolate, bitter like coffee, besides milky and woody. 
Moderate carbonation.
Definitely night-cap drink.
Amazing.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle. Pours deep dark brown to black. Aroma of cocoa, chocolate, roasted grain, raisins, wood, whiskey, vanilla, peat.  Flavor of cocoa, vanilla, wood, bourbon, prune, peat.  Very complex flavors. Quite a nice beer.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pour is a thick black with a small tan head that goes away quickly.  Flavor is nice whiskey barrel with maple syrup and tons of coconut.  Flavor is more barrel notes with a nice roast with a little sweet maple syrup with just a ever so slight alcohol note. Not as thick of a mouthfeel as I thought it would have but it still has a nice chewy malt.  Hard to find fault with this beer.  Plenty of barrel and maple syrup notes without being overly heavy or boozy.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle pours an opaque dark brown/black with small tan head that lingers but doesn't leave much lacing.  Aroma has maple syrup, figs, oak, vanilla, and a hint of coffee.  Taste is quite sweet with warming alcohol in the finish.  Body is full with a syrupy but silky, slick mouthfeel.  I'd enjoy this even more if it were not so highly rated or expensive.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 22 ounce bottle at the house. 2018 edition. Smells sweet with light hint of bourbon. Pitch black in color with little beige head. Some film on the glass. Taste sweet with medium taste of bourbon. Very malted, toasty and complex. Smooth and alcohol is well hidden. Sweet and a little alcoholic burn in the aftertastes. Super winter warmer for the holiday. Cheers!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
I had this at Global Brew. Pours black with a tan head. Taste coffee, bourbon, chocolate. I am not a fan. I would not drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: SB order bottle. The exit. Black with gray foam. Lots of bourbon in the aroma. Full-bodied warming coffee dandruff nowadays. As always, take the Founders. Take no prisoners. Can probably stand for a while.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma is dark malts, mild maple syrup and very smoky.  The flavor is coffee, dark malts, chocolate, mild maple syrup and a mildly sweet/pretty smooth finish.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2019 Vintage. Ar: Deep charred caramel; fig; burnt wood; cherry; cocoa; boozy bourbon. Ap: Black and opaque; medium mocha head with moderate retention, settling into a finely bubbled ring of frothy foam and a covering of fine and medium bubbles. T: Sweet cocoa and tobacco; ash; figs, cherries, and pineapple; nougat and creme brulee; warming, boozy edge; medium-high sweetness; bitterness is medium, with some mossy hops; char, sweet earthiness, and more dark fruits on the finish. M: Medium-full body with medium-high carbonation; big and lush; finish is medium-sweet. O: A big RIS with great flavors of stout, bourbon, and earthy maple; rich and delicious.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from Pasqually's probably: pours black with a beige head. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, whisky, chocolate, a little bit of booze. Taste is fairly dry, smooth coffee, some booze, dark chocolate. Complex, large, a pleasure to drink.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2019 11.3  ABV drinking it again after storing it for 2 years and I give it a higher rating.   Syrupy coffee with tastes of maple and chocolate.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A beautiful black liquid with a relatively persistent brown foam. The nose is complex and points directly towards scents of bourbon accompanied by notes of vanilla, chocolate, coffee of course, hazelnut ... The mouth is really soft, round, velvety; the flavors go towards full-bodied coffee, chocolate, vanilla, alcohol of course but greedy and well oriented, sugar without exaggeration. The finish is also on bourbon (why not Port, all things considered?) but we will not complain in this case. A real dessert ... to be taken as an aperitif.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours a back color with a thick tan head. Aroma of cocoa, whiskey, bit of maple syrup, vanilla and spice. Taste of dark chocolate, roasted malt, quite sweet with bit of booze and vanilla with a lingering sweetness in the finish. Full body, thick and creamy. Ideal for sipping on a cold winters eve.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A pitch-black beer, with cappuccino-colored foam. The aroma is coffee, chocolate, wet wood, vanilla, coconut, and maple syrup. Everything is right here. The taste is coffee, chocolate, maple syrup, wet oak, coconut, vanilla. A great balance between dryness and sweetness. It's not some kind of a fix, it's pleasant to drink. A lot of body, low carbonation, velvety and creamy texture, alcohol hidden. This beer has really high ratings for a reason. World class.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black pour with a small brown head.  The aroma has wood, cocoa, and whiskey.  It has a full body with thick, silky texture.  The taste is sweet and roasted with strong bourbon flavor and warmth.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: I smell alcohol, maple syrup, dark chocolate. Black coming out of the bottle, dark cocoa head. Thick & smooth on the palate. Flavors of milk  chocolate, alcohol, oats, espresso. So well-balanced, what a treat.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap at republic commonmac.  Black with thick tan head. Surprisingly subtle nose for a beer this big, but nice aroma. Rich and sugary.  Full bodied, sweet,  not too boozy all things considered. Deliciously awesome, just aboot perfect.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours black with gross brown foam, very persistent. Aroma is intense of licorice, chocolate, cinnamon, vanilla. Body is thick and smooth, with delicate carbonation. Taste is medium-high sweet. Still lots of licorice. Final is long and very satisfying, warm and embracing.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bomber, Thanksgiving Day. Pours pitch black with a brwon head and aroma of strong chocolate and ample syrup. Taste is warming up front, lots of maple syrup and bourbon, into the chocolate and liquorice notes.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle.  Fantastic Imperial Stout - chocolate, coffee, beautiful sweetness throughout.  Love it!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On Thanksgiving day, dark black pour with a java head. Nose is sweet chocolate , malty with no tinker maple syrup . Finish is chocolaty , sweet and malty . Texture is medium , carbonation is soft . Just excellent.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A fantastic desert beer. Pours dark brown with a small tan head.  The head retention is good with lacing on the glass.  An incredibly rich nose of burned candy sugar, bourbon, vanilla, toffee, caramel and malts.  Taste is sweet, with pronounced maple syrup, chocolate and coffee.  The coffee is subdued.  Full mouth feel.  Finish is sweet, maple syrupy and somewhat cloying but not unpleasant if that's what you're looking for.  There is a delicious boozy bourbon vibe.  To some this beer might be over the top, but it is a delicious blend of all of its elements, and extremely well crafted.  It's almost like heaven in a glass.  YUM!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma of booze, vanilla, chocolate, coffee.  Bursting flavor of bourbon, maple syrup, chocolate, coffee, booze burn, nuts.  Finishes dry.  A very fine beer to be sure, but I prefer KBS.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: I've had a bomber of CBS put away for a couple of years.  It will continue to save, the 12 oz bottle coming out this year has given me an option.  I bought a four pack recently at the craft beer store locally and I am opening one tonight.  A New Belgium snifter will be the glass, I see a dark mahogany brown liquid with a complementary dark tan head that settles promptly.  Nice smell, berries, dark bread and chocolate.  But that is all preliminary, I am here for the drink.  Yep, it is good.  Baking chocolate, strawberry, leather, caramel, licorice, a syrupy sweetness, all with a strong bitterness.  Maybe not the top imperial stout I have sampled. But mighty close.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a three finger light tan head that fades slowly leaving a good lace. Black color, no highlights. Medium carbonation and medium-heavy bodied. Coffee nose, flavor follows coffee and sweet malty caramel. Higher ABV, 11.6%, is hidden. 750ml bottle from Meditrina Wine Beer & Cheese Chester, VT.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a midnight dark brown with a thin creamy small bead chocolate head.  Aroma is chocolate and vanilla.  Taste is sweet roasted malt, rich chocolate, some slightly bitter coffee notes, vanilla and maple syrup.  Totally delicious!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Jet black and khaki. Decadent aroma of chocolate, maple syrup, and just a touch of alcohol. Taste is like a chocolate pancake. Dark chocolate, syrupy sweetness, a bit of creaminess. Again, very faint alcohol taste. Smooth feel. Lingering sweetness is just right. Not overpowering. Fantastic beer.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: $6.10 bottle, WW. Pours black, a little thick, with a small brown head. Chocolate, graham cracker, maple syrup, coffee, barrel nose. Flavor is bourbon, chocolate, maple syrup, earth, coffee, barrel.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Home from a bottle. Black in color, first nice thick foam, but unfortunately sinks. 
Aroma soft due to chocolate smell, but also a bit spicier due to a whiskey hint. Taste soft, considering the 11.6%. Also pure chocolate again, but very good: not too bitter and not too sweet. Slowly sip, top beer.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Should this be a separate entry? I don't know .. I didn't create it but I did drink it. Nitro at Capone's. Poured a Nitro deep brown, near black with an off white head. Maple, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, and roast. Softer nitro ...
Earlier Rating: 7/15/2009 Total Score: 4.6
Draft at the Craft Ale House (2 x 10oz glasses!). Poured a dark black color with a smaller sized off white head. Aromas of woodiness, earthy, some whiskey, chocolate, nutty, vanilla, and maple syrup. Tastes of chocolate, the same woodiness, lighter whiskey, vanilla, roasty, and chocolate. Lighter alcohol in the finish, but overall well hidden. This was pretty damn good and glad I had a few glasses of it!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Scent of wood and chocolate. Incredibly thick and rich taste. Chocolate! Unbelievably good!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Think of your children pledging allegiance to the maple leaf. Mayonnaise on everything. Winter 11 months of the year. Anne Murray, all day, every day.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: I have had the 25-ounce bottles the last two years.  I found them exceptional.  Very smooth and enjoyed them more than their KBS which is my go to beer.  I was looking forward to 4 pack 12 ounce bottles when became available last week.  However I was disappointed.  I am not sure if they changed something in the brewing process or if it needs to age in the bottle more.  Anyone else have a similar experience?

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle from Total QWine and More in Short Pump, VA  WOW!!  This is an amazing stout!  The stout poured an opaque black color with a tan head and ample lacing. Wonderful aroma of maple syrup and roasted malts. The flavors are mind-blowing, maple syrup, chocolate, roasted malts and hints of chocolate.  Very SMOOTH.  The stout is on the sweet side of beers, but so much is going on.  Medium body and soft carbonation.  You can detect some coffee after each swallow, what a complex beverage.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Four-pack of 12oz bottles for about $25 total, these Bottled On: 09.17.19, featuring 11.3% abv.  Nose rich chocolate, coffee, maple syrup; the Bourbon barrel character is there but weaker than, say, Underground Mountain, and has absolutely no alcohol burn/sting/component in the nose -- surprising and unexpected.  Pour deep brown resolving to opaque motor oil, head sudsy and surpasses tan into light chocolate; dense and foamy with some mild lace but not really legs.  Taste very strongly sweet with low bitterness, heavy chocolate and coffee, and oh yes!  there comes the alcohol!  Controlled, though, and not extreme at all, just a little singe and smooth warming that surges and lasts, quite pleasant, actually.  Full body lightly oily, mild astringency of the good kind, just a hint of hazelnut, crema/espresso, grape, red berry, a blush of melanoidin, heavy maple sugar, but never cloying.  The barrel character really is surprisingly low, just a little wood around the teeth in the long aftertaste, but all the classier for it.  Some flavor synergy.  This is a variant on an extremely accomplished beer, not sure that it unquestionably improves on the original, but it's magnificent on its own.  [2019.11.13: 4.2]

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2019 12oz. bottle. Thick black pour with a one finger, creamy mocha head that has great retention and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is loaded with chocolate and coffee, some nutty notes, deep caramel, some maple toastiness, caramelized apples and nice toffee notes. Flavor is deep caramel, mellow coffee, roasted nuts, praline, maple, light floral and spicy hops, light earthy notes, roast and light bourbon barrel. Heavy body, chewy feel, light, blanketing carbonation, so smooth.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark brown almost black with low foam, low carbonation. Coffee aroma. Really nice.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: I gotta be honest.. after years of waiting to try this elusive brew with so much legend behind, it was kind of a letdown. Still good and all but it wasn't really anything more than most BA stouts I've had and in all honesty, didn't crack my Top 10 for the category, let alone my personal all-time Top 10. Oh well. At least I can check it off the list. And it did suit the January like single digit weather here on... Veteran's Day. Gonna be a long ass winter.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours dark and thick as one would expect.  Not jet black depth like a couple of imperial stouts but darker than average for sure.  Head looks like a piece of granite - it is firm and isn't going anywhere.  Even the large bubbles are just sitting there like they are lodged in a glacier.  Aroma of slightly sweet burden and charred wood.  Lots of chocolate, maple syrup and coffee in this beer, and powerful smooth malts to boot.  I'm not sure how the aroma is so tame with this much flavor.  Strong and complete without being overpowering.  Despite the name, if you have this for breakfast you are going to be pretty tuned up.  Yummy beer nonetheless.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The beer was purchased in a four pack of 12 oz bottles. Dark brown body had ruby highlights when held up against light. The head was brown, and one finger thick. The beer was lightly carbonated, and the head disappeared shortly after pouring. The aroma was rich, with coffee beans, toffee, and chocolate being the predominant smells. The taste had an incredible depth to it, as the flavors of vanilla, maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, cinnamon, and caramel were in perfect harmony. The alcohol content was generously warm. This was definitely a slow sipper, as the sweet aftertaste lingered on and on after swallowing. The body was thick, rich, and coated every corner of the mouth. So glad to have finally found it on the shelves locally. The cost is pretty high at around $24 a four pack, but when you want the best, you have to pay.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sexy black creamy tan long lasting head. Cocoa nib aroma chocolate roast, berry coffee notes, maple marshmallow.Nice creamyness, marshemelloy texture, good maple flavor, rich chocolate, mild roast coffee, smooth, aged complexity for a month old!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from Billie's bottle shop Antwerp, best before September 2019. Pours black color. Aroma of quite roasted malts, dark coffee, vanilla, maple syrup, bourbon, alcohol, chocolate. Quite full body, sweet and roasted taste aligns with coffee really well here. Not too boozy. Maple syrup isn't high in here, I guess it's aligned with the sweetness. Roasted dry taste and aftertaste.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2019 CBS. Pours black, tan head. Lots of coffee and bourbon aromas and flavors. Hard to pick up the maple.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 35.5 cl bottle. Best before 24/09/2019. Dark brown, almost black in color with little foam, low carbonation. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, wood and bourbon. Flavor of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, bourbon and maple syrup. Dense body, balanced between sweetness and bitterness, well-hidden alcohol, great barrel-aged imperial stout, a marvel without a doubt.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Founders CBS has a medium, beige-to-tan head, a very dark brown (nearly black) appearance, and some glass lacing. The aroma is of rich chocolate, coffee, malt, and sugar. The flavor is similar, with fairly low bitterness. I did not pick up specific maple nor bourbon. Mouthfeel is heavy, and Founders CBS 2019 finishes sweet. RJT

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very sweet, but not sticky. Chocolate, coconut and a very nice, structured and not aggressive barrel.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From a bottle Deep black pour, small dark tan head.  Big chocolate maple and boozy aromas and flavors.  Rich smooth and delicious.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap. Aroma- fantastic composition of waffles, maple syrup, vanilla and dark chocolate. Mega dessert like. Black, unclear, with almost no head, but with some tiny lacing. Taste- sweet, thick, like a glaze on a top class ice cream dessert. The great thing is, that there are so many things happening here and still any note dominates. There are waffles poured with a dark chocolate and maple syrup, with some vanilla sprinkled on the top. Alcohol barely noticeable. It's definitely a pastry Stout, but there's a subtle roastiness in the aftertaste. Medium-high bodied, with a minimal carbonation. Phenomenal beer, 0,3 l stands for a hour at least.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Don't think I can fault this one. Super rich in coffee, chocolate, maple, bourbon and a huge backbone of dark roasted malt. Shame it's discontinuing. Will always be one of my favourites!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Oh, mikkeller beer geek maple sirup is much more class! No compare!
It is good, but I expected more and more! This beer was so, so hard to be found years ago. Now is here and WHAT? Nothing. Did they reduced the quality or? In order to expand the business to Europe? Dunno. I just expexted more. No such maple barrel aged character. Just similar to KBS. Again overrated. But what I think - if i go to USA, the CBS will be different there.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pleasant aroma, chocolatey coffee, sweet, marzipan, notes of noble alcohol.
Opaque, black, medium beige foam.
Sweet in taste, in the foreground noticeable pralines and maple syrup, in the back light coffee and slight acidity, after swallowing the alcohol attacks the esophagus a little, the only thing is the taste of noble alcohol
Oily, sticks to the mouth leaving a chocolate aftertaste.
After warming, a little soy sauce comes out, and in the glass left for the next day, it bursts with soy sauce.
Pita warka 09.24.2018 after warming gave the impression of metallic (iron?) from the bottle

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The foam stability is low, the body black. The aroma is darkmalty, creamy alcoholic, a bit chocolate. The taste is darkmalty, creamy alcoholic, light chocolate. Good, not as flavorfull as others on this percantage, but somewhat easy to drink and just enjoy.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
By the glass (from the bottle) at Fortnight Wine Bar in Providence, RI. 
 Pours opaque deep dark brown-black.  Thin, medium-brown head that fades to a ring quickly.  Aroma is chocolate, condensed milk, some soy sauce, bit of grass and sap, bit of vanilla.  Body is oily-starchy-watery with medium-light fat carbonation, little burn.  Flavor is delicious vanilla chocolate milkshake - bit of bourbon, grass and sap, pine, bunch of milk caramel.  Wow - that is delicious and addictingly drinkable.  The flavor makes the beer here and earns the reputation.  There are few beers big enough to integrate a bourbon barrel flavor entirely, but this achieves that.  I'm surprised by how unusual this is now that I think about it.  Very good!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very dark, almost black with small head. Nose is coffee and molasses with some cocoa notes. Even really sweet notes. Taste is also rich in cocoa and coffee with maple notes. Palate is high viscosity and very rich fruity notes. Coconut and siroup is OK.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. 2017 Release. Pours a black colour with a medium tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, bourbon, chocolate, coffee, some liquorice, leather, slight maple, coffee and subtle brown sugar. Taste of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, some brown sugar, maple, leather, slight liquorice, vanilla, alcohol and subtle spice. Full bodied and soft carbonation. A sweetish, maple and  chocolate finish with a tingle of bourbon in the aftertaste. Big and bold flavours of mainly bourbon soaked chocolate with the slightest bitterness of coffee. The maple comes late, but overall itâ€™s thick, chewy and gorgeous. More refined than other similar maple impy stouts Iâ€™ve had.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Smell of oak, tar, red wine. Black colour, brown head. Aroma of oak, vanilla, roasted malt, alcohol, chocolate, some red wine in finish. Lively carbon. Sweet, bitter.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
355 ml bottle @ Saveur-Biere online store.
CBS 2018
Black colour with a light brown foam, medium retention. Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, toasted caramel, liquor. On the palate, vanilla, roasted notes, caramel stand out. Oily texture. Very well-integrated alcohol, balanced and sweet. A marvel.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
CBS2018.

Black body with a nice, minimal beige head. Aroma is espresso, candy sugar, wood, bourbon. Taste is vanille, coffee. Spicy and warming finish. Full body, soft carbonation, sticky texture.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
wonderful complex beer, so much going on, so much to think about. It tastes boozy no doubt, but not to a detriment. The maple is just perfectly balanced in there, everything recipe-wise is spot on. Online saveaur bier (3.9 sept 2019

I agree with ^ . Beer temple Amsterdam

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: (Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, 24 Feb 2019) Black colour with creamy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of coffee, oak wood, dark chocolate, vanilla and maple syrup. Malty, roasted taste with dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, oak wood, marshmallows and a generous roasty bitterness in a slightly vinous finish. Full body, with thick and velvety mouthfeel. Quite sweet. Really tasty and full flavoured, fairly well balanced for its strength. Lovely beer! (7/4/9/5/17=4.2) Rerate: (Bottle, 24 March 2024) Black colour with foamy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with dark chocolate, espresso, oak wood, bourbon, butterscotch, vanilla and maple syrup. Malty, roasted, sweet taste with notes of chocolate, coffee, black bread, oak wood, bourbon, tobacco, vanilla, plums, maple syrup and a generous coffee bitterness in the finish. Full body, sweet. Rich, powerful and really tasty. Grear beer!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: (Bottle) Black body with a large, dark brown, cascading head. Aroma of dark roadt coffee, chocolate, molasses, vanilla, and wood. Medium to full body, with creamy mouthfeel. Flavor has coffee, chocolate, maple syrup. Alcohol is strong but it's smooth.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours pitch black with a creamy tan head. Aroma is heavy in chocolate, roasted malts, bourbon, slight coffee and maple. Taste is rich and sweet with some dry bitterness throughout. Full body, good carbonation, and creamy on the palate. Very nice beer.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very dark color. Relatively durable brown foam. On the nose it is first of all well carried on the chocolate, and with time it is the maple syrup which clearly takes over with a hint of coffee. On the palate the texture is quite syrupy. At this stage we are on a skillful balance between chocolate, coffee and maple syrup. The whole is still quite alcoholic, with the wood which becomes more expressive at the end of the mouth. The Bourbon is rather discreet. Never mind, this CBS is a perfect dessert beer, delicious as you want and which reflects all the know-how of Founders.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours very thick and dark. Nice thick and heavy feel. Good, deep taste, but VERY sweet, perhaps a bit too sweet for me, but still quite enjoyable

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very dark colour, with abundant and fine-bubbled foam. Aroma perhaps a bit too delicate, a noticeable note of bourbon, vanilla, maple syrup hidden. On the other hand, the taste is much more distinct and intense. Roasted coffee, dark chocolate, maple syrup with pleasant sweetness, alcohol pleasantly nipping, very drinkable.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From bottle at home. An imperial stout brewed to perfection. A definite upgrade to the Kbs. The alcohol content of this one bites a little but it is wonderfully balanced with the chocolate and coffee smoothness. This is how imperials are made with no lactose in the mix.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Strongly roasted, chocolate, coffee, nutty, distinct bourbon barrel, vanilla, almond, lots of maple syrup, intense, multidimensional

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle, murky brown with a super big head, lots of chocolate, honey in the aftertaste, some coffee traces, outstanding

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottled: 09.24.18. Appearance: pitch black, opaque, abundant, fine-bubble foam. Aroma in order: marzipan, chocolate, pralines, vanilla, coffee, raisins, maple syrup, there really is a lot going on, it's hard to describe. The taste is sweet, apart from vanilla, marzipan and chocolate, maple syrup begins to emerge to the forefront. Only after a while does a delicate roasted coffee counter come. Vanilla remains on the palate. The beer is velvety smooth, with imperceptible alcohol, I will only stick to the body, I really miss it a little bit. This does not mean that it is not there, quite the opposite, but a little more and it would be great. The balance is definitely on the sweet side. Mega drinkable, amazing beer, worth its price.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black. Very rich, beige, long-lasting, thick foam. In the aroma, roasted notes, chocolate, pralines, chocolate box, raisins, vanilla, a little cocoa. Maple syrup withdrawn, although delicately noticeable. In taste, very smooth, chocolatey, bourbon, but in a noble way. Noticeable maple, but absolutely does not generate any stickiness. Leaves a pleasant aftertaste of dessert chocolate. Overall, it has a bit of the consistency of chocolate liqueur. Intense and strong.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle shared at home. Thick inky black pour, thin brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, freshly brewed coffee, figs, cherries, buttery caramel. Flavour is all of that with loads of maple syrup...could go on and on. Lovely and complex aromas and flavours, glad to share though.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Smells dark syrup, tobacco and, vanilla, chocolate. Tastes dark, roasted, burnt tones - like burnt sugar. Dark chocolate. Vanilla. A little alcohol. Fantastic balance! Thick, slightly bubbly body.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
355 ml bottle @ home, served in a tulip glass, due date: 2019/09/29

Aroma: quite intense aromas of coffee, freshly ground coffee beans, black coffee, roasted coffee, cocoa, black chocolate.

Appearance: very dark brown color, almost black with brown foam made of small to big bubbles. High to very high head thickness with very high retention and low Brussels' lacing.

Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, low sourness. Flavors of coffee, black coffee, cocoa, chocolate. Hints of wood, vanilla, maple syrup, bourbon. Very well balanced beer with a lot of layers of flavors.

Palate: medium body, oily to silky / velvety texture, low carbonation, very long sweet and dry finish with low bitterness and low to medium sweetness and the same aforementioned flavors. Alcohol is very well hidden yet noticeable because of its warming effect on the mouth and throat but no noticeable in the flavor or the aroma. No astringency but noticeable acidity from the black roasted malts.

Overall: very good appearance, very good aromas of freshly ground coffee beans, black coffee, cocoa, black chocolate, maple syrup, bourbon. A lot of complexity and a lot of layers of flavors. Very good beer to enjoy slowly, excellent sipper. Excellent mouthfell

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Poured out the bottle thick foamy head dark brownish color smell of dark fruits slight banana no hop smell taste of dark fruit caramel can definitely taste alcohol like if drinking wine not harsh at all great beer loved it

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle 35.5cl on 07/13/2019. BBD: 09/24/2019. (2018)

Foam: Brown foam, fine bubbles, fades quickly.
Liquid: Black, opaque.
Nose: Bourbon, barrel, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, caramel, vanilla.
Palate: Roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, bourbon, barrel, vanilla, woody, sweet, discreet maple syrup then develops over the tasting, complex.
Palate: Low-medium carbonation, thick, very good length in the mouth.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Complex aroma: dark chocolate, cocoa, raisins, barrel, coconut. Taste: woooow - a real rollercoaster, the sweetness of chocolate, maple syrup, coconut and raisins works great with the notes of cocoa and a slight roastiness. The whole thing is reinforced with a barrel of noble alcohol. The beer is very well balanced without the impression of being sticky - which is why it is very drinkable for a style. The beer is super composed - the alcohol is imperceptible.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Perfect aroma. Chocolates, coffee, pralines, walnuts, vanilla, light whiskey in the background, coconut. You can smell it for hours, sweet and intense. Full, sweet, long chocolate aftertaste. In the taste, after warming to room temperature, alcohol comes out, but it doesn't bother too much. Actually, that's the only thing you can find fault with, the rest is great.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Large foam but quickly falls. In the aroma maple, vanilla, coconut. In the taste sweetness of maple syrup, milk chocolate, pralines, coffee, vanilla. Very smooth, full-bodied beer. Master craftsmanship.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Opaque black color with a fine ivory foam. The nose is on coffee and Bourbon. The mouth is soft and sweet because of the maple syrup. A beautiful complexity with notes of coffee, chocolate, barrel and Bourbon but I have a preference for the KBS. On the CBS, the maple syrup softens the whole thing too much.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 0.35l bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, maple syrup, bourbon, oak, roast, licorice. Taste is sweet, bourbon, maple syrup, oak, coffee, salty licorice, dark chocolate. Full body, soft carbonation. Warming sensation as it goes down.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 fl oz bottle from the 2018 release, bottled in September 2018. Appearance is a dark, opaque, brown-black, topped with a finger of dense,tan froth, which retains very well. Aroma is a mix of coffee and chocolates mostly, almost no hint of bourbon or overly roasted malts. Taste is sweet throughout, just a little short of being cloying. A mixture of flavours, none dominating - maple syrup sweetness and stickiness, lightly roasted coffee, milk chocolates, a light ting of bourbon booziness. The 11.6% ABV is not detected at all, so smooth and enticing this one is, so it can be gulped or sipped as you please. Oily, slickly smooth velvety full bodied mouthfeel, maintains it's consistency throughout with a little carbonation.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Heavy, rich taste. To my mind, the maple syrup taste isn't perfectly suited to this beer. It gives a closing sweetness that KBS doesn't have.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Vintage 2018 (09/24/18). 
Eye: completely black, medium-abundant foam, brown, quickly falling. 
Nose: maple syrup, bourbon, vanilla, barrel, noble alcohol. 
Mouth: sweetness of maple syrup, light sourness of ash, chocolate, a hint of coffee beans. 
Summary: it is definitely better than the base! Last call, this will go in the wrong direction (looking at how the base ages and how beers with coffee age, I bet that the direction is ash and beans).

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Deep brown pour with tan head. Aroma is cocoa powder and alcohol. Taste is bourbon, chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Great.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Finally got a chance to drink this, with a couple buddies. As delicious as expected, although silly expensive. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: December 14, 2017 - at Bar Hop (King Street) with blankboy - on draught.   Amazing - I have never rated this!  Black with  smallish light brown head.  Aroma is vanilla, stale coffee, bitter chocolate and a hint of maple.  Taste follows - really sweet and boozy - mild bourbon and big vanilla;  could use some extra bitterness  - this is a big bastard.  Slick, still, medium-long burnt bitter finish with emerging sweetness;  "give me a plate of bacon to eat with this and maybe I give it a 4.0"

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: the aroma is caramel and coffee with hints of black chocolate, toffee, bisquit, oakwood and port... the taste is caramel and chocolate with notes of roasted malt, coffee, cocoa, toffee, cake, oakwood and red wine... the aftertaste is sweet, dry and warming...

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Very dark to black, little to no foam.
Sweet rum, coffee scent
Mild to medium carbonation
Sweet, licorice, coffee, caramel and chocolate notes
The taste lingers and changes continuously 
2018 version

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black beer with a brown head. The beer tastes very sweet and with many hints of chocolate and coffee. Through all this, the maple syrup used is very good to taste. Due to the maturation on these barrels, the beer has become sticky sweet and has acquired a special aroma.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottled on 10-01-2018- 11.6% ALC by Volume..Jet black thick creamy tan head nice lacing smell of roasted malts chocolate vanilla coffee bourbon maple syrup faint sweetness smell really smooth taste coffee notes roasted malts smokey tobacco taste light syrup bourbon at the end alcohol is well hidden delicious beer

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355ml bottle from LCBO. Pours an average size but very thick and frothy tan head and has a deep dark brown appearance. Bubbly and patchy lacing. Moderate carbonation. Aromas of dark roasted malt, coffee and chocolatey notes, hints of maple. Flavour a are sweet straight away followed by some coffee and chocolate notes, the maple is noticeable as well as some rye in the finish, giving it the barrel aged aspect. Has a little bit of a woodsy finish also, and is a little bit boozy but not offensive in the least. Somewhat of a syrupy mouthfeel, nice and warming as well. Slightly oily sensation on the palate. Goes down smoothly, making it a bit dangerous in the long run. Very good!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Monday, June 3, 2019. Bottle, 355mL. 11.6%. Purchase ("saveur-biere.com", FR). Home. A sparkling black oily beer with a medium beige foamy head ; average retention ; good lacing ! Chocolate, coffee, bourbon+, sugar+. Heavy sweet, fat, quite warming, light to medium dry bitter, light fresh. Good body, oily texture, flat, sugary coffee dry lasting finish. Overall, good ! Nothing much. Honestly, I love coffee and chocolate (> bitterness)but this beer is too sugary ; what a pity... Strong on maple syrup I guess. I agree with mcberko...

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours dark, with good head.aroma is vanilla, coco and maple syrup. Lovely beer

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 1/6/2019. Bottle from Nisse666, shared at the Krsko GP beer share. Pours almost black with a small foamy tan coloured head. Aroma of milk chocolate, brown sugar, syrup, coffee, chocolate, bourbon, oak and nut. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. Full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Excellent.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
355ml bottle (bottled 24/09/2018, 11,6%) from Prik&Tik Kampenhout.
F: big, dark tanned, average retention.
C: black, opaque.
A: rich chocolate and roasted tones, bit vinous, woody, nutty, vanilla, bit coffee, dried figs.
T: rich chocolate, sweet coffee, dark fruits, warming alcohol, bit vinous, woody, vanilla, bit coconut, mellow fruity, complex harmonic taste, decent bitterness, lower carbonation, nice really delicious evening sipper yet for breakfast I not sure about, fully enjoyed.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 ml bottle 2018 bottle date. Rated 5/27/19. Also saved a bottle to age for a year or so. Had to see if lives to hype. Drank memorial day night. Dark molasses pour thick creamy head good retention. Aromas complex, roast, coffee, chocolate, cinnomon, oak, wood. Flavors a very sweet oak, wood, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, alcohol in the nose only, maple sugar note is there but hard to find. Very sweet overall. So based on the overall rating, I would say this is a great imperial stout, however, not as good overall as the rating overall suggest. This is a great beer to age and I will age a bottle for a year or more and make a note here on the changes and if it taste better. I have had better imperial stouts than this. By better I mean more complex and more balanced. Struise imperials remain as some of my favorite imp stouts all time.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pours dark, nearly black with a thin brown head that dissipates quickly. 
Immediate taste of a mild bourbon with notes of roasted coffee and vanilla that slowly fades into a mellow dark chocolate. The sweetness is pleasant and offsets the alcohol, though some of the alcohol remains on the finish. Aroma is of vanilla, dark chocolate, and a touch of wood and earth. Mouthfeel is velvety and smooth. I find this to be one of the most drinkable and full-bodied stouts I've had.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Appearance: Very dark brown, near black. Some dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, roasted, maple syrup, vanilla.
Taste: Good barrel, lots of dark malt, roasted, smooth. Vanilla and quite a bit of sweetness. Very nice!
Bought: Trade with Nisse666 - big thanks!, 355 ml
Info: 30/4-2019, BB: 27/10-2018

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
330ml bottle served in a tulip glass. 
A: Pours an oily black color forming a medium creamy dark beige head with medium retention that forms and leaves some spotty lacings in the glass. 
S: Strong roasted notes in the nose. Strong notes of oak barrels, bourbon, dark chocolate, coffee beans, licorice, vanilla, nuts and earth. Slightly booze finish. 
T: Sweet upfront taste. Strong notes of chocolate malts, roasted malts, coffee, wood, bourbon, maple syrup, licorice and vanilla. Grassy hops profile. Good hops bitterness. Great bittersweet balance. Lingering persistent hops bitterness. 
M: Heavy creamy body. Incredible smooth. Chocolate, coffee, wood and bourbon in the aftertaste. 
O: Excellent drinkability. Masterpiece IS.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Aroma: spirit, chocolate, 
Appearance: pitch black, hint of brown on the edges, tan head 
Flavour: super sweet malt, the maple syrup shows 
Palate: lingering choc/port/maple syrup in the long finish

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Well, what else can you say about Founders Canadian Breakfast Stout? It has the highest rating for Founders on RateBeer â€“ 4.30. The sample I tested was Release 2018, without the policeman (for those who donâ€™t know: in 2017, CBS was released in bottles for the first time after a long break â€“ the previous release was in 2011. Previously, the label depicted a Canadian mounted policeman, but the CBS Release 2018 label depicts only a rearing horse â€“ without a rider, the label was changed at the request of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, since this image turned out to be a registered trademark). Of course, I havenâ€™t tried the beer bottled in 2011, but I managed to buy Release 2017 in Italy, it hasnâ€™t been delivered to Russia yet. Compared to 2017, 2018 seemed more balanced and soft to me. Well, CBS itself is undoubtedly a dessert imperial, oily, slightly sticky, with a low creamy foam cap at the beginning, the smell is magnificent, the taste: caramel, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, notes of oak, bourbon, vanilla, of course maple syrup (but without fanaticism). The alcohol is hidden quite well and does not distract attention, but warms in the end. CBS is a full-bodied, complex in taste and aroma imperial, all components in a great balance. In the aftertaste there is a little bitterness and maple syrup at the same time. One minus - the bottle volume of 0.355 is small, a couple more sips are missing :-).

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 22oz bottle shared with blonderedhead and friends. Deep cola brown, basically black with light tan head. Nose is Sunday breakfast with plenty of maple and waffles. Taste leans on the sweeter end of spectrum. Alcohol presence is definitely felt. Syrupy mouthfeel. Bourbon characteristics that build with time. This is as good as advertised. A sweeter take on the classic KBS.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a real dark brown, kind of black colour with a big frothy-creamy mocha-coloured head, great lasting with some thick creamy lacing. Big aromas of roasted malts, chocolate, mild coffee, dark fruits and sweetness from the maple syrup. The taste starts off on the coffee side taking over the dark malts. The maple is not too sweet here to kill the fun. Wow! These Founders Imperial Stouts are so delicious. Worth the stiff price.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark body, off white head. Lovely rich roast aroma and taste. When I tried this I thought maybe they have me KBS by mistake since I didnâ€™t taste much maple. I re-ordered and this time I watched them pour CBS. The maple is subtle but itâ€™s a good beer.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: An intense coffee enhanced with Bourbon introduces us to a malty, spicy and alcoholic olfactory. Also perceived: chocolate, barrel wood, hazelnuts and fudge. But it is the alcohol that reigns supreme. Mocha-colored foam, creamy and persistent, on a black and opaque liquid. Rather chocolatey entry in the mouth with beautiful notes of maple syrup, then the alcohol gradually invades the palate with a well-felt Bourbon and a slightly spicy, alcoholic but not very bitter finish. A yeasty fruitiness reminiscent of raisins quietly intrudes into this rather chocolatey but above all, and perhaps a little too much, alcoholic palette. It remains, however, absolutely pleasant to drink.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle of 33cl from Saveur BiÃ¨re (drunk in my official Barrel Aged Founders glass ^^). Pours black with medium tan head. Medium malt, chocolate, strong coffee, roasted bread. Didn't feel the maple sirup... Medium plus sweat, light to heavy bitterness, strong cooffee fell. Starting to really love imp stout!

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dense brown color, creamy foam. Powerful and complex nose with notes of chocolate cherry, caramel, maple syrup, black coffee, roasted malt. Mouth with a broad and powerful attack, smooth mid-palate, long finish of rare complexity. An extraordinary imperial stout.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: At Malvern Beer Store, draft served in tulip glass, black with tan head.  Licorice maple aroma, full bodied and oily.  Chocolate coffee and maple taste,  finishes chocolate licorice.  Nirvana impy.

product_name: Founders CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Super good! Syrup sweetener is like balm for the soul. Small minuses are some booziness and slightly too noticeable coffee bitterness.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared 2024, 750 ml. bottle poured to a snifter, showing a black/brown hue, with slight amber highlighting, minimal foam to some spots & strands that quickly dissipated, leaving modest legs on the glass. The nose was roasted malt, cocoa, dark caramel & toffee sweetness, cinnamon, barrel induced vanilla & coconut, and bourbon. Medium to full bodied, the taste followed similarly, with fair but adequate carbonation, a fairly viscous mouthfeel, continued sweetness, bourbon, and roasted & oaky bitterness. Bold and balanced.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours inky black with a one finger, dark tan head. Aroma is cocoa, cinnamon, molasses, whiskey, roast and vanilla.  Taste is chocolate, cinnamon and brown sugar, moving to vanilla, roast and light pepper heat.  Finish is chocolate, cinnamon, whiskey, pepper and vanilla.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
[Spontan CykelkÃ¦lder Smagning]

Aroma: Huge butter and cinnamon, cocoa nips, brownie, huge burned figs, bourbon and ice cream

Appearance: Pitch black with no head

Taste: Heavily sweet and moderately bitter, butter, waffles, cinnamon, burned figs, fudge and cocoa nips ending in a slight chili burn ðŸ”¥

Mouthfeel: Really thick creamy smooth mouthfeel with soft carbonation

Overall: Probably the best cinnamon beer I have ever had (Freedom Toast comes close) ðŸ§‡ðŸ¦ðŸ«ðŸ˜‹

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Worth the hype. Was worried about the chili but it's tiny and only at the end. It's not too thick, which kills too many stouts. Really smooth and just tastes fantastic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2022 750mL bottle thanks to Nathan, shared on 2/17/24.
Clear, I think, dark, viscous, no head. Magenta/maroon highlights.
Nose is pretty nicely homogenized. No single adjunct jumps out at you and the cinnamon doesn't seem overdone. Dense, chocolatey malts with some dryness interjected by both spicy chili and light barrel. No booze. Surprisingly tame and mellow.
In the mouth it fares similar. Surprisingly mellow all around. Some bourbon but not quite as much barrel character as I'd like, or have gotten used to having from so much Side Project. Humble brags aside, it's mellow, flavorful, not boozey or sugary. Well done.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Backlog 8/31/2020: 2020 bottle shared at Fury for a Feast share. Thank's Adam! Pours a deep brown with almost no head. Very thick body with lots of cinnamon and brownie fudge on the nose. Chili comes out as it warms. Liquid fudge on the palate with lots of bourbon, chili and cacao nib on the palate. Cinnamon an bourbon comes in on the finish. Thick and viscous throughout.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft at City Beer. Black with a small tan head. Aroma is barrel, vanilla, dark chocolate, cinnamon. Smooth balanced rich flavor, Mexican mocha, subtle chili, barrel. Full body. Very tasty.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2020 bottle. Dark beer out of the bottle with a lasting brown slick on the surface. Chocolate, cinnamon and bourbon barrel nose. Beautiful silky mouth feel. Very complex beer with lots of chocolate, cinnamon, vanilla, bourbon and a hint of chili spice. Really great beer.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ Ratebeer Spring Gathering Odense, 2023. Pours Black with a small beige head. Roast, ashes, soy, chili, peppers, bourbon. Well rounded barrel flavors. Quite Lovely.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Ratebeer Odense International St Paddy Celebration. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee with cinnamon, vanilla and green pepper. Sweet and full bodied roasted flavour with light spice and a touch of chili heat. Very well rounded and reasonably balanced spiced beer.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Cinnamon and pepper the predominant notes. Cocoa and the barrel aged bourbon sweetness add on the balance the spiciness. Very well done adjuncted BA stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle @ Ryan's. Pours an opaque black shade with a thin tan head. Nose is chocolate, light cinnamon, and hint of tobacco. Flavour is rich chocolate, tobacco, mild cinnamon, with ancho chilli spice in the background and vanilla presents more so after it warms up. Thick bodied, mild carbonation, and a moderately high sweetness and a pleasant ABV warmth that blends well with the ancho chilli. Very nicely integrated however the whiskey barrel is really hiding here.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
750ml (thx, Brent D.!) @ Ryan's. Vintage 2022.
Appearance: pours like oil, very dark brown with a weak dark beige head.
Aroma: cinnamon, chillies, some black currant notes coming from cinnamon probably, lots of whiskeys barrel.
Taste: very thick, lots of barrels, very complex cinnamon. When it's warming up you can find nice black chocolate notes. I couldn't really find any vanilla.
Overall: for sure - this is a nicely done imperial stout, but you can't really find much over the cinnamon and chillies here. Not that they are overpowering here, no, they are nicely balanced, but the rest is quite weak. Some black chocolate here, yes, for sure, but no vanilla here for me. A bit disappointed considering the price tag. I would better have 3-4 bottles of the Counterpart Deciduous, than this one at this crazy price.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Poured from 750mL bottle. Black with small tan head. Lots of ancho and cinnamon with underlying vanilla, cocoa and whiskey barrel. Nicely balanced. Overpriced (just a comment, not taken into account in my rating).

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750mL bottle, pours a deep dark oily black with small tan head. Aroma is extremely rich, with lots of bourbon barrels, cinnamon, cocoa nibs, and a touch of vanilla. Flavour is rich and integrated, with lots of rich bourbon barrels, a bit of earthy spiciness, and a wonderful array of vanilla, cocoa and a hint of cinnamon. Rich, complex, and wonderfully luxurious. Lovely stuff and worthy of the high rating on here.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Opaque black beer with a slight dark brown head. Medium/heavy aroma; taste starts heavy sweet and ends slightly bitter and dry. Wood, whiskey, vanilla, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts and cinnamon. 8/5/9/5

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle, â€˜20 vintage. Black, soy sauce in color, maybe a reddish brown tint... Low carbonation.... Aroma of ancho chilies, peppers, not much cinnamon on nose, whiskey barrel... Mouthfeel is a lot thinner than I expected, pepper is fairly prominent, rye spices, light chili notes on palate... more vegetal than cinnamon... Not as good as I hoped, but still very tasty 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 75cl gold waxed bottle at home. Pitch black and thick pour, no head. Lots of chocolate, mocha, ganache, praline, cinnamon, lots of caramel, light chili pepper heat, lots of alcoholic bourbon - sweetish boozy. As it warms it gets some vinous fruity tones, nutty too. Incredibly lingering boozy cinnamon chocolate. Huge body, low but very pleasant carbonation. So good altogether...

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 26-09-20 // Happy Zwanze Day 2020 at Mon Petit CafÃ©, Stuttgart. Bottle, shared. Thanks!  Another big boy checked off. 2020 versions and damn its great.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Cinnamon-forward, perfect for Christmas by the fire. There's a blast of chili spice to balance the sweetness. Also deepens with cocoa flavors as it lingers with spice. Bourbon is present but very understated, adding texture, creaminess and complexity. Cinnamon dominates through the long finish.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This is being rated because they lost one of my ratings and I can't be arsed to do more than this. If you don't know this beer is good by now there is something wrong with you.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap and bottle on different occasions. Black with brown head. Loads of whiskey, vanilla, cinnamon and chocolate. Superbly integrated in a creamy, boozy pillow case. Some light chili without much head.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Draught @ MBCC'18 [ Green Session ]. - Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2018, Ã˜ksnehallen, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 KÃ¸benhavn V, Danmark.

[ As Perennial Abraxas - Barrel Aged ].
Dark dark black brown colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, light brown head. product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a pitch black coloration with a small, creamy head. Smell is dominated by rich chocolate fudge and an intense cinnamon note, as well as a strong earthy, oaky, peppery rye barrel note and hints of vanilla and chili. Taste follows the nose, being dominated by chocolate fudge, cinnamon and and a fantastic rye barrel character of earthy, musty, oaky, peppery notes, as well as lighter notes of roasted malt, vanilla, chili peppers and just a hint of dark fruits. Finishes with a light sweetness and some cinnamon and oaky, spicy notes lingering in the aftertaste. Full, creamy mouthfeel with a rich body and low carbonation. The cinnamon and chili work really well with the peppery, spicy rye barrel character, although I have to say that the cinnamon presence is way overdone here for my personal taste and that there is also not quite enough of a bitter/roasty counterpoint to the sweeter chocolate and vanilla notes. Considering the ridiculous secondary market value of this, I'd honestly rather have Bomb!.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Awesome!!! Mega whiskey aroma, pralines with noble alcohol, oak, vanilla, coffee, cinnamon. The taste is also a bomb, very sweet, liquid chocolate. On the finish whiskey, pralines, mega intense, alcohol perfectly composed, mega tasting. Great RIS. Respect.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Loads of vanilla, coconut, cinnamon, chocolate and coffee in nose. Pours black with tan head. Taste is sweet with vanilla, cinnamon, coffee, chocolate, caramel and some chilies. Medium bitter finish, soft carbonation, full body. Overall beutiful beer, complex and balanced.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: poppy seed cake, apple pie, sweet, slightly astringent alcohol, lots of barrel, spices

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at Jason's. A seriously ark pour cinnamon pepper choc some whiskey

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle.  Pours nearly pitch black in color with barely any head. The aroma is really nice showing notes of dark chocolate, cinnamon, chili pepper spice, dark roasted malts and smooth bourbon laden oak with a touch of spicy rye. The flavor follows suit with notes of the dark chocolate, cinnamon, and chili pepper spices right up front followed by the dark roasted malts and smooth bourbon oak to balance things out while some spicy rye ties it all together. Not overly spiced or too much heat from the chili peppers which is nice. Everything is very well balanced. Full bodied and smooth with soft carbonation that leads to a dark chocolate, cinnamon, and spicy rye with whiskey soaked oak on the finish with soft lingering chili pepper spice long after the finish. Really well balanced and perfectly done with the spices.  Really damn good barrel aged imperial stout.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: MBCC. Black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, whiskey, spices and vanilla. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, barrel, spices, chilli, vanilla, sweet and warming.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sample at Belgium Chiipalooza. beer of the night. Aroma is a symphony of cinnamon, gingerbread, milk chocolate, vanilla, coconut, cocoa, wet wood, everything in harmony. Taste is sweet, but not overly, the peppers are present in the far background. Fantastic.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black with a low, deep tan head. Aroma of, well, everything! Cinnamon, chilli, vanilla, rich bourbon notes, cacao, incredibly complex, deep and multi-faceted! Taste is just... wow. Velvet smooth, milk chocolate sweet up front, followed by a mild bourbon fiery finish that sees first the cinnamon and then the chilli kick in. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation. This is perfection! I love regular Abraxas, this takes the game to a whole new level!

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Best beer I've ever had. Hands down. 2016 vintage. Every flavor you get in regular abraxas is amped up and melds perfectly with the barrel. I need to drink this again.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sampled at Billie's Craft Beer Festival 2017, Antwerp. Pitch black pour with a fine-grained tan head. Notes of chocolate, cocoa, chili peppers, smooth whiskey, oak. Full body, thick and smooth texture, medium to low carbonation and a sweet finish. Very well balanced and full of flavour.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Kind of loses the plot from Abraxas, in my opinion. Very barrel heavy beer with vanillin dominating. Not nearly as good as regular Abraxas.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Perennial's most highly acclaimed product, a rye whisky barrel aged edition of the classic Abraxas - finally able to taste this quite famous beer at BCBF (and I was not the only one interested, considering the long queue of beer geeks lining up when this one was opened...). Thin, moussy, deep brownish-tinged bead head, opening middle but stable in the form of a ring, over a black beer with deep bronze-ish brown edges. Overwhelming, incredibly rich bouquet of Christmas cake, gingerbread including a lot of soft spicy cinnamon, hot chocolate sauce and chocolate liqueur, nutmeg, vanilla-ish bourbon and oak, fudge, brownies, rum, liquorice, fresh cloves, juniper leaves, 'kruidenkoeken' en 'pepernoten' galore. Sweet onset, brown sugariness thickly coating hints of dates and raisins, noble and very concentrated, soft carbo, very thick and greasy mouthfeel. Profoundly deep 'chocolateness' and toffeeish malt goodness ensues, deeply and elegantly nutty, like a mixture of liquid chocolate bars and liquid gingerbread. This huge and decadently delicious pile of malts is brightened by soft woody tannins, vanilla-ish oak and bourbon colours, all on top of the familiar sweet and almost 'Christmassy' ethereal cinnamon and vanilla bean flavours. The chili heat, like in the regular version, accentuates a warming, obviously very bourbon-like alcohol effect without becoming too obtrusive. This is a majestic, caleidoscopic, awe-inspiring masterpiece of a stout - I had already fallen in love with the regular one, but this one is even better, and exceeds my highest expectations. One of the very best stouts I ever had the honour to taste, regardless of hype; I do not see how any stout can get any better than this so after a moment of doubt and comparing it with other top class stouts I had so far, I have no other choice but to give this perfect beauty a near perfect score...

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: BIG THANKS to Alengrin. 750 ml. bottle sampled @ Billie's Craft Beer Fest 2017. Black oily syrup. Nose is amazing cinnamon is upfront but all massive bourbon chocolate pralines syrup candy to the max. Taste is melted pralines chocolate cinnamon warming candy, chocolate, bourbon pralines, vanilla, bourbon sugar, vanilla,â€¦ Pure praline beer, damn this is phenomenal. Holly molly.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap at Hops & Pie. Black appearance with a small tan colored head. Pleasant aroma of light chili peppers, chocolate malt, vanilla, cinnamon, light oak and a touch of whiskey barrel. Similar flavor, rich, malty and moderately sweet with a lightly spiced bitterness. Medium to full body with soft carbonation, a smooth feel and a balanced finish. An excellent sipper overall.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle, thanks to the Gbg-crew. Pitch black beer with a decent head. Aroma brings coconut and cinnamon, chocolate, licorice notes, some cocoa nibs. Coconut flavor, cinnamon, vinous notes, cocoa nibs, vanilla and some barrel notes. Well hidden alcohol. Really good beer.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle received in trade. 2017 vintage. Pitch black pour with a mocha head. Intense coffee, chocolate, coconut, cinnamon & bourbon nose. Nice coffee & chocolate balance. Sweet, bitter, malty, roasty & nutty taste. Soft, round, velvety & tiny astringent mouth. Wow! Very impressive! Especially when comparing to the base. The barrel really did wonders.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
September 29, 2017. Bottle, 2017 vintage. 

Black with a minimal brown head. Aroma is spicy and roasted with cinnamon, toasted coconuts, fruity dried chili notes, dark chocolate, coffee, sweet caramel, vanilla and bourbon. Taste is sweet, spicy and warming. Full bodied, oily texture; smooth with soft carbonation. Finish is smooth, sweet malty and spicy, smooth roasted bitterness. 

 
Very nice one, balanced spicy notes.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A: Dark black with a thin dark brown head N: Bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, coconut, dark roasted coffee T: Coconut! Vanilla, cinnamon, coffee, bourbon O: Super smooth...! Me likey!

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Crazy good. Pours a thick dark black brown color with reddish brown head. Notes of heavy vanilla, faint smoke, cinnamon, coconut, and dust. Perfect amount of chili.

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: PAKK 2017 - Aroma: cinnamon, dark Belgian chocolate, truffles, coconut and delicate vanilla after warming. Taste: thick, oily Belgian chocolate, candied fig, barrel in taste on the verge of autosuggestion, peppers pleasantly and subtly warming on the tongue. The second bombshell after KBBS, unanimously from everyone 4.8

product_name: Perennial Abraxas - Barrel-AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
