product_review: One of my favorite BA coffee beers. B2 poured full of barrel and coffee aroma. Flavors are same as the nose. Coffee, barrel, vanilla and toffee. Amazing. This has been a longtime favorite of mine.

8, 4, 9, 4, 17

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
650 ml bottle at Sander's place courtesy of Sander, many thanks! Pours a nearly black dark mahogany with a light brown head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, hazelnuts and caramel. The flavor is similar to the aroma with more bourbon character, sweetish roasted malt, cocoa, dark chocolate and lots of mild coffee. Finishes with wood, bourbon, vanilla and some sweet roasted malt. Delicious!



Aroma: 9 
Appearance: 4 
Taste: 8 
Palate: 4 
Overall: 17

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Score: 9 / 4 / 8 / 4 / 17

650 ml bottle shared by Sander, many thanks! 
Black body, with a medium, creamy, dark fruits head.
Aroma of bourbon, melting dark chocolate, coconut, coffee, 
Tastes similar, with subtle alcohol. 
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a low carbonation. 
Finishes medium roasty, medium sweet, with dark chocolate, coffee, bourbon, cocoa. 

Delicous! Very balanced and smooth to drink. Lovely chocolate and bourbon notes throughout. Not fully on par with the regular Speedway for me, but another outstanding Imperial Stout by AleSmith.

Massive coffee, lot of whisky (completely different from bourbon flavours though) little bit of vanilla, litle sour, chocolate, cocoa, marzipan, caramel, some cookies. product_review: Bottle shared at Aaron's. A gusher. Dark Chocolate and coffee and a medium mouthfeel. Ok.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle shared with brother at parents house. Aroma: typical Alesmith Bourbon aroma, vanilla, lots of chocolate, lots of complex coffee. App: really dark brown with some red / burgundy tint, minimal to no head. Taste and palate: full body, so so smooth, medium high sweetness, soft carbonation, light to moderate high bitter and alcohol finish probably coming from the coffee. Overall: this is so well made. I so love the nose of this beer. The bourbon is so much present just like the "regular" BA but with a great touch of coffee. Perfect balance! Excellent!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle shared with Julien and Sam. Pours black. Brown cappuccino head. Thick frothy head. Good thick lacing. Smells boozy, roasty, sweet bourbon Barrel. product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: PAKK 2017 - Dominant coffee, lots of bitter cocoa, bourbon, espresso, fudge, cuckoo. Well put together, good balance between barrel sweetness and dry bitterness. Total 4.5

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Strong coffee & bourbon on the nose; earthy, smoky, dark-roast coffee with that sweet bourbon in the back. Full, mouth-coating body. Coffee and dark chocolates lead the way to provide a bitter, smoky base. Some dark sugar sweetness (caramel/brown sugar) in the middle and bourbon to finish. Overall, a delicious coffee-forward stout with enough sweetness and chocs to add balance & variety; bourbon is the cherry on top. Beautiful beer for the coffee fanatics!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Shared at RBAG 2017 - thanks kbudd. 

Pours dark with a thin tan head which does not last very long. Avenues of gummy alcohol run down the glass after every pull. Lots of coffee and toasted malt aromas assisted by oatmeal and dark chocolate. Taste is coffee and roasted grains; I can pick out oatmeal and rye most prevalently. The alcohol is present but not a feature.

product_review: Bottle pours black with tan head very rich tootsie roll chocolate mild coffee flavors. Bourbons and chocolatey big ABV burn. Delicious

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A slight disappointment, but still a great beer. Weaker than the base - drier, less creamy and milky chocolatey.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours a very dark black beer with a big beige head on top. Has a small gusher when opened, luckily nothing wrong with it. Aroma has lots of bourbon, vanilla and caramel, dark chocolate and roast. Flavor is very sweet, lots of booze, alcohol is well hidden. The coffee notes are faded to the background, bourbon is very present. Very full, well balanced, full on flavors in your face, with the coffee more present in the background. Mild carbonation, long bittersweet, licorice aftertaste. Great stuff.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beermail; Bottle 0,75l; pours black opaque with creamy brown head. Aroma: roasted coffee, roasted grain, dark malts, molasses, burnt sugar?, vanilla, wood, leather, bourbon. Flavour: roasted grain, roasted coffee, malts with notes of toasted toffee, caramel, milk chocolate, molasses, burnt sugar?!, vanilla, bourbon, woody notes, dark fruit esters...finish is dry, almost sticky...body is thick, texture smooth, carbonation moderate. Was I in a bad mood? Imo: It was too sticky in comparison to regular version of Vietnamese Speedway, which is superb, but this one, coffe note is maybe too hidden...only last three or four sipps reveals that it live up to the hype.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750-ml bottle. Faint barrel notes and heavy chocolate pace the aroma with mild spiced coffee floating in the background. Prominent milk chocolate controls the flavor with only minor notes of the spices that make the regular version so awesome. Incredibly smooth mouthfeel. Iâ€™m glad to have finally tried it but give me the good olâ€™ base Vietnamese Speedway instead please.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at tasting. Black pour. Aroma of delicious bourbon vanilla, milk chocolate, creamy coffee and soft red fruit. Taste has creamy vanilla, soft bourbon booze, smooth chocolate, coffee, red fruit and creamy roasted malt. Sticky mouthfeel, really long delicious finish. This is how a bourbon ba coffee ris should be. Extreme flavors, but with great balance. Fantastic.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: strong caramel flavor. high alcohol can come through at times. definitely worthy of high ratings. a must try for beer lovers!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 ml bottle courtesy of IrishBoy (Thanks Richard!) poured a clear dark reddish brown with a small lingering brown head. Aromas of dark chocolate, bourbon, coffee and light oak. Palate was medium to full bodied and smooth. Flavors of dark chocolate, bourbon, coffee and light oak with a smooth lingering bourbon mocha finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ Solar Eclipse part 3 - The Darkest Night. Black body with a small light brown head. Roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla notes, slick and smooth. Well balanced. Lovely.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Solar Eclipse Part 3: The Darkest Hours. It pours jet black with a creamy beige head. Sweet and roasted aroma with oaky and vanilla notes. Light candy notes. Freshly grinded coffee beans. Creamy texture. Sweet bourbon and sweet roasted flavour with coffee and chocolate.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Solar Eclipse part 3 - the darkest hours. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, brown sugar,vanilla and coffee. Notes of bourbon. Complex Starts sweet but finish bitter with lingering roasted notes. Full and creamy.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ Sanderslum Pubbens Vintage launch/Solar Eclipse pt. 3. - The darkest hours. Pours black with a small creamy head and lacings. Savory. Slick and vinous. Coffee and bourbon. Subdued. Boom!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ SEP3DH. Pours black with tan head. Aroma of huge coffee, vanilla, slick borubon, licorice, savory, light spice, roasty malts, some dark and milky chocolate. Taste is rather sweet, loads of roasty charater, the coffee blends well with the barrel, slight boozy - heavy in all aspects, a sipper.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
on tap @Alus Celle, 

Big beer! Pours pick black, thick with nice dark brown/violet top. Aroma- massive vanilla reminder plus notes of roast, wood and seemed also as unroasted coffee beans, sweet maltiness. Taste is moderate sweet, medium to high bitterness, pleasant full bodied mouthfeel, thick as cream texture, enough lasting bitter/roast aftertaste. Indeed enjoyed, aroma blew my mind.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: [1/28/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at a bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Black. Huge aroma of chocolate, fudge, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, cookies, cake. Full-bodied, thick. Wonderful stuff.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark black. Woo this is good. Very mild and so smooth. Thick chocolate. Subtle oaky.  Had side by side with fresh vietnamese coffee.....way smoother than the coffee.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Outstanding brew. Perfect nose with roast, deep vanilla, smooth dark chocolate, perfect bourbon BA impact gives more layers to complexity, offering wood, light smoke.
Moderate sweetness with moderate bitterness. Awesome.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark brown beer with a small brown head. Smells like bourbon, vanilla, alcohol, roasted, coffee, chocolate, dried fruit. Tastes sweet, vanilla, alcohol, bourbon, coffee, chocolate. Nice.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Thx to the bijens. Beautiful black color with a good collar. Smells full, bourbon coffee, vanilla, cream, alcohol. Tastes full, vanilla, cream, alcohol coffee. Beautiful full aftertaste. Beautiful thick structure.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Arjan thanks! Smells perfect. Nice black, but quickly dead. Tastes great too: everything is in there. Sweet, vanilla, caramel, coffee, chocolate, the bourbon. Topper!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark brown with small beige head. Slightly sweet very nice dark bread aroma. Roasted grain bitterness with coffee notes and some vanilla sweetness on the background. Roasted bitter aftertaste with vanilla notes.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black with almost no head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malt, roasted nuts, coffee, oak, muscovado sugar, slight vanilla. Taste is chocolatey and oaky with lovely coffee notes and roasted nuts. Mouthfeel is smooth and velvety and full bodied with almost no carbonation. Fantastically well balanced. Awesome!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pours dark with low off white head 
Aromas insanely well balanced with beautiful notes of vietnamese coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, dark fruits, nougat, muscavado 
Taste has notes of vietnamese coffee, milk chocolate, caramel, roasted malts, dried fruits, dark muscavado 
Mouthfeel is mouthgasm

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours black with a tan head. Hickory, oak, condensed milk. Thick mouthfeel. Low carbonation.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: One of the best beer drinking experiences Iâ€™ve ever had. The best coffee stout Iâ€™ve had at the taphouse Oct 2016. Delivers everything you want, not too heavy, had a 4oz taste, followed by another.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Thanks Matthew for sharing the bottle! Poured into a wineglass showing pitch black with no head. 

The nose shows light acetic tones with light caramel and latte notes over restrained black coffee. Vanilla and bourbon notes become apparent upon opening up. 

The palate is thick bodied and lightly carbonated. Bourbon and latte forward but perfectly balanced without either flavor overcoming the other. An alcoholic prickly heat appears on the mid-palate followed by a lot of vanilla and lightly roasted coffee bitterness on the finish. Overall, the beer is a bit messy and disjointed but there are definitely a lot of nice flavors going on here.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours black with a medium brown head which recedes to a small brown layer formed around the circumference. Aroma is caramel, fudge, oak, coffee, hazelnuts. Taste is vanilla sweet, caramel sweet, hazelnuts, light coffee bitter, chocolate sweet, oak, slight hint of raisins. Full body with a rich mouthfeel.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle sample at Beer Study bottle share in Durham. Dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of toasted coconut, vanilla, coffee. Taste has vanilla, coconut, espresso, subtle sweet brandy. Delicious.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Massive nose just wafts out of the glass. dense as, this is alcoholic, buring an so much fun. Not a lot of coffee flavour, just big stout flavours with oak an bourbon. Sweet as bro.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: As expected, one of the best beers I got to try in 2016. I love speedway - though I like the base better than the Vietnamese version. Add in barreling, tough, and the sweeter Vietnamese coffee just works on another level. The Brewers blend which is 50% barreled is one of my all time favorites and this is just a notch below that. Decadent, complex, sweet, roasted, delicious.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Type: 8-oz. draft
Glass: Clear snifter glass 
From: AleSmith in San Diego, Calif.
Price: N/A (was $10 for 6-oz.)
Purchased: N/A; Got free ticket at Emilyâ€™s birthday party
Consumed: Dec. 31, 2016
Reviewed as: American Double / Imperial Stout
Misc.: N/A

This was pretty much my most sought after beer. Absolutely loved the regular Vietnamese Coffee version (4.53) and expect this one to be the best beer I ever tried. That good. Was lucky enough to get a free pour while going to Emilyâ€™s birthday party. A huge thanks to Chris and Lesley for probably a huge tab. Rushed this, but hereâ€™s to heaven.

Poured a pitch black color with two fingers of frothy tan head when I got it. Very serene setting underneath the chaos. Excellent spotty lacing. Excellent retention. (Sight - 4.25)

Smelled smooth buttery bourbon, milk chocolate syrup, cocoa, some malt chocolate, creamy espresso, vanilla, toffee and sweet caramel. (Smell - 4.75)

Wow on the taste. Still than milky chocolate syrup, malt chocolate, smooth bourbon, creamy vanilla, touch of oak, espresso, lactose and coffee creamer. (Taste - 4.75)

Full body. Creamy-to-sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth finish. (Feel - 4.75)

Just as awesome as I hoped it would be. So glad I got the chance to have it. Unfortunately I feel like I slightly overrated it a tad. (Overall - 4.75)

4.72 100 A+

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Rich malty base, vanilla and coffee, sweet bourbon, molasses, faint dark fruits, and a smooth and balanced finish. Rich and delicious.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On draft at the Small City Tap House in Sandusky Ohio. Great Stout. Would have again.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a oily black with thin ring of bubbly brown head. Aroma of big barrel notes, vanilla and oak, hint of coffee and sweet cream. Taste is even more of the barrel, boozy and big, a hint of sweetness, coffee kind of gone here, but not a big deal. Thick and viscous, slick on the mouth, minimal carbonation. Very nice barrel beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft to an actual plastic thimble. Pours jet black with a little khaki head. Aroma of roasted chocolate malts, coffee grind, molasses, and bourbon. Taste is of chocolate, roasted nuts, coffee, bourbon, and oak. Surprisingly easy drinking. Very well balanced. Smooth. Enjoyable. Highly recommend.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Jet black, with a strong coffee nose. Chocolate fudge and oaky bourbon mix with coffee to create an amazing flavor explosion.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma is of heavy sweet bourbon with sweet chocolate. Flavor also has tons of bourbon with moderate roast and a very smooth coffee backbone. Very nice balance between coffee and barrel. Finishes smooth and warming.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draught at the brewery. Pours opaque black with a medium, frothy tan head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is moderate Bourbon, vanilla and oak with roast and chocolate malt, and nutty coffee. Flavor is light brown sugar, nutty coffee, smooth Bourbon, vanilla and oak with spicy alcohol and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Wow. Thanks Kirk! This is wonderful. What a great night of imperial stouts. This is the grand finale. Pours black. Dark head. Thinner than Zhukov sightly thicker than cognac/brandy Peche. Aromas of coffee, bourbon, oak, very woodsy. Flavours are bourbon, coffee, oak, some spicy bourbon heat on the end. Fantastic.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Thanks cards04 for trading for this. Dark body Brown head some lacing. Bourbon dark chocolate roasted malts grains dried fruit aroma. Taste is rich, coffee, oak, dark chocalate, dried fruit. Fantastic.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
On tap at Mohawk house. Great coffee and bourbon flavors. One of the best beers I have had

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Shared 2013 bottle with coffee.
Near black with s good light brown head.
Excellent super with a lot of bourbon flavor. Very smooth, full body.
Excellent, lasting aftertaste.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Wonderful! Very balanced which is not the case with every coffee stout I have had. Hides the crazy abv well! Thereâ€™s like just a subtle hint of coffee... Itâ€™s pretty great.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from Himmeriget back in late March with Herr Angstmann. All Speedies are amazing, but this was something to behold. A bit more sweet and vanilla from the Vietnamese coffee, and a thinner body than the non-BA Speedies. The bourbon is almost overwhelming with its taste and heat but somehow backs off just enough to showcase all the other flavours. It is still smooth and very drinkable, marshmallow/brownie flavours competing with the coffee and smoky bourbon. I love it, one of my favorites.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black, Small to OK , bit darker white head. Smell is intense, grainy bourbon. Taste is intense, very silky ( this also describes the MF , which is paired by perfect and low carbo ) . Bit bitter, coffee notes, but mostely intense bourbon. Mild booze. very nice beer, but not the best speedway offering so far.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 mL bottle shared with ebone1988 for his 1000th rating. Congrats buddy. The pour is a nice oily black with a thin head of dark khaki that falls to a ring, leaving no lace. The aroma is a huge chocolate bomb. Itâ€™s awesome. There is such a big chocolate malt presence. There is a strong barrel character as well. The bourbon is big and it does offer a nice addition of vanilla. The coffee is quite subdued, which Iâ€™m not that much of a fan of. The flavor is good, but lightly disappointing. The coffee again is lacking. The chocolate is big once more and the bourbon is nice. There is a strong woodiness to it that I just donâ€™t care too much for. The head and chocolate balance well though. The mouth feel is a little light. Itâ€™s viscous, but you have to work the carbonation out and Iâ€™m not crazy about that. This one is good, but itâ€™s not quite as good as some of the other BA variants. The aftertaste is chocolatey and malty and carries a little bourbon to it. Itâ€™s tasty

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: My 1,000th rating on Ratebeer! Of course, bottle shared by koleminer20, because he kicks ass and takes names. Aroma is barrel, booze, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, great great stuff. Appearance is black, poured thick, brown head. Taste is chocolate, coffee, barrel, booze, roasted malt, some vanilla, really good. Mouthfeel is heavy body, light carbonation, smooth, booze and chocolate aftertaste. Overall, this was a solid choice for 1,000!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Finally cracked open one of my cellared bottles. Aroma is burnt sugars and coffee. Smooth body. Molasses, caramel, coffee, oak, and bourbon blend beautifully. Vietnamese coffee is my favorite version of this beer. Fabulous.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 5 ounce sample at The Davis Beer Shoppe. Aroma has very mild coffee notes and some woodiness. Light anise. Opaque black body with a small, light brown head. Starts with some sweet cocoa present. Has some roastiness in the middle with coffee hints. Finishes with more roasted cocoa and a light sweetness. Good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 25.4 oz bottle. Dark brown with brief froth. Nose is fudge brownie, bourbon, coffee, molasses, vanilla and wood. Silky, almost full body, with a tang and a warming buzz. Taste is chocolate syrup, earthy coffee, caramel, malted milk and soft bourbon. A bit of spicy heat on the back side. Rich and decadent.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: bottle thanks to Bret. This one is worth the hype. Incredible vanilla sweetness from the coffee complemented perfectly with the base. YUM YUM.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Black of color with a brown head. An aroma of oak, coffee, alcohol, roasted, raisins and dark chocolate. A flavor of cold coffee, bitter, dry, liqurice.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
tap in jabeerwocky. there is everything that is in the basic version, but this Vietnamese coffee slightly covers the whole. which is still - underneath - noticeable. what is more interesting - it covers the alcohol which was more evident in the basic SS and - here I do not know how - adds sweetness. also a lot of vanilla, of course chocolate, dried fruit, family - all of this is also present. I will take the beer

The rating was treated with the script for calculating ratings (UT/RB agreement).

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Another great variant of the Alesmith Speedway Stout. The Vietnamese coffee adds a hint of the sweet but stronger coffee flavors along with hints of vanilla. You canâ€™t taste the 12% but donâ€™t need to as the flavors are off the charts. Again, another great example of taking a bourbon barrel aged classic and creating unique releases that continue to hit the mark. Cheers!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from Perkins shared at the summer big deck tasting. Dark brown with a creamy hades that eventually fades to a thin film. Incredibly dry, dark chocolate, smooth and thick body, nicely balanced vanilla, oak and booziness with a nice espresso coffee roast, light carbonation, bitterness that at first is astringent but as things warms up becomes warming and delicious. A great beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle share at CBC Clerkenwell for Padraigâ€™s 2.5K tasting. Many thanks to Manny for opening this one. 12% BBA Vietnamese coffee edition. Black with a big foamy brown head, dotted lacing. Aroma is molasses, coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation, quite oily. Taste is coffee, vanilla bourbon, molasses, tangy red berry, sweet but with a woody dryness in the finish. A very big beer, A bit meaty sweet and hot to be a God-tier impy, but itâ€™s very good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 9th Dec- RB LDN Xmas tasting at CBC EC1 and my Untappd Elite (2.5K) tasting. Bottle from a trade with Sir Theydon of Bois. Thanks Colin! Pour black with a tan head. Nose is coffee, vanilla, bourbon. Taste is super rich coffee, roast and chocolate. Warming alcohol in just the right proportions. Full body and slightly oily. Great stuff.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Split with two great friends. 

Typical Speedway appearance. Near black with a small beige cap. Lovely aroma filled with coffee, roast, chocolate, vanilla. Just beautiful. Elegant and awesome. Highest recommendation.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 75cl bottle shared at Padraigâ€™s 2.5k Untap tasting, CBC CW London. Huge massive thanks to the man himself for cracking open this bad boy, the 2.5k beer. It pours a black color with medium brown head. Aroma is big boozy sweet and chocolatey. Taste is big bold sweet boozy with loads of dark chocolate and some roasted coffee beans. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, good one

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Oh my, what a treat! On tap. Black pour with small beige head. Aroma is huge coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, bourbon, vanilla, espresso and cream. Taste of huge coffee, sweetened chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, soft hop bitterness, vanilla, coconut and just the perfect amount of boubon aging to compliment all the flavors instead of masking them. Full bodied 
, creamy mouthfeel, absolutely perfectly balanced! an amazing brew!!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at our Winter Gathering 151127. Black beer with an brownish head. Roasted coffee aroma, woody, licorice, dark chocolate, dark dried fruits vanilla aroma. Roasted lovely smooth coffee flavour with vanilla Woody dark chocolate licorice. Really Amazing beer, this is love in a bottle.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
November 27, 2015. Bottle, shared by rlgk, thanks!


Black with a small brown head. Aroma is a great blend of bourbon, vanilla, coffee, caramel, hints of dried fruits.

Taste is sweet and soft bitter. Finish is sweet soft bitter, caramel, dark chocloate, hints of milk chocolate, warming alcohol, slight hints of salty licorice, dried fruits. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, oily texture.



Amazing version of Speedway stout, complex, all flavours blend together great.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle courtesy oif rlgk. Pours oily pitch black with a small creamy dark mocha head that leaves some sparse trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, toasted coconut, dried bilberries, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty. Mouthfeel is soft, viscous, oily, round, roasted astringent, tiny boozy and full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, burnt caramel, vanilla fudge, banana bread, chocolate chip cookie dough, charred wood, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, dried bilberries and cherries, moist soil, toasted coconut and bourbon alcohol. I love the Vietnamese Speedway Stout and that is just that with another great AleSmith BA treatment. Great stuff!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Ratebeer KvillebÃ¤cken Winter Gathering, 151127. Opaque black beer with a nice lasting brownish head. Roasted coffee aroma, vanilla, woody, licorice, dark chocolate, figs, cream, salty licorice, caramel, espresso, raisins, figs, some oak. Roasted coffee flavor, figs, spicy notes, vanilla, woody, raisins, espresso notes, licorice, dark chocolate, well balanced alcohol, slightly spicy, peat notes. Full bodied, complex and absolutely amazing,

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Kville. Bottle. Pours jet black with a small brown head. Aroma is sweet acidy ashy bourbon slightly sweet vanilla coffee coconut. Flavor is balanced roasted boozy a bit ashy vanilla bourbon slightly sweet barrel, damn this is good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A: Pitch black with a nougat small head. N: Bourbon, vanilla, dried fruits, liqourice T: Toffee, hazelnut, marzipan, liqourice, vanilla, bourbon O: This is so nice I am out of words...

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Thanks to Youri for this welcome and for the entire tasting. A black body lights up my glass. The dense foam develops the beginning of a lace. The nose is exceptionally rich with its notes of caramel, coffee, maple syrup, vanilla, chocolate, fudge and bourbon. The flavors are superb but slightly dominated by a bourbon tinged with caramel and vanilla with all the right intense malty notes and rounded coffee. The body appears medium-strong to me with a velvety texture and a moderate contribution of bubbles. The finish is on notes of coffee and chocolate well shaken by a bourbon that seems to me to be a little spicy. Fantastic.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A big thanks to mcberko for this wonderful brew! Shared with SlovakSniper during a highly anticipated tasting! From the popped capsule, powerful and overwhelming aromas of vanilla, dark chocolate and bourbon. The vanilla is such and the coffee so delicate in the manner of a French vanilla. A hint of spices also adds a touch of depth and complexity of the most pleasant. The aromas are wonderfully transformed into flavors in the mouth in a superb continuum of the most harmonious. Silky texture, the beer is ample although curiously narrow on the finish. No bitterness, not even the usual roasting bitterness is present. Long, sweet, complex and how comforting!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Perfect dark pour. Super powerful coffee and dark chocolate aroma, boozy yet sweet and easy to drink. Excellent stout for winter sipping.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Glass, brown bottle, 750 ml, from and with Stephen Morris (thank you!), savoured on July 21 2015; eye: black, opaque, no head, no lacing; nose: woody, bourbon, oak, roasted barley, chocolate, alcohol, light vanilla; mouth: woody, bourbon, oak, roasted barley, chocolate, alcohol, light vanilla, alcohol warmth, finale in chocolate with presence of roasted barley, full body, below-average carbonation, lightly bitter, lightly sweet, lightly oily texture; overall: quite fine

ENGLISH

Glass, brown bottle, 1 pint 9.4 ounces, from and with Stephen Morris ... palate: woody, bourbon, oak, roasted barley, chocolate, alcohol, slight vanilla, alcohol warmth, chocolate finish with presence of roasted barley, full-bodied, below average carbonation, slightly bitter, slightly sweet, slightly oily texture; in summary: very good

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: bottle, at home. Pours deep chestnut brown, a bit more oily than the regular one. Sticky sweet vanilla nose, coffee bitters, liquorice and faint tofee, a lot less of the nice coffee roast aromas of the Original one. Thick body, quite high on the alcohol, salty finish, and a rather bland taste. The richness of both aroma and taste is a bit gone...

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle:(many thanks to Phaleslu)
Pours black with an oily, dark tan head.
Aroma is cocoa, molasses, coffee.
Taste is rich...smooth coffee malt, vanilla, chocolate malt.....
Nicely moderated bourbon and wood notes.
Wow....absolutely exceptional....
One of those that makes you sad when you realize the bottle is empty.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 ml bottle shared by phaleslu. Pours dark brown to black with a medium plus sized, fluffy khaki colored head. The aroma and flavor have big chocolate, cocoa, caramel, nice roasted coffee more than the base from what I remember, bourbon, vanilla, char, some spices, more of a sweet, decadent, dessert coffee, only mild bitterness, great mouthfeel, no sign of the abv, this was a treat. Very happy to have tried this.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle (huge thanks to Phaleslu for sharing). Sugar, vanilla, coffee, chocolate, malt and hay aroma. Black-brown with nice tan head. Sweet creamy vaniilla, mocha coffee, malt, moderately strong bourbon, and moderately bitter herbal hay flavor. Spectacular balance.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by phaleslu. Poured black color with an average frothy brown head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy roasted sweet coffee, lactic chocolate and bourbon wood aroma. Medium to abundant body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy roasted sweet bourbon flavor with a medium to heavy complex sweet finish of moderate to long duration. My high expectations where exceeded with a standout beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 ml bottle via trade. Pours a deep opaque brown with amber edges and a small tan head that settles into a ring. Notes of vanilla, fudge, oak, coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, tobacco, toffee, and brown sugar, with a hint of ash sprinkled in - perhaps more accurately descriped as charred oak. Medium-bodied, with low to moderate carbonation and a sweet, rich, coating mouthfeel. Smooth and easy to drink with no overpowering element despite the ABV and rich roasty base. Another excellent Speedway variant from a world-class brewer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared by phaleslu. Huge thanks dude! The beer is a thick black with a khaki head of foam. The aroma has rich coffee, rich cream and caramel. Kind of reminds me of a more roasty vietnamese style coffee, which is just fine with me. Pretty sweet and creamy taste, but the coffee comes through well. The barrel isnâ€™t all that prevalent. Big body and medium carbonation. Chewy. So good!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at Cincinnati tasting pour opaque black with thin tan head. Nose coffee, roast, and light Bourbon. Taste excellent chocolate, coffee, dark roast, and pleasing Bourbon flavors. Some vanilla. Nice and viscous. Great example.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at my wedding on 9/12/15. Pours pitch black with a deep-rising mocha colored head. Fading to a ring, with some swirls of lace. Aromas are bold with coffee wafting out immediately. The barrel character makes itself known, but does not smell hot....lingering sweetness of molasses, brown sugar, vanilla, chocolate and a final dose of heavy roast. Taste is delicate, yet bold. Nice medley of coffee and chocolate out of the gate. Simmers into oak, vanilla and fudge....and then the bourbon creeps in to take the sweetness of the edges. Great mouthfeel, thick but not chewy...seems the barrel thinned this out in comparison to the non-BA Vietnamese version I had. Still, this body holds up nicely against the backbone and never tasted "hot". Finish was very oily and gave a great bitter coffee splash with more chocolate, vanilla to compliment the oak/bourbon. Great stuff!!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle enjoyed @ a friendâ€™s cottage. Pours black with a small creamy brown head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt, bourbon, vanilla and marshmallow. Flavour is medium sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is dry, coffee and a little bourbon kick.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Absolutely loved this beer. The nose and taste are mostly coffee with a nice secondary marshmallow experience. Nearly perfect.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
SMELLS SO FUDGY! 

Excellent stout, very very good. Its like drinking a brownie

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pretty gnarly...not much different from a good BA speedway...but the mouthfeel/palate is take to 11.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Big alcohol brew, there is nice roast and vanilla but the alcohol dominates. May be with time it will mellow. I have good promise for it but too young and heated now.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: incredible thick mouthfeel, pours a rich dark chocolate color. huge notes of coffee and sweetness. Wonderful

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty woody bourbon coffee chocolate aroma. Roasted malty woody bourbon coffee and chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty woody bourbon vanilla coffee and chocolate finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
How: Bottle (750 ml) at tasting. Shared by czar, thanks! 



>>> AleSmith strikes again with a wonderfully rich and balanced coffee imperial stout. The mouthfeel is out of this world. 



+  Like most Speedway variants, the beer is beautiful. Pitch black with a medium beige-brown head, very good retention and some lacing 

+  Flavors of coffee, caramel, vanilla, bourbon and even marshmallow are all very intense and deep, but at the same time they are totally cohesive and nothing is overpowering 

+  The mouthfeel is incredibly smooth, super silky and rich with a mild alcohol warmth at the end 

+  Itâ€™s on par with the best Speedway variants along the regular, the non barrel-aged Vietnamese one and the bourbon barrel-aged Speedway.



Flavors:  Vanilla, caramel, coffee, bourbon, marshmallow, vegetal notes (mild)

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle 750ml.
Pours jet black with low beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of chocolate, coffee. Taste is of chocolate, coffee, alcohol, roasted malt, some bitterness, slight alcohol. Palate: Full bodied. Low carbonation. Overall: Very nice. Slight acidity.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a dark dark brown with a small brown head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of chocolate, vanilla and coffee. Taste is of chocolate, bourbon and moderately sweet. Body is full, carbonation moderate and alcohol is nowhere to be found. Overall a really nice bourbon BA imperial stout but I think i preferred the non-Ba by a large margin. I could still drink a lot of that, though.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A deep dark imperial stout with a thin brown head. In aroma, sweet fruity chocolate malt with smooth bourbon barrel, light cork, smooth coffee notes, vanilla extract, beautiful and delicious. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity chocolate malt with coffee grind, bourbon barrel notes, light vanilla, alcohol warmth, beautiful. Bottle from Puhskinwow. Puhskinwowâ€™s Big Deck tasting.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pitch black oily pour. 2 finger coffee colored head. 
This smells absolutely fantastic. sweet, bourbon forward, lots of chocolate and fudge.Okay so I did not like base Vietnamese speedway much. This though is perfection. Lactose is prominent, sugar is present. incredibly roasted chocolate presence and fudge. a little bit of anise. but this is straight up exceptional.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: pours unclear very dark brown with a small crema cap, minimal retention and lacing. nutty burnt maltiness, raisins, sweet soy sauce, green but fresh coffee berries, vanilla, chocolate beans, warming alcohol. flat carbonation, medium-full body - oily; boozy and smooth bourbon spicy finish. very good coffee BA stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared. Aroma is really intense, nice coffee, rich bourbon notes, vanilla, rich, beautiful. Taste is super rich, molasses, coffee, vanilla, light spice, super decadent but not cloying, so tasty. Palate is rich, med carbonation, so tasty. Really love this.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Black body. Big khaki head. Medium collar. Bourbon aroma. Kinda nutty. Chocolate. I donâ€™t get a ton of coffee on the nose, though. Lots of coffee flavor, though. Lots of bourbon too. Both are sharp flavors. Bourbon and nutty malts. Bright coffee flavor. Oak comes through in the back end. It has a different sort of flavor in the finish. Has a little bit of a sharp flavor, like a bit of red wine. Heavy. Boozy. Medium carbonation. Excellent. The finish is just a bit odd, but otherwise fantastic.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
19th June 2015
Bottleshare, big fanks to the Bois for this one. Opaque black - brown beer, decent tan head. A rich and sweetish bourbon nose, very nice. Palate is airy and smooth. Modest fine carbonation. Very smooth dark malts, creamy sweetness. Bourbon spice but otherwise fairly mellow bourbon flavours. Mild coffee. Little brandy. Trace of barrel induced paint esters. Dry and slightly spicy finish. Dry and slightly spicy finish. Pretty well integrated and very nice but could possibly use a little more time.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Pours a completely black color, with a small, light brown head.

Full of fudge and ground coffee on the nose with lots of dough cream and a warming barrel appearance. Coffee is extremely well pronounced, revealing a flowery berry quality, gently wrapped up into fudge and charred malts. 

Drinks outstandingly smooth, very soft on the tongue with an intense barrel infusion, creating a hot bite during the finish, together with bitter coffee.

Tastes of sweeter fudge, immediately coated up by earthy, silk coffee with a faint berry quality to it. This foundation gets joined by a prominent, vanilla heavy, warming barrel, adding smoky oak, camp fire warmth, resin and a whiff of hazelnuts to the taste. Finishes with present, hot, dry bourbon among cream, coated by coffee and fudgy booze.

Features a full bodied beer, surprisingly fudgy, with flowery, berry infused ground coffee. Extremely smooth, almost easy drinking if it wasnt for the prominent barrel.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle, thanks GT2, black pour brown head, nose and taste super coffee, vanilla, wow

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle at RBSG. Thanks!

A: Pure black, cappuccino head. 

N: Oh goodness, itâ€™s all fusel alcohol on the nose. Thereâ€™s bourbon, caramel, coconut, vanilla, cocoa, and coffee underneath, but the alcohol dominates. 

T: Sweet to the point of cloying.

M: Oily heavy body, light carbonation, some alcohol burn.

O: Quite frankly, I am unimpressed with this one. I liked the original, but this is a hot mess that burns and makes me plead for relief. No thank you.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at Leightonâ€™s wedding get together. Huge thanks to Colin. Opaque viscous black pour with a lasting tan head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, cakey, boozey, toasted marshmallow, woody. Flavour is awesome woody coffee, vanilla cakey toasted marshmallow, little bit of bitter roast. Long lingering woody roast, cakey. Palate is full and velvety, moderate creamy. So so good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle pours out black topped with a small tan head. Nose is great roast malt chocolate coffee vanilla barrel bourbon and some sweetness. Taste is even better than the nose amazing roast coffee vanilla chocolate bourbon barrel and a nice end.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle shared by vacax at the RBSG grand tasting in Portland, thanks 

Black with a small tan head, some lacing. Aroma of dark malts, coffee and vanilla. Taste of dark malts, rich milk chocolate, vanilla and leather 
 
Very nice

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750mL bottle, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma brings out a great mix of lactose, bourbon barrels, and coffee. Flavour is similar, bringing out lactose, bourbon, coffee and light cocoa. Very complex and well-rounded. Many layers to this. Another excellent rendition of an amazing base beer from AleSmith.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ Zeebra 2015, small sample. Thanks to Podjebier. Dark color, short frothy brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, vanilla, cookie, slight spicy coffee. Soft sweet in taste, vanilla, creamy texture, slight roasty bitterness. Great stuff.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours a dark black color with a small white head. A big sweet fruity chocolate. The flavor is big sweet chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, sweet, sugary, smooth. Amazing.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared on the pre-Zebra bus through Zeeland morning tasting. Pours near black with a brown head. Aroma of rich bourbon, vanilla, oak barrel, molasses, coffee, dark chocolate and fudge. Flavour is light heavy sweet and bitter with a medium thick fudgy palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Excellent!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle big thanks to Colin!!!. It pours jet black with a decent tan head. The nose is rich, oily, decadent, coffee, some acidity, bounty bar, salted caramel, vanilla, fudge, toffee and cocoa. The taste is rich, oily, earthy roast, big coffee, dirt, vanilla, wood, boozy boost, fudge, salted liquorice, leather, warming, coconut and bounty bar

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle share by the Bois lover. Deep down with a small head. So inky. Nose is nice and rich. Toasted coconut, espresso and rocky road fudge. Taste is lush. Toasted marshmallows all day. Reminds me of vanilla dark lord. Smooth cocoa. Earthy. Just a touch hot. Oily and thick as all hell. Great stuff. A next level impy.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Colin! Pours oily black-brown with a creamy brown head. Big dark chocolate nose, plenty of burnt toffee, vanilla, wood. Big sweet flavor, creamy vanilla, lightly bittersweet cocoa, earthy hops, brownies. Full bodied, chewy, with fine carbonation. Warming finish, lots of brownies, vanilla pods, espresso, oily dark chocolate. Excellent.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared as part of a full bottled speedway vertical by Ben at his 40th birthday. Thanks for sharing all the killer beers! Drinking all of these side-by-side while becoming increasingly intoxicated drives home a few points. (1) they all pretty much taste the same -- I mean, the bourbon barrel versions are a little smoother with more bourbon/vanilla with the coffee in the background, but with the exception of regular Vietnamese I couldnâ€™t telly you which of the many variants I was drinking without looking closely at the bottle. (2) thatâ€™s fine, though, because theyâ€™re all pretty tasty. BA Vietnamese doesnâ€™t really capture the milky smoothness/sweetness of the non-barreled version, and tastes basically like (you guessed it) all the other BA Speedways.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black pour. Nose is coffee, bourbon, huge brownie. Taste is boozy brownies. Creamy mouthfeel.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle thanks to dogday! Aroma is incredible. Chocolate syrup, coffee cake, marshmallow, oak, and some dark fruit. Tastes so good. Chocolate cake, espresso, bourbon, dark fruit, caramel, cookie dough and light coconut. Silky, oily mouthfeel. Amazing beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Courtesy of umich03jm


Bottle: The aroma consists of dark chocolate, molasses, vanilla, coffee, light bourbon, nuts, and a hint of oak. It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a small tan head that quickly fades to almost nothing. The flavor starts with moderate dark chocolate, caramel, and vanilla. The finish has coconut, coffee, maple syrup, and bourbon. Itâ€™s medium-full bodied with soft carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel. Overall, this is outstanding and my favorite version of Speedway.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Black pour tan head. Unique coffee aroma. Taste is bitter coffee with some oak wood tannin finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From notes. Bottle. Nose is lightly fruity with a ton of chocolate, booze, and cake. Smells like BA speedway in that it is like a boozy chocolate cake. Fruitiness is higher than regular though. A touch more vanilla maybe. Taste is similar but seems a lot more forward with the chocolate and a big, thick, chewy mouthfeel. Pretty damn tasty. A bit big with some alcohol warning but always smooth.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared thanks to charule. Pours the typical dark brown with a light brown fluffy head. Aromas of chocolate coffee and fudge. There was also a ton of dark fruit in it. The coffee wasnâ€™t as pronounced as I would hope. Really great but I think I like the tabular BA speedway better.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This poured very dark brown to black with a beige head. Aroma was of lots of cake and fudge, very light coffee and mild barrel. Flavor was sweet chocolate cake, light barrel, marshmallow, and coconut. Another winner from alesmith.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours opaque black with a medium dark brown head that dissipates slowly and laces well. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, coffee, chocolate mocha. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter, bourbon, vanilla, some chocolate and coconut, coffee of course. Fullish body, creamy mouthfeel. A touch of heat.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from trade. Poured black with tan head. Light carb med thick bod. Aroma of sweet marshmallow. Tastes sweet choc.vanilla.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Missing this in a previous parallel test, so now it had to stand alone. Thank you Biggsbowler for leaving this in our fridge for further adventures in Belgium. When pouring, expectations rise and when smelling, you feel that there is good stuff going on. First sip. Holy shit! World class so it says great. Best I ever drank in the style. So incredibly balanced on all parameters with a delicate coffee tone that lingers when the chocolate mousse has settled. How do you make beer this good?!. Alesmith sets the bar and delivers rock hard.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle... This beer rocks!â€¦ Pours midnight black with a small, creamy, beige head. Good retention. The nose features deep-roast coffee, bourbon, vanilla, toasted oak and coconut. Full-bodied with a lightly creamy mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. The flavor is of acrid deep-roast coffee and fairly hot bourbon, flanked by an acidic, espresso and warming bourbon finish. Big thanks to newcigarz for providing this world class beer!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This was out of control amazing. Very balanced with strong coffee overtones. It also has a good caramel flavor to go along with it. It was my favorite for the 2014 coffee stouts

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared bottle. Thanks Reed! Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of bourbon, malt, coffee, and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, bourbon, coffee, chocolate, and some vanilla. Very nice. Have enjoyed all of the variants.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On its own I think this beer is pretty solid. Unfortunately, I tasked among a bunch of other great beers and it was forgettable. This is probably my least favorite Speedway variant.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black with an off white head - Sweet wood and vanilla aroma - Malt body with sweetness from wood and vanilla with bourboun - Lasting sweet finish from vanilla and bourboun with some alcohol heat in the back - This was good

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare 10th anniversary (aka Dangerous Bottleshare 9.0). Thanks Aaron! Pitch black pour with a dark tan head. Nose has butter scotch, vanilla fudge, bourbon and some lightly roasted coffee. Taste has coconut, butter scotch, sweet vanilla, molasses, super smooth, caramel fudge, syrup and light coffee. Delicious!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared @ dangerous bottleshares 10â€™th anniversary Thanks to Aaron! Pours black with a dark brown head. Aroma of big bourbon vanilla, coconut, lightly roasted coffee, green coffee, weak sweet spice, brown sugar, molasses, fudge, dark sweet fruits and chocolate. The has a huge amount of delicious coffee along with coconut, chocolate, sweet bourbon notes, vanilla, fudge, dark and bitter chocolate, brown sugar, vanilla, slight roast, liquorice and hints of heat. Full body and bla bla bla - This is so balanced and delicate. I could easily drink a bottle of this myself. My favorite speedway variant so far!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #9! Thanks alot to Aaron for brining this! Pours a pitch black with a small, creamy, brown head. Wow! The aroma has so much toasted coconut, bourbon, vanilla, roasty malts, coffee, oak, molasses, gunpowder, sweet licorice. Despite the big bourbon notes, the coffee is still very present! Taste is sweet and roasty bitter. Massive coffee and huge bourbon. The balance of the barrel character and the coffee is beyond anything else iâ€™ve tried. The best speedway variant that iâ€™ve had! Very pleasant. Huge, smooth body, medium carbonation. Dayum!!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at Dangerous Bottleshare 10th Anniversary. Thanks to Aaron for bringing this! Been looking forward to this like a child looks forward to unwrapping the big hard christmas present under the good ol tree. Ya know. Pours pitch black with a medium brown head. Aromas of coffee, vanilla, dark fruits, coconut, bourbon, cinnamon, roast, dark and light chocolate. Taste is subtle green fruity coffee, vanilla, cinnamon, subtle coconut, dark chocolate, milk chocolate, dates, molasses, roast, light licorice, oak, dry wood. God damn, this is good! Best of the night.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml. Mocha chocolate. Some bitter coffee. Very little bourbon. Thick and smooth. Good, but nowhere near BA kopi.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 ml bottle from Alesmith. Nose is dark bitter coffee,vanilla, graham crackers, and chocolate with just a hint of bourbon. Black with a medium cinnamon tan head. Flavor is chocolatey with some light coffee, vanilla, and a hint of bourbon. Really smooth and delicious.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: (On tap at the opening of Rip Current North Park): I'm going to get tired of describing the Speedway but not of drinking it. I've been waiting for this one for a while and without being disappointed, I'm simply surprised by its balance. The coffee doesn't seem more powerful to me than the properties provided by the barrel. The chocolate base is as good as the other versions and the roasted contribution is definitely present at the end of the mouth. Very solid without being exceptional and I can't give it 9/10.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at speedway tasting with 2 friends. Pitch black pour with a creamy tanned head. Dark roasted espresso, dark sweet chocolate, roasted walnuts, almonds, marshmallow, milky chocolate, bourbon, oak, bit of a spicy finish, vanilla, chocolate fudge, cookie dogue. Wow Incredible beer. And that as the starter!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On cask at the AleSmith tasting room. So lucky to be in SD this weekend to get to try this beauty. Bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, roast, more bourbon and more vanilla. Went back for multiple, multiple glasses of this one.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tasted during RBWG15 Grand Tasting. Black color. Thin brown head. Good lace. Wow. Awesome, fantastic coffee and bourbon vanilla aroma. Moderate roast. Bigger bitter taste. Moderate sweet. Light bit of warmth. Bigger body. Velvety, silky mouthfeel. Lighter carbonation. Fantastic BA coffee stout. I should have thanked whoever poured this much more profusely

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle - Big boozy bourbon and sweet coffee. Deep jet brown with a decent light brown head. Chocolate, coffee, bourbon and a sweet finish. Very nice.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours black with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, some bourbon and oak and vanilla, a lot of chocolate, faint coffee, and a good amount of sweetness. Flavor the same with a great blend. Thick texture. A really good beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: At Jacobâ€™s house with group. Delicious creamy thick brownie, creamy chocolate, great.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pour shared by Jared, Thanks! Black with low mocha head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, heavy brownie batter, toffee, toasted oak. Taste is quite sweet but somehow not cloying. Really tons of brownie batter without much conventional coffee. Rich complex and tasty stuff.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Vintage 2014. Thanks SaltyMalty!

Pours black with some tan surface foam, opaque. Smells awesome. Iâ€™m not getting a ton of coffee here, but the barrel offers up just what I love: nougat, mineral, vanilla, oak, cocoa. okay, give it some time and air - theres the coffee, and it is classic coffee with a touch of soil. I suspect then fresh itâ€™s more aggressive, but Iâ€™m uncertain I would like that. Flavor is spectacular as well with sweet malts, mineral, vanilla, bourbon, marshmallows. Full, silky body with nice low carb and a semi dry finish. Very nice, very fucking nice.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle generously shared by Tony. Dark brown pour with a brown head. All kinds of coffee notes, with dark roasted malts, and bourbon highlights. There is definitely an off note here. Good body with an average mouthfeel.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle - Pours dark black. Oak, bourbon, vanilla, and chocolate in the nose. Lots of fudgy and creamy chocolate with bourbon. This beer is the tits!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle (75cl)@The luxury tasting continues: Shared by Benzai: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Black beer with a small brown head.
Aromas of mocha, marzipan, alcohol hint, coffee, light smooth bourbon, chocolate, smooth delicious dark candy aroma while not to sweet!
Flavours of bourbon, mocha, marzipan, smooth soft spice tone, dark chocolate, roast, wood, cacoa, light liquor, light coffee tones, some dried raisin, some praline/bon bon and caramelised herbal roast.
Aftertaste is a mix of chocolate, mocha, light bourbon, chocolate spread, light coffee, light bitter and light spice.
Low carbo, creamy close to silky mouthfeel, full bodied.
Seriously delicious stuff!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ â€™The luxury tasting continuesâ€™ shared with Countbeer. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized dark brown head that diminishes quickly. Aroma is intens: bourbon and dark chocolate up front, roasted malts and coffee thereafter and lightly some alcohol. Taste roasted malts, bourbon, bourbon mixed with coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, slightly wood, sweet initially with bitter notes coming through occasionally as well as towards the end of each sip. Lovely soft, velvety texture, full body, medium carbonation. Absolutely delicious!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle thanks to Nick. Pours a very dark brown with beige head. The aroma is strong roast, chocolate, wood. Slick mouthfeel, rich chocolate, roast, vanilla, really enjoyed this one.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours black with a thin beige head. Nose is bourbon, vanilla, coffee. Flavor is chocolate syrup, coconut, brown sugar, oak, slight coffee/roast, marshmallow. Fantastic mouthfeel. Totally different beer than regular or even non BA Vietnamese Speedway.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2014 Bomber - jet black Speedway pour with mocha head and a sliver of retention. Nose is roast, coffee, dark chocolate and a hint of vanilla. Taste is an amazing balance of coffee, vanilla, whiskey, and roast. Has a light sweetness to it and that really brings it all together. Thick on the palate but not too oily. Simply awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: this is a very good beer with a fantastic barrel aged presence that adds another tasty dimension to the already great base beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dense black pour, brown head. Lots of coffee, charred oak, booze, chocolate and roast. Tasty, yet again.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Appearance: Pours black with a quickly faded head.



Aroma: Honey grahams, bourbon, milk chocolate.



Taste: Woody bourbon. Acidic dark roasted coffee, tannins, dark chocolate.



Mouthfeel: Full bodied, astringent, mild carbonation.



Overall: This is an amazing variation on Speedway Stout. One of the most balanced barrel aged versions Iâ€™ve had as well. The booze, the roast, the chocolate and the coffee were all in perfect balance on this batch. Tremendous work. Those who snagged the bottles oughta think twice before trading it away for some midwest shelf beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours jet black, with no head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, bourbon and vanilla. Taste is coffee, vanilla, oak, and chocolate. Really smooth and crazy drinkable. Great beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Etched glass. Weekly tasting. Pours black tan head. Nose/taste of bourbon, chocolate, roast, oak, coffee. Full body.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Black pour with fan head. Bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, coffee aromas. Flavors blend awesomely, bourbon vanilla and coffee.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On draft at the brewery. Pitch black, with a wispy brown head. Milk chocolate, brownies, bourbon, vanilla, smooth and silky, some dark fruit, raisin, and charred oak. Delicious and smooth. Great barrel aged stout, but most of the Vietnamese coffee is lost to the barrel.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Big thanks to Nick (nbutler11) for sharing this beauty. The 750mL pours with a murky chocolate brownie colored body that supports a tan head of foam. The aroma offers up dark roasted malts, marshmallows, thick rich dark roasted coffee, some burnt malts, chocolate brownie and smooth candy like bourbon notes, wow! The taste delivers rich chocolate brownie, smooth rich dark roasted coffee and soft pillowy marshmallows swimming in a thin stream of smooth bourbon goodness. Good gravy, this only gets better as it warms. Love it!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap @ Alesmith. Black pour with a thin tan head. Tons of bourbon, vanilla, and coffee. Sort of boozy, some chocolate syrup, and brown sugar. Some coconut, hazelnut, and charred oak. Flavor is a touch on the hot side. A lot of bourbon, hazelnut, coconut, and creamy coffee. Some caramel, earthy coffee, and spice. Moderate roast and marshmallow. Nice stuff.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Had this on cask @ Speedway Grand Prix. Much like the regular BA Speedway which I love. Bourbon was pretty present but didnâ€™t take away from the actual beer itself too much.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Keg at the brewery during the 2014 Speedway Grand Prix, 14/11/14 (but not part of the Speedway GP).
Pitch black with a dirty tan swirl.
Nose is rich roast, bourbon, coffee beans, spice, chocolate.
Taste comprises rich chocolate, coffee, light charr, spice, decadent bourbonics.
Full bodied, viscous feel, light warming alcohol in the close, never gets too hot.
Solid BA impy, the bourbon has taken quite a foothold though, will be good to revisit in a year or so when it has mellowed.
Bottle re rate 19/06/15.
Has improved quite a few notches since 3.9 rating on tao. More coffee, less booze, mellowed nicely.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On tap dark vanilla wood coffee licorice good dryness toffee caramel toasted soft

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 75cl, Vintage 2014, new exclusive American brew, with coffee, thx alot to Anthony for bringing this over!, very complex Stout, roasted/alcoholic/sweet and slightly woody/fruity, heavy, yet balanced, hazy, small head, very good brew, yet very expensive!, â€™Probably some aging will balance out the strong Bourbon presence...â€™

product_name: AleSmith Speedway Stout - Barrel-Aged Vietnamese CoffeeðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
[ Keg ][ 4oz x 3 ][ AleSmith ][ $3.50 ][ Taster ][ 11.15.14 ]

>> Three different samples over a two day period. Flatter ink black pour with wispy yellow lacing. Nose is more in the Creme BrulÃ©e vein than the Creme BrulÃ©e version of Speedway on tap today. But the main character in the nose after it warms is almost pure rum raisin. Taste is a bit sweet and almost all bourbon barrel forward with big rum raisin, flashes of soy. If you like the nuanced flavors of the Vietnamese coffee, they are gone, taken over by the barrel. I honestly donâ€™t see the point of this beer as it kills off what makes the Vietnamese version so good. Rich bitter chocolate? Gone. Balanced hoppiness? Gone. Vietnamese Coffee flavor? Gone. Soft palate- silky and rich with well integrated bourbon.

product_name: Hill Farmstead / Blaugies Le SarrasinðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: Bottle shared by Jeff - thanks! Dry, tart, lemony, and funky. This was really awesome.

product_name: Hill Farmstead / Blaugies Le SarrasinðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: Thanks Jeff for sharing. This is dry with yeast and plants,  lots of spice, earthy, and flowers. Great.

product_name: Hill Farmstead / Blaugies Le SarrasinðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: Bottle shared by Jeff, thanks! Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has bright flora and light fruits with some sweet light grains and a bit of grassy funk. Flavor has light tart fruits, funk and a bit of grass with some flora and sweet fruits backing.

product_name: Hill Farmstead / Blaugies Le SarrasinðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review:
11.10.2014, 0,75l bottle sampled @ ï¿½l & Brï¿½d Hill Farmstead dinner:

Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sour-ish floral, weeds, flowers, oak, yeast, sorrel, wet hay, bark, grass, citrus peel. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish, sorrel, oak, weeds, grass, yeast, citrus peel, flowers, bark, sap. Medium bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Nice one.

product_name: Hill Farmstead / Blaugies Le SarrasinðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: Gold pour, nearly clear, larger head, small to get of lace. White grape aroma, oak, citrus zest, Brett, barnyard. Lighter citrus and white wine up front, grape skins, Brett, barnyard funk. Light to medium body, good carbonation, long lightly tart finish. Sublime.
