product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750ml split at a bottleshare. Pours jet black with a tan head. Aroma: roast malts, chocolate, liquorice, coffee. Taste: moderate to heavy sweet & moderate bitter, chocolate, liquorice, espresso hints. Medium to full body, sweet-ish boozy finish

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Opaque black colour with medium brown foam with medium retention and good residue. Aroma of cocoa seeds, espresso coffee, coffee liqueur and burnt malts with notes of cake and nuts. Flavour of coffee liqueur, coffee with milk, dark chocolate, caramel, vanilla and burnt malts with notes of almonds or walnuts, cake and liquorice. Medium-high malty sweetness, high roasted bitterness, very light acidity, medium alcohol and very long aftertaste. Oily texture, medium-dense body and medium-low carbonation. An Imperial Stout with a roasted coffee character balanced with the sweetness of the malts, as well as various notes of nuts, cocoa and even some liquorice. Very complete, complex and liquor-like. A real pleasure.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
This beer was one dream for me. I mean is not available in my country and i thought i never drink it but in the end i find it somewhere. First of all the beer is the most expensive i have get in my life. 19 euros for the bottle hurt me little bit..
Anyway for such big price you expecting great things and for sure this beer dont disappoint you. The aroma is decent as usual for the style but the mouthfeel is amazing. Big coffe and sweet chocolate flavors fill your mouth.. The taste is very sweet and pleasand and the aftertaste has long warm direction. Also i notice there some kind metallic taste in the beginning of the aftertaste. The alcohol is not noticeable and the beer is very rich with soft carboration.
Overall a really great beer but to be honest i have drink better beers for the style that cost me few money. So if i had again the chance to get this beer, i dont know if i buy it with such high price.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Strong bold coffee flavor combined with heavy chocolate liquid.  Bitter roasted finish.  The body of the beer is strong and powerful.  The alcohol level is 12%!  Still very well done!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Copenhagen 14/10-2015. 50 cl from draft at SÃ¸ernes Ã˜lbar. 

Pours dark brown - almost black with small light beige head. 

Aroma is of chocolate and coffee. 

Soft carbonation and creamy palate. 

Taste is very well balanced between sweetness which is not too sugary and rich coffee bitterness. You can sense the quite prominent intensity from the alcohol. 

A very nice imperial stout you are forced to enjoy at a thoughtful pace.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: pours thick black, nose bubble gum, toffee and coco. on palate is bitter coco, coffee and u get bit of the alcohol. nice lingering bitter finish

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Foam small and quickly disappears. Chocolate, coffee aroma. Coffee notes, dark chocolate, milk chocolate.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: All of the leather tobacco coffee and dried fruits that you may desire for such a strong stout. Highly recommended

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial

More fruity aroma and more malty flavour. Sweet-bitter, balanced, alcohol hidden. Its reputation is justified.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Black as night,
Nose: malt, dark chocolate, coffee,
Taste: roasted beans, dark chocolate, a bit of coffee, incredibly delicious, perfectly integrated alcohol, simply supreme

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Black with a fine beige foam that is relatively persistent. Full chocolate nose then coffee, liquorice. Soft, full, creamy, round, balanced mouth... with alcohol (whisky style), roasted, coffee, fruit (black and dry), a little pepper but above all good chocolate, good African or American beans. A real "killer" because an example of perfect balance... with chocolate as the American star.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle from 2013 cellared till 2019. Black appearance. Aroma is sweet, cherry, malt and coffee. Flavour is coffee, sticky, malt, cherry and roasted.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
2013 bottle drunk in 2019.
Very thick creamy tan head stayed impeccably on a black still body.
Malt, demerara, dark fruit & toffee aroma.
Full bodied, smooth, & oily over the tongue with lightly carbonated clean back.
Dark chocolate, malt, sweet coffee, liquorice, vanilla & dark spirit tastes.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: On tap at at the Alamo Drafthouse Cinema, Ashburn, Virginia. Almost black in colour, with a slight, beige, head. Prune and chocolate sweetness, some liquorice, dense, charred malts, a touch of oak, leafy hops, leading to a warming, toasty, finish. An excellent imperial stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can. Very dark brown - almost black, average to large and mostly diminishing dark brown head. Medium to full, malty and sweetish aroma, light - some roastiness and coffee, faint dark fruits, light chocolate, light - some hoppyness. Body is medium to full, malty and  sweetish flavor, light roastiness and coffee, faint dark fruits, light chocolate,  light - some hoppyness, light alcohol. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish, light roastiness and coffee, faint chocolate,  light - some hoppyness, light alcohol. Nice one but way too sweet - way too much coffee for me. "Don't believe the hype".

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Beer in a bottle.
Bought in the Hoppiness store in Koper.
The best rated Imperial Stout ns Rate Beer so far that I managed to get... so let's see what kind of top Imp it is. Stout...
The fine aroma of coffee, chocolate and hazelnut that can be felt a meter from the glass...
The body is somewhat thinner, but I have already learned that from the few American samples that I have tried so far... My conclusion for now is that Americans obviously make thinner bodies than Europeans, which does not necessarily mean that it is worse, because such beers they drink more easily..
The taste is the same as the aroma, and I especially like the smell of "bajadera" that goes to your nose when you shake it in your mouth.
And so... it's not the best Imperial Flavored Stout I've tried, but it's quite decent, and I gave it that rating..

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Tap at Hopa. Oily black pour, beige head. Nose is big booze, coffee, roasted malts, molasses. Taste is thick sweet notes of booze, malts, chocolate, a touch of coffee. Medium to heavy body, soft carbonation. Very nice with a superb balance but somehow I expected somewhat more.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours an opaque midnight brown with a nice thick tan head.  Roasted malt and coffee aroma.  Taste is sweet roasted malt, molasses, coffee, and some mild bitterness near the end from the roasted grains.  Some alcohol warmth after the swallow, but not in the taste.  Excellent impy stout!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: An american, black, Imperial Coffee Stout with low brown head. Aroma is coffee, prune, light chocolate, light liqourice, light caramel, light hazel nuts. Taste is bitter and light sweet.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Black with off white head.  Coffee and malt aroma.  Malty body with a taste that takes over your mouth.  Long lasting finish

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel, nuts, wood, dried fruits, liquorice and a hint of soy sauce. Black with a tan head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Full body with average carbonation. Dry and bitter finish. Overall a very nice Imperial Stout. A Well balanced, warming and creamy brew.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Memories from the tasting during the epic panel that took place on September 14, 2019 :)

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
There are enough reviews below to describe what it is like. My questions were always "Will it be worth the price here in Australia?" and "Is it overhyped?". The answers are "yes it is" and "no it isn't" respectively. 
But at that price and because it is such a big beer, one is enough at any time. In fact the 440ml can is good to share after a nice dinner and dessert.

Draught @ Youâ€™ll Never Walk Alone, Kolding. Pours hazy very dark brown with small tan head. Clear aroma of malt, with botes og chocolate, dried fruit and yeast. Bitter, roasty flavour with botes of malt, caramel, coffee and yeast and touches og dried fruit. Estery and barrellike aftertaste with fruity and roasty  hints. Earming alcohol presence.
Very well balanced and nice to drink. Decent piecr of work.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: A very solid dessert, no need for anything else to finish the meal. Powerful taste, with everything from coffee and chocolate to dark basement feeling

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Black, opaque. Light brown, medium creamy foam, almost two fingers thick and excellent retention. Aroma of soft coffee, gaining intensity with temperature, cocoa and light liquor. Taste of coffee, roasted malts and chocolate, light liquorice and smoke when tempered, coffee-like finish, slightly dry and liquor-like. Oily texture. Low carbonation.

Given its fame and price, I expected it to be not richer, but more complex.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Brand black, semi thick, light/thin brown/beige foam. Aroma is pleasant intensive dark roasted malt, natural without anything sticking out. The taste is dark malt, some coffee/chocolate, incredibly balanced and easy to drink, hides the high alcohol (12%) well, really soft and round, very slight bitterness in the aftertaste. Really good beer, partly because it's so easy to drink and has a super nice balance.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: It's strong, it's intense, it's well-balanced, an imperial stout as we like them in the end. However, it's not the most thunderous I've had to taste, but it's very well done. Visual on a total black without foam, classic. The nose is powerful and full on coffee, chocolate, vanilla, hazelnut and caramel. The intensity is very present from the attack, with an excellent balance, the 12% alcohol structuring the stout well, supporting the aromas and giving character, the bitterness at 70 IBU allowing to give a touch of freshness necessary by aromas of strong roasted malts in the mouth. In addition to the aromas present on the nose, we find a hint of pepper and an alcohol that gives itself small airs of whisky. Very nice body in the second mouth with the chocolate which asserts itself while the pepper and the alcohol fall into line. On the back of the mouth and the finish, there are very beautiful aromas of coffee which are expressed with a bitterness which falls a little quickly all the same. Solid.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Black stout with a small head. Tasty coffee with a high alcohol percentage

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Smell of cocoa, roasted malt. Black colour, creamy brown head. Aroma of coffee, cocoa, vanilla, roasted malt, licorice. Bitter, sweet. Velvety palate. Soft carbon.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 10-month old can poured into a snifter.  Pours opaque black with light bubbling on the glass.  Soapy, 3-finger mocha-colored head.  Milder than expected aroma, with noted of roasted malt and coffee.  Full-bodied and lightly oily.  Long finish with just a touch of astringency.  Flavor of chocolate up front, giving way to a coffee note that is strong without being overpowering.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bomber, pours opaque black with tan head.  Aroma of malty alcohol and dark fruit.  Full body.  Tastes of chocolate, licorice and coffee.  Bitter slightly boozy finish.  Great stuff!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Aroma: lots of toffee, nut, coffee, dried dark fruit, licorice
Appearance: hazy dark brown color with small lasting brown head. beautiful lacing.
Taste: lots of toffee, nut, coffee, dark dried fruit, licorice, grassy hop, high sweetness, medium-low bitterness
Palate: full body, chewy texture, sweet finish, very low alcohol sensation for 12% ABV
Overall: It's really rich in flavors and almost like a liquid toffee brownie. Malty sweetness is higher than roastiness. Satisfying and easy to drink for a imperial stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Coffee aroma and taste cut through well. Nice dark color. Could use some more foam in the head to bring out the flavors even more. Some bitterness from coffee taste but relatively smooth for alcohol content. Smoother when coming from tap at Alesmith brewery than bottle.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Wow wow wow!!! Definitely a top 3 beer for me. It comes out in all corners of the mouth immediately. I am completely sold

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
2016 02 20
From tap to takeaway bottle 0.5 l, Kufle i Kapsle Wwa. Light brown foam, not too abundant, fine-bubbled, nicely circulating. Considering the alcohol content, it is quite durable, the ring remains practically until the end. The beer is deep black in color, completely opaque. Intense aroma, dominated by noble alcoholism, liqueurism, roastiness, coffee and a bit of dark chocolate. In taste, despite its powerful body, it is quite dry, strongly roasted. In the foreground again, intense roastiness, coffee, noble alcoholism, and a bit of dessert chocolate. Fullness is high, carbonation low, bitterness medium high, with a roasted-alcohol character. The drink is thick and full-bodied, leaves a long aftertaste of coffee and roastiness, pleasantly warms the throat. The only thing I would consider a flaw is a bit too strong alcoholism. Despite this, although I haven't had many ris until then, I can say that for me this is an outstanding beer, very rich and complex. 4.5/5

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Dark brown/black colour 
Light brown rich foam 
Sweet vanilla & is fragrance
Light carbonation 
Sweet coffee caramel flavor with deep bitter tones
Light cocoa flavor

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Exceptional stout, subtle chocolate and roast coffee bean notes. Easy drinking that. Keep delivering flavour on the back palate.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Black with a beige foam. Aromas of dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate and licorice. The same returns in the taste together with caramel, roasted malt and dried fruit. Oily mouthfeel. Deliciously good!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Pitch black, thin beige ring. Roasted nose with some soy sauce, a bit dry fruits. Quite cerealy as well. Roasty taste, some chocolate, medium bitterness, a bit herbal. Some gentle sweetness. Full body. Roasted, quite coffee like. Good one, but was hoping for more.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Tap at Mikkeler, Kastrup Airport. Black with a brown head. Aroma: Coffee, dark chocolate, liqourice hint of tobacco. Taste: Bitter chocolate with roasted notes. Lingering sweetness. Very nice oily mouthfeel.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Dark charcoal in appearance. Strong aroma of 
coffee and bittersweet chocolate. Initially acidic on the tongue, strong coffee, mild toffee taste. very appealing taste. Oily mouthfeel. Highly recommended.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle 0,331 ltr: Opaque black with an long dry bitter taste, major hints of dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate and minor hints of liquorice, caramel, plums and vanilla. The heavy abv is well hidden.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pored from can, medium head.  Heavy coffee and caramel smells.  Oily texture that covers the mouth.  Smooth and rich, no burn upfront or on the backside.  You get a little vanilla and almost hazelnut at the end.  It's more subtle than I expected after reading the label description on the can.  Very balanced and not heavy in the malt, coffee or dark fruit tastes that I expected.  They are present but not over powerful.  Really enjoyable and dangerous at 12% ABV.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Black with brown highlights and a hazelnut-colored head, compact, creamy and long-lasting. Intense, elegant and inviting aroma, coffee, chocolate, toasted malt, vanilla and sweet alcoholic warmth of fruit in alcohol. In the mouth, coffee dominates the drink which is full-bodied, soft, full and satisfying and with low carbonation. Alongside the coffee we find hints of milk chocolate, toffee and plum. Finish that balances the sweet drink, licorice, ash, hops and a very long alcoholic embrace. Exceptional!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pint can from Kill The Cat, London, UK. It pours dark brown, with a medium, brown, persistent, head. Aroma is chocolate, strong coffee, malt, toffee. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter. Body is full, carbonation is fine.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Tap at a Restaurant in Old Town San Diego, happy to find it here, they offered it in very small glasses - pitch black, oily, malty, some coffee, sticky-sweet. had to drink it rather fast, as the baby was crying outside. great ImpStout!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: This beer was a very good stout. Pitch black in color couldn't taste the alcohol.  Just a good beer to drink

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle at home during CL match Ajax Juve. For me the match was better than the beer, I am sad to conclude. The beer had very fruity elements to the coffee which I donâ€™t really appreciate, neither in smell nor in taste. The bitterness is there but overall it lacks the fullness and other flavors to make this a balanced and convincing effort. I find it hard to believe that what I had in my bottle is a top 50 beer. To each his own I guess or the trip didnâ€™t do it good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Itâ€™s a bit hard to judge without bias with such a hyped up beer. That said, I really enjoyed this. Big and unapologetic.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can at home. Black with a tan rim residing. Scent is brown sugar and toffee. Taste is big maple brown sugar toffee with a bit of pepper and a fair bit of sweetness of sugar. Finish is a bit sticky. Great.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Barrel at Reza's. Aroma of fortified wine with plums and cherries.  The taste some acid but then plum or krikon. Good balance with a rather dry finish then a nice little bitterness. Good

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
2 finger mocha coloured head.
Pitch black beer.

Aroma is specialty coffee, dark rye bread, dark chocolate, oats, toffee, hint of red berries, vanilla and toasted oak in a fantastic blend.

Taste is cappuccino, complex espresso, light coconut, oats, dark chocolate, vanilla, crema, charred oak and a light fruity note from the coffee.

Mouthfeel is unbelievably smooth with a perfect medium-low, soft carbonation. Very drinkable without ever feeling thin and while retaining a creamy feel. Plump body. Medium bitterness. Amazing pastry stickiness. Only small hints of alcohol (and they suit the beer) at this ABV, which is pretty ridiculous. This is how you do it. 

Overall: Thanks to BierCab Barcelona's amazing bottleshop, I finally managed to get ahold of this beauty. This is worthy of the hype! I do think it gets a tad bit too sweet at times and then too roasty at times, so the optimal balance isn't there but that is a bad case of nitpicking honestly. Fantastic brew.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Absolutely black color, small foam. Aroma is very complicated: coffee, roasted sugar, vanilla, some strong alcohol. Taste is strange, like strong wine, too much alcohol parts, too heavy. Not my beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Opaque black color with tanned head. Aroma has caramel, dark malt, coffee and nuts. Taste is malty sweet with long quite sweet aftertaste. Flavors of coffee, dark malt, nuts, dark chocolate, vanilla. Creamy smooth mouth feeling with very nice balance.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle at home bought from Beer Gonzo a few years ago. Poured jet black with a dark tan cap. Light coffee but heavier liquorice nose leading to a thick liquorice chocolate cocoa taste the coffee has died off. Lush

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can. Deep black with white beaded head. Almost cherry nose alongside chocolate and coffee. Super smooth.  Insane balance.  The coffee is subtle.  Nothing else is. Simply luscious.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Appearance: pwio is black, opaque, with a nice high, fine-bubble foam. The aroma is definitely coffee, often the addition of coffee in risotto makes the aroma go strongly espresso, while here you can feel a pleasant coffee. Then I detect notes of burnt toffee, dark fruits (dates, raisins), a bit of dark chocolate. The aroma is very complex. The taste is dominated by dark chocolate, supported by coffee, the roastiness is medium-high, but pleasantly coffee, remaining on the palate. The beer is very smooth, the alcohol is imperceptible, it lacks a bit of body. A very decent stout without flaws, but also without madness. Very good in every way, but unremarkable.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours black, large fluffy brown head with nice lacing. Aroma of roasted barley, coffee and berries. Tastes medium bitter, toasted barley, cocoa nibs, coffee beans, caramel and some dark fruits, minimal booze feel. Excellent mouthfeel, very creamy, lovely light carbonation, lingering flavours in its after taste. Excellent brew, very well balanced and that keeps quite typical without indulging in culinary experiments. Grand.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 22 ounce bomber bottle. Smells little bit like blueberries. Pitch black in color, No real head. Front taste like burnt sugar. Alcohol is well hidden but I can tell it there. Smooth on the malt. After taste is some what lingering. Heavy bodied. Very interesting unique. Cheers!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Aroma: loads of coffee mocha 10
App: dark brown head sudsy lacing 4
Flavour: smooth mocha and intense sweet malt balanced by carbon 10
Palate: super thick, amazing long finish 5
Overall 19

Sept 2017

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: The beer is almost opaque black with light beige foam. The aroma is dominated by milk chocolate, in addition to caramel, toffee, light alcohol, coffee beans. The beer is semi-sweet in taste, first of all bitter chocolate, you can feel dark fruits, caramel, coffee is felt mainly on the finish. The alcohol is well hidden, density is also ok. Very good RIS, but also overrated, I liked the base Ten Fidy much more.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Speedway Stout on tap from AleSmith Brewery in San Diego, CA. 

Aroma: I would give it a solid 4/5. Roasty and full of malt scent. Full body and thick. 
Appearance: Dark brown color with off-white head. Great retention. 4.25/5
Flavor: great roasty malt flavor, a bit more on the dry side compared to some stout. Better than standard. 4.25/5
Mouthfeel: I think drinking at tap in its own brewery helps. Full body and smooth, creamy with different layers of taste. Carbonation is spot on. With CO2, this beer is still very smooth. Not as smooth as the nitro stouts, but the CO2 retention is great (of course). 4.5/5
Overall: this is one of the best stouts I have tried (among standard stouts, not any barrel aged stouts). Personally, I would rate this beer a 17/20.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Almost black, viscose pour with a caramel head. Deep roasted malt aroma, with coffee, vanilla, pencil shavings. Texture is thick and the fine bubbles coat the mouth. Flavour of coffee, prunes, dates, molasses. Sweetness is well balanced by the lingering bitterness and alcohol burn.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: An imperial stout worthy of the name... black, round and sweet... soft chocolate on the nose and in the mouth... a round texture in the mouth... delicious

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 11.2-ounce bottle pours black with ruby highlights and a thick creamy brown head and residual lacing. Aroma: chocolate, coffee, molasses. Flavor: the above with figs, dates, prunes, raisins, brown sugar, toffee, caramel, ashtray (but in a good way), campfire marshmallows. Mouthfeel: medium- to full-bodied, bittersweet finish, somewhat oily.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 33cl bottle. Clear dark brown color, fine creamy brown head. The smell of coffee and chocolate. Taste is sweet, coffee, chocolate, pepper and toffee. Full body, lots of carbon dioxide.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Oh the smoothness, oiliness, soft carbonation, balance of everything, deep chocolate and coffee flavor. Love this beer!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Tap at Cafe Langebro, Copenhagen. Pours black with frothy brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, roasted malts, a little fruit, red wine, oak and vanilla. Some sweetness. Medium bitter finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pint can. Beautifully balanced flavor! I generally don't like coffee in my stout, preferring the roasted grain flavors. However, the coffee seems to enhance the natural grain flavors without dwarfing them.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle (around 750 ml): Literally black with a small and stable tanned foamy layer, moderate to solid nose of roasted malt and chocolate, dried black berries and some woody traces included; solid bitter-sweet flavour with a slight acidity, full bodied as expected and pretty smooth; lingering roasty and vinous finish with returning dried fruits and a gentle, but solid bitterness; followed by a soft alcohol-burn in the aftertaste. Yes, as good as expected...

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours very dark brown, small head. Aroma is toffee, praline, dried fruits, toasted malts. Flavor is good quality coffee, cocoa, sticky toffee, burned malts, cherries in chocolate, pralines. It's not too sweet, balanced and satisfying.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Pours an opaque brown-black with a shallow creamy beige head that fades relatively quickly to a cinnamon ring. Nose is coffee, chocolate, roasted pecans, smoke, and dark wood; very nice, and incredibly well integrated. Nothing stands out, everything is present. On the tongue -- that is simply the best textured Imperial Stout I have ever had. Silken doesn't do it justice. Velvet is closer. The taste is coffee, chocolate, and a very strong punch of smoked meat -- it's almost brisket-like in its heartiness. It's almost too much, but not quite; but that is a LOT of smoke. I'll be honest, I don't find it the be-all and end-all other people make it out to be, but it's damned good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and chocolate! Robust body, compact foam with medium retention. Roasted flavors, coffee and chocolate with a slight acidity at the end and a great balance in the alcohol! Excellent beer!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can 0,5. Pours pitch black with medium beige head and nice lacing. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, malts and brown sugar, alcohol is well hidden. Full body, flat carbonation and oily texture, yet smooth and silky. Very good

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Excellent beer. One of the best American imperial stouts. Coffee, chocolate, caramel. A true explosion of aromas and flavors.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Probably the best (including barrel aged) Imperial Stout I've ever had. The flavor character isn't overwhelming for a single flavor note, but the overall taste is amazing. One everyone should try!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Big bottle shared with few friends. Pours black with tanned head. Lots of coffee, roasted malts. Hint of dark chocolate and alcohol. Good one.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: From backlog. Bottle shared with Bergstaden, in Vista, Ca. Black with brown head. Roasted malts, Chocolate, coffee, vanilla and wood.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Speedway Stout is now available in 16-oz cans. I'd rather open the smaller quantity, because if I do not finish what I open it will go bad on me. But here is a caution if you open a can: Your beer will taste better if you drink it from a glass. I think the reason is you get more aroma from a glass than from the tiny opening in a can. The 16-oz version really does taste just as good as the 22- oz version, but only from a glass.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Dude holy shit this is fucking good. Poured like a thicc oil sludge. I could smell it as soon as i opened the can. High percentage but still super drinkable. So fucking worth 10$ for one pint

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Espresso, but more chocolate I think... vanilla and a bit of liquor... lovely bitter sweet balance... long chocolate vanilla finish...

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
9/14/18
With A watching iZombie and grilling steak. 

Poured from 16oz can into a tulip. Opaque black without much of a head. 

Powerful smell with tons of dark chocolate, coffee and roasty flavors. 

Taste is big and sweet with lots of silky chocolate leading and roasty coffee following. More mellow and more of a milk chocolate flavor than I was expecting for such a big stout and I really like it. 

Palate is medium thick and very heavy. 

Overall, a fantastic stout!big and flavor and very drinkable for the abv!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: With a 0.5l bottle from Mike. I had already heard a lot about this. I had even tested one mouth, but with coffee. Crazy good. So soft and velvety. You don't feel the degree. A bit like the Dark Side, but still different. There is something there. Dried fruit or, like leather, or even a tobacco smell. I don't know, but crazy complicated. I drank that one 0.5l almost the whole evening. Pour your mouth and wonder, pour your mouth and wonder. Impressive. Here in Latvia, we need to bake such a monster.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: At a tasting, many many thanks zvsn, small deep brown creamy head, opaqblack to brown colour, aroma of roastwd coffee, chillie and dark chocolate, intense dark chocolate flavor with coffee and dark bread maltiness, very nicely balanced. Excellent classic stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Dark ebony, slight rusty translucency. Thick skin of thick foam. Coffee-chocolate aroma, with a specific note reminiscent of anise. Good balance in taste, cocoa, slightly sour coffee with milk, dessert chocolate with raisins, a note of cream, vanilla and a slight roastiness, a distant echo of citrus and mild whiskey. Alcohol well hidden. Very decent stout, although at the same time typical and nothing surprising.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pint can, 2017 vintage. Strong roasted malt aroma with notes of chocolate, coffee, dark fruit and caramel malt. Pours deep brown with a thin toffee brown head that has excellent retention and good lacing. Starts with rich roasted malt, chocolate and caramel malt flavors as well as a full body and smooth, viscous mouthfeel. Finishes dry and smooth with dark fruit and strong coffee malt flavors that linger with roasted malt on the palate after each sip. Really nice imperial stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: The color is opaque black with a thick, velvety foam. The aroma is very cocoa, dried dark fruits, powerful depth. The taste is a bomb of what appeared in the aroma... an amazing beer... a base with a tapa of beer pulp at the level of ris. A model to follow without a doubt

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 12% but as smooth as a criminal.  Coffee overtones; Italian not starbucks.  If you find it HAVE IT!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Jet black, full flavor and aroma, lots of coffee, toffee, dark chocolate, dark fruit, big bitter With a grassy peppery prickly bitter. Full roasty, well hopped and creamy. Topper!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle sample at a tasting at tomer's place. Thanks zvsn! Opaque black with creamy brown head. Sweetish aroma with lots of coffee, dark chocolate, alcohol, liqueur and chill. The flavor is mild sweet with lots of coffee, alcohol, dark chocolate, liqueur, roast, a bit hot. Full-bodied. Excellent classic IS.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can 1 pint. Black with a creamy brown head. Burned caramel and coffee aroma. Smooth mouthfeel, almost massage for the tongue and rich. Very rich. Intense coffee flavour, great malty backbone, which not is too sweet, followed by a bitter finish. Greatly balanced beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours very dark, black for sure. Nice light brown firm head. Aroma of coffee licorice and dark malts. Taste is soft, whoa, a mouthful of taste. Coffee is definitely present. Bit sweet but perfectly balanced with the hops. Uh, see itâ€™s a 12% beer. That explains some sweetness. Long stay. Perfect beer!!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle shared at a tasting, 2016 ed. Pours dark brown-black with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, smoke and vanilla notes. Bitter-sweet, dark chocolate, ash, heavy roast, fudge, coffee, warming sensation but alcohol is not too dominant, superbly balanced flavors. Full-bodied, super smooth, really easy to drink for such big stout. Great classic RIS.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can. Poured an opaque black with a 2cm mocha dense foam head that retained very well and laced very well. Carbonation moderate, slow and very fine. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, milk chocolate, dried dark fruits and sweet caramel with hints of roasted grain, wood smoke, liquorice and alcohol; alcohol quite hidden. Taste is sweet with light notes of bitter roasted grain and touches of alcohol; alcohol quite well hidden; taste not as complex as aroma. Heavy body. Smooth with a syrupy mouthfeel and a very sweet finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 10.08.2018. 1 Pint can. Cafe RenÃ©, Haugesund. Black with tan head.  Very rich. Very strong. Lots of dark malts. Sweet vanilla. Coffee. Berries and green apples. Not much flavours of alcohol, even though its really a strong beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can. Pours pitch black with deep brown head. Coffee roast aroma. Amazing balance of roast and sweetness with coffee flavours all over. Amazing brew

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Good Imperial Stout, with a great aroma in which coffee predominates, but not so noticeable in the mouth, very rich, definitely worth repeating.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 2015 vintage, 0,75l bottle. Pours jet-black with khaki head. Aroma of roast, chocolate, coffee powder, licorice. Taste is chocolate milk, roast, hints of coffee and sweet licorice, caramel comes through in the finish, along with huge chocolate notes again. The essential imperial stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
2016 vintage. Appearance: deep dark brown/Black, opaque, with a low lying khaki head and nice lacing
Aroma: All malt, with rich dark chocolate, toffee, caramel, and light roast
Taste: Rich dark chocolate with a light toffee and roast. Beautifully balanced with just enough bitterness to balance
Mouthfeel: Medium bodied with a light creaminess and a light carbonation 
Finish: Roasted malt and bitterness lingers on the finish with a touch of dark chocolate 
Overall: Beautifully balanced for an imperial story with coffee. Profile is insanely smooth throughout, from aroma thru the finish. Dark chocolate and toffee are most prevalent, but a lightly roasted coffee note balances while remaining smooth. A light creaminess tonthe body helps blend the flavors together. This beer has 2 years of age, and stands upbas a top notch imperial stout

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Beautiful nougat colored persistent foam. Pleasant aroma of chocolate, coffee and a little licorice. There is dark bitter chocolate that is the main theme of this Imperial Stout, but in the aftertaste, it also develops a bit of bitter espresso coffee and a little English licorice as well as sweet hints of vanilla. The carbonation is soft and contributes to a good full taste in the mouth where all its fine shades of chocolate and coffee last for a long time.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can. Color: Black, light brown head. Aroma: Coffee, mocha, lightly alcohol. Taste: Darkoasted malt, strong notes of coffee and mocha, hints of molasses. Medium sweet, moderate bitter. Soft carbonation, bit creamy, full body. Slightly boozy at finish, bit warming mouthfeel. Great coffee Imperial Stout. I love it.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: I could drink this beer every single day of my life!! This has to be one of the best imperial stouts of all time. Coffee lovers would also appreciate the smell and aroma's bubbling up from the depths of the bottom of the glass. Even if you dont like beer you would be tempted to press your lips against the cool black glass

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: The beer has got a deep black colour with a steady head and smooth body.  Aroma of dark chocolate and coffee. Taste of warm coffee, roasted coffee beans, dark chocolate,  plums, barrel and cream. Smooth delicious finish.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Black, opaque, with low creamy foam.

In the aroma strong coffee, dessert chocolate, caramel, dark malts, light alcohol. Mega creamy texture, low carbonation, very thick. Intense dose of coffee, cocoa, caramel and roastiness. Medium bitterness and a hint of noble alcohol. Everything plays great together. Very good

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pint can into my teku glass.  Cola like looks with khaki dissipating head. Nose of unsweetened cocoa, coffee, charred malt.  Taste of coffee, cocoa, hint of dark fruits.  Flavors evolve as the beer  warms up.  12% abv is hidden very well.    Nice imperial stout

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Smells like Coors light, but somehow worse. Also there is a pungent urine like aroma. Other than that, this beer is amazing - it was as if I was drinking diamonds. Malty rich initial sensation, followed by a smooth taste of coffee and rye with a silky vanilla after taste. Pours black like Guinness, with a slightly shorter head. Purchased a tall boy.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: No light through, tan head. Nose is cherries coffee, and coco. The first impression across the tongue is powerful; fudge, coco nibs, esspresso, dark roasted chocolate malt, and currants with caramel. Finish shows a little booze, but wraps the tongue once again in a vhocolate, coffee, and malt blanket. One of the best deserts I have ever had. Seriously.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Smells espresso, chocolate, stout. Tastes like a stout should! Chocolate, coffee, toast light licorice, good through and through

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: On the occasion of the Poland-Senegal fling, you can drink something better. The canned version 2017. Wonderful roastiness, excellent coffee and sweet chocolate. Alcohol practically imperceptible, arch-drinkable, begs for another sip. The BA version must be catharsis, I'm starting to hunt

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours a nice black from a can, medium crema-colored head. Rather light coffee aroma and flavor, sweet, more like a coffee dessert than anything. Pretty good beer, expected more.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Sweet coffee with some raw coffee, espresso, chocolate, vanilla bean. Pitch black color with minimal sized brown head. Chocolate taste, roasted notes, cocoa, some milk and earth. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, creamy and bit oily. Fascinating, alcohol is nowhere to be found. Lovely. //can from Beergium

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Wow. A beer from the absolute top shelf, lots of taste. Nice aroma. Nicely full.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
1 pint can at Gyhallmantiâ€™s, bought at Hopt.nl. Appearance: pitchblack with medium sized beige head. Aroma: coffee, coffee grounds, fresh cut peppers, flambeed gon bao pepper sauce, hamkaâ€™s chips and roast. Taste: high sweetness and above medium bitterness. Notes of coffee, dark chocolate, some coffee grounds, sugarry sweetness and roasted malts.
Palate: full bodied, silky texture and soft carbonation. Very pleasant and drinkable imperial stout, but less complex that expected. Still a good coffee stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 50cl can split with SimonBlok. Courtesy of SimonBlok. Pours a pitch black colour with a medium creamy beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, slight mocca, molasses, syrup, candy sugar, hamka's chips, chocolate. Taste is medium to full sweet, moderate bitter with a moderate dry finish. Notes of coffee, roasted malt, mocca, chocolate, molasses. Texture is creamy, full bodied with soft carbonation

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Shared a bottle at home with a friend. The bottle is from 2015. It pours pitch black with a very thin tan head. The aroma is is sweet roasted coffee and chocolate. The flavor starts off with coffee then finishes with off with dark chocolate. This beer is super smooth for being 12%, this is definitely one of my favorite beers, will buy again.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: (âˆž-coffee (ad), > cara-choco, vanilla, black fruit, ~oilo-thick, > coffee (& length), cara, velvety, perfectly dosed)

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Finally got a can on my last trip to Vermont. A bit hard to get find in Canada. Pours an average size frothy creamy tan head and has a deep dark black appearance with some amber highlights. Decent sticky lacing. Alcohol smell is instantly noticeable. Aromas of dark roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, cocoa, some subtle notes of dry fruit, vanilla, a bit of resin. Flavours are also abundant, mostly with the chocolate and dark roasted malts, the usual coffee and cocoa are there as well. A little bit of a bourbon like finish on the palate. Smooth, slick and slightly oily mouthfeel. The alcohol is nicely hidden and just slightly noticeable, much more than aroma. Gets a little smokey the longer it sits, which is great. Should've picked up a few more cans, maybe next time. :P

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Aroma: Medium-high, rich, chocolate. Medium cherry, Light apricot. 
Appearance: Pitch black body, Small, brown head, Very fine bubbles, creme. lacing.
Flavour: Medium chocolate, tobacco, cherry. Medium bitterness. Light apricot, brandy. Dry, chocolate, cherry, apricot. 
Mouthfeel: Medium-low carbonation, very smooth. Medium warming. Full body.
Overall: Great chocolate! Cherry notes, Smooth, hides the alcohol.

2 X 750 ml bottles. :D

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Very concentrated beer, the coffee aromas hit hard. To drink in a group

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 1 pint can. Pours pitch black with a big tan head. Coffee, kahlua, chocolate, cherry, plum, big raspberry, blackberry, toast, vanilla, brandy, cherry liqueur, coffee, more dark berry stuff. Super smooth and super thick. Beautiful.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Aroma is very mild. Strong beer at 12%. Flavor is rich and smooth with a robust palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
2017 edition can. Pours pitch black with a one finger and half thick tan head.
Roasted coffee beans and vanilla aroma, not too powerful to be honest.
Taste is rich of flavours, very sweet but not sickening. Lots of vanilla, dark chocolate, some anise with a nice light bitter roasted finish with subtle burnt burnt caramet notes. Alcohol totally hidden.
Fantastic mouthfeel, thick, oily, sticky.
One of the best Imperial Stout around I had.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Darker in the glass, hardly any foam. A strong and rich scent. Toast, chocolate, alcohol and a little coffee. The taste and mouthfeel are thick and long-lasting. There are malts, coffee, caramel and appropriately alcoholic bites. A soft, oily feeling remains in the mouth. Great IS, one of the best.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bottle conditioned. Speedway Stoutâ€™s ominous, pitch-black appearance has become a hallmark of this modern-day classic. Chocolate and roasted malts dominate the flavor, supported by notes of dark fruit, toffee, and caramel. A healthy dose of locally-roasted coffee from Ryan Bros. Coffee, Inc. added to each batch brings out the beerâ€™s dark chocolate flavors and enhances its drinkability. Despite its intensity, Speedway Stoutâ€™s fine carbonation and creamy mouthfeel make it very smooth and surprisingly easy to drink. This beer ages very well and will continue to mature for many years to come.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Speedway Stoutâ€™s sinister black appearance has become a hallmark of this modern classic. Chocolate and roasted malts dominate the flavor, supported by notes of dark fruit, toffee, and caramel. A healthy dose of locally roasted coffee from Ryan Bros. Coffee, Inc. added to each batch brings out the beerâ€™s dark chocolate flavors and enhances its drinkability. Despite its intensity, Speedway Stoutâ€™s fine carbonation and creamy mouthfeel make it very smooth and surprisingly easy to drink. This beer ages very well and will continue to mature for many years to come.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: AleSmith has the best collection of  beers I think Iâ€™ve ever had. And Speedway is a major reason. If you like Stouts this is your choice. Not only is it a great stand-alone beer, it is also the base for some of the best riffs on a â€œstandardâ€ ...whether itâ€™s their barrel aged, coffee,  or other flavors, Iâ€™ve never been disappointed with a Speedway...except when the glass is empty.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Excellent stout! It has the deep and warm body you'd expect, very coffee and roasted flavour with a nice undertone of smoke. It has a beatiful appearance with very deep black and nice thin layer of foam. A true classic.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can. Black, smaller unstable brown head. Bose basically a Christmas pudding (booze, dates, vanilla, prunes, caramel) with loads of coffee over that. Oily texture. Taste follow the nose, but surprisingly less sweet than one would expect, this adding to drinkability. Very good.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Glad to see this one in a 16 oz can, since it's fantastic and 16 oz is about as much as I can take. It's a motor oil beer and has a great sweet flavor to mix with coffee. I wish they'd start selling them in 4-packs.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Excellent coffee stout. Tons of coffee in the aroma and flavor. Mouthfeel is good. Overall, excellent beer for something that's readily available.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Dark black-brown color with small beige head. Smell is chocolate and coffee. Taste is coffee, chocolate with a chocolate bitterness.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 75 cl bottle served in snifter. Poured black with two finger tan head. Aroma: dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, dark fruit, caramel, toffee, vanilla, marzipan, licorice, pipe tobacco smoke. Taste: roasted espresso beans, dark chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts, caramel, toffee, fudge, licorice, umami/soy sauce, burnt brown sugar, molasses, roasted bitterness, dark fruit, Graham crackers, marzipan, belgian praline chocolate, raisins, dates, plums, Cinnamon. Chewy mouthfeel. Full body with a very roasted and long bittersweet finish. Absolutely divine dark nectar and certainly lives up to the hype!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Black coffee, vanilla, plum, toffee, dark fruits. Sweet, sticks to the mouth, well-hidden alcohol. Very smooth, easy to drink. Low roasted bitterness. Overall great.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: When poured, pitch black, lots of body, initially the foam is medium-sized, fine-bubbled, brown in color. Without putting your nose to it, you can immediately feel the beautiful aroma when pouring. Roasted black coffee, chocolate, vanilla, plum, truffles, a nutty note, making a rather sweet impression, reminds me a bit of the well-known "Nutella", a lot of dark, sweet fruits, which I had a hard time associating. In taste, the beer is very smooth, perfectly composed. Sensations from the aroma appear again. Sweetness from vanilla, dried plum, chocolate, but rather the dessert kind, truffles, a lot of "dark fruit" sweetness, all this countered by balanced roasted bitterness. I have the impression that I have not drunk enough such wonderful beers to precisely determine what is happening in this drink. It is very light to drink, nothing overwhelms, although the salivary glands are constantly working under the influence of the wealth of flavors. Every next sip of beer makes your mouth stick with sweetness. Great beer :)

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 30A/20C). Bottle 75 cl (Batch unknown - BBF unknown - Bottled on 04/05/16). AROMA: medium-high coffee aroma, followed by low dark chocolate, slight licorice (plant), smooth alcohol. APPEARANCE: very dark brown to black color with ruby highlights. medium moussy brown head with good retention. leg formation. TASTE: medium coffee, followed by dark chocolate, slight licorice and faint prunes. medium bitterness with an almost dry and roasted finish. PALATE: full body and creamy. medium carbonation. no astringency. smooth alcohol warmth. OVERALL: a very nice imperial stout with coffee that would be even better with a tad less coffee.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: The beer is completely black, a small layer of foam is created, which lasts until the end. The armoat is dominated by very distinct coffee in the best possible edition. The second fiddle in the aroma of this beer is of course played by chocolate notes, toffee and a light nutty note. The aroma is very pleasant and complex, medium intensity. The taste is very strong coffee from the first sip, and therefore associated with it high bitterness and slight acidity. There is also a large dose of roasted notes. Saturation at a low level, which definitely speaks in favor of this beer. I can't resist the impression that for such a balling (after converting from the original gravity of about 27 degrees) the beer has surprisingly little body, which improves drinkability and can be deceptive for 12% alcohol, which is however perfectly hidden, and therefore hardly noticeable. Very good, solid and worthy of its brand.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle 0,75L. Courtesy of Kita. Four years old. Black color with some amber hue, rather small, frothy, light brown head. Amazing aroma of dark fruits, liquor/brandy, caramel, vanilla, dark chocolate and suprisingly not much coffee. First thing I noticed when try, was a full bodied, smooth, oily texture with very low carbonation.Taste was light sweet/light bitter at the beginning with a lot of dark fruits and liquor notes. Bitter/sweettaste remain the same until the end. Dark fruits were slowly disappearing and coffee & dark chocolate comes out at the end of the sip. Some warming alcohol notes with chocolate in the long lasting aftertaste. Excellent beer with great balance! I really enjoyed in every sip! Great brew Alesmith and great birthday gift, Kita!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Black with ruby â€‹â€‹flashes, brown foam quickly falls. The aroma is sweet, intense, after warming comes out a lot of dark fruits, then vanilla, generally very pleasant. The taste is amazingly balanced, the beer is sweet, very smooth, quite thick. Here you can already feel the coffee, which after a while leaves a great, long, sweet aftertaste. In my opinion, a bit too high saturation for this extract, after warming the alcohol is delicately noticeable, generally well-arranged. At the end very delicate bitterness. Very good, definitely sweet and drinkable beer, beautiful texture, the aftertaste is a masterpiece.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Bottle 750ml at home. From Bierkompass 2012-11-28. Pours black with beige head.  Surprisingly good condition. Roasted malts, sweet licorice,  chocolate, alcohol, caramel, dried fruits. Mild aging in taste. Full oily body, smooth carbonation. 

Original rating 9-4-9-4-16  from bottle 750ml at O'Connell's Tampere 2012-05-14.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: In can. Huge aroma with loads of roast malt and caramel. Very full bodied and rich, the alcohol is prominent but kept in check by the massive malt and hop flavour. At 12% this is one to sip and enjoy, its almost a meal in itself!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Can. Dark black color with a brown head. Malt aroma. Malt coffee slight bitter finish. Heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Good beer. Body, density. The cocoa and vanilla are sweet but not excessive. Some alcohol aftertaste. Good beer but not for what we pay for it in Spain.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bought in Chicago in a 0.5l can. Nice dark brown, good roasted malt. Nice taste of chocolate and cocoa.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Great imperial stout. Fully, oily, soft body. Lots of coffee, sweet dark fruity and dark chocolate. Touch of herbs and licorice. Maybe barrel-aging could bring a little extra to it.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750ml bottle. Pours black, beige head. Aroma is roasty, ashy, coffe, mildly smoky. Taste is roasty, coffee, some woody notes, ash. Hops and coffee in aftertaste. Full bodied, below average carbo. Really well balanced. Superb, what an amazing stout!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Since I long time that I was looking for this beer. Finally, I have found this bottle at the sterk grocery in Amsterdam, in can version. I have tried this beer yesterday and it was my last beer and I have taken a long time to drink it alone and it was really the beer to go to the bed and looking for the stars. It is a classical but powerful imperial stout, better to drink not cold or a little.The body is, as usual, a powerful black body, thin and creamy white foam, the carbonation is low but it is normal for the style. The taste has directly notes of coffee, at the beginning, it is a dry coffee and step by step, it develops notes of mocca, roasted malt, vanilla, hop but hidden by the malt, dark chocolate, the alcool is perfectly hidden, giving a Â«warmÂ» sensation, liquorice side, creamy and all these aromas gives a powerful sensation at your body, the kind of beer to drink with time and with a dessert of chocolate.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
From a can.
Dark, almost black with brown foam.
Clear coffee in the aroma. Also malty, toasty, a bit of alcohol.
The taste is rich, smooth, bitter without being dry. Again, the coffee dominates, and it is delicious. Long aftertaste, easily accessible beer despite the high percentages.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Appearance Black opaque body Two-finger-high dark granular foam with dense surface Duration medium
Aroma Roasted malt, soy sauce, raisins, dark berries, chocolate aroma
Taste Strong caramel sweetness at first, followed by coffee and dark chocolate aroma, and finally vanilla raisin sweetness
Aftertaste Obvious dark chocolate flavor bitterness and astringency Slight caramel flavor aftertaste Duration long
Taste Thick body Weak sandy mouthfeel Strong bitterness Weak alcohol Weak but perceptible astringency

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Jet black with nice, frothy, tan, not very solid head but enough for a fair lacing. Nose full of chocolate with a bit of coffee and vanilla. Same in taste where, chocolate flavors, come first. Sweet start with a bit light bitter finish. Very well balanced, alcohol perfectly hidden. Almost full body, low carbonation and oily texture make a perfect mouthfeel. Very good!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Black color, beautiful, the same fine foam, persistent. Chocolate coffee taste great, if the price was lower I would drink it regularly

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Aroma: Lots of coffee, roasted malts. Appearance: Black, oily, medium, beige head. Taste: coffee, coffee and even more coffee, bit of dark chocolate, no alkohol, low carbonation, full bodied. Overall great beer!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Almost black in color, abundant beige foam. Chocolate and delicate liqueur notes in the aroma. Chocolate bomb in the taste, the aforementioned liqueur accents. Quite low roastiness, sweet, fantastically smooth. Drinks wonderfully. Alcohol unnoticeable. If it weren't for the price, I would reach for it regularly.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
16oz canned 2017 12% ABV 70 IBU poured into sauvin pitch black with 2-finger tan head that dissipates rather quickly with fair amount of lacing. Light coffee and chocolate notes over base of roasted malts and dark fruits. Coffee flavor is lost in taste which is a shame since they went to the trouble of adding â€œwith coffeeâ€ on the can! Taste of chocolate and molasses over roasted malts and hops. Well balanced beer, not too sweet and not too bitter. Good job of masking alcohol content in nose and taste!
Buy again? Yes

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Tried this beer a few times, but first time i rate it. 
Can. Pitch black with tiny tan head. Nice aroma of vanilla, chocolate, coffee, sveske, complex and inviting aroma. Taste Liqorice, vanilla, coffee, chocolate. Hidden abv. Nearly as much power as i was expecting according the aroma. Oliy texture and well cabonated. 

Nice beer!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 09-09-17 // taster, draft. At Beavertown Extravaganza 2017, London. Pitch black. Aroma of choclate sweetness, roasted malts, coffee. Smooth full bodied drinking. Great!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle thanks to wombat23. Pours black with a dark tan head. Aroma is coffee, roasted grains, heavy cream, plum schnapps. Taste is mildly bitter with smokey, roasted notesâ€”trends lightly sour at the finish. The alcohol is mostly disguised but not completely, feels a bit raw around the edges. This sat in the cellar for about 8 months, maybe a bit more time would have done it good. Body his thick and heavy, carbonation is mild. Overall, quite good but verging on overwhelming. A candidate to age and rerate.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Dark brown, clear, thick head. Aroma: coffee beans, chocolate, malty sweetness, lucorice. Full to medium body, high sweetness, medium bitterness. Lots of coffe, but it doesn't cover everything; malty base, quite clean, chocolate, well hidden alcohol, bit spicy finish. Quite complex and balanced.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Clear dark brown with an average beige head. Lots of roasted malts, cocoa powder, dark chocolate, coffee, some vanilla, caramel, creamy, bitter.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 1 pint can. Appearance is opaque jet black with a thick head of tan froth, which gradually dissipates into a thin ring and doesn't regenerate on swirling. Aromas are rather muted, but dark chocolate and roasted malts are prominent, with coffee and dried dark fruit in the background. Tastes are similar, bittersweet chocolate and roasted malts upfront, with dried cherries and prunes, then later the drier and more bitter flavours of coffee and roasted malt. Mouthfeel is amazingly creamy and rich, like hit chocolate or cappuccino. Some booziness in taste, like bourbon despite this not being a barrel aged version.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: The beer looks incredibly beautiful and noble. Very dark with a constant thin coffee foam. The aroma is pleasant, coffee-based. The taste is bitter chocolate, coffee. Slightly dries the mouth. As a result, a classic thoroughbred stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours nearly black with minute head. Aroma is chocolate, plums and roast. Taste is chocolate, dried fruit and caramel. Very sweet taste, but a very smooth finish. Not sure if this is a dessert stout or not, but it is an elite beer.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Aroma is heavy roasted malty with loads of strong coffee and licorice. Taste is lovely of course, chocolate, sweeter malts, lots of coffee. Very well balanced stout that is bold and powerful but never lets anything go totally apeshit on you. Superb!

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
ABV - 12 IBU - 70

.Appearance: Jet black, creamy tan head. 

.Aroma: Roasted coffee, roasted dark malt. Dark fruits, sweet chocolate, caramel , burnt sugar. Smells sweet, with a slight booziness - almost like a bourbon barrel aged beer. Very nice aroma. 

.Taste: Fresh coffee bean - a very nice refreshing coffee scent, not overpowering. Notes of roasted malt, milk chocolate, raisins, caramel, burnt sugar. Strong roasted flavors work into a subtle lingering bitterness. Just enough bitterness to balance out the sip. 

.Mouthfeel: The aroma and flavor of this beer are top notch, but what truly stands out here is the mouthfeel. Very full, rich and creamy. Almost chewy in a sense. Just awesome. Easy drinking with a nice warming feel. 

.Overall: A.

.Bottom Line: Top notch. Complex flavor profile, not overpowered, but enhanced with a nice amount of roasted coffee. A very rich, velvety mouthfeel brings the beer to another level.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Black with a big off-white head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee and vanilla. Taste is dark chocolate, liqurice and roasted malt

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Complementing the profile of the note.
Foam abundant, fine, quite durable, decorates the glass. Color black. Aroma, dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, rather poor with alcohol piercing. Taste high dark chocolate, coffee, fruity sweetness and malt fullness, liqueur notes with alcohol piercing. In the structure smooth, medium full with marked bitterness, liqueur alcohol piercing but not strongly, barely noticeable which at 12% commands respect. Very Good Beer but without this effect of tearing D... .

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 16oz can, Total Wine SDL. Man is this good. Pours black with brown edges and a thin, creamy, tan head with some lacing. Dark chocolate, sweet malt, coffee, licorice, toffee. Full bodied, very low carb. Alcohol is extremely well hidden. Long, roasty, sweet chocolate finish. Everything in balance, delicious, awesome.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pure black pour, brown head. Smells very rich, strongly roasted malts, coffee, some spice. Full bodied, very smooth and creamy, very low burn from alco but gentle warming sensation. Great, too easy to drink, long and sustained aftertaste. Not over the top at all, balanced. Would drink again.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
437 ml can, black with beige head.
roasty, coffee, dark chocolate, dried fruits, 
full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonisation, medium to heavy sweetness(lasting), light bitterness, warming, some alcohol, but it is quite well integrated. Overall really well balanced.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
473 ml can at home. Pours pitch black with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt with lots of coffee along with molasses, hazelnut, dark chocolate, some dark fruits, vanilla and some booze. Full creamy body with a soft carbonation a medium to medium heavy sweetness, a light bitterness and some noticeable alcohol. Flavor of sweetish roasted malt, brown sugar, molasses, chocolate, lots of coffee, faint hints of alcohol. Finishes lightly sweet and roasty with light herbal earthy notes. Overall very well balanced, full of flavors while nothing stands out in particular, very enjoyable brew.



Aroma: 8 
Appearance: 4 
Taste: 8 
Palate: 4 
Overall: 17

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: From the handy pint can. In the glass, pitch black like its packaging, lovely creamy foam that lasts a long time. Dark chocolate on the nose, roasted. In the mouth, incredibly powerful, creamy, liqueur-like. Coffee, chocolates, almost drinkable, milky. Heaven, this is a delicious thing.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours black with creamy head. Aroma: beautiful aroma of coffee perfectly balanced with dark chocolate, a touch of dark fruit, vanilla and subtle roastiness. Taste: here again a perfect balance of coffee, chocolate, vanilla and subtle roastiness. The texture is just perfect, with the beer being pretty full bodied but smooth and easy to drink (no way there are 12% ABV). Great.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Smells and tastes of strong, burnt coffee with chocolate in the background. Alcohol is heavy. Like licking the bottom of a burnt coffee pot. Good, but not sure it lives up to the hype.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Black-brown opaque beer with abundant beige foam. Wonderful aroma of coffee, besides chocolate, caramel, roasted malt and toffee. In taste similarly in the foreground coffee, then roasted notes, chocolate, a bit of caramel dark fruits. Complex taste, well balanced. Full, tasty beer. Super

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: On tap at Beer Temple. Black colour, beige-brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, fudge. Flavour is thick, lovely roast, coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, light hoppy. Full bodied. Great RIS.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours dark brown with a brown head. Aroma of vanilla, coffee, oak, cola and licorice. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Tap @Beer Temple, Amsterdam.
Small, frothy, beige head, black colour. Aroma: dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Sour taste with strong dry/coffee aftertaste and a bit of spicy/alcohol. Full body, long finish, thick, soft carbonation. Fantastic.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Drinking from the tap at Jabeerwocky

Class. The smell is overwhelming and full - a strong chocolate-candy box smell. The taste is quite complex but well-organized, there is not too much stout sweetness here (that's good) but somewhere there is some lactose (?). Terribly chocolatey, full and pleasant. You can't feel the alcohol at all, but you have the impression that it is somewhere enhancing the impressions. You drink it like a really good and tasty liqueur

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Very smooth, with a beautiful creamy head. Lots of chocolate aromas, good, roasted coffee, sweetness and full feel. Noticeable note of soy sodium, for me it blends well and does not bother at all. Wonderful sweetness and smoothness, very balanced and tasty.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can from Carmen24, Gliwice. Great. Thick, full-bodied, has a super non-Ris note, floral, powdery. Alcohol hidden, coffee delicately plays with the rest perfectly. Damn, what a delicious beer this is. Brilliant Ris, everyone should like it.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Lots of coffee beans both in the aroma and in the mouth. Maybe it lacks a bit of complexity to get to the top, but for a coffee stout it is excellent

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: In the aroma dark and milk chocolate, slightly roasted, coffee, very pleasant but not very intense. Almost black color, fine foam, nice, persistent. In taste quite dry, strongly roasted but also chocolate. Dense, medium bitterness, low carbonation. Alcohol perfectly hidden. Very good beer, like RIS from stone nothing can be done without a barrel.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle @ home. Dark brown, slightly cloudy with ruby â€‹â€‹red reflections. Beige foam, fine but not very persistent. Intense, fine and very complex aroma. Instant coffee, chocolate, bitter cocoa, vanilla, liqueur, dried fruit, almond paste. Sweet and pleasant taste at first sip, bitter from hops, coffee and roasting, none of which prevails. chocolate, marzipan, and Moroccan. herbaceous on the very elegant, long finish. Full-bodied, warm, slightly carbonated, incredibly rounded. Perfectly balanced and harmonious

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
It smells sweet and coffee-like, associations with tiramisu, roastiness, chocolate and once again intense coffee.
The taste is mega sweet, coffee and even more coffee, then dried fruit, licorice.
The bitterness is low, roastiness at a moderate level, smooth and creamy body.
No alcohol in the taste, it is drinkable and mega mild for such a stout.

product_name: AleSmith Speedway StoutðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Can at home. Pours black with a tiny tan head. Aroma has cocoa and bitter coffee. Taste has cocoa, vanilla, coffee and licorice. Nice and smooth on the palate. Really nice.

product_name: Hill Farmstead AnnðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: Shared bottle.  Pours a cloudy gold with a smallish white head.  Aroma of fruit, honey, floral, and barrel.  Taste is wine, barrel, honey, yeast, and floral.  Wow!

product_name: Hill Farmstead AnnðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: 750ml bottle pours out hazy golden topped with a white head. Nose is soft floral notes spice and barrel. Taste is more of the nice soft notes very nice and happy to have finally tried this one.

product_name: Hill Farmstead AnnðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review:
Earlier Rating: 4/17/2015 Total Score: 4.3
Bottle shared by Al, pours vibrant and hazy golden color with small to medium white head. Aromas of bright lemons, blood oranges, oak, vino funk, sea salt, grapefruit and tangy minerality. Medium bodied. Been wanting to try this little skank for years now. A little underwhelmed for hill standards but still a very nice beer. Probably not in my top 10 from these guys but still epic juice.

product_name: Hill Farmstead AnnðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: This beer is just amazing. An incredible complexity in taste! Starts of sour but ends sweet and soft . Probably one of the best beers I ever had.

product_name: Hill Farmstead AnnðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: Glad to cross this one off the bucket list. Shared at HF. Golden pour, baby finger sized white head, no lacing. Aroma of green grape, white wine, oak, apricot, white peach. Taste is something else, oaked white wine, apricot, peach, light cellar notes, white grape, hay, picking up a light honey-sweetness and very light funkiness. Lighter body, carbonation holding up pretty well.

product_name: Hill Farmstead AnnðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: Pours yellow with a small head, aroma of fruits, barnyard, sulfur, brett, pickles, flavor is sour, barnyard, brett, pickles, wood, medium bodied

product_name: Hill Farmstead AnnðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review: 2015 375ml bottle on site right before FoFA, couldnâ€™t believe this was on the bottle list...pretty damn excited. Clear golden with white head. Delicate, incredibly dry, long finish. An amazing combination of green grape skins, chardonnay, yeast, hay, straw, light oak, light apricots and peach, somewhat herbaceous and then incredibly dry. Moderate carbonation and full body, dries out with flavours further developing revealing more deliciousness. On top of that easily drinkable. Great beer.

product_name: Hill Farmstead AnnðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review:
*5/27/2014
750ml bottle poured in a Hill Farmstead taster. (bottle share)

A~ super hazy glowing yellow, not much of a head, and no lacing at all.

S~ tons of fermented honey, white grapes, vinegar and white wine. super strong acidity unlike any brew iâ€™ve ever smelt.

T~ wow! this is crazy unique! pretty much follows the nose with more saison aspects. black pepper and bready yeast. all ending with a strong lemon vinegar tartness.

M~ not very carbonated but thats probably because the sample was saved for me. otherwise super smooth with the texture of dank lemonade. if this was freshly cracked iâ€™m sure this would have had a nearly perfect score.

O~ definitely the most unique brew iâ€™ve ever had the pleasure of experiencing! iâ€™m hoping this is still being done again but iâ€™m sure it wonâ€™t be the same, this is just too crazy! hopefully its the same kind of wine barrel as well, the white wine/grape aspect is unreal! i seriously hope to have another chance to try this, 2 ounces was not enough!

EDIT FOR BATCH 2:
a lot brighter and way more citrus than batch 1. honey and white wine still very forward. so delicate and amazing all around!

EDIT FOR BATCH 3:
just wow! everything you could love about Ann is here! i had to rate this higher!

product_name: Hill Farmstead AnnðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Saison / Farmhouse / Grisette
product_review:
