product_review: Bottle @ Ulfborg Semi White Whales Tasting 2019. Black body with a small light brown head. Roasted malt, chocolate, whisky, liquorice,

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle. Pours black with a very tiny beige head. Aroma of wood - a bit charred, quite some barrel - heavy, loads of licorice, slight dark chocolate. Quite bitter roast, loads of sweet barrel, slight touch of ryebread, loads of licorice, some good chocolate. Great stuff.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle @ Ulfborg white-whales tasting. Aroma of roasted, toffee, chocolate, bourbon, liqourice, charred oak. Heavy sweet and moderate bitter with lingering roasted notes. Full and creamy. Great.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Quite awesome, so intense with bourbon, vanilla, cocoa, some alcohol. Full body, very huge with a soft carbonation, sweet and intense, again bourbon and vanilla....amazing brew fro sure!!

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750ml bottle pours out black topped with a small tan head. Nose big barrel notes roast chocolate maple sweetness ash heavy. Taste is more of the nice sweet chocolate vanilla coffee booze barrel notes and some ash.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle at share. Dark brown, kind of flat. Aroma is boozy, roasty, light chocolate. Silky smooth, chocolate, sweet

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Whalez Share @ Browariat. 12.01.2019

Dragon-smell disproportion. The aroma is very poor for such a beer. The taste, however, blows me away! Vanilla, chocolate, cream cookies, bourbon, dark fruits. Depth, complexity, class!

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle at Tide's Pitch black with brown head. Huge rye, liquorice and roast. Oaky bourbon, some light vanilla, almost smoky. Good stuff!

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750ml bottle from a trade. 2017 batch 1. Super balanced, roasty and woody with some oak, bourbon, hints of smoke, loads of licorice, rye, cocoa, some vanilla, smoke and toffee. Really well done and just awesome barrel aged imperial stout. Everything is in almost perfect balance here.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Sample from the bottle at Tide's, Helsinki. Color is dark brown with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Dark chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. Some bourbon and vanilla. Great.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle from a friend. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, smoke, chocolate, bourbon, oak, dark fruits, nuts and licorice. Bitter finish with roasted malts, chocolate, licorice, oak, bourbon, coffee, dark fruits and nuts. Exquisite imperial stout.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle shared by my roomie Matt Parks. Aroma of roast, cocoa, vanilla, oak, beer, barrel and time. Flavor is cocoa, bourbon, vanilla, roast, beer, barrel, and time.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bourbon barrel aged imperial stout by this highly acclaimed brewery in Missouri, thanks Tom for sharing at Bumb3r. Some pale off-white bubbles here and there but otherwise close to no head, black robe with hazy copper-hued edges. Intense and deliciously fragrant bouquet of chocolate liqueur, old madera, wet oak including the vanilla aspect, coffee cream, hazelnut oil, whisky, beef stock, caramel, touch of soy sauce. Sweetish, concentrated onset with umami mixed in, as sugared gravy with raisins, softly carbonated, very full, vinous, oily mouthfeel. Deep and thick nutty and toffeeish malt body with softly roasted bitter tail drenched in wet oak tannins and long-stretching, heating bourbon-coloured booziness; ends very rich bittersweet and complex. An astonishing 'biÃ¨re de dÃ©gustation' indeed, worth the hype that seems to surround it.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pure black with fine mocha-colored head. Dark aroma, pure chocolate, mocha, coffee, chocotoff, barrel. Beer built up in multiple layers, you taste something new every time. Beautifully balanced. Truly stunning. Splendor of a beer.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle at bumba. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, cherry, fudge and booze. Taste has thick bourbon, cherry, booze, oak and caramel fudge. Boozy finish. Very nice, also quite boozy.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours black, small tanned ring of foam. Smell is thick, sweet, dyrupy, roasty. Taste is full, roasty, sweet. Boozy, bourbon, oak. Tad too boozy for me. A really nice beer nevertheless.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours black with low brown head. Aromas of bourbon, roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, dades, nuts, muscavado, leather. Taste has enormous full bodied creamy notes of bourbon, vanilla, dark chocolate, roasted malts, muscavado, leather, coffee, fudge, alcohol. Mouthfeel is brilliantly creamy, velvety, smooth, full bodied, sweet, low carbonation and mid bitter finish ! Wow!!!

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, roasted nuts, muscovado sugar. Taste is- I lack words. So insanely well balanced. All here: chocolate, muscovado sugar, caramel, bourbon, barrel notes, roasted malt, slight vanilla... all balanced to complete perfection. Mouthfeel is full bodied and velvety with low carbonation. Just wow.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
9 5 9 4 18
Bottle shared at Not Breaking The Bakeâ€™s Tasting. Black with a small brown head. Aroma of oak, bourbon, dark chocolate, roast, vanilla, coffee and light coconut notes. Flavour is light heavy sweet and bitter. Full bodied with a thick texture, big alcohol warmth and soft carbonation.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Rami Rami is drinking a Beer : Barrel : Time (2017) by Side Project Brewing at Mikkeller Bar Warsaw

Taste >> aroma. In aroma delicate, a bit bland, and in the mouth it appears nicely chocolate-coffee-barrel, smooth, sweet. Makes an impression. Rami Rami is drinking a Beer : Barrel : Time by Side Project Brewing at ul. Anielewicza

Better bottle. Beautifully balanced, barrel-brewed, balanced, super hidden alcohol, sweet but not too sweet... yummy I leave a rating for this better bottle :)

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: backlog. What Cory and the rest did is masterful - no additives, excellent base, perfectly selected barrels and time. They came out with the best non adjunct ba stout I've ever had the pleasure of drinking. The aroma and taste are amazing chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, accents of whiskey, coffee, incredibly thick, the alcohol slightly warms in the throat. wow! wow!

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Opaque black color, beige foam. 

Very intense aroma, extremely rich and complex. Broadly understood chocolateness dominates, from cocoa, through dark chocolate, sweet liquid chocolate, pralines, chocolate pudding. Then espresso coffee, molasses and notes of whiskey. 

Dense, oily, smooth in taste. Lots of chocolate, notes of cocoa, coffee, pumpernickel in the background. Praline, with vanilla on the finish. Alcohol warms slightly, has a bourbon character.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750 mL bottle. Inky black body. Smells of strong whiskey, nutty and oaky character, and almost soy sauce malt aroma. Tastes of fudge and chocolate. Creamy and chocolatey. Whiskey kicks in with strong oak and it dries out with a boozy finish. Aftertaste is just shy of soy sauce again. Heavy and slow to drink. It's very good. I say that begrudgingly.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle @ Aarons Oldman buttcrack share. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma of adult bourbon candy. Big bold bourbon notes, chocolate, weak smoke, Dark dried fruits, vanilla and roasted malts. Taste of sweet bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, dark dried fruits, weak roasted malts, fudge and very well balanced overall. Textbook bourbon Stout. You feel the heat but you love it.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle @ Aarons Oldman Buttcrack Share. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aromas of burned wood, chocolate, coconut, warm boozy notes, vanilla, tar, oak. Taste has lots of chocolate, roast, savory notes, burned wood, vanilla, fudgey notes, tar, oak. Fucking incredible!

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Finally... the beer, the myth, the legend. Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of bourbon, front and center, vanilla, chocolate, light molasses, hints of coffee, really complex and well-rounded, this smells awesome! Taste is abso-frickin-lutely awesome and delivers on that nose in spades! Rich, sweet, chocolate forward with just a touch of balancing bourbon in the start and the finish. Rich and velvety creamy body, a tad sweet sticky, with soft carbonation. In the end, this is close to perfection but just a wee bit too sticky sweet for top marks on taste and palate - just a touch more balanced and this would have been a 4.9!

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Bottle thanks to JMFP. Pours black with small tan head that lasts. The aroma is roast, wood, vanilla, cocoa, bourbon.Thick body, chewy roast milk chocolate, vanilla, roast, oak, smooth, hides alcohol well, really enjoyed this.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750 ml. shared bottle. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and bourbon. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, and bourbon barrel. Elegant.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750ml bottle. Black, thick used motor oil pour, no head. Aroma is oak and roast. taste is lots of roast. More oak and smoke than the typical derivation. Very very smooth. Very low carbonation, but thick enough to make up for it. Alcohol well hidden, hard to believe these are 15%.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: Dark black. No head. Thick fudge. Thanks chris. Boozy. Whiskey is subdued but present.  Very nice

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: From notes. Enjoyed at the Side Project Cellar, with Gus, on November 24. 750 mL bottle, black wax. The pour is a nice dark black motor oil with a dark film of espresso colored ring of head with no lace as it lingers. The aroma is great. There is a dark chocolate and heavy roasted malt with a beautiful leathery undertone. A lightly bitter earthy hop comes in late and the vanilla comes through with a strong oak on the finish. This is complex and deep, but the hop is a little too detectable. The flavor is much of the same. The bit bitterness up front works with the light alcohol before the roasted malt, leather, tobacco, and a hint of oak lead away from the hop and finish with an almost dark fruit heaviness. The light vanilla and oak again bring up the back and this warms all the way down. The mouth feel is lighter heavy bodied with a soft carbonation and a nice charred oak and bitter chocolate roasted malt on the finish. This is a solid beer, but is definitely overshadowed by Derivation. 9 5 9 4 18

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750 ml bottle at the Side Project Cellar, shared by Doug. Thanks again, Doug! Pours a deep, dark, nearly opaque brown with a small dark tan/brown head that settles into a ring. This is somewhat jarring next to Derivation #8 because, as the description details well, there are no adjuncts in here and D8 is popping with vanilla and coffee and coconut. There is also a lot more balance between barrel and base than the first iteration of BBT on draft, which was called Barrel-Aged Time when it debuted for the Coffee Crawl in 2017. That one, with the old Heaven Hill barrel, was intense in the way it soaked up the barrel, and was bourbon-forward and almost dry. This one certainly has plenty of oak and vanilla and slight char and toasted sugar, balanced by roasted malts and dark chocolate. Medium-plus bodied, with modest carbonation and a smooth, roasty, rich mouthfeel. Excellent. It's being overshadowed by D8, but that's expected. Great in its own right.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review:
Poured a deep black color with off white head that settles off almost completely. Strong roasty sweet aroma. Sticky sweet, with a charred bitter balance...intense. 

Notes: 750ml bottle at the Cellar, TG weekend Nov â€˜17

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750 ml bottle opened at Cellar. Dark and oily with chocolate and barrel notes. Slick. Sticky. Nice.

product_name: Side Project Beer : Barrel : Time - 2017ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial
product_review: 750 ml bottle to goblet at SPC, listed as Beer: Barrel: Time on the label. Looks good; a slightly translucent very dark (almost dull black) cola with darker beige head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells and tastes good too; dark malt, dark chocolate, vanilla, oak, and a bit of bourbon. Mouthfeel is full-bodied, warming, and moderately bitter. Tasty.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Not my usual genre. Dark strong without an excess alcohol taste. Best drunk slightly chilled for those European winter dried fruits (think Xmas cake or pudding) to come through, too cold and this + spices get demolished. Nice for a change.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Visually very dark mahogany in color. The light brown, fine-pored head appears fluffy and "only" moderately long-lasting, which is not surprising given such a high alcohol content. The aromas pamper you with incredibly strong notes of spicy forest honey, dark caramel, light hints of chocolate, Powidl, dried fruit notes of cherry, berries, plum and fig, as well as a hint of sherry and/or port wine. Incredibly complex! The first sip is soft, sweet and broadly malty to ripe fruity with light hints of dried fruit and rum pot. A powerful, warming body spreads in the mouth with a gentle and slightly sparkling effervescence, heavy, oily texture, slight dryness and present sweetness. Complex notes of dark caramel, light chocolate, fruity dried fruit (cherry, berries, plum, fig) and slightly rum-like notes reminiscent of rum pot can be seen on the tongue and palate, and these can even lead to notes of sherry and port wine. I think you can tell that you are dealing with a very high level of complexity that results in an incredible and harmonious overall picture. Drinkability is not an issue at 11.3% (!!!) - but this quadruple is not too heavy or overwhelming. In the aftertaste, all the aromas have a very good and long-lasting effect with a light sweetness, a lovely warmth and a slightly alcoholic note. Only after a longer time do you notice a very delicate, dry bitterness, which is still backed by a pleasant chocolate note.
Conclusion: This beer is definitely one of the very best in the world!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma of malts, candied fruits, and caramel. Similar taste with dark dried fruits, bitterness, and alcohol warmth added. Sweet and with a high level of alcohol but not too heavy.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark mahogany stained with nice brownish persistent foam. Not much scent. Beautiful beautiful taste. Delicious quadruple with enormous depth and a long aftertaste. Nuts, raisins, prunes. Can't taste the 11.3% at all

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Disappointing Belgian Trappist beer with little distinct malt flavor or aromatic character

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
About time I got to this one. Pours a dark mahogany with good sized and lasting beige foam. Aroma of malts, caramel, figs, dried fruits, sugar. Taste has notes of caramel, treacle, dried fruits, blackcurrant, candy sugar, plenty of alcohol warmth but not abrasive, rich but not sickly. Medium to full bodied and thankfully not too heavy, lively soft carbonation. 

Very flavoursome indeed. I prefer the Rochefort 8 but this is still a very fine beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle. Dark brown color with beige foam, slightly bitter, strong taste, light caramel notes, vanilla flavor, slightly sweet, hoppy, malty, pleasant to drink. Very good

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: â‚¬ 2.52 for 330 ml bottle in Schipol Airport , Amsterdam (13/10/18) : Dark Amber-brown colour , medium beads , big foamy  head ... treacle aroma ... thick foamy mouthfeel , boozy  , good bitterness , totally OTT beer , wonderful & insanely cheap : Wow !

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: As good of a beer as I have access to. Lucky to get this imported for only a couple bucks a bottle. What a steal. Like to know what food this pairs with, cuz seems like a challenge.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Year 2023. Dark mahogany with yellow-beige foam. Sweet malty aroma with notes of marzipan, dates, alcohol and caramel. Malty taste with complex notes of herbs, marzipan, hops, syrup and alcohol. Medium bitterness and a little sweetness. Small bubbly and boozy.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Amber brown pour with a lasting white (slightly tan) head; aromas of orange, marmelade, some sweet bread; rock sugar/candis. Tastes of candied orange, rum, raisins, malt, toffee, licquorice, herbs for the aftertaste. Heavenly stuff - really good, the sugar is not too dominant and you do not feel the ABV.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A real treat. The bitterness is there but it's all the better. Perfect!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Wonderful beer that benefits from aging a little before being tasted. Complex beer whose sweetness makes it easy to taste for novices.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Smells good. Dark malt, dried dark fruits, a bit of some kind of dark sugar and maybe some dark bread. 
Taste is pretty much the same. Its good, but these kind of beers are a bit too sweet for me. I still like to buy these trappist beers once in a while.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Very dark brown, lots of carbonation, big head.
Aroma is beautiful, fruiy, spicy, warming.
Smells like a mulled wine.
Taste is warming, sweet, dark fruits, caramel, with a bitter boozey finish.
Very good beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Brown beer. Beautiful dress. Explosion of aroma in the mouth. Fruity note, bubbly gum.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: This beer is so good that I think it should be honored by choosing the right moment and the right atmosphere to consume it. A heavenly drink, its flavors and aromas bring you closer to God even if you are the most atheistic of humans. Glory to Trappist beers.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330ml bottle brewed in Belgium at 11.3%. Dark chestnut black-brown, with a good size, fair-duration head. Light tree bark, dark fruit juice (a little figgy), mellow biscuit malt and a flowery vanilla touch in the aroma. Moderate carbonation, small robust bubbles. Chocolate biscuit malt. Dark sticky fruit twang in the finish, first plummy then figgy, with faint suggestions of spiced orange. Vanilla aftertaste with caramel undertones. Strong, rich, characterful Quadrupel, just a little boozy. Complex, balanced, and focused with it, which makes all the difference - you can really feel coherently what the brewer wanted it to taste like.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Beige foam head of a dark brown cloudy quadruple. Strong aroma of overripe dark stone fruits, roasted malt aromas with a light hop note. Strong effervescence that runs through the whole beer. Full-bodied, complex body with notes of dark overripe stone fruits, dark sourdough and rye bread, yeast, strong roasted malt aromas and dark chocolate. Long, slightly warming finish that is rounded off by a fine acidity. Great quadruple.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Impeccable. Dark copper/caramel pour with lingering head. Sweet aroma of sugar, dried fruits.
Rich mouthfeel, flavours of the aforementioned dried fruit and a hint of booze in the long finish. Enchanting beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: "Quadrupel" - "the strongest Rochefort" - "11.3% vol." were all keywords that prompted me to taste just one beer today. Sugar and wheat starch are also noticeable here. Spices were omitted. Trappistes Rochefort 10 smells of alcohol, caramel and roasted aromas. The beige head is as thick as a thumb, mixed-pore and then remains stable at a low level. The color is almost black. On the first sip, the taster is greeted by a complex, almost incomprehensible variety of flavors. Nevertheless, I will try to name a rough selection: sherry, raisins, coffee, honey, wine from Beerenauslese. On the finish, yeast prevails and hop bitterness sets in slightly. The alcohol taste is so strong, however, that I take my time tasting it. So we are talking about a very low effervescence. This Quadrupel goes to the limits of good taste. Certainly a highlight for fans of strong beer! 04-2019

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Appearance: looks beautiful, very abundant fine foam, meringue, quite durable. Brown beer, opaque, slightly cloudy.

Aroma: quite complex, in the foreground bread crust, sponge cake, freshly baked cake, slightly burnt candied sugar. In the background fruits - raisins, dates and pleasant noble alcohol with a spicy accent and in a sweet to the taste shell.

Taste: full, clearly malty, bread notes less present, more sponge cake, cake, caramel, alcohol present from the beginning but with it fruity accents come raisins, dates, light plum and cherry. Very noble alcohol despite being present does not interfere, it super complements this sweetness, which gives the impression of some caramel candies with liquid alcohol. Herbal, tobacco, alcoholic finish.

Very good beer, classic of the genre and style :)

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Date to: 20.02.2023; Drink: 10.11.2022 (approx. 4 months before the deadline).

Appearance: Dark brown, opaque. Dark beige, low, fine-bubble foam, after a while it drops to zero, leaves no lacing. After stirring with a glass, a thick texture is noticeable.

Aroma: Complex, pleasantly balanced. At a medium level, maltiness of bread crust, caramel, cuckoo, toffee, molasses, caramel, sponge cake and cookies, complemented by medium-low, noble rum alcohol and dates and notes of raisins at a similar level. In the background, pleasant oxidation accents of a sherry character.
Taste: In the foreground, the maltiness of caramel, cuckoo, caramel, sponge cake, bread crust, toffee and molasses at a medium level, along with a more distinct, sharper, semi-noble rum alcohol at a similar level. Alcohol notes are supported by low peppery phenols, and malt notes, in contrast to the aroma, only by subtle accents of dates and figs. Dry in the mouth, medium-low body - pleasantly airy, but not empty, medium-high carbonation, medium alcohol warming. Medium-low bitterness, peppery - alcohol, short but noticeable. Dry finish, mainly alcohol with notes of caramel and toffee. 

General: Pleasantly complex in the aroma. Alcohol in the taste a bit too aggressive, without the right malt counterpoint.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Opaque dark brown color; caramel brown fluffy head at first, before rolling over to creamy; good retention; aromas of caramel and dark chocolate; medium body; balanced flavours of malts, hops, and dark chocolate. Delicate mouthfeel.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown color with fairly persistent and abundant ivory colored foam. On the nose intense sweet aroma of caramel, chestnut honey and dried and ripe fruit. On the palate a dense and intense body is immediately released, less sweet than the aromas released previously. High alcohol intensity but absolutely worth trying

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: One of the best beers in the world. The strongest Trappist beer in the world. Drink it cold with a few pieces of cheese to enhance its taste. Be careful, it's a strong beer. ðŸ˜

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A clear deep dark red beer with a light brown 1-finger thick foam collar of average structure. Smell of dried red fruit, raisin, leather. Taste has a nice balance between malt and hops. Here too the dried fruit comes forward but also caramel and chocolate. A bit too much carbon dioxide in my opinion, but that is perhaps for the better. That way you don't drink it too quickly.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: It pours a reddish color with a large, off white, long lasting head. It has the aroma of bread, dried fruit, leather, Belgian yeast & wet leaves.  This is a complex, rich, extremely well brewed ale with a wonderfully velvety mouthfeel. I taste hints of chocolate, dried fruit, toffee & caramel with a wonderful bread flavor. This was truly a treat & a privilege to drink.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Cherry-copper color, fine-bubble foam almost immediately reduces to zero, clear. In the aroma raisins, dried plums and cherries, caramel-toast notes, pleasant. In the taste semi-dry, malty with a toast character, raisins very briefly noticeable, and later already a spice finish. I know that the carbonation should be high, but here it is probably too high, together with the spice finish it is a bit biting. Alcohol slightly warms the palate. Considering the reputation of this beer I think I came across a weak specimen, the beer will definitely get a second chance.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A very strong beer, although the alcohol content is not noticeable in the taste and is not bothersome. Dark in colour, with a finger's worth of foam with good retention, medium body and a caramelised touch but not excessive. Perfect to accompany with strong cheese or red meat, in my case aged cheese and entrecote and with that combination the note would be higher, it just goes down a bit.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Well balanced malts make this 11.3% very smooth going down. Aftertaste is warm dark fruits. Hard to draw any negatives.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Pours hazy nut brown with a touch of orange.  Off-white 1-finger head.  Mild aroma of nutty malt with a note of candy sweetness.  Some herbal notes as well.  Full-bodied and a touch syrupy.  The finish is long, with a mild boozy astringency.  Nutty malt flavor with a sweet note (kandi sugar?).  Some herbal notes at the back (think of a cough drop, but more pleasant).  Maybe a touch of tart cherry as it warms.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330 ml bottle poured at home. Pours brown with a thin off white head and lots of sediment. Smells like dark fruit, molasses, malt and brown bread. Taste is raisin, a touch of alcohol and some sweet breast malt. This is quite good!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Appearance: copper color, light gushing, medium foam, quickly falling, high carbonation
Aroma: dried fruit, nuts, bread crust
Taste: sweetish, moderate bitterness, full, fruity, nutty, you can feel the power.

Very good, worth recommending.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 1 finger beige head, brown-mahogny body. Nose: Raisins, dark dried fruits, plum, malt and molasses. Taste: Malt, raisins, dark dried fruits, plum, molasses, brown sugar and alcohol. Long ending with some bitterness.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Belgian strong Ale with a brown color with mahogany reflections. Abundant beige foam. The nose is dominated by notes of fruit, candied fruit, chocolate. In the mouth the main notes are fruity, chocolate, light spiciness and smoked hints. Finish with a discreet bitterness.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Opaque brown color with lasting, thick, tan head.   Malty and earthy aroma.  Taste is sweet, malty and woody with a slow alcohol burn.  Smooth and strong but with balanced flavor.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
It has a dark brown color, cloudy, with an earthy appearance. It forms an ivory-colored foam, with little persistence and medium retention. Medium bubbles.
It forms a good lace.
On the nose it is very aromatic, very complex. With sweet aromas, notes of ripe fruits, plum, raisins, dates stand out, at the same time the aroma of Kola nut, vanilla, caramel stands out. The hops are perceived thanks to a subtle floral note in the background. It is rare but on other occasions I had noticed more the presence of banana notes, on this occasion they are very slight. The presence of alcohol is perceived but in a subtle way.
On the palate it is congruent with the aroma. It begins with a soft sweetness that highlights the presence of notes of Kola nut, vanilla, malt. At the same time the nose is filled with that aromatic, floral hop, which dresses the experience in the mouth without bothering or interrupting. 
The aftertaste is balanced, with a slight sweetness and a mild bitterness. 
With a medium to full body and medium carbonation.

*Note: on this occasion I noticed it was very aromatic, almost like a perfume. I had never smelled a beer like that, not even the Rochefort 10, but it is almost as if I were drinking a very seductively perfumed beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 11.2 ounce bottle at The Winking Lizard in Copley, Ohio. Smell the sweet Belgium sugar and yeast. Dark brown in color with foamy tan head. Taste the sweetness. Smooth and powerful. You can tell there is 11.3 percent alcohol in this beer, but itâ€™s well hidden. This is an extremely very nice beer. Cheers!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
sweet, licorice, sour. deep triple alcohol taste. truly a nice balanced beer. to be enjoyed like a wine. it pairs like port with cheeses. 
truly versatile and yet a great beer on its own.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: beautiful notes of chocolate and nuts that are perfectly balanced! highly recommended

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: bottle.  Poured murky brown with a silky beige head. Sweet malty aroma, slighty tart. Full bodied, high carbonation, slick mouthfeel with a warm finish. Flavour of dark fruit and roasty malts, notes of figs and peppery spice, a warm sherry quality.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Figs, raisins, spices, gingerbread. Fruits noticeable in the taste, from red to dark dried. Gingerbread dough with spices adding sweetness, bread crust, maybe a bit of wine. Strongly carbonated, alcohol well-balanced. A classic of the genre in its best form.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottle: 330 ml, at home, #StayHomeDrinkBeer Price: 2.39 eur
Stored for a long time for a special occasion, good, but not wow

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle conditioned. Little sherry aroma , no head. Like a mature Christmas cake, figs, prunes , very warming sipped slowly. Lovely. Surprisingly not that sweet given itâ€™s alcohol content. Small champagne type bubbles.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Monday, December 6, 2021, 8:08 PM
330 mL/11.2-ounce bottle poured to wine glass
Sight: Brownish, dark amber color, medium foam, not clear
Smell: aroma of malted grains
Taste: very good, low bitterness, some sweetness
Mouth feel: low carbonation, alcohol comes out, sticky, good follow through, dry finish, slightly bitter aftertaste
Overall: very good beer, ok to repeat, not to look for BA RB

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Good dark beer, quite strong, good cereal taste, hint of vanilla
Lingers in the mouth
Not really too bitter

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
33cL bottle at Carlsens Kvarter
Cloudy dark brown with a nice, but diminishing beige head. Deep, complex, and very vinous aroma that brings your thoughts to a nice Barolo wine. Intoxicating notes of sherry and burned figs. Extremely well-balanced and intense taste, deep, sweet, and complex, very vinous with notes of prunes and cocoa. The alcohol is present, but very well hidden in its intensity. Texture is very foamy, more oily than watery. Exquisite beer, and my old favourite.

9-4-9-5-19

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark ripe fruits. Sweet caramel. Butterscotch. Prunes. Light toasty malts. Yeasty. Lively carbonation. Alcohol taste well masked, just some warmth down the throat. Complex flavours. Solid belgian ale.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Rochefort 10 pours a dark brown color with a red hue. Its beige head is and frothy and sustains itself well for the brewâ€™s weight of 11.3% alcohol by volume. The dense nose is an incrediby complex interplay of notes including brown cane sugar, caramel, baked apple, pear, figs, blackcurrant, milk chocolate, biscuit, butterscotch, as well as bright bubblegum notes and even some fruity ginjoko. This incredible bouquet is not simply dark as one would expect, but its darkness is accentuated by bright aromas at the same time. On the palate, the muted sweetness is balanced out by the heavy flavors up front, which include notes of prunes, caramel, and dark bread crust, before the roastiness of the malts as well as the bitterness from the hops invigorate the mid-palate. Peppery spiciness and warming alcohol conclude each mouthful with a dry finish, which leaves impressions of dark fruits and dark bread behind. A deeply complex brew.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottle - best before 20.08.2025 (batch).
Dark amber color, clear, not very sparkling, no efferescence.
Aromas: raisins, blackcurrant, dates, figs, cinnamon, caramel, vanilla, alcohol.
Flavors: slightly sweet on the palate, shower of alcohol warmth, low bitterness lasting on the finish.
Texture: medium body, low carbonation, very good drinkability.
Very nice balance.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very nice and smooth taste with a light caramel tone and slight smokiness. One of the better brews I've tasted and one of the better Trappist beers.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark amber,moderate thick head, medium retention. Aroma caramel, some alcohol feeling,and yeasty sweetness. Same in taste, with moderate body and carbomnation. Nice finish.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Malty. Okay to have one.  Not something I would buy for myself.  Donâ€™t buy me this beer.  I donâ€™t really want it.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Beer drunk at the CÃ©cile brewery in LiÃ¨ge. Very good beer in the style but definitely too sweet for me.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: It was my first time tasting a quadrupel but I really loved it. This beer made me be a fan of Trappist

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Pours dark brown with off white head. Lovely nose on caramel, roasted malts and milk chocolate. Complex in the mouth, perfectly balanced. One of my all time favourites.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Delicious Trappist to enjoy quietly, full flavor, not very bitter, heavy

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle (7/23/24) pour from Total Wine & More, Burlington. It's a hazy dark amber with TONS of effervescent sparkle, 1/2-finger width crackling tan head with excellent retention and trace lacing. Aroma is strong dark fruit, fig, green apple; lemon as it warms. Taste is strong dark fruit, caramel, fig, rock candy. Mouthfeel is light side of light-to-medium bodied with smooth, thin, frothy texture, average carbonation, vaguest alcohol warmth and finish as taste. Overall, good complexity and balance. Glad I finally got around to trying it.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: If you are new to craft beer, then I suggest you choose No. 6 or No. 8. ,This No. 10 is not suitable for junior players.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Not sure when I first tried this ... over 30 years ago!  Lovely rich malty bier with notes of caramel, toffee, dark chocolate, slight alcohol.  A true Belgian classic.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Wow.  Unbelievably smooth, rich, incredibly tasty; great head, nice lacing... only way you know is high ABV is from the warmth going down your throat.  One of the best beers Iâ€™ve ever had.  Wish I could afford to drink it regularly, but alas itâ€™s expensive for good reason.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: One of the best, strong and in my opinion not for everyone, sweet caramel and a little chocolate, you can feel the dried fruit and the spicy part, you can feel the alcohol a lot in the mouth but it is pleasant and warm. Gorgeous

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Brown liquid with very short foam. Malty nose, caramel, tobacco and chocolate. In the mouth, it is identical with a fairly marked alcoholic side, plums and yeasts! Correct!!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Raisin aroma. Dark color, amber reflections, thick, dense foam. Raisin flavor, coffee, quite dry, well-hidden alcohol, slightly sour aftertaste. One of the best beers I've ever had.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Hazy dark orange-brown with a generous and lasting mousse-like beige head.
Aroma: Powerful and complex. Malt: Toffee, tobacco, chokolade. As well as fruity hops (orange) and esters (banana).
Mouth: Sweetness well balanced with just the right bitterness and pleasant fruity acidity. Full body, low/medium carbonation.
Great beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Brown beer with a spongy foam that retains well. Medium body and high carbonation. Aroma of malt, caramel and vanilla. Sweet flavour with notes of plum.
Tasty and imperceptible that we are drinking a beer with 11.3% alcohol. A great beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: It's a little more alcoholic and you need to take your time. The overall experience is good, but I prefer a lighter beer

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Fabulous quad. It's got a toasty malt and caramel sweetness up front. Nice effervescent mouth feel. A long lingering finish that lets you know it's a high abv in a pleasant way.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 33cl bottle at home from an online store. Tried on 01/04/2021 BB 26/12/2023. Dark mahogany color with off-white, brownish smooth head. Very nice aroma, intense and rich with hints of alcohol, caramel, something herbal, and fruits. Great. The most perfect and complex taste among the Rochefort for me, not extremely different from the 6 and 8, but very rich and perfectly done. Taste is elegant, full and sweet with hints of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, yeast, prunes and dried fruit, somewhat winey. Good sparkling carbonation and very strong at 11.3% abv yet well hidden. More sweet than bitter but spicy and warm... absolutely incredible taste.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Dark brown opaque color with underwhelming head. Aroma is nutty, dark fruits, rich. Taste is intense with nutty notes and sundried apricots, generally dark fruits. Mouthfeel is great, quite intense carbonation. You don't taste the alcohol that much.

I prefer the red version.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Mahogany colour and nice head. Fruity aroma, complex and rich, the flavours keep coming after several seconds. Caramel, spices, cloves. Special beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle at home. Poured dark brown cream head. Bready banana malt grain notes. Strong.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottle from Systembolaget. I should really have been paying more attention whilst drinking this. But here goes. It was in many ways a classic quadrupel - interesting winey aroma and flavours; quite light on the palate for the percentage and girth. Didn't wow me but was lovely anyway. (13/3/21)
----
Bottle from the brewery, Rochefort. As above, it has a profound aroma that is hard to pinpoint. It's a mature and profound trappist ale. 3.8 to 3.7.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with beige creamy head. Aroma is lots of dark fruit. Full-bodied and increasingly rich flavour, but also immensely moreish. Perfectly balanced sweetness with light bitterness and even a little roasted malt too. The beer is perfectly balanced and the alcohol tickles the taste.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: High expectations are fulfilled even before the beer is in the mouth. The aroma is heavy with fruit, syrup and tobacco. Almost smells like a broth. And yes...the taste is a behemoth of sweetness, dried fruits and licorice.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
L.24.02.2021 330ml.

Brown, clear, ecru foam, small bubbles, high, slowly reduces to a thin sheet. The beer is constantly working in the glass. In the aroma dried fruit, sweet ripe red fruit, molasses, toasted cake. In the mouth, classic Belgian beer fizz resulting from high carbonation. The beer is full-bodied, in the taste a whole lot of dried sweet fruit. In the background, slightly spicy notes of yeast, also strongly marked on the long finish. Spicy, toasted, dry and warming. Due to the carbonation, it starts to make itself known in the head quite quickly.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Round malt and kandis. Very strong and clear taste of alcohol in beginning, but then full aromatic fresh with clear notes of dry fruit like raisin and a little plumb. One of the finest beers I have ever had. Reminds me of the Danish gambrinos dark only with a royal Belgian twist.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A little too sweet for my taste and markedly alcoholic, you can really feel the caramel malt, after a while it gets tired

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: The pour demonstrates murky brown liquid, yeast following from the end of the bottle and a fluffy, but relatively light, head. I love the aromas. It's a combination of malts, caramels / molasses, plum / raisin and Christmas spices. The first sip brings out the breadiness of the beer and exposes the full-body seen in most trappist ales. At mid-palate the flavors open up with a large hit of malt and molasses. As it continues to roll through your mouth, you'll start to experience the fruits and spices which will leave you with a pleasant aftertaste and wanting to jump in for another sip. It's a beer to take your time with, both to admire the complexity and its potentt 11% ABV. For me...a fine symphony in a glass.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
How: bottle. BB: 19.07.2021 Stored in room temp for a few years.
Head: off white. Three fingers, with careful pour.
Colour: deep amber, brown.
Aroma: caramel, spicy, light herbal notes, dark fruits, a bit licorice, dark bread, molasses. A ton of aromas going on, yet really well balanced between flavours.
Taste: medium body, very lively carbonation, quite bitter and dry, caramel, dark bread, dark fruits. Quite mellow taste.
Really long, a bit warm, aftertaste that follows taste.
Really well aged. Definately best of 6, 8 or 10 of this brewery.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown with low foam. Aroma is dried fruits, biscuits and spices. Taste is caramel with a touch of dried fruits, some biscuits and coffee. Alcohol is present in taste but not too strong. Carbonation and bitterness medium.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark mahogany in the glass. The aroma has dried fruits, figs and cookie-like notes. Carbonation is felt in the mouthfeel. The flavor still has dried fruit, plum, fig and date. The bottle was from the vintage department, so maybe the best blade was lost.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Brown colour with white to beige head. Aroma of dates, biscuits, spices, dried cherries. Taste of caramel sweetness paired with dried fruits and spices. Only lower herbal bitterness in the aftertaste. Very nice.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Old rating from 04-03-15 - 330ml bottle, pours a dark brown with a big off white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of caramel, dark fruits, coffee, wood, biscuits, citrus, vanilla, spices & hints of the strong alcohol. Light to medium body. Soft carbonation. Medium sweet finish. Outstanding

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Pours hazy dark ruby red with a medium sized head. Aroma of dark fruits, berries, spices. Taste of spices, molasses, spices, alcohol. Medium carbonation. Medium sweetband bitter aftertaste with an alcoholic warmth. Nice one

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark copper colored beer, clear. Fine-bubble foam, quite abundant. Malt aroma, distinct phenols, bubble gum note dominates. The beer is warming, full-bodied, strongly saturated, low bitterness. Toffee flavor, pleasant alcohol note.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Quadrupel Trappist beer with a high alcohol content, well hidden by the monks' know-how with the recipe.
Dark toasted colour, spicy smell (clove). Fine and consistent foam, medium persistence.
Strong flavour but with a magnificent aftertaste, beer of great quality and complexity.
Perfect example of a good Trappist beer

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Appearance: dark amber, clear, light beige head
Aroma: red apples, cherries, pastry base, peppery notes in the background, then cloves
Taste: medium-low sweetness, high carbonation, low bitterness, red apples, caramel, alcohol warms.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottle online from Beerhouseshop.be.
Pours a murky deep mahogany brown colour with a large thick creamy beige head. Aromas of dry dark fruits, caramel, candied sugar. Taste is rich and full flavoured with more dry dark fruits, caramel, candied sugar, plums, vanilla, hints of leather and a touch of peppery spice. Full body, average carbonation with a smooth silky slightly oily mouthfeel. Sweet but not too sweet finish. Excellent balance. Alcohol extremely well hidden. Fantastic Quad.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Thick foam and it pours with deep dark brown colour. Nose is caramel with some tobacco and vanilla. Taste is changing as the beer gets warmer. It has strong taste of alcohol at first and then it gets maltier. It is somehow spicy and bitter aftertaste.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: (Bottle) Dark chocolate body with a large, light brown head. Aroma of toasted malt, chocolate, dark and dried fruits, caramel, lightly spiced. Light bodied, velvety mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Sweet but not cloying; roasted malt; dark fruit, currant, hint of cherry; light wood; mild chocolate; alcohol is subtle for the ABV but leaves a warming sensation. Long and lovely finish.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
I knew about this beer and the hype around it, which is why i approached it thinking "I really want to try it, but it will probably be just slightly above average.

I was pleasantly wrong. I have never tasted a beer so strong, being so balanced, almost light? Nice body, smooth, a nice kick at the start, flavour packed, that finishes gently almost disappearing, with the ever so slight sweet linger that makes you go for the next sip.

Classic, but at the same time unique, almost as if this was truly the highest form, the perfected form of the classic in style. 


I didn't get the appeal until i tasted it, for some reason this beer makes me feel better psychologically than palate- wise, this beer is my comfort zone.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: best beer iâ€™ve ever tasted. smooth, heavy, but very flavorful.  doesnâ€™t taste like a 10%+ beer

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma of alcohol, dried fruit, burnt and sugar. Flavour is sweet, perfume, caramel, dried fruit. Alcohol sugar and esters on the finish.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: I don't get the appeal. I love what the Trappist monks do and I'm a bit fan of a lot of the other stuff. I couldn't get my head around this one though. It's too expensive too.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Smidge of cloud in the golden pour. Creamy head. Familiar bouquet of a trappist. The flavour sets it above all other monks brews. Soft mouth feel with delicate esters and sweet malts balance the bitterness perfectly. Vanilla, oak, caramel, fudge. Delightful.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: One of my favorite beers, with notes of raisins, licorice, caramel and alcohol. It lingers on bitterness and sweetness at the end.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
A beer haiku for you.....

Rochefort Belgian Monks
Secrets shared for us to drink
Best of breed, indeed.  

In my humble opinion this is what should appear in any dictionary when one looks up 'Quadrupel'.  Absolutely best in class by any measure, and worth every penny needed to enjoy those few precious ounces of delight.  Cheers!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: From bottle. Dark brown appearance with foamy head. Tastes brown sugar, caramelized malt, chocolate, coffee with mild bitterness with sweetness. Quite complex tastes. Strong alcohol and with some warmth. Maybe it is too strong for me. Iâ€™d prefer Rochefort 6 or 8.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very delicious, strong without being too heavy. adding more words so it will count.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle, Pivoljub. Dirty, dark brown. Medium sized foamy beige head, ok lasting. Medium yeasty nose, mild chocolate nose and some gentler dry fruits, figs and raisins. Medium bitterness, some yeastiness. Dry fruits sweetness with some cellar feel, a bit peppery. Lasting aftertaste. A bit of alcohol warmth that warms nicely. Medium light body.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
A wonderful classic, and the Rolls Royce of Belgian beer. Extremely soft and full-bodied, but also powerful, candy sugar, trappist yeast and all the delicious malts. 

Pours dark brown, cloudy fine off white head. 

Full body, low carbonation.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Pours dark brown with white creamy top. Nose is brown sugar, earth and wood. Taste is malty, caramel and old wood barrel. Nice warmth from alcohol. Taste gives you associations to an belgium harbor.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A tasting beer with complex but sublime flavors, to drink one-on-one, taking your time with someone who appreciates good things!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown with a tan frothy head. Smells of malt, wood, raisins, chocolate and dried plums. Light sweet with semi-strong bitterness. Some chocolate, raisin, plum and herbal notes on the tongue. Semi-full body and nicely long lasting.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Coffee. I can mainly taste the coffee here. 

Beautiful appearance. Abundant foam. Fine and medium bubbles, but velvety on top. 
Alcoholic, liqueur-like in taste. Spicy, spicy, and coffee. Somewhere in the background, maybe some soy sauce? 

I am not a fan or expert of these beers, so my assessment may not be adequate to the quality of the beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: An incredible Trappist beer where balance and complexity accompany a very high alcohol content.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Oacura, caramel and vanilla flavor, slightly bitter on the palate, very fizzy

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Rochefort undoubtedly stands on its own as part of the Trappist Olympus - a very spicy, harmonious, full-bodied beer, which I enjoy as a nightcap after a fatty meal. Excellent, but not a perfect 100 for me.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Dark copper, transparent, with a persistent beige head.

A lot of sugary-sweet elements in the aroma, a bit of raisins, wine elements.

Less sweet in the taste, a bit of oxidized, raisin notes, and some other fruits, maybe cherries. You can clearly feel the light malts. A pleasant bitterness on the finish, slightly alcoholic.

Definitely very well balanced, the alcohol is well hidden, although I expected something better, maybe it's a bit hard for me to judge because I haven't had too many real quadruples.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Adding in my 300 Beers To Try ticks because I want to see how they impact my stats and some of them I will never see again. Will however re-rate them when practical.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very dark ruby brown, hazy too but maybe I just poured it badly. Murky brown foam head, dissipated fairly quickly. Strong, classic Trappist yeast aroma, goes right up in the nostrils. Itâ€™s a complex bag of aroma and taste notes; raisin, coffee, almond, dark chocolate. Smooth in the mouth with a perky fizz on the tongue. Strong but not overpowering. This is a great quad - it packs so much flavour but without having to smack you over the head with it.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A strong aroma comes up from the moment you pour it into the glass. It tastes a bit similar to the last time I celebrated, but I still don't know what it is. It tastes a bit like chocolate and the color is very dark. As expected of a beer with an alcohol content of over 11 degrees, the alcohol aroma is strong. I keep drinking it, but it tastes very unique.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Among the Trappist beers, it is the one that leaves the most persistent flavors on the palate.
It is very reminiscent of licorice, coffee and fruit.
Brown color.
Rich in flavors and aromas.
Meditation beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
30.06.2020
Bottle 0.33 l, valid until probably April 2020. Beige foam, very abundant, thick, durable, with beautiful lace. Dark brown color, opaque, probably hazy. In the aroma notes of sour cherries, marmalade, red apple, red wine, alcoholic, dark cake, sponge cake, light spices. In the taste sweet, dessert, dates, raisins, toffee, dark cake, nougat, sponge cake, dessert wine, cherry in liqueur, noble alcohol. The finish is unfortunately empty, as if ending abruptly. Medium-high fullness, medium to medium-high carbonation, low bitterness, alcohol noticeable, but not unpleasant. Another classic well-aged and checked off, a bit weaker than Bernardus, but also very good.

Aroma of sour cherries, marmalade, red apple, red wine, alcoholic, dark cake, biscuits, slight spices too. Sweet taste, dates, raisins, toffee, dark cake, nougat, biscuits, dessert wine, liqueur cherry, alcohol. Empty, suddenly ending finish, unfortunantely. Medium to high body, medium to medium high carbonation, low bitterness, warming, yet not unpleasant, alcohol. Another cellared belgian classic quad, very good, but I prefer Bernardus.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very intense at first sip, it becomes smoother when the taste settles down. The sweetness level is a bit too much for me but still one of the best trappist ale.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Dark brown with medium, fine-bubble foam.
Aroma full of dried fruit with caramel and toffee in the background.
In taste thick and sweet, but not too sweet. You can feel spices, caramel, sponge cake, dried fruit.
Slightly alcoholic in a noble way. Good.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Best beer in Belgium when I traveled Europe.  I finally found this beer in Korea but it wasn't same taste, though.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown opaque colour with a whitish foam finger of excellent retention. Aroma between coffee and fruity. Sweet flavour, slightly bitter, between caramel and roasted malt, integrating well that sugary touch typical of Belgian beers and not revealing its liquor side until the end. Full body and medium-high carbonation. Excellent balance and presentation, one of the best beers I have ever tried.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Great taste and aroma, mouthful, not a big head. Cloudy, beautiful dark crude amber color. Smells amazing: bourbon and spices; and tastes even better: burned fig, walnut, caramelized sugar, spices, cardamon(?). Personally too high in alc. vol. to my taste. Not as rich as no 8 (favorite of the three). Alcohol vol. is not too intensive/over-present in the drink, it is not offputting (I find 6 to be that). Fantastic with a heavier meal (I had a vegan burger from Del Haize and it went well together with the beer)

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle. Also used to drink one in the pre-RateBeer era. Still a strong and good beer. Aroma somewhat sweet (caramel, malt). I am less crazy about the taste than I remembered, but the long-lasting bitter aftertaste makes up for a lot. Of course a heavy beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: This is it folks!  The best beer of the three siblings.  Everything is blended to perfection. The fruity flavors with the spices.  You will not notice the alcohol level.  It is that good! Best of breed!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
04-05-2020

Trappist beer with notes of chocolate, citrus, biscuits and bitter malt.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A robust body, a dark, cloudy brown colour and a soft, dense, coffee-style foam. A woody aroma with dry hints of chocolate and nuts, and the same hints in the mouth but with brutal nuances. I have had it with strong cheeses and chocolates. A 10/10 beer, and to top it off, a Trappist Abbey like few others.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Appearance: copper with yeast particles inside, with a big head, but it disappears fast 
Aroma: burnt sugar, caramel, fruits in caramel and a ripped banana,
Taste: moderately sweet, burnt sugar, caramel, fruits in caramel, a ripped banana and subtle noble alcohol at the end.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown color with mahogany highlights. Intense hints of syrup and caramel on the nose and palate. Slightly acrid and spicy flavors with fruity notes of plum and cocoa. Strong but refined body. A super classic of Trappist beers!!!!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown with white head. Smell of prunes, malt and brown sugar. Taste of sweet barley malt and a great lasting aftertaste of prunes (almost like an old port). Nice

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Aroma of rye, barley and mild plum
Beatiful brown colour with lasting head
Taste of sweet barley malt and mild alcohol
Extremely smooth mouthfeel. 
Extremely nice beer

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: For me the best strong dark beer, best Trappist and simply my no. 1 beer. Full of taste, pleasantly sweet, not like the Gulden Draak which is good but so sweet that I can only enjoy it on special occasions. I almost never drink beer with less than 7% alcohol because they are too weak and tasteless, but this beer never disappoints, always satisfies after one or two bottles. The full taste combines great with a simple meal or BBQ.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Yeah it has finesse and delicacy, but it also has serious weight, like a sumo wrestler doing ballet

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
0.33 bottles.
Hazy, indeterminate but not ugly color, large foam when filled and then half a finger. The aroma is a nice blend of caramel, raisins, cognac and Belgian beer. Full-bodied, very sweet beer. I won't go into detail, any dried fruit can be felt from the taste. When heated a little, the foam is bigger and nicer. At first it is very carbonated, if left to stand, it is finer. Great dessert beer, but I've already drunk a level or better with it. Mainly excessive sugaring which made him not get more points.
***
 Confused, indefinable, but not an ugly color, large foam when filled, then remaining half a finger. It smells like a nice mixture of caramel, raisins, cognac and Belgian beer.  A full-bodied, very sweet beer. I won't go into detail, any dried fruit can be detected by its taste. The foam is bigger and prettier when filled when slightly warmed. At first it's very carbonated, but if you let it stand, it's tastier. It's a great dessert beer, but I've had one on the same level or even better. Mainly the excessive sugariness, which is why he didn't get more points.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle. Dark, mahogany color. Foam is also very nice, ivory in color, high, definitely decorates the glass. Burnt sugars dominate, dried fruit, caramel, light yeast in the background. The beer is perfectly balanced, alcohol gently tickles the palate. I could write but it's better to enjoy something good on a sunny, pre-holiday day.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Um. C'mon. This beer is perfect. I dont say so very often. There us just nothing bad I can about it. It looks gorgeous, pouring deep reddish bronze. Nice even.bubbled tan head. Some lacing. Amazing complex aroma with caramel leading, raisin and plum following, and anise, smoke, and leather playing bit parts.  Its hefty, but not hot, nor cloying. Amazing malty raisin bread and rum fade. This makes my nuttsack very smiley.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Clear dark amber pour. Small tan head. Aroma is lots of dark fruit. Some candied sugar in taste and aroma. So smooth. Heavy and itâ€™s effects are obvious. Yet smooth and excellent sugar grains. Mild gum. Just awesome all the way around.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Like its sister 8, it also has a powerful, thick head that quickly holes and slightly coats the glass. Also brown in color, but it seems darker. In the scent, a bit of alcohol, raisins, floral, oxidation notes, wine. Unlike 8, it definitely has body, it is not watery, sweet, caramel, you can feel the alcohol, but noble, not tiring. It warms the esophagus.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle served. Very dark brown pour with medium beige head. Aroma is strong with dark fruits, roasted nuts and little to no hop, despite being 11.3 ABV. Just the perfect mixture and balance among each ingredient. Cannot beat this, Westvleteren XII will give way to this Rochefort 10 on the top of my list.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
02/08/2020, bottle dated to 02/20/2023
I don't know what it is, but it doesn't smell or taste like quadrupel at all. A distinct note of cherry/cherry in the aroma and taste, basically not very phenolic, some red fruit, generally rather winey experience. Overall tasty, but not what I expected.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle into Rochefort goblet. Dark with decent foam. Aroma of plum, raisins, bubblegum and alcohol. Similar taste. Slightly sweet with notes of brown sugar. Well balanced. Flavor opens up as the beers warms up to reveal more plum, anise and dark fruits. Nice Belgian brew.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 33 cl, drunk at Bibere house of beer, Piraeus. Pours brown/dark amber colour with a huge, long lasting head. Strong malty aroma and taste. Its best characteristic is the unimaginable bittersweet mouthfeel - it's worth drinking just because of this.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle from Drink? Hebden Bridge.  Very dark with a lovely crisp smoothness that hides its strength very well.  The alcohol isn't very stated here even though it should be, just a subtle liquorice sweetness to compliment the fine textured mouthfeel.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: My favourite beer. Best after som years in the cellar. The aftertaste goes on forever.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown-ruby color with big off white head, sparkling carbonation, floaties. Alcohol, caramel, dried fruit aroma. Dried fruity, caramel, boozy, old flavor. Warm, bit spicy palate, medium to heavy body.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: AROMA: High sweet alcohol aroma. High black prune esters. Absent hop aroma. Low phenols with peppery notes and low vanilla notes. APPEARANCE: Dark mahogany-colored beer without transparency. Straw-colored foam, creamy and without much retention. FLAVOR: High esters with flavors reminiscent of black prunes and raisins. Medium bitterness. Esterous, fruity balance of dried fruits and a finish in which the alcohol mixes with the high notes of dried fruits in a very pleasant way. MOUTH SENSATIONS: Medium-high body, medium-high carbonation. Warming due to high alcohol. Not creamy, astringent or rough. GENERAL IMPRESSION: Great beer in which the dried fruit flavor prevails with notes of dry alcohol. Low drinkability due to its high alcohol level, although very pleasant to drink quietly when the day is over.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very good beer, very good like all Trappist beers, highly recommended for beer lovers

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Copenhagen 20/8 2017. 33 cl bottle from Meny, Ã˜sterfÃ¦lled Torv, Kbh Ã˜. Simple label stating that this is a Trappist Rochefort 10. Nice simplicity. 

Pours hazy dark dark brown with small off-white head. Settles as thin layer of foam barely covering the surface of the beer. Moderate lacing. 

Aroma is intense and contains both a strong sweetness but also a more sourish quality. Figs, brown sugar, plum and overripe berries meet wet cellar. 

Quite strong carbonation and thick oily texture. 

Flavor is heavy sweet without becoming cloying. Followed by medium bitterness. Aftertaste is quite sweet followed by quite strong bitterness. 

Very nice and well balanced Quadrupel. Truly a sipper which feels like a nice meal.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
0.33 bottle
C: dark brown
N: yeast, brown sugar
P: full body, caramel, light acidity, yeasty, lightly grassy, creamy touch, lightly rooty, nice and warming. Everything well balanced.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: This is good stuff! Great and rich smell - some citrus, liquorice, but mostly dark and red fruits sweetness. Some freshness. Wonderfully good taste. Rich, very complex, heavy, present. Some liquorice and plenty of red and dark fruits. Bready, creamy, some hints of coffee, dark chocolate, caramel,  vanilla. Freshness. Subtile sweetness developing into subtile bitterness. Robust yet smooth and creamy. A very pleasant, warm and lasting aftertaste. Absolutely fantastic!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: This beer is a really great way to get drunk... You're gonna feel really well after one of these, believe me

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Beer is such a drink that every time you lift a glass or bottle to your mouth, you find something new, depending on a thousand-million little things that affect the current situation. So I limit myself to this text for each beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: October 23rd, 2015 - Enjoyed with a good friend in a cozy setting, the Trappistes Rochefort 10 was so involved, so engaged, so magnetic, that I appear to have not recorded any notes at all, except that this particular bottle was best by September 10th, 2015. But I know this beer well, and the mellow sweet notes and unassuming complexity are familiar. It is still very much a nearly perfect beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
What can I say? 

We first entered The Subterranean Drinking Den without knowing truly what we were in for. 

My friend was shy at first, but with my support ordered the Rochefort 10 biere aka the brain-leg dis-connector. 

When the bottle was opened, the sweet aroma of the monastery filled the bar, everyone in the close vicinity looked around and asked, "what is that?" - me and my friend were shocked to say the least. Hints of Madagascan Vanilla pods mixed with Ecuadorian Cocoa beans hit the the two external openings to the nasal cavity in the nose. Simply put, a sense of enlightenment brought from the monks' biblical teachings spilled out in the room from the bouteille.

Now that the bottle opening is settled, we can move onto the pour. Exquisitely dark, the pour was like a river flowing through the desert solely on a mission to quench ones first. A large gasp overcame the room to which my shy no longer companion exalted "be gone heathens of non Trappist connoisseurs, ye shall not comprehend the beauty of what thee witness - be seen and thus be shown!". A sense of profundity overcame thee newly labelled heathens. 

It would be sacrilege to describe the taste of ones Trappist Rochefort 10, this is a journey one must overcome themselves.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: #583; 12/2016. A distinctly alcoholic powerhouse. Multi-layered fruit flavor with excellent drinkability.

If you love Belgian beer - you'll be blown away. But I don't see that one as top of the top amongst all beers.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 0,33 l bottle. Pours dark amber brown with a finger of lasting beige head. Aroma is fruity, plenty of dried fruit, dried plums in particular, raisin and dates, there is also some caramel and toffee. It has vinous properties, similar to strong red vine from a region with plenty of sunshine. Alcohol is present, but not too forward. Taste is quite heavy sweet and medium bitter. Body is full, carbonation mild, mouthfeel sticky. Finish is long, rich with dried fruit and mild lasting bitterness. Mild stomach warming sensation adds to very pleasant experience.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
[Tasting - Beder]

Aroma: Rich dark fruits, dates, plums, raisins and mild yeast

Appearance: Amber brown with a huge long-lasting head

Taste: Moderately sweet and bitter, dates, plums, raisins ending in a warm alcoholic finish

Mouthfeel: Oily-creamy texture with soft carbonation

Overall: A masterpiece brewed by the Belgian monks :)

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 11.2 oz. bottle. Easy availability at local bottle shop... about $6 a pop and well worth it. Cloudy, cola-brown appearance with enough carbonation to match. Big tan head nearly spilled over the sides of my glass, forcing me to rush to lick the sticky candied concotion. Sweet dark fruit aroma. Raisin, fig, spiced rum cake, plum notes come to mind. Winter seasonal spices are intermingled with care. Hints of cinnamon, anise, vanilla bean all work in harmony. Hearty dose of brown sugar and molasses hits you up front.  Sugar in the Raw. Grandma's scratch-made pastries. Sweet, but not cloying. Warming, only mildly creamy. Cola-like tanginess in the finish. Clocking in at 11.3% ABV, this beer conceals the alcohol content unbelievably well, a testament to the smooth balance of the recipe. A very sweet beer. It's almost like taking a bite out of a decadent cake. Ideal for dessert after a nice meal, but also stands up all on its own. Dense fruity sweetness builds character with every sip. Mouthfeel is medium at best with creaminess that melts away quickly. All in all, a true beauty of a beer. Compares favorably to St. Bernardus Abt 12.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
I am not going to describe one of the greatest achievements of this endeavor that is brewing.

All I can say is thank you God.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
330ml glass bottle dated as best before 20/02/2024 from Vini Vivi wine store in West Hampstead. Aged for about six months since purchased. Served into an oversized wine glass having been becoming up to room temperature from refrigeration for over 30 minutes.

The beer pours a medium brown with light bleeding through at the edges giving it a reddish tint. A three finger tan head that dissipates down surprisingly quickly. Lots and lots of micro bubbled streams of carbonation. The carbonation eases out over the life of the drink quite dramatically. Almost taking it to flat bitter level by the final gulp. 

The aroma has a noticeable alcohol presence, which is not surprising for eleven percent beer. Ripe banana, coriander, caramel malt and raisin are prominent. Definitely in the Belgian tradition.

The taste is extremely well balanced and moreish without ever being overstated. Caramel malt, spicy coriander. Sweet sugar, raisins and prunes. A little yeast. The slightest hop bitterness. Very easy going on the palate for such high ABV. 

The alcohol continues to warm long after the glass is empty. Nice mouthfeel, some sweetness lingers on the palate. Sugar and a little banana. 

Overall, an outstanding beer. Top marks to those monks.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
