The alcohol is noticeable enough, not too much, but it is especially noticeable at the end of the sip; it closes and balances the overall sweetness with a light resinous bitterness.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Aroma of prunes, plum & raisins. Clear reddish brown with a very low tanned head. Medium sweet with a burning feeling from the high alcohol which though gives a very long finish. Medium body, slick texture & average carbonation.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very complex quadruple. Many different flavors come to mind such as chocolate and caramel. Three-finger foam. Very light hops flavor. Really pleasant taste which pairs well with the high ABV, but I have to say I generally like beers with high alcohol content so it may not be for everyone. All in all a very good beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A high quality complex quadruple. Super boozy. A great beer but i prefer the westy12 as to me that has more body. Great though and this won't disappoint. I also enjoy the beer more as the carbonation lessons. More flavour released. Up rating after another bottle enjoyed.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
26.08.2019 Pink already turning into red. Cloudy. Huge, beige foam, with a compact structure. Holes and reduces very slowly. Marking the glass. 

In the aroma peaches, raisins, molasses, cake soaked in rum. 
Well saturated. With a fluffy texture. The taste is sweet, but not overdone. There are also fruits: peach, apricot. Raisins, molasses, sponge cake. Delicate leather bitterness. 

One of the best Belgian beers. And the top of the miracles from the Trappists. 
21.03.2021 Warka to 20.09.2022
Clear burgundy turning into pink. The white foam is also broken into pale pink. A lot of foam, but it is reduced when popping. In the aroma sweetness and red and forest fruits. Accents of alcohol, neither wine nor liqueur. 
Well-saturated sweet. Alcohol hidden perfectly. Does not make a heavy impression. In taste mainly fruits as from the aroma, but also bread crust. There is a slight warming. On the finish shy bitterness.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Aroma: raisin, pear, caramel, chocolate, alcohol
Appearance: hazy brown color with a three-finger tan lasting head
Taste: raisin, pear, caramel, some spice, medium-high sweetness, medium bitterness.
Palate: medium-full body, medium carbonation, medium-high dryness, medium-high booziness 
Overall: The drinkability is really low because of its booziness. The flavor is strong and characteristic of a quadrupel though. Ok.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Every time i tried this beer, it seems better and better. And this fact show me that i dont know how good it is. When the beer stops to impressing me.. Every time it gives me more things. The beer is so complex and definitely you cant undrestand it for a single try.
Anyway the aroma is one of the best out there. It trap you and dont let you go. Is so smooth with so much depth. So many dark fruits and sweet caramel there. But the taste is really insane. In secs the beer embrace your tongue and warm it with pleasand sweet fruity notes. The mouthfeel is incredible and almost the same good like Westvleteren 12. The beer is very fruity and sweet. Berries, plums  chocolate, caramel and all these together make one amazing taste. The finish has one warm bittersweet aftertaste. Also you get little wine flavour there. The carboration is great and push the beer in your stomach perfectly. And lastly you dont believe this beer has 11.3% alcohol.
Overall one of the most balance beers out there. Really the beer is perfect and hasent weakness. This and Westvleteren 12 are in the same level. And you can get it very easy with reasonable price. So in that case we get lucky. So make sure you get one bottle soon! 5 Big Stars!!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Pours a deep mahogany coloration with a reddish tint and a medium, frothy head, with visible carbonation. Smells of bready, caramel malt and distinct dark fruit, with notes of raisin and plum, as well as some chocolate and estery spice, with hints of clove and allspice. Taste is an excellent balance of bready, caramel malt, brown sugar, dark fruit, with notes of raisin and plum, chocolate, some estery spice, with notes of clove, vanilla and licorice, as well as hints of bitter, herbal hops. Finsihes bittersweet, with a medium sweetness, light bitterness and some caramel malt, dark fruit and spice lingering in the aftertaste. Full mouthfeel with a rich body and medium carbonation.

Probably my favorite everyday Quadrupel, only coming in just behind Westvleteren 12, which certainly isn't worth the quintuple price point. What I love about this personally is that it feels a little bit more bitter and spicy than its contemporaries, while also being quite rich, although perhaps just a tad too boozy at the same time. Overall this makes for a very rich and well-balanced Quadrupel that's quite hard to beat at its availability and price point. Perhaps a little too boozy, but making up for that with its more bitter and spicy accents, never feeling quite too sweet, as many other examples of the style.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Brown beer with a foamy head of ivory color. The aroma is caramel, toffee, dark fruits, delicate spices, peach. It smells very sweet and inviting. The taste is primarily spices, maltiness is secondary, but caramel and toffee are still noticeable. Medium texture and high carbonation make the beer extremely drinkable.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark amber, almost brown, mahogany. Medium-fine ivory-colored foam, persistent. Low carbonation. On the palate hints of fruit in alcohol, caramel, dark chocolate.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: "O time! Suspend your flight"... There are some tastings that we would like to last forever. This Rochefort 10 is one of them. Everything is there, balance, power, intensity for a beer that is not the easiest to understand. It took me 999 tastings to begin to understand it. And I say begin, because dozens of tastings of this marvel would not be enough to understand it completely. Just like other Belgian Trappist beers, we of course discover this mastery that only several generations have managed to achieve. But this Rochefort 10 is more difficult to access, even compared to a Westleveren, as its alliance is so specific and its balance complex. At the beginning of my initiatory journey, I therefore appreciated it little, not knowing how to decode it. So I must believe that I was well trained, and for that I thank Corkyrory who accompanied me and who still accompanies me. This tasting is therefore dedicated to him, it is both a thank you and a tribute. And without a doubt he would be able to speak much better than me about this Rochefort. Visually it is a pretty brown that presents itself to us, topped with a 5 mm beige foam. The nose is a firework: plum, prune, liquorice, clove, hint of chocolate, apple, pear, madeira wine and a very tonic alcohol mix in a powerful, elegant, rich, complex cocktail. When tasting, the same explosion with a remarkable tension in the mouth. Superb balance on the attack with the anise and liquorice which stand out slightly from the crowd. The second mouth is superb with a strengthening alcohol and an exceptional complexity. On the back palate, prune and liquorice take the ascendancy somewhat with an alcohol at its maximum intensity, allowing strength and contrast. The finish is long and distinguishedâ€¦ a marvel.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: thick foamy head dark brown color dark fruit smell light banana no hop smell dark fruit caramel taste can definitely taste like alcohol like drinking wine is not hard at all great beer loved it

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown, good beige foam. Good aroma, a bit of whiskey-like, strong taste (but that is also allowed with this percentage) and a full aftertaste. Sweet but not over the top. An excellent beer to sip from.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very dark appearance with a frothy, compact head. Hoppy smell of an ordinary beer and a very malty taste that fills the whole mouth. A rich beer, easy drinkable that doesn't taste like having 11,3% alcohol. Probably my favourite quadruple.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Poured out the bottle thick foamy head dark brownish color smell of dark fruits slight banana no hop smell taste of dark fruit caramel can definitely taste alcohol like if drinking wine not harsh at all great beer loved it

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottle. Opaque mahogany color with ivory foam with medium/large bubbles, medium hold, low carbonation. 
What can I say... just uncorked great nose, winey, almost liqueur-like, hints of Malvasia and rum, raisins in alcohol, dried plums. In the mouth it evolves towards a truly interesting bouquet, confirms the nose and reveals complex and iridescent nuances, of caramel, leather, tobacco, dark chocolate, wood, very lightly smoked. Warm, liqueur-like, enveloping finish. Bitterness really minimal, a hint on the finish. Satisfying body. It resembles its little sister 8 (another wonderful beer) but it is all "more": more intense, more persistent, more balanced, less cloying. Great beer, among the undisputed queens of the category, a masterpiece.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: At home from a bottle, at a good temperature, slightly chilled. Dark brown, good beige head. Good aroma, a bit whisky-like, strong taste (but that is allowed with this percentage) and a full aftertaste. Sweet, but not overdone. An excellent beer to sip.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Only Quadrupel which comes near to this is Westvleteren 12, Absolutely love this one, I still can't decide which one's better, this or Westy

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: There is so much going on both in the aroma and the flavor of this beer. Aroma has a lot of dark fruits, slightly roasty. Both in taste and aroma no hop presence, but the slight bitterness is still there. Warming alcohol prescence; almost wine-like. Taste has a lot of dark fruits, fig, raisins, slight choclate, slight roastiness. Great body. Better than Westvleteren 12 IN MY OPINION.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Beautiful dark beer reminiscent of a good wine. Nice silky and compact foam. Carbonation in the standards of a quadruple. Do not drink chilled at the risk of the alcohol taste taking over. At the right temperature, reveals flavors of plum, fig, ripe grape or even Port. Bitterness to be guessed. A beer to be savored.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: An incredible beer that lives up to the hype. Definitely a close second in Abbey quads only to westvleteren 12. Nicely complex, plum, raisin, yeast and herbs to name a few. Drinks unbelievably well for 11.3% and is so well balanced. These monks sure know what they're doing!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: I'm no beer expert but have tried all of the trappist ales, Westvleterens included, and to me, this one is the best. Aged 10 months, it's an absolute explosion of complex flavors, dried fruits, caramel, sweet malt, wine-ish alcohol... little to no hop presence. Tried it with and without its yeast sediment, and when poured together with it, the aroma is delicious. Exceptional with a strong cheese.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Masterpiece!
Bright aroma of dried fruit, chocolate caramel and spice.
Body of beer dense in taste. Dried fruits, malt, a little bit of hops. Small sweetness.
The finish is long, hop bitterness, dried fruit

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 330ml bottle, price 145k vnd, many flavors, but sometimes the bitter taste is a bit hard to drink. Should be drunk when it's really cold, straight from the bottle, in small, long sips. Super product.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Forms a strong, white foam that stays for a long time. The beer is dark brown but clear. The aroma is sweet with lots of fruit and raisins. Spicy. The taste is sweet but with spice and the beer feels creamy and bubbly in the mouth.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
My favourite. It's better than Westvleteren, more mature, more complex.
I like the bottle, the simple print, old fashioned, simple bottle... I remember for a long time they didn't have a marked glass, they would serve it in the standard trappist glass... that was clever, it made it to me 'the standard of all beers'... now they have their own glass... 
The name - strong rock - and the fact that it comes from the mysterious Ardennes, the highlands where time goes slower and people still put love in their foodstuffs. 
You have to pour it fast for it to make some foam, if you poor it careful like most other beers, it just doesn't make a 'collar'... 
The taste and smell are a mix of all good things like chocolate cake, fudge, caramel, dulce di leche, port.
Still it's not too sweet, not too bitter, not too sour, but a good degree of each... mature, sophisticated, ...
The colour also sets it apart, dark.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: 33 cl bottle 11.3%. One of the world's best beers that's for sure. Sweet, full-bodied, long lovely aftertaste, high alcohol percentage but you hardly know it.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle from St Remy in Provence, carried on the train all the way back to Paris and drank at the airport! Aroma: astringent, almost like a less sweet light red wine, grassy field/green vines, sweetish fig and spice (though not cloying), slightly fermented banana, some oak/wood. So much like a softer, fruity, slightly yeasty/bready wine (Pinot Noir?). Taste: plum, dark berries, toffee almond-y bitterness in the middle, tannic spicy yeast in the finish, booze not too apparent until the end where it is drying and lasting. Body: very smooth, fizzy prickly delicate carbonation, a little bit oily. Super complex and refined; surprising how wine-y the nose is. Wish I could try this side-by-side with the Rochefort 8.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle from Intermarche in St RÃ©my at Paris CDG before checking in. Dark cola brown pour with puffy sudsy head. Sedimentation at the bottom. Aroma is rich and complex - plum first, bread, light fruity red wine vinousness, wood/oak, leather - like a barrel aged beer. Red wine is very prominent as it warms - red berries. Taste is sweet dried fruit, big earthy bitterness, oak, wine not as present on taste, dark bread. Prickly carbonation. Lasting alcohol warmth. Smooth palate thatâ€™s not heavy. Delicious for this style, certainly one of the best. Sweet but not cloying, and much more complex than usual plum-bombs.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Trappistes 10 was really excellent, but in my opinion it did not surpass Chimay. However, this is really about subjective feelings. All of these beers above 4 are excellent.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Pleasant smell of fruit and caramel, beautiful amber color and creamy foam.
Alcohol very present but unfortunately a little too sweet for my taste. Nevertheless it is a nice beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: It is a great beer , but the alcohol taste is a little bit too strong. Very nice bitter sweet taste.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Visually a little behind the Trappistes Rochefort 8, which immediately caught my eye due to its extreme carbonation. 
Nevertheless, it is a remarkable sight: a wild, albeit subtle head of foam, over a cloudy, cola-colored beer, which is more reminiscent of the fairy tale of the fisherman and his wife than of a standard beer.
Not too much fuss on the nose. I smell mostly chocolate, but it is more likely that it is raw cocoa.
An explosion of flavor on the first sip. Liquorice and chocolate. Possibly pear. Very soft finish.
Stays on the tongue for a long time. Texture rather simple but very well-rounded.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle. Malty aroma and taste, chocolate, plums, sugar notes, medium sweet, light bitter. Full body, malty bitter sweet finish. Good.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Very good Quadruple and Trappist.

Colour: dark amber with dark white head.

Taste: explosion of flavours but well balanced. Sweet, hints of dark fruit, caramel and herbs. Warm aftertaste.
Very nice glass and perfect to bring out the flavours in their fullest.

Bought in Carrefour but is available in almost every supermarket. The price is higher than other special beers but is really worth it with the better raw materials and the time that has been put into this beer.
This is a good example of the years of striving for perfection

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: In Ghent . Colder than it should be, served around 8/10 C, but I couldn't wait.Deep flavor with nuts, red fruits , liquor.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: This beer is close to perfection. I am very particular about the taste of water in beer and we can say here that the water from the Tridaine spring is exceptional.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Incredible. This one is a meal in itself. Drank from a pint glass. Tried hard pouring for the first time. Aroma is coffee and dates with plenty of general sour notes. Hard pour led to half a glass of foam once it settled. Spices speckled the top of the foam making the beer appear like some sort of dessert. Taste was definitely dark fruit and spices. Some sour notes on the back end but definitely one of the best well-rounded finishes I've ever had. Expensive but completely worth having multiple times a year.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottled at Chef Raide (Caen)
Malty nose, of vinegary grapes.
Dark brown color with slightly ruby â€‹â€‹hues.
Fine foam.
In the mouth a sweet, malty and vinegary grape taste is drawn and seductive.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
0.33 bottles
Beer with excellent texture and color, full and rich foam
The taste is excellent, as is the brutal aftertaste
Along with Gulden Draak, the best beer I've tried

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: A classic that I had not yet had the opportunity to test, so here it is corrected. After its two little sisters, the Trappiste 10 with its ebony color turns out to be almost perfectly smooth. The aromas are powerful but balanced, with notes of caramel, alcohol and marzipan. The flavors are similar in power and balance, and they too are rather caramelized, alcoholic, even syrupy. A delight. A treat.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Bottle from the LCBO. Clear dark brown with a large fluffy khaki head that fades slowly and leaves sparse lace. Nose is plum, raisins, cherries, brown sugar, anise, light smoke, cocoa, wood, roast, and bread. Light+ dark fruit sweetness with a medium tartness. Mouth is full- and oily with soft carbonation and a warming finish. 

9/3+/8+/4/17

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown, lasting cream head. Aroma rich dark fruit and apricot. Taste is strong and rich, plums and hint of almonds. Noticeable alcohol.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: The texture of the foam and the dark color are convincing at first glance. The aromas and taste will knock you off your socks, but at second glance it's a bit too thick. I'd be happy to try it again.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: In aroma-  fruity, apricot, raisins, cherries. Brown, clear, with a medium, beige head. Taste- much more Belgian spiciness and still nice dark fruits. Simple recipe, but intensive. Medium-bodied, with a medium carbonation. Fantastic.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Pour was dark, with low head, disappeared fast. Nose, brown sugar, fruit cake, coco. Palate, co2 overpowers the initial palate, then get coco, bit of coffee,and dark fruit, date. Finish is medi7m, with some tanins, sweetness relative quick bitter fish. Westvleteren better!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Tried in a 0.33 bottle. Plum color with a very persistent beige head. On the nose dried fruit, plum, cherry, malt. On the palate caramel, malt, dried fruit, red peel fruits and licorice. Long and balanced finish between sweet and bitter. Full body, non-invasive carbonation. A unique beer, probably the best in its style and absolutely one of the best beers around. Every sip is a unique sensory experience.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Beer in 33cl bottle, caramel taste with a very pronounced and very balanced aroma. I recommend it

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Rerate based on my checklist, has been on my shelf for the longest time and is the last beer I have in stock.
Smell - medium strong, malt, yeast, caramel, Belgian notes, roast.
Foam- thin, alcohol, caramel, Belgian notes, some sweetness, and malts, warmth. The head is large, light brown white color. But goes away quite fast.
Appearance- unique beer bottle cap, simple enough but classic design for the label.Slightly hazy, quite dark brown, orange color. Not sure if hazy to be honest.
From - snifter
Taste - caramel, malty, alcohol, Belgian notes, yeast, roast, plum. The aftertaste is roast, caramel, sweet. Very good and tasty.

This started all the checklist thing :) Interesting enough before I liked 8 more, now I think this hols up a lot better.

Old score: 7/5/8/5/18=4.3

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Strong, dark color, creamy and stable foam. At first glance, the Rochefort is very appetizing. The high alcohol content is immediately noticeable, but in a pleasant way on the first sip. Later, however, the force takes over for me. Absolutely high quality, no question, but ultimately a matter of taste. A bit too powerful for me.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
If you are in to Trappists, this is the go to beer! Very Nice allaround! Coudlnt recommend it more

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle 0.33 liter. Dark copper color, clear. White foam, high, very durable, nicely coats the glass. Aroma quite heavy, dignified. Lots of dried fruit, figs, raisins. Slight sweetness in taste, red fruit, plums, red apple. Alcohol barely perceptible, warming

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Complex beer, warm, full body, very smooth, long aftertaste, quite sweet, fruity, cacao, caramel, a bit of port/liquorous wine, alcohol is there but very well controlled, meditation beer. Amazing.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Bottle. Aroma- very fruity, apricot, black currant, raisins, cherries and white pepper in the background. Brown, clear, with a medium, beige head. Taste- much more Belgian spiciness and still nice dark fruits. Simple recipe, but mega intensive. Medium-bodied, with a medium carbonation. Fantastic, distinct Belgian Abbey Beer.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown/ruby red beer with beige head. Smells like banana and malt. Tastes fruity, sweet, bread, chocolate, raisins and much more. Good beer, often compared to Westvleteren with good reason!

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review:
Dark brown, mahogany, opaque. Abundant, creamy foam, small bubbles, slowly falling, leaving a nice lace.

Aromas: subtle dried fruit, plum, figs, raisins, a bit of chocolate, pumpernickel.

Flavors and sensations: complex and delicate flavor, sweet, slight acidity, quite strongly effervescent, low bitterness, faint alcohol taste, warms the gullet.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Best beer I had in Belgium, rich, tasty, full body and at a reasonable price. One of my favourite beers now.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Dark brown color, medium foam not very persistent with medium-sized bubbles, light carbonation. On the nose raisins, candied fruit, plum, black cherry, caramel. On the palate candied fruit, cake, yeast, licorice, dried fruit, spices, pepper, chocolate. very long aftertaste, perfect balance in the drink between sweet and bitter. A beer perfectly harmonious in its components, the alcohol is felt but the drink is always satisfying. A wonderful beer, a point of reference in its genre that gives the best of itself in aging.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very full and creamy. Beautiful dark brown color and a nice head.

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: This is the best beer period, it's a little harsh on the palate but the taste, smell everything about it is just so good, this is the last beer I'll drink. Farwell beer lovers

product_name: Trappistes Rochefort 10ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ªQuadrupel / Abt
product_review: Very creamy head. Full, malty aroma. The taste is just like the aroma; malts. Very, very sweet with a warm sensation of alcohol. Not in a bad way at all. It really gives this beer warmth and colour. My favourite Rochefort.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Black without head. Aroma is sweet, malty, apple, chocolate and licorice. Flavor is quite sweet and light bittet. A little spicy.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tap @MBCC 2024, Green Session. Black, small tan head. Cinnamon, chili and barrel aroma. Rich, dark malty. Bittersweet flavour, boozy brandy heat, chili, dark malt. Ok controlled chili warmth.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Draught, taster. @"Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2024", Copenhagen (Denmark). 11/05/2024
[#7.461 Global - #1.465 United States of America - #10 Cigar City Brewing]
Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma: caramel, chili, apple brandy wood barrels and spiced malts. Taste: brandy and spiced malts. Boozy.
Next one, please!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
From backlog. Taster, On tap at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2024.
Almost Black with little head. Roasted Malts, coffee, barrel, Apple, some booze.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen Green Session 05/11/2024

Rating copied from Untappd.

2024

Peppers strongly similar to alcohol and barrel wood. Dry on the finish

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: I was very surprised by this stout at the festival. Lots of barrel in the smell, just brandy slightly caramel, raisins, plum, roasted malt, dryness. The taste has all the listed motives, but unexpectedly a very bright hot pepper is added, which is completely unexpected, it seems a little extra in the overall composition. An interesting experience, but many stats at the festival were better. This is more of an old school.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Mikkeller Beer Celebration, Green Session. Almost black beer, no head. Aroma of coconut, strong dark malt, apple brandy of course. Taste of apple brandy strong dark malt, caramel, boozy finish.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Rated at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2024 (MBCC). Spicy, dry and roasty with some apple brandy notes, cinnamon, chili and chocolate sauce, oak and wood. Pretty complex and tasty OMT still.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: MBCC. Black with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, wood and brandy. Flavor is very sweet. Dry finish with heavy alcohol and a spicy burn. Boozy. 110524

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
[MBCC 2024 Green Session, Copenhagen]

Aroma: Apple brandy, slightly spicy, oak, fudge and cinnamon?

Appearance: Pitch black with no head

Taste: Mildly sweet and heavily bitter, roasted malts, brandy, boozy and intense dark chocolate

Mouthfeel: Creamy thick mouthfeel with soft-no carbonation

Overall: Really complex and interesting on the nose, but a bit too boozy for my liking on the palate ðŸ˜…

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sample at MBCC2024, Copenhagen. Colour is very dark brown with very small head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, brandy, coffee....

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle thanks to Homer!! Pours inky black,  tiny black head,  minimal lacing.  Aroma is cinnamon,  chili,  fudge, brandy.  Flavor is medium sweet,  light bitter,  light plus heat.  Medium plus body. 
4,9,8,4,17

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Huge thanks to Mike for opening this bottle!  Rating #5000!  pitch black,  nice light heat,  light cinnamon,  well attenuated but with nice residual sweetness.  Mellowed roastiness.  Medium plus body.  Pretty good. 4.4

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2020 bottle. Finally getting to try this long-time want! Pours dark brown, near black, with a brown head that fades into splotchy lacing. Oily in the glass just like the other Hunah's. Nose was oak, apple brandy, with hints of chocolate and vanilla. Taste follows with present barrel notes providing warmth but no heat. The vanilla and cocoa are prominent, but the chili peppers were barely noticeable. A dry note from the cocoa hits mid-palate with a touch of cinnamon before the apple brandy barrel takes over in the finish. As much as I wanted to rant and rave about this one, it might be my least favorite of the Hunah variants that I have tried. Still fun to try and glad I did!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared bottle.  Pours black with a decent tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, spice, fruit, vanilla, and barrel.  Taste is sweet chocolate, cinnamon, apple brandy, vanilla, and roasted malt.  Excellent.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: New 2020 version. Strong cinnamon and milk chocolate in the aroma with apple pie, not as boozy as I expected. Dark brown body and head. Apple pie taste, brings out vanilla, some welcome oak barrel at the end to break up the sweetness. Not super thick and mouth coating, but that works well with these flavors.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 18K rating. Growler thanks to Kevin. Pours black with paperthin tan head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong roast, chocolate, brandy, apple skin, peppers. Held up so well, mouthfeel was thick, heat was still there, apple brandy sweetness, roast, chocolate, really enjoyed this.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle split on day 2 of Coconut/Cinnamon Death 2017. Pours pitch black with a small dark brown head. Aromas of caramel, apples, cinnamon, vanilla, malt and extremely oxidized fruity cardboard notes that sadly overpowers most of the underlying notes. Also a bit of tobacco as it warms. Taste has fruity chili, tobacco, cinnamon, less oxidization but still a hole fuckin lot. Dark chocolate and some berry-like notes. Sad this has gone so bad but oh well.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle sample (massive thanks to Tad & co 14/04/2017) - black pour with small tan head. Aroma and taste is sweet malty with notes of chocolate, caramel, treacle, some chili spice, apple brandy wooden accents coming in, rather old and restrained now, but sure would of been immense in its heyday.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle thanks to Anton. Pours opaque black with a modest brown head which quickly recedes. Aroma is oxidised cardboard, theres a hit of cinnamon and chilli coming through. Taste is cocoa bitter, hit of chilli, some tart apple notes, little cinnamon spice. This is oxidised by now but theres some discernible features. Tastes better than it smells but past its best. Bottle 70/89

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
32 oz. screw-top growler graciously shared by Dave. Originally reviewed 6/29/2012.

Pours an incredibly flat inky black. Glass-staining, as always. Viscous, but no head. Bummer. Growler, maybe?

Nose is brandy, booze, and, well, standard Hunahpu aromas. Chilies and chocolate. And more booze. The brandy aroma is a little on the sickly sweet side, though. Really detracts, I think.

Tastes awfully sweet at the start. Brandy comes through, but it isnâ€™t an imposing flavor, except for the sweetness. Chocolate and chilies are still pretty potent in this treatment. Thick and sweet and syrupy, though. Every bit of sugar is amplified by the brandy.

Thick and boozy. Still has the wonderful viscosity of Hunahpu, though, but it tastes every bit of 11.5% and then some. The sugar doesnâ€™t help.

Not an impressive treatment. Itâ€™s still a fascinating combination of flavors, but not something that improves upon the original beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: One of the best beers I have had the pleasure of drinking. Just amazing. Great barrel character. CCB should do more stouts with Apple Brandy. Possibly Vanilla as well.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sweet brandy alcohol heat that adds amazing complexity. Subtle oak and vanilla blending in with the vinous dark fruit notes. Chewy viscous body with lots of silky chocolate maltiness that is balanced out by the vinous apple brandy barrel notes. Slightly earthy oak that is very vinous with hints of dark fruit and vanilla balancing out the chilli and roasted malt perfectly.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: As good as it gets for barrel-aging synergizing with the base flavors. Rich spiciness and heat from the barrel, chocolatey and fudgy, that signature CCB stout mouthfeel, jesus christ this beer is amazing. I of course gave away one bottle and traded the other. Oh well.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: "Man, this is my 3rd version of this stout and they have all been soooo delicious. Harmonious blend of apple brandy, chocolate, dark fruit, very very subtle peppers. Super smooth dessert beer!"

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle kindly shared by Fux at the CMLSG14 tasting. The Apple Brandy distinguishes through a rather harsch brandy aroma, added with green spicy notes.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle (750 ml). # 2 / 84. Huge thanks for sharing this huge whale Fux! Cigar City black with a small ring of brown head and almost no lacing. Aroma is surprisingly well balance with dark chocolate, vanilla, brandy, light fruity notes, coffee, light green peppers and hints of chili peppers. Taste is slightly sweet with dark chocolate, brandy, vanilla, light coffee, raisins, very light oxidation notes and a light but lingering nice warming finish from the chili peppers. Full bodied. Medium carbonation. Thick mouthfeel. Light spiciness in the finish. Iâ€™m not sure I would be able to recognize the Apple Brandy in a blind tasting, but the complexity and the balance of this beer are impressive. And itâ€™s actually quite easy to drink.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle 2/84 at tasting. Black pour with no head. Aroma is quite mellow compared to the other Huna (tasted side by side with 2010 regular version), faint spirit notes, nothing identifiable as apple brandy however, just a more integrated, mellow spiciness, cocoa, cinnamon notes. Taste is balanced, lots of cocoa, light spirit flavors, spicy finish, light alcohol warmth. Nice stout.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle #2 of 84 shared at the 2014 tasting in the Cellar of Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles. Pours near black with no head. Aroma is fairly light with the vegy chilli , roast, dark chocolate and caramel. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter. The palate as well is somewhat subdued, maybe from the age. Itâ€™s lovely, but subtle. The apple brandy aspects come out lightly but nothing much. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Great, but so subtle compared to the fresh normal huna drunk side by side.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 750 ml bottle shared by some local beer guys. Pours dark brown to black with a small, dense tan head. The aroma has big dark chocolate, cinnamon, apple brandy, wood, lighter peppery notes, vanilla and coconut, all building anticipation for the first taste. The flavor has much of the same; chocolate, cinnamon, peppers, wood, brandy, coconut, full bodied, flavorful and definitely worth seeking out. Another home run in the Hunahpus line.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler @ Arminâ€™s palace. Thanks! Pours a fairly clear dark brown appearance with a tan head. Anise, dark grape, pear fruity, spicy dark chocolate, pretty interesting aroma. Dark chocolate, rich coconut, vanilla, caramel, birthday cake flavor. Pretty fucken tasty.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler at FoCo Stout Tasting 2013, courtesy of Armin. Thanks man! Pour is deep viscous black - like car oil - with a small tan head. Big cocoa, caramelly, toffee, sweet brandy, light chili, espresso, dark fruity, and raisins in the aroma. Taste is sweet dark chocolate, light hint of heat, chilis, cinnamon, sweet vanilla, nutmeg, coffee, grapes, and dark cherries with a big roasted finish. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. This one really held up well and is super tasty. Nice stuff.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sampled from a 0.75l bottle @ Top Hops (BA) Bottle Share. Damn this is black. Doubt the blackness-scale has anything blacker than this and it has a small quickly sidesticking really really deep dark brown top. Lovely nose with chocolate, apples, vanilla, wood, and itâ€™s actually so deep and intense that itâ€™s a little scary. Yeah I said it, Iâ€™m a little scared. Itâ€™s super smooth in the mouth! Thick, chewy and almost syrupy oily with a soft really prickling and stingy carbonation. It has a pure chocolaty liquefied roasty flavor. Oh my. There is also a soft sharpness in the finish here. Only subtle nuances of apple, wood, vanilla, raspberries and dark cocoa powder. One of the best Iâ€™ve had in a long time (and I have recently had some pretty incredible stuff). Huge thanks Josh! The things I would do to this bottle if I could just get it for myself.. 15.06.2013

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: As close to a perfect beer as you can get. Draft at the Funky Buddha 3rd Anniversary. Snifter. Pours a very dark, thick, opaque pour with thin off-white head. Aroma is strong with bourbon, meat, roasted malts, dark chocolate and earth. The taste is powerful with bourbon, oak, thick malts, spices and brandy. Full body. Flavorful, spicy finish. Just so good. Period.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at Borefts, thanks! Black with a small head. Aroma is coconut, chocolate, vanilla. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel, sweet on the palate. Taste is coconut, marshmallow, chocolate, vanilla. Yummy.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: THX! for the sample of this gorgeous rarity. 75 cl. bottle, yellow wax, no idea of the bottle nr. Black with a mocha rim. Nose is sweet molasses, light spices, chocolate, vanilla, touch pepper & warming what I assume is apple brandy. Taste is sweet molasses, huge vanilla, wood, I am even getting even coconut, sweet berries, caramel, very creamy chocolate, cocoa, warming. Creamy rich & decadent. Very good & completely different from the Stranahan which I have also had, Stranahan was a touch better even if this is still an incredible beer, so good.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Original review (2012-07-16): Gloops from the bottle as any Zhukov-based brew should. Tremendous roast in the nose with brandy and caramely notes. Lots of complexity here, though I wish it were more pungent. 



Taste is marvelously complex with brandy, booze, vanilla, spice, and plenty more that end up dancing atop the delicious stout base. Chiles are mild, where they belong. The trademark Hunahpuâ€™s chocolate, vanilla, and chile aftertaste gets a boost from the brandy as it tickles the back of my throat upon swallowing. Ultra-viscous body, as expected, and just amazing. 



Ranks among the best stouts Iâ€™ve tasted. I could drink the whole growler!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Yellow wax. A very sweet stout, appley, the cocoa and spice mellow out substatially.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: July 3, 2013 - bottle shared by Joe. Another whale came swimming out of Joeâ€™s cellar. Black pour with a tan head. Aroma and taste of chocolate, spice and brandy. Thick and smooth on the palate. This lived up to the hype.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: bottle 36/68 dont know what happen here i was poured maybe an oz so i will factor that so i was late getting to the tasting it was now room temp which in this beers case shouldnt be a problem so poured a silky jet black dark tan lacing nose was cigarette butts and some boozyness thats it taste was an ashtray i somewhat can say either this wasnt keep right or someone is messing with me

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler pour at a tasting. Black pour, tan head that disappears immediately. Alcohol legs, glass-staining lace. Nose is big apple brandy, spices, dark fruits. Taste is apple brandy barrel, sweet milk chocolate, dark fruits. Syrupy viscousy mouthfeel. Held up incredibly well. Easily the best CCB brew Iâ€™ve tried & very happy to have gotten a pour of this.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from Jay the Welder from Cigar City. This could be the best Stout in the World right now. Amazing Chocolate taste. Alcohol is very well hidden. Donâ€™t get any better than this

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Backlogged. Small sample at Capones during the 1st CC event in 2011. this was the first time they sent their beers to our area. Poured deep black with medium sized mocha colored head. Aromas were rich chocolate, vanilla, apple brandy, wood, cinnamon, and light pepper. Flavor was more layered with soft wood, brandy booze, sweet malt, spices, and cocoa. MEdium to fuller bodied with light to med carbonation. Barely any booze present. This was another gem at an awesome CC event before they over-extended themselves.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
22nd May 2011
Bottle 57/84. Opaque black beer, thick dark brown head that dies away quickly. Softish semi dry palate. When cold itâ€™s all about the soft creamy chocolate with dashes of coffee and molasses. As it warms up other  flavours appear - wood and vanilla sweetness. The apple brandy is quite subtle but provides a fruity sour undertone. Gets a little stronger towards the finish and is in balance with the chocolate and coffee. This is a lovely beer but Iâ€™m surprised how high in the top 50 it is.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Thanks to RB Dsgolovin for hooking me up with a growler of this nectar of the gods...

Apperance: Pitch black with a dark, dark, brown head.

Aroma: Chocolate, Spices, Barrel, Coffee, Roasted malts.

Taste: Cinnamon, Chili, Chocolate, Brandy, Coffee.

Palate: Supersmooth and perfectly balanced. Medium carbonation. Goes down way to easy considering the abv.

One of the best stouts iâ€™ve yet to try. World class.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler shared at CCB Black Friday. Poured a black color with a minimal fizzy brown head that mostly lasted with minimal lacing and great legs. Moderate to heavy toasted dark chocolate, vanilla, woody and apple alcohol aroma. Heavy sweet toasted sweet malt flavor with a heavy sweet and small brandy alcohol bite finish of long duration. Full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. This is a standout beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Apple Brandy Barrel - enjoyed Summer and Fall 2012


Appearance:  Pours dark brown with a thin brown ring. An iodine like coating is left behind on the glass.



Aroma:  Sweet brandy. Chocolate, coconut, pepper skin.



Taste: Strong apple brandy, cinnamon spice, dark chocolate, barrel char.



Mouthfeel:  Thick, spicy carbonation.



Overall:  A fantastic treat, even on a warm summer day in this case.  I had it in Denver and it was amazing then too.  As the old XX Meme goes: â€œI donâ€™t usually need barrel treated Hunahpu, but when I do, itâ€™s Apple Brandy Barrel Aged Hunahpu.â€

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a pitch black beer with a dark chocolate head. The aroma is malt, chocolate, roasted and fruit. The flavor follows the nose with additional sweetness, coffee and brandy. The palate is sticky with sweetness. Overall a really good beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler shared with Per, HUGE thanks to Greg. Pours oily pitch black with a small brown diminishing head. Aroma is fantastic; slightly vinous dark fruits raisins vanilla cocoa coffee chocolate roasted malty sweet. Flavor mmmmm.... Damn so good. Acidy fruity roasted sweet in front, explosion of cocoa chocolate coffee licorice vanilla and a bit booze with some pungent bitterness, all flavors just stay and stay all the way to the end with longlived bitter chocolate licorice and warming boozy aftertaste.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Really used motor oil with a thin mocha head,  Aroma of noble rot, chocolate and toasted nuts with resin and grape notes. The palate is smoked and licorous coffee with some vanilla

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler from Sean9689, thanks my friend. Black body with a small brown head. Aroma is chocolate, oak, roasted malt, licorice, sweet, syrup. Flavor is chocolate, vanilla, syrup, licorice, oak, roast. Delicious.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Jet black and then some. Tiny light brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, licorice and spirits. Sweetish chocolate, roast, dessert wine, licorice flavour with a faint hint of ash and some dried fruit. Deliciously complex and free of that annoying green pepper flavour often seen in Hunapu...

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ Odense September 2012 Tasting. Thanks Hallinghansen for sharing.  Pours black with a small creamy beige head. Coconut, pancakes, maple syrup, roasr, coffee, vanilla and oak. Smooth, oily and slick. DOPE.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Nice size sample from growler thanks to Corbet! Pours solid black & viscous with a thin mocha head. It smells of boozy whiskey, brandy, and vanilla as the oak gives off a powerful bouquet. Taste is chocolate, fudge, sweet brandy, oak with some roast and sweet coffee. A bit of pepper is noticeable on the finish and adds that nice base Hunahpu element. Very full bodied imperial stout with low carbonation and a thick, mildly sweet malt feel. One of the best stouts Iâ€™ve had and the only Hunahpu variant I like more than the base!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Tiny pour from a growler shared by Alex.  Motor oil colored.  Aroma of brandy, bourbon, malt.  Thick body, flat, tastes of malt, bourbon, slightly tart.  Very nice beer, reminded me of Sam Adams triple bock without the soy sauce flavor.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler. Extremely thick, engine oil like pour. Black with no head. I got lost in the aroma and taste of this beer, so good... Man, Iâ€™d like to have a bucket full of ths stuff.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Served on tap at Stoneâ€™s 16th Anniversary Celebration. The tap list has it as "Apple Brandy Barrels" but I am not seeing that in the database so I am putting my rating here for now. The appearance is a rich inky black with a rich brown head. The aromas  are full of chocolate and apple brandy with a healthy dose of malt aromas. The flavors are warm gooey dark chocolate, rich flavorful brandy with some apple tones, heavy roasted malts that give off a touch of coffee with some cinnamon and spice. The finish is rich with a maple oak profile. Very thick mouth where the heat is way present but not distracting. Just a wonderful beer and a real treat to make it to CA for a festival!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler courtesy of the Cheeseman. Poured a thick motor oil black with a small tan head. Huge cocoa aroma, a touch of cinnamon and just a hint of the barrel. More chocolate in the flavor, a little bit of pepper heat, and the most caramel flavor Iâ€™ve ever had in a beer, like a fine candy. Full long finish, with enough bitterness it manages to not be over sweet. World class.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate brandy aroma with weak hints of vanilla and coffee. Roasted malty thick chocolate and coffee flavor with nice woody brandy hints. Has a smooth roasted malty thick chocolate and coffee finish with brandy hints in the aftertaste.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle shared at RBSG 2012 Grand Tasting. Pours that signature inky black with an otherwordly dark brown head. Delicious rich fudge and chocolate with luscious vanilla rounding out the body and a mild chili influence.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler â€™12.  Rating off a growler opened yesterday.  I get soy and itâ€™s throwing me way off this brew, that wasnâ€™t as apparent yesterday.  The chiliâ€™s are still around I think this growler is relatively fresh.  Itâ€™s great...but soy.  Update:  Had multiple growlers of this batch with the same result.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Poured from a 32 oz. growler into a snifter.

Like the regular Hunahpuâ€™s, the Apple Brandy Barrel Aged Hunahpuâ€™s pours a viscous dark black chocolate color with a barely noticeable tan head around the ring of the glass.

The aroma is full, complex, and somehow elevated beyond the greatness the original Hunahpuâ€™s achieves.  The brandy is noticeable and seems to gently overlay the other aromas, which are consistent with the regular Hunahpuâ€™s: dark chocolate, a bit of espresso, vanilla, with a bit of pepper and a slightly fruity apple presence.

Each sip is nearly perfect.  The dark chocolate fudge, roasted malt, and creamy espresso notes all blend amazingly well with a brandy flavor.  The middle of the sip contains the zenith of its complexity, with the apple coming through, mixing with oak and vanilla from the barrel, and a bit of residual chocolate flavor.  The end of the sip wraps the treat up nicely, leaving a nice brandy flavor in my mouth.

The brandy mellows out the sticky sweetness that the base beer contains, and the barrel definitely lightens up the carbonation a little bit as well.  It is creamy and smooth, with the brandy cutting through the thickness of Hunahpuâ€™s as well.  This beer really just has the perfect body, carbonation, and smoothness that I am looking for.

After tasting Hunahpuâ€™s for the first time I did not think there was any way to improve on it, but after having the whiskey and the brandy, I have changed my opinion.  This is such an incredible beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
32oz growler courtesy of LoPo87. Thanks! Small 3 oz pour.

A: Thick as motor oil. No head. Legs on the glass like the lamp from A Christmas Story.

N: Intense caramel, cotton candy, brown sugar, coffee, fudge. This is mostly sugar, though, hence the score.

T: Good god. Diabetes. Cinnamon, chocolate, coffee, a little bit of soy sauce. A very slight pepper. Lots of dark fruits. Alcohol is well hidden. Pretty much the epitome of throw everything into the kettle. 

M: Heaviest beer Iâ€™ve ever tried. A little bit of carbonation. Expands and contracts all over my palate.

O: Thereâ€™s almost no apple brandy so deducting some points there. Honestly, this is amazing, and then itâ€™s way too much. I compared it to the way Nibbler must feel in Futurama as well as making the Mitch Hedberg joke that itâ€™s like pancakes: When it starts, itâ€™s amazing, by the time youâ€™re done, youâ€™re sick of â€™em.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler...  Poured jet black like motor oil with a thick, brown head.  Nose had brandy, oak, booze and roast.  Thick, viscous mouthfeel.  Super sweet with brandy, apples, dark fruits like plums and figs, dark chocolate, sweet milk and malted sugars.  A dessert in a glass and truly a fine sipping beer.  It doesnâ€™t get much better than this for a barrel aged imp. stout.  This is on the level of Vanilla Bean Dark Lord amazing.  [This was Apple Brandy aged, although I had no hint of ghost chili peppers on it.  So I put my rating here for now].

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler shared at RBSG Grand Tasting, 2012. Black, oily, ass with long legs. Huge brandy, vanilla, chocolate caramel aroma. Really rich. Very sweet, lots of barrel, comes off as bourbon a bit at first, but, no, itâ€™s brandy. Chocolate. Great, rich, flavorful stout.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler shared at the RBSG 2012 Grand Tasting. Pitch black liquid with minimal tan head and viscous, lacing liquid. Aroma is compared to the regular Huna less driven by the added flavourings but reminds more of a "regular" imp stout. Lots of chocolate, oak, vanilla and sweet fruit. I miss the chili from the regular one. Same flavours dominate the taste with maybe just a tiny hint of the chili. Decent amount of sweetness and raw sugars. Very viscous, full body with low carbonation. Absolutely delicious, but I think I prefer the original.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Poured from tap into CCB snifter.

Just like the regular version, pours used motor oil. Blacker than black. A good inch of head that has nice retention. Leaves nice lacing. This is my favorite hunahpu variation, with the rum right behind it. The latest batch is even better than previous batches.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Both 10 and 12 at STL gathering. Thanks boys! Iâ€™m going to rate this off the 2012. Pour = black. Aroma is really roasty and sweet with loads of fruit, cOconut and vanilla. Flavor also amazing with incredibly smooth and sweet fruit notes and light spice. So good. My number one of the night

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Swing top growler to oversized snifter for #600!  BIG THANKS TO MIKEM409 FOR SHARING THIS GEM!!!  Looks flawless; pitch black and viscous with a nice boozy-tinted lacing.  Smells fantastic!  sweet and brandyish that opens up into some notes of pepper as it warms.  Flawless on the palate as well.  OH FUCK YES!!!  DO I MAKE YOU BRANDY, BABY? DO I???

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Im leaving room in case I find a better beer out there but this is perfection in a glass.  Pours an insanely viscous black with brown creamy head.  Aroma is rich, robust and amazing with notes of toasted coconut, cinnamon, chocolate, vanilla, dark fruits, and spice.  Taste is more of the same with tons of flavor just lasting on your tongue.  Thanks to Mark a bunch for the chance to try this one .

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Ladies and gentlemen, this is the best beer Iâ€™ve ever had. Amazing aroma and the barrel aging blends perfectly

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler shared by Joel, you rock brotha! This was 2 weeks old but still outstanding. Not a thing I would change about this beer. Amazing aroma and flavor, slightly low carbonated but thatâ€™s to be expected. Thought Iâ€™d never get to try this one.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler into CCB snifter.  Super dark black pour with a minuscule dark brown head that receded quickly.  Aromas of dark fudge, spice, apple, booze and roasted malts.  Flavor explodes with dark chocolate, cinnamon, chilli peppers, brandy, apples, coffee, burnt malt.  Extremely full bodied, low carbonation.  Exceptional beer.  Big thanks to Paul Unwin for sending this rare treat to me.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This poured a pitch black color with a minimal dark tan head.  Aroma was pretty impressive, lots of fudge, apples, caramel, and marshmellow.  Flavor was much the same, just more intense, very interesting as I am noticing new and different tastes like 20 seconds after swallowing. A lot going on here but it all works well together.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
[Growler] shared by Armin. Thanks! Pours ridiculously thick black with a head so dark it's only rivaled by ten fidy. Aroma is incredibly strong barrel, peppery, and alcohol. The flavor is stunning. Peppery, oak, brandy, cinnamon, chocolate, roast, and just a ridiculously thick mouthfeel. So good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Fliptop growler sent by PaulUnwin, way too generous of you Paul! Dark viscous black pour with very dark chocolate brown head, aroma has notes of green apple, brandy, some booze, big dark chocolate, coffee, spices, roast, but mostly barrel with some slight chili.  Taste is awesome however, cocoa powder, bakers chocolate, some cinnamon, touch of oak, nice brandy, some coconut, vanilla, some more dark chocolate, slight roast and coffee, finishing fairly sweet, roasted, and spicy.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler shared by Armin!  Very thick, dark black pour, small ring of carbonation and an aroma of boozy barrel and chocolate.  Flavor is incredibly rich dark chocolate, brandy, then mellows nicely into the peppers and more peat and bitter chocolate and cinnamon.  Pretty god damn solid.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler shared by Armin.  Thanks for a cool one!  Pour is as dark as anything I have ever seen.  Viscous, pitch black, very dark mocha head, that fades to a small skim with a bit of sticky lacing.  Aroma is all barrel.  Booze, brown sugar, light chili heat right at the very end.  Not much of the base beer makes it through.  The taste though...wow.  Perfect blend of chocolate, lots of chocolate, more chocolate, some smoke, earth, a bit of spicy chili heat,  light wood, brown sugar and booze.  Thick mouthfeel and a lasting finish. Great, great taste, but the aroma doesnâ€™t do it for me.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Big fliptop shared by Tooch. Thanks, buddy. Really exciting beer to finally try. Pours a rich inky black thick pour, a small dark brown head atop dies to a ring, laces small. Thick and inky, dark and ominous. Aromas are richer chocolate chip cookies, cocoa, and biscuits. Touches of oak, vanilla, and touches of apples grow. Cocoa, coffee, and vanilla, gentle spirit, touches of dark fruit. A gentle kiss of spice. Initial is fuller bodied, with cocoa and caramel, smoothed out barrel elements offer oak, vanilla, and some mellow apple brandy spirit. Smooth spirit, brandy, and oak, well integrated with richer fudge, roast, and mellow coffee roast. Smooth, the barrel integrates well with a kiss of spice. A very well done barrel aged stout, firm sweetness countered with a touch of thinness with barrel, oak, and brandy. Vanilla, touches of roast, toast, smokey elements still stick around. No real spice. But smokey, smooth and silky, with a good barrel presence that integrates well. It loses the base nature of the beer, but still tastes great. Iâ€™m still out the Bourbon version, but so far, this one of my favorite barrel variant of the series. Very nice.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: black color, aroma of chillies, chocolate, coffee, toffee, dark fruits, brandy, booze, flavors are the same, supper thick like used motor oil, bitterness that lingers for some time, this stuff is amazing

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
The apple brandy version. Pours like motor oil and has tons of legs on the glass. The aroma is a sweet brandy. The taste is as thick as a milkshake. Wow this is a good beer. You get some cocoa in the end and burnt creme brÃ»lÃ©e in the middle. A great whale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Thanks meadme!!!! Jesus Christ this beer is so damn thick. Aroma of huna and apple. Taste so damn good thick cinninib chocolate goodness

Rerated with growler that is actualy carbonated and bigity bam perfect score

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
32oz growler from the most recent release with HUGE thanks to a great FL friend and an amazing FL trader. thanks a ton, guys! iâ€™m a fairly eloquent guy and as you can see from my ratings, a bit verbose but this beer brought me to a level where the only words i could utter were "fuck me sideways, this is perfect". yeah, itâ€™s that good.

pours as only a CCB imperial stout can. thick as motor oil but silky smooth capped by a rich, dense, red-clay colored head that stains the hell out my Hunahpuâ€™s snifter and leaves beautiful rings of lace. aroma is nothing short of divine with all that is great about the base beer...dense dark chocolate, heavy roast, a touch of toasted cedar, burnt cinnamon, smoked chilis, molasses, and espresso backed by elegant notes of wet oak, baked cinnamon apples, and sweet, boozy brandy that really pops as it warms in the glass. flavor is a near out-of-body experience with the oak, sweet brandy, and subtle apple notes complimenting and adding a level of complexity to the heavy dark chocolate fudge, espresso, vanilla, cinnamon, and smoked notes of the base Hunahpuâ€™s but allowing the rich toasted cedar and mild chili spice to still shine on the back end. palate is sheer perfection as well with the bold, imposingly thick, yet smooth as silky mouthfeel iâ€™ve come to love in the base Hunahpuâ€™s with a long, lingering finish of subtle chili spice, dark chocolate, and sweet brandy. overall, this may be the single best beer iâ€™ve ever tasted. itâ€™s an absolute marvel and a testament to barrel aging. wow.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Stumbled across this while picking up a case of Barrel aged church on the hill at the Cigar City tasting room yesterday.  I asked what they had in the unmarked tap handle and  the bartender said â€™â€™ apple brandy barrel aged hunahpuâ€™â€™. After I picked myself off the floor I ordered 2 snifters, sat down and was in awe. The aroma, totaly unique, ballanced smokey sweet, chocolate spice. Tasted just as unique with the peper ballanced perfectly to give you a warm swallow of smooth greatness. This is the most exceptional beverage Ive ever had. My expcetations were high, and this exceeded on every level.  IMHO, the nectar of the godz. , perfect!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler sent from an awesome regular trading partner, thanks Dave! Pours a pitch black in color with a small amount of dark brown head. Nose is light on the apple brandy, but itâ€™s there. There is chocolate, malt, vanilla, brandy, boozy, cracker, and cinnamon. The apple brandy is subdued in the flavor as well, but it layers the base beer nicely. In comparison to the brandy Zhukov, this is far more balanced. Mouthfeel is medium to thick, with good carbonation, and a long finish. Lives up to the hype, another superb barrel treatment of Hunahpu. The apple brandy compliments the base beer (which is an unreal imperial stout) very well.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Big thanks to Adam on this one.  Aroma: lots of chocolate and vanilla, cinnamon, slight hints of the apple brandy, molasses, cocoa, fairly sweet, noticeable alcohol.  Pours like black ink, very viscous, faint brown head dissipates fairly quickly.  Flavor is fantastic - starts with a hefty dose of chocolate, like chocolate cake without being overly sweet.  Apple notes, some warming alcohol, earthy/woody hints, coffee, molasses, roast malts, medium bitterness with minimal hop character.  The vanilla is fairly pronounced and the cinnamon is certainly present, the heat from the peppers has dissipated compared to the base, but is still just barely lurking in the background.  Extremely full bodied without being overly sweet, just the right amount of carbonation, very smooth and silky.  An excellent beer, glad I was able to try it.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this beer. 

The beer pours a black color with a huge brown head. The aroma has a ton of chocolate in it, as well as some roasted malt, oak and brandy. The flavor is similar. Upfront I get a ton of sweet apple brandy notes, with some chocolate and roasted malt coming through as well. I get a hint of spiciness and pepper, but the brandy and chocolate come through the strongest. Thick mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Awesome.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler, big thanks Kan. Aroma of paper, caramel, cinnamon, dark chocolate bar, chilies, sweet green apple. Flavors are sweet caramel and apples but good burst of chilies, dark chocolate, raisin, and spicy finish. Thick body. Getting some slight papery oxidation but hurts it a bit. Not sure itâ€™s better than the base or the bourbon but itâ€™s really tasty.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very dark brown and inky.  The aroma is rich, with lots of imperial stout malty goodness, lots of sugar but maybe not as much barrel.  The distinctive Huny notes donâ€™t really show through here.  Very sweet and candyish, with subtle apple and rich caramel.  I like it.  Very sugary and rich, the chile is I think totally lost, however.  The apple brandy barrel doesnâ€™t show through as distinctively as the bourbon or Palm Ridge barrels do.  But you canâ€™t say itâ€™s not serious business.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
First and foremost, thank you Adam! 

Smells like a really sweet hunahpus, seriously. The chocolate and cinnamon are present but the chili is very subdued, although I can still get the heat a little on the back of my tongue. Taste is very rich and sweet. Almost fudge like. Definitely get the brandy and slight tart. This is just outstanding. Some vanilla in there for sure. Somewhat roasty as well. I love it. Better than the original.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sampled at small peen.  I just had after regular Hunahpu.  I hated it.  This definitely takes the edge off the pepper.  Brandy is gentle but cannot over come the negatives of the pepper.  Not a strong enough base.  For me anyway.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Growler. Viscous inky think unctuous black. Huge chalky sweet woody rich mint chocolate white chocolate coffee crumble. Soft. Oily. Hunapuh spice masala late. Early flavors dark chocolate, sweet plum seems muddled at first because palate needs to attenuate to appreciate and to notice the cinnamon. But then when the tongue is coated, yum. Not as smooth and sublime as original but yummy and fun.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Growler (6/18/12) shared by umr_urgefan- thanks again, Paul! Pours an inky, dark, opaque brown with almost no head whatsoever. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate, oak, berries, apples, molasses, caramel, and soy. Flavor of vanilla, caramel, cola, oak, chocolate, brown sugar, molasses, and then some subtle smoke and peat on the finish, maybe with a hint of the spices. The spice from the base beer is very subdued here. Medium-full bodied, with a silky smooth mouthfeel and low-moderate carbonation. Pretty damn sweet. The barrel takes over in this one. Excellent, and looking forward to having it again in a few weeks. Re-Rate: Well, itâ€™s been a few weeks, so we had it again along with a 2010 bottle (number 37 of 84) that was shared by Sean9669- thanks, Sean! The 2010 wasnâ€™t quite as tasty as the 2012; it had smooth apple brandy, molasses, vanilla, caramel, and oak in the nose; the flavor was just as smooth and rich, with low carbonation. It just didnâ€™t pop like the 2012, which is every bit as good as the regular, whiskey, and bourbon Hunahpuâ€™s, and which was the overall winner for our tasting group. Itâ€™s just a little too sweet for me to put it above those other three, but itâ€™s damn good. A singular drinking experience.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2012 growler and on tap. best Hunahpuâ€™s treatment. Smooth and so good. I want to bathe in this. chilis on the back end, spices kick around there but the barrel gives this great sweetness, it is so smoooooth!

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
What just happened? Thanks Brad for this share, completing my Huhaphus journey. Beer served in a cervoise.

Beer is black with a nice tan head, small bubbles, lacing, low carbonation, decent retention.

Aroma is hunahpuâ€™s base, chocolate, sweet, mild spice, with this incredibly layered liquor, this smells perfect.

Iâ€™m cautioning myself from giving this a perfect 5 but it is damn close. Nice body, medium, creamy, coats the mouth almost completely, mildly roasty, sweet liquor up front, mild fruitiness, chocolate and fudge on the palate. An awesome beer.

product_name: Cigar City Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel AgedðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Shared by who else but ygtbsm94. Wow man, thanks for sharing another one of my most highly coveted beers.

Bottle 61 / 84

The beer is black. The appearance is oily and viscous. Atop the beer rests an inch of dense, beige head that hangs out for the duration. Cigar City sure makes some good looking stouts.

The aroma offers less cinnamon and spice than the standard Hunahpuâ€™s. Beautiful dark roast and chocolate aromas, along with oak, vanilla, and a light boozy sweetness.
