product_review: 1st birthday. Bottle shared with koleminer20, Gus and others at the Unnamed Bottle Share. Aroma is wonderful boysenberry, honey, sweet, wonderful, jam. Appearance red purple, poured thick, wow. Taste is boysenberry, honey, sweet, syrup, so fucking good. Mouthfeel is heavy, syrup, boysenberry honey aftertaste. Overall, fuck me this is fucking good.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle generously shared by somebody at the Mongers throwdown. Pours a reddish purple color. A huge sweet oak and berry nose. Very sugary sweet, no heat, light tart berries but mostly just core juicy sugary berries. Amazing. So damn good.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
375ml bottle shared at ML Fontainas, 3iÃ¨me fÃªte de la St Jean, shared with Rlgk and _Angst_. Huge thanks to Alex for this generous offering.
Purple in color, golden in the glass leaving a fine red reflection on the edges.
Aroma is generous, powerful with a fresh and organic bouquet of honey but a finely sour retro of red berries. The whole is well-conducted, complex suggesting scents mixing fine fruity acidity and the wilder side of honey.
Palate is warming, fruity of red berries, certain thickness in the mouth with a profile letting escape a fine acidity, small earthy sweetness of strawberry, raspberry, acidity of blackberry and other berries with a name that is often new to me. Surprising at all levels especially in the way the honey marries with the fruitiness which is very varied here.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Shared bottle at Aaronâ€™s. Big nose with booze. Fruit. Blackberry and raspberry notes. Sweet and sticky.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Thank you Brad! 

Deep purple body. Grandiose nose of dark berries and jam. Amazing nose and flavor. So delicious itâ€™s difficult to focus on anything else.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle at Woodshop 10 thanks to richiesd. Inky purple pour, still, big alcohol legs. Outstanding blackberry pie and fruity berry blend aroma. Flavor is super jammy and rich, excellent interplay between sugar, acid, alcohol, and tannin creating pinot noir like complexity but with wildly intense flavor. Exquisite palate, dense and rich but not syrupy sweet. Amazing.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle thanks to Brian. Pours a dark purple with no head. The aroma is honey and berries. Thick, jammy, boysenberry, vinous, very sweet, really impressive.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Madeline is just a treat. Ruby red edges around a purple body. Smell is honey and boysenberry essence. Taste is great - a tad less sweet and more berry and earthiness than other Schramms fruit bombs. Amazing stuff. Wish I could get cases of it!

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle shared by Kermis at a mini Netherlands session. Pours vampire blood purple with no head or lace. Flavor is sour apple, boysenberries, blueberry, raspberry, and vino honey. Smell much of the same, so much dank and dark fruit. Iâ€™m loving this one.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle shared. Dark dark red with no head. Aroma is red wine like but with spice, red fruits, raspberry and honey/floral aspects. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with a thick chewy mouthfeel and soft carbonation.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle - Holy @#$%!!! Iâ€™m in love. Nose is honey, sweet, boysenberries, black currants and raspberries. Taste is very sweet and decadent with beautiful flavors of the boysenberries, blackberries, and a slight bit of lemon zest to finish.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 375 mL bottle. Pours blood red. Thick. Smell is honey and boysenberry jam. Sweet and rich fruit aroma. Taste is also very sweet. The fruit lends a deep tartness and is reminiscent of currants. Sweetness is rich and heavy, as is the mead itself. Strong alcohol bite is the only detractor.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle at Schrammâ€™s. Pour is deep purple with some nice lacing. Aroma and flavor of raspberry, blackberry, oak, vanilla, and booze. Finish is sweet, but not overly so, with the booze heat coming through right at the end. Definitely sweet, but not as much so as some of their other offerings.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Just a phenomenal product yet again from these guys. I wonâ€™t go into great detail but one thing I recall while drinking this is that while it was sitting in my lap I could smell it like I had a fresh jar of boysenberry jam. Incredible.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle pour. Dark purple pour, flat. Boysenberries, tart and sweet fruit aromas. Nice sweet and berry tart Flavors.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Purple - nose and taste of rich honey, boysenberry, alcohol soaked vanilla and oak - med body

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Pour out of bottle at the Schrammâ€™s Holiday Gala, thick dark reddish purple pour with no head, still pour, aroma brought tart berry, cherry, blackberry and slight currant into a bit of spice, cinnamon into lots of nice honey, vanilla. Taste was a nice mix of sweet berry, cherry, raspberry, blackberry are the predominant flavors, into a nice honey, vanilla, floral mix with a touch of tart berry as well, finishing slightly spicy, sweet. Another winner, per usual.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
April 29, 2017. Bottle at Schrammâ€™s Balcony Bonanza (indoor edition). First birthday.

No butter nor popcorn. Very nice. 



 November 27, 2015. Bottle, shared by linusb, thanks! 


Deep purple with no head. Aroma is sweet black berries, hints of sweet raspberries berries, honey, alcohol, there are some disturbing nutty brown butter notes. Taste is sweet and tart berries. Finish is tart and sweet black berries, raspberries, black currants, honey. Medium to full bodied, oily, no carbonation. 

Didnâ€™t live up to the expectation unfortunately, Taste was very good but the aroma was a bit off for me. 

7-4-8-4-16 = 39

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Bottle courtesy of linusb. Rating 4000 if I add my backlog to my current total. A coincident but extremely happy a Schramms mead is my 4000th rating on this great site. Pours viscous deep bluish red leaving some prominent legs on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy fruity with honey, black raspberries, blackberries, butterscotch, moist soil, liquorice root, leather, minerals and alcohol. Taste is sweet, sour and heavy fruity. Mouthfeel is round, oily, sticky sweet, tart, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and sour with honey, black raspberries, fleshy sweet blackberries, black currants, leather, moist soil and alcohol. This is good. Really good. But somehow Iâ€™m still dissappointed. Tasty fruited mead but lacking in depth for a Schrammesque score. Sweet blackberry/raspberry jam with a very high acidity in the back. Iâ€™m in no way a boysenberry expert and this might just be the case of a berry that doesnâ€™t suit me as well as raspberries, currants or cherries.

Re-rate! 1st birthday. I experience this as much rounder and balanced than the first batch I tried. The honey sweetness and berry tartness and astringency seems more balanced. Round and delicious!

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle at Ratebeer KvillebÃ¤cken Winter Gathering, 151127. Deep ruby beer with no head. Honey aroma, raisins, blackberries, almonds, toffee. Honey flavor, blackberries, grapes, almond notes, toffee, raspberry notes, sourish notes. Maybe my expectations were too high, but this was a bit of a disappointment.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Update with "First birthday". Donâ€™t get the buttery popcorn at all. Very nice indeed!! 2015-11-27, 4p A: Deep deep red. N: Blackberry, butter, popcorn T: Blackberry, Cassis, butter O: ......wow.....

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Pours deep red aroma of earthy Berry. Flavor is rich boysenberry, rich sweet, mild tannins. Fuller in body. Rich. Great.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Smell is incredibly rich and condensed jammy boysenberry essence. Taste is the same. Thick body with a slight alcohol tinge.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Purple red color. Juicy, delicious liquid heaven. The boysenberry flavor is bright, sweet, concentrated. Just a slight hint of tannins. Not overly decadent. Just overly amazing.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Sample at Schrammâ€™s on 8/9/15. Dark purple pour with no head and some legs. Aroma of boysenberry, light botanicals, alcohol and honey. Sweet berry flavor with some honey accents before a tart berry finish.

Tried it again at Schramm's on 9/9/18 and it's a 10 on flavor, not an 8. I usually don't re-rate, but this one is amazing.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Really nice color, almost purple. Tastes like sweet boysenberries. Like all of their stuff, super juicy. Coats the mouth. Just a delightful beverage. Fantastic tribute.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Dry fruity nose, very enjoyable. Taste is the same and a perfect balance between the two.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: This is a fantastic boysenberry mead. Very sweet. Lovely hazy dark red color. smell is slightly acidic. I love large boysenberries and this is amazing. Very earthy and herbal, yet nice and sweet.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Omg this is so fucking fantastic..... This fruit is so
amazing... This might be the best mead I've ever had

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
2nd favorite beverage of the night! nice heat, bold flavors, perfect mouthfeel.

Madeline would pair nicely with my perfectly smoked signature ribs, and ANYONE BUT my motherâ€™s cornbread...


Madeline is a wonderful mead, and an even better baby girl!

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Pour at schramm. Fantastic purple color. Big red wine aroma and fresh berry. Taste is big bold juicy berry. The honey is not over bearing.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Pour to plastic taster at Schrammâ€™s. Looks good; a still, cloudy black raspberry. Smells fantastic! A decadent blend of berries and honey. Tastes like it smells with a smooth, slightly tart medium full-bodied mouthfeel thatâ€™s a bit warming. Incredible.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Tap at Schrammâ€™s. Aroma is ultra rich berries with lots of vanilla and honey too. Tastes very rich with a strong sweetness but never cloying. Itâ€™s basically liquid boysenberry syrup with hints of flowers and honey. So easy to drink with the perfect mouthfeel I always expect from Schrammâ€™s.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Pour at the meadery. A very dark barely tinted dark red color with only a couple bubbles. A tart berry aroma. Huge jammy berry flavor upfront. Tart in the back as it goes down. An amazing honey quality flavor all throughout. Fantastic stuff as I would expect nothing less.

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Tap @ Schrammâ€™s: Light indigo body; a good gradient of crimson & purple. No head, just a few stray bubbles at the top. Mind numbing berry explosion on the nose. Huge boysenberry, blackberry, & even some blueberry; juicy, sweet, nice load of honey & very mild grassiness. My saliva glands even get a hint of tartness from the aroma. Flavor is incredible. Just like biting straight into a bushel of boysenberries. Very sweet, like boysenberry syrup, yet not over the top or cloying at all. Balanced well with a hint of jammy tartness & some light perfume/floral notes in the finish. Leaves a mouth coating of honey dipped berries. The way Ken & company constantly kick out meads of this caliber is nothing short of amazing. Congrats to Alyson & James on their beautiful baby girl. What a great way to honor her - this is incredible!

product_name: Schramm's MadelineðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Pour at the schmeadery. Pours a still, crystal red-purple. Aroma is an intoxicating blend of Berry, earth, and honey. Taste is an extraordinary balance of boysenberry and wildflower honey, with a sweet start and a fruity tart finish. Sublime.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle bought as single. Nearly pitch black in color, opaque with slight head which is tan-brown. Aroma is both sweet and roasty with hints of coffee and chocolate. Really good. Strong malt and some alcohol taste. Definitely taste the chocolate and coffee - even more in the aftertaste. Great beer and it better be for $8.99/12 oz bottle.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Mild coffee and chocolate aroma. Small head, lasts a little. Smooth but thin texture. Mildly bitter blended with typical stout flavours.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355ml bottle from Dunells in Jersey. Pours jet black with a thick beige foamy head. Aromas & tastes of coffee, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak & roasted malt. Medium to full body. Smooth finish. Alcohol very well hidden. Outstanding

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Thick and dense and heavy and dark. Strong stout with all the trimmings of Imperial bite, strong coffee and chocolate. Heavy 12% ABV to warm you up on those cold winter nights. A great beer.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Medium, long-lasting, brown foam, black color. It attacks with dried fruit aromas, prunes stand out from the crowd. In addition to the hazelnuts, there is chocolate, coffee, cocoa, and of course the massive feeling of bourbon. The taste brings the richness of the aroma cloud, chocolate, coffee, cocoa, dried dark fruits, vanilla, bourbon, caramel. Full-bodied, slightly carbonated, moderately bitter. The flavors blend into each other, the balance is excellent. Great beer!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Wow! When I see this beer on tap or in the store, I donâ€™t let it pass by. Tastes of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, and barrel-aged perfection.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Vintage 2023. Opaque dark brown with thick beige foam. Roasted malty aroma with notes of whiskey, chocolate, cream, vanilla and cola. Malty taste with notes of coffee, chocolate, whiskey and cola. Medium bitterness and light sweetness. Full-bodied, slightly creamy and rough.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
33cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Black colour with a thin tan head.
Aroma is roasted malt, cocoa, coffee, vanilla.
Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, sweet, coffee, vanilla, hints of bourbon and oak.
Full body, soft carbonation.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 10/6/2023. Bottle shared at SBGP3. From Beer Republic online store. Pours thick, black with a rich tan coloured head. Great pour. Aroma of big coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, molasses, liquorice, burnt toffee, wood and a hint of coconut. Moderate sweetness, medium plus bitterness. Full bodied, creamy, soft carbonation. Lovely.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
.355 in Kroken while trying to enjoy Manchester United's Europa League visit to the RamÃ³n SÃ¡nchez PizjuÃ¡n stadium. While I am arguably late to the party Founders' products have increasingly become my go-to brewery over the last couple of years due to the nigh on unbeatable combination of relatively low cost and - crucially - consistently very high quality of their products. I am yet to be disappointed and would argue that Founders is among the beer-aficionado's best friends in these trying times for our world.

Having said that, the deep dark brown slightly oily, murky body of this brew is perhaps not the most inviting. The espresso-coloured head does help improve the looks along with the crocheted lacing. 

Given the alcohol level the first impressions of the aroma are perhaps lighter, less pungent and invasive than one would hope for and expect. Not that it is anything wrong with that, not at all. Regardless, the main impressions are of smoky, slightly bittersweet roasted malts with notes of wet charcoal, freshly baked brown bread and spices. The sweet component might be something akin to vanilla or similar.

The flavour is at first distinctly sweeter when compared to the aroma. Again, this is not a problem, the KBS gives you an initial bitter smack on the snout before soothing you with its sweet touch. This reviewer always enjoy beers where the combination of aroma and flavour are distinctly different but come together to produce a great experience. The dark malts are still there, but the bitterness is less prominent in the notes of cocoa, dark chocolate and coffee. The characteristics of bread and vanilla from the aroma are joined by bourbon barrels leading into a long, dry and bitter finish. One could argue that the finish is too bitter and dry for some, and I might agree at least on some level. Regardless, this combination of aroma and flavours will take you on a rollercoaster-like brewbased thrillride.

All in all the experience is helped by one of the most pleasing palates this reviewer has come across recently. Very much full-bodied, quite creamy, and slightly oily. I swear, this is (even) better than it sounds.

Given my previous Founders reviews this is perhaps getting boring, but this comes - again - very much recommended. Great stuff!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Coffee,smooth.very malty and heavy body.lots of bitterness.Excellent.
Tap@Leskinen,Oulu,FI

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours absolutely pitch black (I put a flashlight against the other side of the glass.  Nothing.) with a thick chocolate milk colored head that is in no hurry to go anywhere.  Aroma is chocolate croissant with roasted grain and nuts.  Mouthfeel isnâ€™t as think as the pour would suggest, but certainly had a texture.   The first few sips blew me away.  What shot right though the middle was a vegetal, almost green bell pepper streak that I wasnâ€™t expecting at all.  It was enveloped by what you might expect.  Subtly sweetened croissant, toasted grains and yes a touch of a bourbonish aftertaste (not the aftertaste of the beer, the aftertaste of a sip of bourbon).   Again, the vegetal taste really stands out to me in a spectacular way.  This is more savory than sweet and I wasnâ€™t expecting it.  The aftertaste of the beer is not bitter, more toasted, and doesnâ€™t outstay itâ€™s welcome.  Thereâ€™s absolutely some warmth in the back of the throat.  The complexity is astonishing.  I cannot believe it has taken me this long to have this. An all time great.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: bottle 355 ml, bottled on 02.11.2019, medium-grained persistent hazelnut-colored foam, black color, the nose is an explosion of aromas immediately Bourbon then mocha coffee cocoa caramel vanilla Vov wood, in the mouth it is enveloping rich Bourbon coffee Vov dark chocolate dried fruit vanilla licorice, structured body, the alcohol is felt and is balanced, flat carbonation, oily, sweet and at the same time dry, accentuated bitterness long in the finish. A spectacular complex beer but I would have preferred it a little more rounded. c. Beer-shop.it 17.02.23

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Opaque black beer with a small brown head. The aroma of coffee is most prominent, but the bourbon and vanilla also come forward. I did not pick out the cocoa and oak. The taste is supported by a silky mouthfeel with just enough carbonation. Here too, coffee and bourbon play the leading role.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Nice enough stout. Easily replicated and bettered by countless craft breweries, but if you can get a bottle why not. The 100 score is just reputation overdrive.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355 ml bottle. Intense dark coffe low foam. Great strong smell, and not overly sweet. Oaked. Vainilla, cream, coffe, chocolate, milk, some red fruit in there. Taste is softer than i expected. Feels way less than 12. Is good. Not one of the best in the world, but good.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: After more than three thousand reviews of this beer, what more can I say that hasn't already been said? I simply ask you to please choose the right time and company (or solitude) to enjoy this great beer. Take your time to discover and enjoy all its countless nuances, enjoy it to the fullest, life is worth it. Great.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Drunk in a 35.5 bottle at Pico's house
Aroma cocoa, wood, vanilla, bourbon. Toasted
Bright black impenetrable color. Not excessive foam of good appearance. Fine grain
Strong coffee flavor. Cocoa and liqueur present. Bitter coffee finish. slight smoked wood flavor.
fpPr

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Sweet coffee and chocolate notes with a smoky undertone.  Drinks like a dessert.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Not my favorite flavor as this has a taste of maple syrup, though nowhere is that listed. It has a nice smooth taste and no real alcohol flavor. I noticed a little bourbon and coffee taste on the finish. This beer poured dark brown with a touch of red on the top of the beer.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Dark imperial stout; low light brown head; aroma of bourbon, coffee, sweetness, and vanilla;  balanced taste of bourbon, oak, cocoa, and coffee; full body, round carbonation, and silky mouthfeel. 6-year-old.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Well... it is quite possible to trust its label, I'll go for it anyway.
Dark beer with a fine beige head.
Just on the nose, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla and bourbon are recognizable.
All these notes remain clearly identifiable on the palate and what can I say... it's delicious!
Highly, very highly recommended!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
My friend Moretum brought this beer over and it made our evening; I've never had such a highly rated beer. 
The alcohol content alone creates a warm feeling in the stomach.
It has intense earthy, peaty notes that, mixed with strong dark chocolate aromas, offer a special drinking experience. There's also a dash of cherry liqueur, which also means that the beer really goes to your head.
It's definitely not a light beer, but it's a real flavor bomb. It would be too heavy for me every evening, but that's not what the beer wants; it's clearly a drink for special occasions and it's really well suited for that.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2018 vintage. Deep black color with beige tint. Distinctive aroma of chocolate and vanilla. Very present and dense in taste with chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, malty and slightly hoppy. High sweetness with light bitterness, full body with gentle carbonation.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Whats not to love about this beer...its as silky as a ribbon of dark chocolate dipped in a shot of vanilla espresso. The bourbon is a bonus to the perfection of this creature.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 35.5 cl bottle. Best before date 02/25/2020. 2019 edition. Black color with light carbonation and a finger of foam. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, wood. Flavor of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, toffee. Medium body, hidden alcohol, smooth, easy to drink, balanced, it may not be the best barrel-aged imperial stout today but it is very tasty, a classic in the style.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @La barrica 13, CandÃ¡s. 07/30/2022. Opaque black color with a beige foam crown, toasted aromas, roasted flavor, vanilla, cocoa, silky body.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355ml bottle from hopt.it, France. 2019 vintage. Pours fairly dense, dark brown, almost black, with minimal brown foam. Rich in residue in the glass. Aroma is rich of molasses, some chocolate and vanilla, nutty, ripe figs. Body is a little oily, medium dense, with soft ticking carbonation. Some alcoholic feeling. Taste is fairly sweet, also spicy like chili peppers. Final is long, of medium strength, with more maltiness and chili.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Syrup like pour, thicker than black coffee. Dark beige color 1 finger head. Chocolate fragrance. Opaque drink with sweet lingering cocoa tastes that stick to the tongue. High ABV = serious warming as expected. Mouthfeel well tolerated, the IBU too. Finish is medium.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black coffee brown, opaque, almost no head. Aroma and taste, coffee, chocolate, bourbon. Unctuous palate. Classy sipper.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black color, medium brown foam not very persistent. On the nose licorice, vanilla and coffee. On the palate, vanilla, coffee, toasted malts, intense woody notes, raisins. The astringent notes are noticeable in the finish. A beer with an excellent structure, the drink is long and well balanced, the aging in the barrel is very successful and blends perfectly with the toasted notes that are not exaggerated, the alcohol is a lot but perfectly managed

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Great Aroma like sweet chocolate Coffee with a hint of red fruit. Beautiful appearance of dark pudding with a frothy head that dissipates due to 12%ABV. Taste amazing, flavors of coffee, dark chocolate, and a finish of boozy oak.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Opaque, dark brown, almost black, with a thin tan head.
Aroma: Malt: Chocolate, coffee, tobacco. Hops: Dark berries, orange. 
Mouth: Full body, smooth mouthfeel. Starts out sweet which gets balanced with both dark fruitiness and especially roasted bitterness. Chokolate Mousse.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
This is a 2019 release which I am drinking 2022.
A local brewery had a few bottles stashed away for a while. Pours a very deep amber color. The head was thin and fizzy but to be fair it may have lost a little carbonation while it conditioned in the bottle. The aroma is very complex, it's boozy yet subtle with hints of oak, bourbon and beef jerky. The flavor is smokey but sweet. Notes of coffee, brown sugar, chocolate and a touch of vanilla.  I can only assume my bottle of KBS lost some of it's luster over time but the mild flavor only serves to enhance the complex layers of flavor. There is a bitter finish that lingers a little but this beer is great.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours pitch black with brown head. Coffee, chocolate and a whiff of bourbon on the nose. Creamy mouthfeel, coffee grounds, dark chocolate, bitter roasted malts, sweet boozy finish. Bourbon Ba is subtle. All wonderfully balanced. Wonderfully complex. Masterpiece.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at home on Christmas Eve. To be honest, I was a bit afraid of it, because it has happened several times that I ran into a beer rated very highly here, which then caused more or less disappointment. After all, in order for something to rise to the status of a legend here on ratebeer, it doesn't hurt if it has many/more reviews, which is relatively rare for new (newer) beers, knowing the site's traffic. At the same time, KBS and only KBS, I thought to myself, surely knows something that will offer something exciting even to a moderately experienced consumer like me. Well, I had to be wrong again. Even putting aside my relatively high expectations, this is certainly decently put together, with a correct little impy with a medium or slightly less intense barrel character. And that's pretty much it. Of course, it's easy to see why it was such a big deal 10-15 years ago, but fortunately nowadays even a moderately good brew can surpass this level by quite a bit. It was a kind of student money, maybe, and a warning not to expect too much from CBS, hehe.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle 355ml at Ruovesi KBS - CBS  horizontal. Pours black with thin bige head. Flavor has chocolate, coffee, bourbon barrel, caramel. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, roasted finish. 

Original rating 9-4-9-4-17 from bottle 355ml at Konttori 2015-04-24.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottled on 9/9/21. 12% about. Jet black, light brown head. Definite notes of bourbon, vanilla, and some kind of dark fruit. Hints of chocolate when I inhale a little more deeply. Flavors of dark fruit are quite prominent. Vanilla and bourbon flavors are more subdued than in the aroma. Strong hints of cherry linger in the finish. Almost like those chocolate cherry cordials. Truly one of the best beers I've had in years. Glad I have a 4-pack!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Shared with the boys at BBT 11/2021. Medium body, med-high carbonation. Loads and loads of malt character. Focused on the dark malts, strong coffee, slightly burnt and ashy. Also strong chocolate, cocoa, light caramel, and toffee. ABV hidden pretty well, it is perceivably strong, but well rounded. Very good.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma: rich dark roast coffee, vanilla, chocolate. Taste: rich in vanilla, coffee, chocolate. Full bodied, moderate carbonation, moderate bitterness. Complex, good, enjoyed.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Malty aroma and taste, a lot of coffee, chocolate, bourbin notes, medium to high bitter. Full body, malty coffee bitter finish with warming alcohol notes. Good.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2018 Vintage.
In the aroma there is bitter chocolate, coffee, roasted notes, the barrel is barely perceptible.
Dense body. Taste. Moderate sweetness, burning bitterness, dark chocolate, a little coffee and a little barrel and whiskey. Perfect balance, but expected a little more from the taste.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The aroma is very strong and immediately with character. Lots of barrel at first, then strong notes of bourbon, some chocolate and coffee beans, almost in cocoa, there is a slight sweetness, decent burnt from malt. The color is black, the foam is small, very thick in texture. The taste is good and recognizable to everyone. Lots of barrel and bourbon with it. Again, the character of beer in the form of an alcoholic note and a small burnt from malt when sipping. There is enough chocolate, a little as if with coffee notes again. Hints of caramel and a little sweetness. Overall good, but still its older brother CBS is an order of magnitude stronger.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very complex taste, chocolate, coffee, chilli, vanilla, high alcohol, heavy barrel flavor is worth drinking!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 33 cl bottle, bottled 12/16/2016, 11,9% ABV. Jet black beer, medium tan coloured head. Aroma is full of chocolate, coffee and bourbon. Rich mouthfeel, silky smooth, low carbonation, dry finish. Flavours are chocolate, toffee, coffee, bourbon, oak and roasted caramel malts, looong aftertaste. Wonderful beer, if you like the alcohol taste and burn. Personally, I don't...

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A first class beer that I have found at the sterk, Amsterdam. Opening this bottle yesterday and it was our beer to sleep and it was just the perfection made by human heart. A big brewery, unfortunately on Spanish hands but you still have a beautiful quality, simply a powerful stout, complex and aromatic with generous aromas of roasted malt, syrupy, boozy but the alcohol is not sharp, smooth, coffee, chocolate and you get a note of vanilla, oak giving a pleasant side of sweetness, final bouquet with the hop. The body is dark and troubled, normal carbonation, white and brown foam, a dream in our realistic side, perfect on the balcony during a windy night.

product_review:
There's no point in writing about it. If you have the chance, you have to try this beer. It's fucking awesome.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2020 Vintage. 12% ABV. Serve at snifter with room temperature. bourbon strongly noticeable, barrels a lot, vanilla is also there, smooth, perfectly arranged, strongly roasted, coffee and chocolate especially the bitter one noticeable powerfully, beautiful smell is the strongest side of this stout. appearance also brilliant, black color without any gaps, medium 2-phase foam where it meets the liquid very dark caramel brown. on the finish coffee and a large dose of hop finish. Alcohol professionally hidden like our faces under masks, but once I felt the aftertaste of alcohol, only once no less classifies it for hiding and a plus. Powerful heavy stuff, I recommend it with hard cheeses.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Very dark beer, dark foam, smells of coffee and vanilla that we find in the taste, I would say that it is a gourmet beer, I feel like I am eating a tiramisu with a high alcohol content.

product_review: Black, small tan head. Earth and dried fruits, red fruits. Vanilla, tobacco, leather. Very tasty, salty licorice aftertaste, balanced and very drinkable for a strong beer. A real pickup breakfast.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

The taste is well balanced with vanilla, booze and roasted malts in good proportion. The mouthfeel is full and smooth and the carbonation soft. Long and glorious finish. Overall: decent

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The creaminess is crazy. Beautiful layers that build into the punchy barrel flavor. Wonderfully made malt. Everything in nice balance. The bourbon is almost over the top, but the high abv manages to blend in with it. Fantastic.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This is by far the best stout I have ever tasted, and top 5 in best beer ever tasted

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355ml bottle brewed in Michigan at 12.2% (2019 vintage). Black with a neat tawny head, decent duration. Caramel and vanilla with some lurking coffee and chocolate fudge succulence in the aroma. Lowish carbonation, robust texture. Bitter finish with light alcohol. Sweet chocolate and coffee ground developing more complexity, then bourbon wood kicks in in the aftertaste. Thoroughly souped-up version of their Breakfast Stout, staying close to it in terms of flavour profile, perhaps a little sweeter all-in-all despite the increased bitterness. Complex, rich, balanced - but perhaps a little overrated. Still, it deserves credit for popularising the style, and definitely delivers on it.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Pours black with beige head. Aroma is coffee, whiskey, oak, bourbon, smoke, some toffee, ash, liquor. Taste is all of that plus sweetness, caramel, cigarettes, some oak powder. Ultimate beer!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, lots of bourbon, leather, tobacco, coffee liqueur, oat cookies.....a delicious and versatile beer, sometimes after a strong sip the alcohol burns through quite a bit, giving me the feeling that there is a chocolate bourbon in my glass, but I enjoy it every time.
I'm just not sure yet whether I like this or the CBS better.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Subtile bourbon notes with vanilla cream and oats with a coffee finish. Nice winter warmer drink.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

Full body, sticky texture, normal carbonation. Finish is alcoholic, but sweet.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, bourbon destillate, coconut, some grass notes? Taste full of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, caramel, hard chocolate candies, coconut, almond. full body, low carbonation, low bitterness. Overhyped

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black Tiramisu. Coffee and kahlua punches you in the face when you take a whiff. The pour is an agressive and confronting obsidian and caramel. The palate is thick and creamy like a maccas iced espresso latte smoothie. Without the half kilo of sugar.  Coffee by the truckload but balance from malt sweetness and dark chocolate. The thick mouthfeel adds the cream and sponge bringing the tiramisu. The finish is long, with alcohol warmth entering the conversation late but lingering after your other guests have left. Coffe never leaves the conversation though.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle.  By far the highest rated common beer that i somehow have missed the last many years.
pitch dark, small smooth brown head.
Super complex roasted malty aroma, a little dusty, not only complex but also quite smooth at the same time. notes of coffee and chocolate, toffee, caramel and of course roasted malts and bourbon.

flavor is just wow. coffee, roasted malts, a little wood, bourbon barrel flavors, good coffee bitterness that really rounds it off perfectly. No doubt it's a 9 or a 10  fainter sweet bourbon notes as it warm up.  Very potent. Really nice imp stout.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours black with a nice brown head. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, bourbon, cocoa, roasted malt, plum. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. A full body beer, texture is smooth, carbonation is low. Finishes dry and warming alcoholic with lingering chocolate and coffee. Persistent in the aromas and flavours.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Little foam retention. I expected more body. Flavor dominated by cocoa, the coffee is in the background, I have not noticed the bourbon. It is rich.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A classic, a real oil, black is black. A viscous texture and a nose carried on the Bourbon. The mouth is dense and greedy, in decadence with cocoa, coffee and always the Bourbon very present. A success, a delight.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Dark chocolate brown, slight beige head that quickly dissipated. Maple, coffee, aroma. Chocolate, coffee, maple, toffee, and caramel flavor. Chewy bread like body with alcoholic finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

Very intense aroma, coffee and chocolate with a touch of vanilla.
Taste equal to the aroma, very pleasant, not intrusive. A lot of bitter good coffee, without acidity.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beautiful view! Super black with thick and high foam, brown in color. In the nose, coffee attack and dessert chocolate immediately. In taste, of course, a repeat of the entertainment, i.e. a coffee and chocolate concert in a dry, dessert style. Very full and nicely composed, almost no alcohol. You can also feel the influence of the barrel in the form of noble alcohol and oak.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: D. Coffee. Vanilla. Bourbon. A. The same. Burnt sugar. Round. Soft. Balance. Friend.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Beer #500. Goodness. Poured into a snifter. Pours black as sin with a thick, burnt marshmallow head. Vanilla, oak, bourbon, chocolate, hints of coffee and toasted sugar... What an aroma. Initial taste is heavier on the oak and bourbon up front with a hint of vanilla. Fades to mellow roasted coffee and chocolate. Body is full but not thick. Carbonation is spot on. I'm trying to find something to improve on. This is just absolutely amazing.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 355ml Bottle - Black in colour. Coffee, vanilla, wood and chocolate in the aroma. Boozy taste with coffee and chocolate standing out. Too boozy for me.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle received as a birthday gift from my wife.  The pour is opaque black, with a Â½ inch tan khaki head.  The aroma is roast, sweet toffee malt, smoke and a big bourbon presence.  The taste is big roast, sweet toffee malt, black licorice, soy maybe and a blast of the wood and bourbon booze. The palate is heavier bodied, soft carbonation and a big boozy lingering roast sweet wood and Bourbon finish.  This beer is really well made, hits exactly what they were doing, though not my favorite style.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The famous KBS; itâ€™s def living up to the expectations. Subtle, yet boozy and complex; coffee (!!), chocolate, licorice and a hint of bourbon. Wow, just wow!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
In short: coffee and alcohol. Medium retention foam. Ground coffee on the nose, when it warms up the alcohol appears. Little body for such a high alcohol content. In the mouth, only coffee and alcohol. I look for cocoa, I look for barrel, I look for vanilla... nothing. Disappointing.
Bottled 02/27/2020

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pitch black pour with a massive everlasting tan head. Bourbon, dark chocolate, coffee grounds, roasted malts, oatmeal, vanilla, caramel, black licorice, leather aroma. This smells like a real treat. Taste is halfway medium sweet and medium bitter. Alcohol is so well hidden. Full bodied with soft to medium carbonation. There's no denying this, it's fucking awesome. Now I just feel terrible for never having this one before. One to have again.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The aroma is strong with booze. It's barrel aging is obvious with plenty of coffee and dark malt. The appearance is dark brown with a tan head. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is smooth. This rating is dedicated to Bowden.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black with a beige head. Aroma of bourbon, roasted malts and vanilla. Kinda disappointed, I expected something more special. I've definitely had many better imperial stouts.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2017 model, times r tuff during the Chinese Virus lockdown! I found this exquisite beverage @ the back of my fridge! Pours a dirty motor oil dark brown color with a hugggggeeee fluffy tan head that lingers leaving lace all over glass. Smells of excellent coffee, licorice, wood, earth, brown sugar, whiskey and a hint of alcohol. Tastes of chocolate, coffee, molasses, malted milk balls, bourbon, wood, (not that kind of wood), vanilla & alcohol. Ginormous body, tingling carbonation, thick, luscious mouthfeel and a coating, warm, bold finish. IDK what to say? Maybe the best stout in the planet? I could tell u more about this beer but I donâ€™t have the skills to dissect the complexity of the KBS! This is way out of my league! Phenomenal! Exquisite! Unbelievable! Outstanding! All right, gotta change the H2O pump on the Bronco! #Merica! ðŸ’¥!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Deep mahogany colored beer with soft cappuccino colored foam. It is very complex to drink, espresso, vanilla, dark chocolate, caramel...all with a warm and full body.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
After opening the bottle, vanilla bursts from the barrel,
Dark with quite a nice foam, something between beige and dark beige.
The aroma after pouring is dominated by coffee, after a while chocolate and vanilla come. Overall, the aroma is very complex, individual aromas overlap but do not drown each other out.
Fullness in taste, bitterness velvety.
After a sip, the mouth is filled with dark chocolate, with notes of coffee, vanilla, chocolate and noble alcohol, chocolate and coffee give depth to the roasted bitterness. The beer is smooth, intense and simply delightful.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Classic among classics! Black dark, thick syrupy, rather sweet, coffee from everywhere!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Dark brown, without any gaps. Brown foam. Small and some medium-sized bubbles. 

Beautiful aroma of coffee and chocolate, with a hint of vanilla. Even intense. A bit of cacao choix liqueur. 

Silk, satin, velvet. Smoothness not disturbed by carbon dioxide, which fortunately is not much. 

Alcohol manifests itself only through pleasant warming. 

The beer is very thick. It resembles a liqueur filling. 
The taste is also dominated by coffee with chocolate. There are definitely notes of vanilla, and perhaps on the verge of perceptibility accents from barrel wood. As if marzipan too. 
There is basically no roastiness, and the bitterness is (despite its 70 ibu) very delicate. Well, ok, the coffee brings a bit of roastiness, but the minimum necessary amount. 
What's more, this beer, despite its parameters, is not tiring. 
A real gem, worth every penny it cost.

Don't age it. Unless you're lucky and have more than one bottle.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Re-rate @2021-11-13
How: bottle. 2016 vintage. Bottled: 12/05/16 11,9%abv.
Head: tan, one finger.
Colour: black.
Aroma: ash, oak, espresso, tannins, subtle vanilla, some oxidation, black currant, dark fruits. A bit faded aroma. Some alcohol.
Taste: medium to full body, soft carbonation, coffee, ash, oak, chocolate, astringent, a bit warm.
Very long aftertaste like initial taste.
Aged yes, but haven't improved with ageing. Or five years is just too long time for this.
Gonna leave earlier numeric valuation, as that is how this beer is when moderately aged.
8-5-8-4-15
From notes, rated @ 2017-9-12
How: bottle, 11,9% ABV.

Taste: full body, medium carbonation, chocolate, oak, coffee, a bit warm, rich.
Long aftertaste.
10-4-8-5-17

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: DATE: April 21, 2020... OCCASION: an Easter like no other: still quarantined, I write a gluten-laden classic while watching the 2016 Cavs/Warriors Game 7... GLASSWARE: Maudite snifter (bottled 2/26/2018)... sizzles out of the bottle into a jet-black body whose half-finger brown body erodes to a creamy halo... whoa, the hammer falls hard: thick molasses, chocolate, smoky bourbon, sweet brown sugar, and roasted coffee malts--a full offering for the nostrils, alluring and lingering, if not intimidating... first sip coats and thickens, a breakfast and dessert simultaneously warming and filling... chewy, oily, and simmering--between the hop tickle at the teeth, the strength in the mouth, and the long, slow burn at the finish, the whole beer seems to be one continuous experience without pause between sips... is it whiskey? coffee? stout? it expertly shape-shifts as all three... its flavor profile is the stuff of legends, a blast of coffee beans percolates between the sweet chocolate and woody pulp of bourbon... some vanilla sneaks late... it cannot be overstated how satisfyingly smooth and full this is--the trendsetter that I have waited a long time to experience...  at 12.3% ABV, it's downright dangerous... this makes you want to send a letter to the folks at Founders, thanking them for making some unholy offspring that reminds us why we drink beer...

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:

Poured into the glass like resin. Black night. Not much foam, creamy. Not transparent.

rich, complex: coffee, chocolate, cocoa beans, hazelnut, prune, fig, noble alcohol vapors are felt.

Body:
dense, low carbonation.

malty sweetness, tart burnt, bitterness and alcohol are felt at the end.

the aftertaste is rich and complex. Coffee, chocolate, nut, dried fruits, cognac alcoholic notes.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Copenhagen 26/12 2018. 35,5 cl bottle from Voldby KÃ¸bmandsgÃ¥rd Webshop. This is the 2016 release with an ABV of 11,9. The Classic label with the tagline â€œIs good for everything a flavoured stout ought to be good forâ€.

Pours opaque dark brown with small beige head. Settles as thin, transparent layer of foam unable to cover the surface of the beer. 

Aroma is very intensive, sweet with a nice boozy backbone. Sweet chocolate and caramel. Like coming into a candystore offer9ng Classic chocolates. Shoe cream, vanilla, coffee. Powerful alcohol lurking in the background. 

Low carbonation. Thick, oily and creamy texture. Have to work a bit to get it out of the glass. 

Flavor is heavy sweet. Followed by more moderate bitterness. Aftertaste is long and sweet with a spicy undercurrent. Lingers for a long sweet while. 

This is a very nice, very sweet and very strong Imperial Stout. A metal in it-selskab - but I would not dare to drink it for Breakfast.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
(2019 KBS) Pours pitch black and with a tan head. Noticeably smells of boozy and lovely bourbon with some vanilla and coffee beans. First tastes that come through are pleasant coffee and then a nice wave of bourbon comes through before finishing with semi-sweet chocolate. The ending hop presence is a nice addition and gives it some dry bitterness (in a good way). Very smooth given the ABV.

Very well done beer that sets the bar high for barrel-aged stouts.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Yes yes yes! A bottle of KBS is like the gold at the rainbow. Dark, full-bodied and simply amazing. Hints of coffee, malt and chocolate. Warm and cozy beer. Works anytime of day!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
I waiting so long time to find and after drink this beer in my country and i was so exciting to try it. But all my excitement was nothing when i finally drink this beer.
Anyway like i said i was pretty sure for how good can be this legendary beer and when i open it the aroma bursting my nose in the first secs. So much coffe inside and so much power. The beer is really lively. And when i get the first draught, one massive mouthfeel fill my mouth and my stomach. This beer is a real dynamite. It has the most coffe flavor i have get from any other beer out there and i love that. The beer is so rich and complex and give you one insane mouthfeel and go down in your stomach so smouth. Your mouth is so alive when you drink this beer. You can get any detail from the flavors in your mouth.. Chocolate, caramel and one massive amount of rich coffe there. Also the carboration is moderate and in the right levels.
Overall one of the best and rich beers i have drink in my life. And also the most coffe beer too.. Despite "Stout - imperial" beers are so expensive, this one deserve every penny from my wallet.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 33cl bottle 2019. Strong vanille aroma with lots of sweet milk chocolate, malts, some floral notes and Bourbon. Immensely powerful and complex flavor: sweet, bitter chocolate, vanille and roasted coffee, ending in a long dry roasted finish with some gentle alcoholic warmth. Very smooth and dense mouthfeel. Superb! One of the best barrel aged stouts available!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Instead of the usual Irish coffee, this is the ideal beer as a dessert after a night of heavy dining. Heavy roasted coffee, chocolate, vanilla stout. In which you can strongly find the warm alcoholic taste of bourbon. Full well-balanced body of coffee-chocolate, vanilla and Bourbon. Where the latter dominates and lingers in the strong bitter aftertaste. Very dry strong bittersweet chocolate vanilla bourbon aftertaste that lingers for a very long time. In fact, you can hardly get rid of that dry taste. Strong bourbon scent with chocolate and coffee. Thick deep black oily structure with a small cream-colored head. In short, for lovers of strong beers who also like spirits and vanilla, otherwise you will certainly not appreciate this beer. You hate it or you love it. For me, it has just a little too strong bombastic bourbon and vanilla flavor and it will now remain on my menu as a dessert beer. In addition, a memorable moment on the second day of Christmas. This is my 500th beer that I reviewed in 1 year (2019). xD I don't think I will ever surpass this.... Tasting glass

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2019 bottle

Black as tar with a brownish froth. I am struck immediately by the balance and complexity of the nose. Like studying a dark Rembrandt painting, I drift between the layers, the brushstrokes, the characters within the scene. No particular aroma overpowers the tableau. It goes without saying that dark chocolate and coffee are a strong presence, but too often those smells are broad and generic â€” KBS goes another step further. The coffee itself is fruity and nuanced, with hints of cherry and brown butter and toffee. There is a hint of vanilla bean, light licorice, some orange peel and mango. Rye bread and blackberry jam. The flavors are equally well balanced. The mouthfeel starts with an inviting, roasted bitterness of dark chocolate, progressing into a sweeter, custardy, vanill-y, crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, and finishing again with a punch of espresso. Fine carbonation throughout. Again, KBS shows restraint â€” while bourbon notes are present, they don't overpower. Too many imperial stouts want to boast their barrel-aged bonafides, but end up being as barbaric as a boilermaker. A rousing success.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a deep, jet black, with gorgeous brown foam. Nose is a lot of bourbon. But there is a strong roasted coffee base with just the barest hints of chocolate and vanilla. Taste is equally big; big coffee, big bitter chocolate, chocolate, smoke, and a hit of vanilla. Mid to full bodied, exceptionally creamy and does a great job of hiding the strong amount of booze in it. This an all around excellent beer.

Medium bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation & a finish that just keep on going and going and going. For sure the best beer i've tasted in 2019.
