product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: One of my favourites of all time. Huge bourbon character, some coffee and dark roasted malt a treat. Beautiful beer that is unbelievably smooth!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: This KBS is a relative disappointment. Relative because this stout is generally pleasant with frank and intense aromas. But disappointment because the aromas of coffee and chocolate are too erased compared to those of caramel and omnipresent bourbon. The balance is also not perfect, too much sugar weighs down my mouth and the bourbon aromas are a bit too violent. This KBS still lives I think on its image of yesteryear, a time when imperial stouts matured in barrels were rare. Currently, there are much better. Visually, we are in total black with almost no foam, classic. The nose is intense with a good character on chocolate, coffee, caramel, bourbon, oak barrel and vanilla. We do not obtain the same fullness in the tasting with the alcohol at 12.3% too much on the front, too much sugar and the aromas of caramel and bourbon barrel overwhelming the others. Excellent aromatic breadth in the second mouth on a warm but too present alcohol. The aromas are linear and are also found as such in the aftertaste and on the finish. Excellent lengths and body on the other hand and a bitterness at 70 IBU well dosed. This stout lacks a little finesse.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Imperial stout type dark beer with bourbon and coffee. You can smell and taste the alcohol a little too much, I like the deadly sin bourbon much more than this one. It's good but I expected more, it doesn't deserve a 100 on ratebeer.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Color: pours black as pitch, opaque. Foam low, fine-bubbled, light brown, medium-lasting, falls to a ring, with slight lacing.

Aroma: intense, barrel notes in the foreground, vanilla, bourbon, wet wood, then roastiness hits the nostrils, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, coconut, marzipan, cuckoo, plums, in addition dried red fruits appear. Over time, a light peat smoke comes out, ashiness. The aroma activates the salivary glands very strongly :)

Taste: heaven in the mouth...sweet, barrel rules, vanilla, bourbon, wet wood, roastiness, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, coconut, marzipan, cuckoo, plums, peat smoke, but unobtrusive. Coffee bitterness, low to medium, dark malts give a bit of sourness on the finish. After taste is dark chocolate, ash and coffee. Alcohol is well hidden, but it really heats up after consumption. In a word, class.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: From bottle. Opaque with a tan head. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon. sweet with a bit of a boozy kick. Creamy feel, finish of woody bourbon.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle from McCambridges in Galway, â‚¬10.25, bottled in 2016.
Attack: slick smooth
Mids: roast coffee beans, vanilla, dark chocolate, soaked bourbon
Finish: lingering roast coffee, bourbon exhale.
Overall: Super clean, insane transitions, an absolute pleasure to drink.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: black with an oily mouthfeel, vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate, hints of the barrel ageing

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Keg at The White Horse, Parsons Green In 2017. Itâ€™s a classic for a reason. Black with a brown head. Aroma of liquorice, treacle, roasted malt, bourbon, oak, leather and vanilla pod. Really full and rich body. Huge dark chocolate, toffee, molasses and whiskey flavours.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pitch black with no head. Aroma deep chocolate, mocha, espresso, vanilla, ripe dark fruit, licorice. Taste as aroma with a nice boozy kick at the end. Long oily aftertaste and mouthfeel with nice bourbon undertones.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 0,33 l bottle from Systembolaget. Fantastic beer, maximum points of course, thanx!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: It's all written in the name a little bourbon coffee breakfast. Thickness, length and presence, a must drink in the style!!!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
It is without a doubt one of the best dark beers in the world. Strong, with very marked notes of coffee, chocolate and bourbon, making it a beer with an important sensory experience.

A beer with great personality.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: The foam is quite large but quickly falls. Vanilla, cocoa in the aroma. Dark chocolate, vanilla, coffee in the taste, alcohol noticeable, lots of body.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Sweet smell dark high ABV. Chocolate coffee delicious. Aged in oak bourbon barrel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma of dark malts, chocolate. The taste is rich, sweet, chocolate, very thick. Great beer.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
On tap @ Taplokaal Gist, Utrecht.
Pitch black with a thin tan head. Massive roasted malts aroma with the familiar coffee and chocolate notes. Some bourbon as well. Taste is medium bitter with a dry roasted malts finish. An excellent imperial stout

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle: Black color, brownish head. Flavor is malty, roasty with intensive dark chocolate notes, cacao notes, nips, coffee, vanilla, wood, some bourbon and alcohol.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
750ml bottle at home, 2018 version. Pitch black pour, creamy thin tan head.  Chocolate, molasses, dark roast malt, coffee grinds, bourbon, oak, vanilla.  Low carb, thick, heavy texture and full body.  Roasty dark finish warms as it progresses with bourbon coming through most on the end.  This has just about everything going on, super impy stout.
Also on tap at ADT and Hive.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Ar: coffee, licorice, malt, chocolate Ap: black, creamy brown head T: med bitterness, coffee, med sweetness P: full body

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Great aroma with Barrel and coffee and vanilla smell. Thick and dark mouthfeel. Dark color.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle from Total wine Worcester, MA.  Pours oily, somewhat milky, ink black with dark chocolate head, surprisingly big for a barrel aged beer.  Aroma, chocolate, vanilla, impression of lactose too however, lotsof bourbon, somewhat vinous, gently burnt underneath.  Very good but lacks true depth.  Taste a bit more impressive even though the barrel aging seems less obvious: rich, creamy, good roast, dense, chewable, well balanced, albeit a bit too sweet for my taste, soft, alcohol well hidden.  MF very dense and softly astringent. Very good, very tasty, lacks a bit of finesse because it's too sweet and crude, a highly acclaimed brew that consequently makes me appreciate some of my own little Belgium's brews  even more.  Sugar... makes my arteries clogged up with cholesterol, eats my teeth and messes up my beers.  I can live with heart attacks and cavities but...  Maybe I should have appreciated their regular breakfast stout more.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: WAY overhyped and WAY WAY overpriced, Kentucky Breakfast Stout from Founders is the Poster Beer for exactly what is wrong with the hipster-driven corporatification of the craft brew movement.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Jet black pour, dark brown head. Strong espresso coffee bean aroma.  Brown sugar, molasses, cocoa and chocolate. Intense burnt coffee grind palate. Velvety smooth, warm alcohol finish. If you find this one out in the wild it's well worth the pickup. Close to a perfect imperial stout.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pour is dark mahogany with a dark tan head. Aroma malts and whiskey. A thick and rich stout with tons of chocolate, coffee and whiskey flavors.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Kentucky Breakfast Stout 2018, I think everyone understands everything and there is no need to write anything. Another respect to the brewers from Michigan for an excellent drink at a relatively low price.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On the nose , chocolate, caramel, coffee and tobacco. Early palate is milk coco, develops into a sweet spicey coffee, lingers with tannins and bitterness. Very good

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2018 beer dark brownish black color tan foamy thick creamy head oily lacing smell of vanilla coffee chocolate  roasted malts taste cofffee roasted malts tabbacco taste how it smells taste the bourbon at the end alcohol isn't strong though but does creep in

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bier Haus, New Glarus, WI. Almost black in appearance. Dark bronze head. Effervescent. Very rich, complex flavors. Heavy, dark chocolate flavor...like chocolate flourless torte in a bottle. Hint of bourbon. Dry, but mildly sweet. Very rich. Best at room temperature. Multiple bottles tried. Slight differences bottle-to-bottle.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 2019, 12.2% (ouch!) Pours black as night, not a hint of transparency.  Minimal head and lacing, maybe should have poured harder.  Super rich, complex, strong bourbon, but almost dizzyingly complex, so many flavors competing for your attention, vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate; nose is sweet candy, toffee; body is viscous and slightly boozy but alcohol is still very subtle for such a monster, very smooth and warming; lingering bourbon tail lasts for a long, long time.  Exceptional, but too rich to make a daily drinker.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
9.6.2019: 375 ml bottle at home, 2016 release. Pours a very dark brown with a tan colored head. Aroma of mild bourbon, toffee, chocolate, soy sauce, some cocoa, some sweetened coffee, hints of vanilla. Full creamy body with a medium sweetness and a light to medium roasty bitterness along hints of alcohol. The flavor starts with bourbon, burnt chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toffee, tobacco, burnt wood, caramel and nuts. Finishes with a medium roasty bitterness, mild bourbon and light burnt notes. Pretty good - the roasted malt are pretty dominant with quiet some burnt notes while the bourbon barrel is more in a complementary role.

Aroma: 8
Appearance: 4
Taste: 8
Mouthfeel: 4
Overall: 17


25.5.2022: 355 ml bottle at home 12.3% ABV, bottled 13.3.2018, bought at BeerLovers, Vienna! Pours a very dark mahogany with a tan colored head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, toffee, cocoa, mild bourbon, hints of raisins and hints of vanilla. Medium-full to full creamy body with a medium sweetness and a light to medium roasty bitterness that increases towards the finish. The flavor starts with sweet roasted malt, chocolate, brown sugar, some hazelnuts, sweet mild bourbon and hints of vanilla followed by more chocolate, hints of tobacco, light dark fruity notes, coffee, light burnt notes and burnt wood. Finishes with a medium roasty bitterness, some coffee and hints of chocolate. The coffee is very dominant, whereas the barrel notes are more in the background.

Aroma: 8
Appearance: 4 
Taste: 8
Palate: 4
Overall: 15

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 oz bottle. Aroma smells of bourbon and chocolate. Burnt motor oil in color. Really nice, can taste the coffee, chocolate, and bourbon. They all work together great. Rather thick and syrupy, nice sweet aftertaste. Excellent!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Holy hell. What a great stout.
Wonderful roasty, caramelly aroma. 
Pours rich, dark, creamy coffee head
Tastes malty caramally goodness.
A must try for any stout fan

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2015 edition, ABV 11,2%.
2020 edition, ABV 12,0%

An american, black Imperial Stout with chocolate and coffee and with very low, brown head, aged in oak bourbon barrels. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, bourbon, light prune, Taste is bitter sweet. Soft. Vineous.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Ha, this is a funny and amazing beer.
Not much (tan) head or retention, but big nose.
But what is it?
It's kind of a giant coffee and treacle chocolate tart. If such a thing were possible, this is what it would taste like.
It's delicious, but it's not beer.  What is it?
Amazing.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma: vanilla, coconut, oak wood, sweet notes of whiskey/bourbon, subdued notes of barrel, but you can feel that the beer was aged in barrels later, sweet coffee and milk chocolate. Very clean aroma, zero alcohol. Appearance: opaque black, very nice fine foam in the color of toffee, beautifully decorates the glass. Sweet, roasted, imperial classic in taste, awesome milk chocolate with vanilla and coconut, there is also a nutty note at the end. Very, very good beer. Perfectly composed, zero alcohol. Classic imperial Stout BA, no unwanted notes, aged and pampered. Palate: carbonation slightly too high, but only a little bit :) The texture is nice, but it could be a little more oily and full, but that's just nitpicking :) I recommend this beer, it came to me from the other end of the globe and it's very good that it happened :) 4.5/5.0 I am a fan of the classics and here I got it in an almost perfect execution. I recommend it to everyone!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma and taste of chocolate, coffee, forest berries and a little barrel.  Had expected/wished for more Bourbon in both aroma and taste. Good? Yes, but definitely an overrated barrel aged Imperial Stout. Hope we can get Founders Imperial Stout back here, IMO their best Stout.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Carbon black with thick beige foam. Smells of chocolate and coffee. The taste is very rich, sweet, chocolate and cream, syrup, molasses and dried fruit. The aftertaste is long with spicy, chocolaty notes, coffee, Irish coffee and baddare (the candy).

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
From LCBO, 330ml bottle.
 Appearance : Opaque black with a generous tan head.
 Aroma : Rich liquorice, wood, sweet and strong.
 Taste : The Bourbon is very present when fresh, a bit more blended after one or two years at the right cellar conditions.
 Palate : Rich and round.
 Overall : A perfect night cap that last a long time at room temperature.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. Pour is black with a dark chocolate head which leaves a long lasting lacing. Aroma is malt and whiskey. A thick and rich stout with tons of chocolate, coffee, molasses and whiskey flavors. A very nice tasting stout, would recommend to friends.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Had high expectations for this one based on the reviews. Ever so slightly disappointed. A bit one note, but that one note is good. I poured hard with this one. The result was a beautiful half head, half liquid beverage. The head looked like rich chocolate ice cream, the liquid looked like a dream cold brew coffee. Probably the best looking beer I've ever seen. Aroma is mostly bourbon with some nuttiness (probably the coffee). Taste was very much bourbon on bourbon. However, it's a bourbon with a lot of depth. Not enough coffee for my tastes. Aftertaste was more of the same but didn't hang around too long and wasn't too heavy on the tongue. Would be happy to pick this up again even though it's slightly overrated. 2019 is 12.2 ABV by the way!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: They need to put the abv on the bottle. Drank this after a couple of other beers and it messed me up pretty good.  Luckily I didnâ€™t have to drive!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle 35.5cl home. Vanilla, full and creamy, clear bourbon tones, bitters, roasted malts, laurel, dark red fruit, boozy, chocolate, caramel. Excellent. 4.95. (4-5-2019).

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
5/1/19
With A & Hannah having breakfast for dinner & chatting about the world all night :)

2018 bottle. Poured from bottle into my new KBS snifter. Big and dark as expected with a 1-finger brown head. 

Nose is huge coffee and with chocolate and subtle sweet undertones. 

Flavor is immense roasty dark chocolate with a big brown sugar bourbon kick and a touch of toasty coffee bitterness. 

Palate is thick, oily and super heavy. Amazingly smooth for a barrel-aged brew. Goes down easy. 

Overall, lucky getting a year-old bottle for some added smoothness but this is unbelievable. So much going on while still being delicious and drinkable. Prob my favorite BA stout!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a dark oil spill.  Immediate strong coffee with a slightly bitter chocolate taste.  I really like the bourbon at the back of the taste, it makes it a much smoother beer...not one that is overly bourbon flavor throughout.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Warka 2019-02-13. A revelation. The barrel gave back all the best. The barrel vanilla hits immediately. Smooth chocolate. A small minus is the slight noticeable alcohol. But after a while you can get used to it and like it. Worth every penny.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
The brown foam is persistent with medium bubbles
The color is deep black
On the nose we find mainly: Chocolate - Vanilla - Coffee with a slight hint of whisky
On the palate we find what the nose suggests by adding a woody note. The taste is persistent with a nice balance of sweetness/bitterness
A complex beer that knows how to be appreciated

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma mega sweet intense coffee nuts chocolate vanilla. Perfect. In taste the same enhanced whiskey, alcohol comes out but it is not too much. If it was a bit thicker it would be perfect for me

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours like ink with consistency of oil from a can; boozy oaky dark chocolate on the nose; complex rich palate with a finish that is everlasting!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 5oz stemless goblet at Lucky's Market. It poured opaque dark brown with weak beige foam. Very boozy stout, toasty, roasty, dark fruity, some coffee and vanilla as described, but the main impression is bourbon barrel aging traits. Over-the-top in every way, memorable, but not exactly enjoyable in a regular beer-drinking sense.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours from the bottle an opaque black-brown with a very fizzy tan head that fades to a thick coating and ultimately a rim. Faint, wet legs. Beautiful sweet aroma of bourbon, molasses and coffee. Warming brings out some chocolate.  Taste demonstrates an incredible depth of flavor. Bourbon, coffee, molasses, vanilla and chocolate - but not too sweet - and a well-roasted malty bitterness to close. Aftertaste is bourbon-inflected bitter malt. Not overly boozy, but packs a wallop. Dry finish; a bit cloying. An outstanding beer. I think the sweetness to bitterness balance is amazing.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Really great bourbon stout and I would put it up there among the best. Bourbon strong on the nose but not overly so. Lots of strong coffee and vanilla tones. Doesnâ€™t linger on the tongue too long, unlike other bourbon beers which can just sit. Highly recommended. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Jet black beer with a mild head. The beer should be taken from the bottle with a knife and fork. The chocolate and oak are already clearly visible in the aroma. The beer tastes very strongly of chocolate and coffee, and the alcohol also comes into play. In the background, the maturation in barrels can be tasted well.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Dark black beer with a small lasting beige head.
Tastes sweet, chocolade, toasted malts, vanilla, liquer, wood, bourbon. Nice.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Much better than the Canadian stout. Like the less sweet version of the CBS. Please seethe CBS rating for more detail on KBS.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle @ DÃ˜E tasting, No5, vintage 2016. Black w a small dark brown head. Aroma heavy malty (caramel, roasted, coffee, licorice, dark chocolate, bourbon barrel, dark fruit, a note of smoke). Flavor medium+ sweet, ending light bitter, well balanced, alcohol not present. Full body, almost oily, low carbonated.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Definitely not in the right state of mind to rate this brew. I had heard of this beer but I forgot it was so highly acclaimed. Just saw it at the grocery store, with no price tag, and went for a bottle..turned out to be $6 a bottle, not terrible if it is one of the best beers in the country. Aroma is rich rich coffee milk. Full bodied, creamy palate. Super rich creamy coffee flavor. Bourbon barrel aged aspect along with a strong alcohol presence, especially while rating from the fridge. Overall it's a boozy coffee brew. Super well crafted, rated from perspective of appreciation and not necessarlily enjoyment.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: When drinking this beer you feel the atmosphere of the States, the alcohol is a bit too emphasized, but I've drank more alcoholic ones.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a black that no light can get through. It has a dark brown head. The aroma is subtle dark chocolate and bourbon. The flavor is great, you get a lot of coffee, chocolate and bourbon. This definitely living up to the expectations

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Impenetrable black color, with a hazelnut colored foam, very fine and creamy, long lasting. On the nose very roasted, coffee, wood and ethyl warming with strong notes of bourbon. On the palate a lot of coffee, dark chocolate, more bourbon. Dense but not cloying body, low carbonation. Very pleasant and not too demanding to drink despite the 12.3 degrees. Excellent aftertaste, with a very long finish.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Inky black pour with a thick foamy tan head. Lovely nose of bittersweet dark chocolate mixed with a touch of coffee, coconut, and bourbon barrel. Big full flavor thatâ€™s dark and deep with suprisingly not too much sweetness...definitely a product of the pre-pastry stout age. Layered and complex flavor with tones of wood, coffee, cocoa, and bourbon that shine through independently yet also melange into a sublime balance. Dark with lingering woods slightly bourbonny warming finish.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: $6.20 bottle from Wine Warehouse. Hah, finally. Pours thick, black, small dark brown head. Lovely aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, barrel, tobacco, leather. Flavor is thick, strong... delicious. Dark chocolate, barrel, leather, tobacco, bourbon, coffee, raisin. Worth the hype.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Great stout!!! This the 2022 batch.  Dark brown with a 2cm head.  Chocolate and bourbon nose.  Malt and chocolate palate. Had it with ham, egg and cheese on everything bagel for breakfast.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Reviewed in 2014-  11.2% ABV -  Nice to have a neighbor who works at Total Wine & More.  This one sold out quick too, but I was fortunate enough to get a share.  Was about $6 for the single, so we figured for a bomber or 750ml actually priced about right.  I have had $3-$4 beers better than this, but not complaining as it's top quality.  Pretty much a bourbon aged imperial stout, but like the Founders regular breakfast stout, this feels somewhat lighter and is quite drinkable for 11%.  Alcohol partially hidden in the flavor, but is there for sure in the aroma.  Solid, well-balanced IPS.... barely living up to the hype though.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Pours a very dark caramel with a thick khaki head. Brown sugar sweet with a hint of cocoa nibs. Slight whiskey booziness. Perfectly well balanced between sweet and malty. My favorite barrel aged strong stout.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: My favorite. Great coffee notes with just the right amount of flavor from the BBA

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Almost black in color, opaque, topped with brown, fluffy foam. Medium high with negligible durability, melting creates a delicate ring.

A sweet, chocolatey coffee aroma, roasted with a distinct note of Bourbon. After gentle warming, licorice appears, some dark fruits.

Taste: there is chocolate, the bitter one, cocoa, pralines, licorice, burnt caramel, coffee. Of course, there are also slightly warming alcohol notes, which remind us that the beer matured in Bourbon barrels. Quite distinct bitterness, associated with both dark chocolate and bitter coffee.

As I mentioned earlier, alcohol gently warms the esophagus. Low carbonation, high fullness, the beer has a soft, smooth texture.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Gorgeous appearance, black with a creamy beige cap. Intense nose, just uncorked the scent of bursting coffee and cocoa, then toasted malt, vanilla, dark fruits and whiskey finish. It almost seems like you can smell a sweet tiramisu style. On the palate, a forceful but elegant entrance of barboun, then sweet, vanilla malt and milk cocoa. Always alcoholic finish and narrowing and bitter aftertaste with a decidedly warm aftertaste. The alcohol is felt throughout the drink which is pleasant, round, full-bodied and with a low carbonation. Bottle 2018.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Had on draught at UNOs.  Smells of coffee and deep roasted nuts.  Taste is extremely smooth - bourbon notes, coffee, chocolate, roast nuts, but blended together and velvety.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Wow. Beer from the absolute top shelf. Lots of fullness and flavour. Thoroughly delicious and inviting. Bought from Menu on Lyngbyvej, Kbh

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: On draft, 2018 vintage. Jet black with a tan head. Aroma of oak and vanilla. Rich mouthfeel with a full body. Sweetness from the barrel aging and the malt. Has a layer of roasted malt flavor in the middle. Finishes with a roasted malt bitterness and hint of sweetness that lingers. This is barrel aging done right. Excellent.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
-Non-STOUT lovers

Dark brown, thick-bodied wine with dense foam
Aroma: cappuccino, milk chocolate, bread crust, some vanilla
Concentrated American style in the mouth, dark chocolate, toffee, dark chocolate (85%) in the mouth
There is obvious sweetness, but it is well balanced with the bitterness of coffee without conflict, and the alcoholic taste is not strong.
The finish is long, dominated by the aroma of young spirits aged in bourbon barrels, and the burnt bitterness becomes fragrant and pleasant over time.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Draft at Omaha Tap House, Pepperwood. 2015 vintage. Poured black, minimal tan head. Aroma of bourbon, coffee, chocolate, barrel. Taste was syrup sweet, charred, barrel,  mild alcohol, creamy. Very nice.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle. Clear dark brown with a creamy light brown head that lasts and laces. Aromas of bourbon, roasted malt, coffee, wood, vanilla, dark fruit: prunes, figs, dates. Flavor is the same, sweet bourbon and vanilla upfront with some roastiness in the middle with the malt and coffee flavors and finishes with some dark fruit. Medium plus bodied, smooth with a dry, warm finish.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black beer, impenetrable, with a persistent cappuccino-colored foam. As soon as you open the bottle it releases an aroma of vanilla, then caramel, coffee and chocolate. In the mouth you can perceive all the aromas perceived by the nose

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: One of the finest, strong, bold, sticky, delicious. Definitely hunt down and try.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Great balanced beer. Lightly roasted coffee, vanilla and caramel. Marshmallow, light earthy hops. Alcohol well hidden.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle at home. Three year old. Pours a dark brown to black colour with a khaki head. Aroma of roasted malt, alcohol, oak, tobacco, dark chocolate and leather. Roasted flavour with more ash, dark chocolate, rye bread, oak, tobacco and leather. Has a silky mouth feel, full-bodied and light to medium bitterness. Tasteful and well roasted.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2019 release fresh from bottle. 

Almost no head tan color fine but long lasting

Very smooth and non cloying for heavy stout. 

Taste is slight bourbon with coffee chocolate coffee flavor is strongest in after taste and bitterness lingers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Bottle from the LCBO. Deep mahogany under a small dark brown head that fades slowly to a sheet, leaving tight lace. Nose has bourbon, coffee, wood, vanilla, dark chocolate, plum, anise and some molasses. Light+ sweet molasses with a medium- coffee bitterness along with some fruity tartness. Mouth is full and creamy with soft carbonation and a dry finish. Alcohol is definitely present but balanced with the rest of the huge character.

9/4/9+/4+/19

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Beer with an impenetrable black color like the night, topped by a beautiful mixed grain cappuccino colored foam. On the nose an explosion of roasted aromas from coffee to chocolate to burnt caramel to licorice, dried fruit (plums and walnuts) and a finish of woody vanilla and coconut notes certainly given by the aging in bourbon barrels. The beer on the palate is instead a riot of flavors, the entrance is sweet very chocolatey, with hints of coconut vanilla and coffee, then the flavor veers towards a sweet liqueur like Nocino (walnut liqueur) that warms and gives a warming effect, to close on the finish with a light bitter root like licorice that cleans and closes the sip. The carbonation is light and helps the drink. KBS is a cornerstone beer of the American giant Founders Brewing, despite its 12.3 vol % alcohol it is easy to drink. It's a tasty and never cloying beer that gradually warms up allowing each sip to have a different experience from the previous sip.
Hand grenade! ðŸºðŸ«â˜•ðŸ’£

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Big barrel flavours coming through with the vanilla and bourbon, rich and sweet, decadent!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottled 0,355L. Intence dark brown color, libely and crisp aspect with nut foamy head of medium duration. Strong and intence dark chocolate and vanilla aroma, notes of bitter cocoa, ashed malt, braced and roast sweet cereals. Smooth and creamy texture, medium prickly taste, very equilibrate and balanced overall impression. Long sweet and perfumed vanilla and dark/bitter chocolate mouth.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Date: 13.02.2019. Appearance: black, opaque, nice high brown foam, fine-bubbled. Aroma: sweet, chocolate, vanilla, coconut, pralines, somewhere in the back coffee, some marzipan and dark fruit notes (minimal). Taste: very chocolatey, in the type of chocolate 70%, vanilla, quite sweet, countered by medium coffee-chocolate roastiness, which together with vanilla settles on the palate. Somewhere towards the very end, unpleasant alcohol creeps in. Quite smooth, with medium body and low carbonation. Very good RIS tending towards sweetness rather than dryness.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Finally on tap at Conrads, the holy grail! Been on the hunt for years for this. For being barrel aged it goes down oh so smooth. Coffee , chocolate and a bit of vanilla. For 12.3 abv it is amazing how the flavor pops without the alchohol burn

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Aroma: coffee, chocolate fudge, vanilla, wood, toffee, alcohol.
Appearance: hazy, dark brown to almost black in color topped with a small long-lasting brown head. nice lacing. plenty of sediments at the bottom.
Taste: coffee, chocolate fudge, vanilla, wood, some toffee, some bourbon note in the finish, high sweetness, long medium-high bitterness.
Palate: full body, really viscous, minimal carbonation, boozy, mild dryness in the finish
Overall: This is a really decent imperial stout, featuring malty richness and roastiness which balance very well with vanilla and bourbon notes. Although not surprising, its flavor is rich, warming, and satisfying which all together make it a great reward after a day of hard work.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel, bourbon, vanilla, soy sauce and hints of liquorice and wood. Black with a brown head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Medium to full body with average carbonation. Dry finish. Overall a very nice Imperial Stotut. Well balanced with a plesant warmth.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottle 35.5cl. @home poured into a tulip glass. Pitch black, tall frothy tan head, good retention, heavy lacing; aroma roasted malt, cocoa, coffee, vanilla, wood, bourbon; retronasal vanilla; taste light heavy sweet and light to medium bitter, roasted malt, chocolate, black coffee, vanilla, licorice; lingering roasty sweetbitter aftertaste, woody, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla and woody notes; full-bodied, creamy to oily texture, soft carbonation; rich and well-balanced, top notch.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Black with a small head.Lovely complex flavour which involves coffee and chocolate with vanilla in the background.Strong but not overpowering presence of alcohol. Some wooden flavours in the background. Didn't want this one to finish. It covers the distance between being very good and outstanding very easily.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: My second favorite barrel aged beer. This beer has everything that is great about bourbon barrel beers. Chocolate, vanilla, fruity, awesomeness!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: A 12 fl. oz. bottle, bottled on 13th March 2018. Poured into a snifter glass. It was dark brown to black in colour with a half finger mocha brown head that dissipated fairly quickly, but left some nice lacing. Aromas were roasty, coffee, chocolate, bourbon, oak and a light caramel. Tastes of roasted malts, lots of rich dark chocolate, coffee, bourbon, oak, vanilla, light bitter finish. Creamy, smooth, full bodied with soft carbonation. Overall aroma wasnâ€™t as rich as the taste, but the taste was outstanding with the strong rich and smooth chocolate flavours. The coffee, bourbon and oak balanced it out very nicely, and it was just a great sipper for a cool winter (or air conditioned) night.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Aroma: chocolate, bitter, coffee, chocolate box, pralines, a bit of alcohol and vanilla
Appearance: black, nice creamy foam, nice liqueur
Taste: powerful bitter chocolate, chocolate box, a bit of vanilla, then pleasant chocolate box alcohol, bourbon, delicate coffee
Palate: dense, low-saturated, smooth, gently warming

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Simply the best Stout I've ever had. It's expensive here in Brazil, but I've had more than one and I intend to have more.

Very dark with medium-sized, dark brown foam. Excellent chocolate aroma, strong aroma that connotes alcohol presence, doing justice to the 12.4%.

Initially, the flavor is slightly sweet, with toasted malt and a strong flavor of chocolate and vanilla. Coffee also appears and a light fruity flavor that reminds me of coconut.

Very complex beer with
Toasted and long-lasting aftertaste.

Rating 10

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Appearance black with brown foam.  Aroma chocolate coffee smoke whiskey caramel Taste milk chocolate coffee nuts alcohol whiskey. Strong barrel character, good sweetness. Bottle of Cormorant, 33cl 12.3%

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Bottled on 02/13/2018, expiration 02/13/2019. Drunk on 02/15/2019. Imperial Stout with an impenetrable black color, pours a small amount of cappuccino-colored foam that quickly disappears. Intense notes of fruit in alcohol immediately emerge on the nose, followed by toasted malt, chocolate and coffee. The taste is very complex and well-balanced, notes of chocolate, vanilla, toasted malt. In the aftertaste, hints of coffee, spices and licorice emerge. Full and velvety mouthfeel, extremely pleasant. Important alcohol content but not at all invasive. Perfect.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
Drinking date: 2019.02.09
Drinking temperature: greater than or equal to refrigerator temperature

Style: Specialty Wood-Aged Beer/Imperial Stout

Alcohol content: 11.9%vol
Bottle date: 2016.12.02
Vintage: 2016

Aroma-9/12
Appearance-3/3
Flavor-15/20
Mouthfeel-4/5
Overall Impression-7/10
Total-38/50

Aroma: Very obvious dark chocolate flavor, definitely roasted and burnt, slightly vanilla, coffee sweetness, very slight alcohol. The aroma feels normal, and the spirits are not prominent.

Appearance: Dark brown-black opaque body, chroma of about 40+, slightly brown edges; head of wine is brown, medium thickness, fine foam, very similar to espresso, good durability, and good hanging cup.

Flavor: It tastes quite sweet at the entrance, just like milk chocolate and Black Forest cake. The caramel toffee flavor of dark malt and the nice creamy sweetness brought by bourbon barrels dominate, accompanied by some roasted flavors and burnt flavors of chocolate and coffee, but the roasted aroma is not obvious. There is a slight licorice flavor and medium bitterness in the middle section, a slight mellowness and roasted flavor at the end, and a light burnt acidity and hop wood bitterness in the aftertaste.

Taste: Medium to strong body, very sweet at the entrance, medium killing, and a certain alcohol stimulation.

Overall impression: A famous Bourbon barrel-flavored Imperial Stout, with chocolate and coffee added during brewing. The overall balance is relatively sweet, but not greasy, sweet and mellow, and still has a certain light texture. The bitterness is moderate, which plays a role in balancing the sweetness, and the alcohol taste is not too prominent, which sets off a certain spirit texture. The disadvantage is that although the flavor is enhanced, the aroma is relatively bland, which is within the normal range and there is nothing obvious. The result is that it is easy to drink, but it does not have the rich bitterness of dark chocolate. Is it possible that after two years of aging, the body of the wine has become mellow but the aroma has dissipated?

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review:
2020
Appearance: Black, opaque. Light brown, medium-high foam, mainly fine-bubble, falls after a while to a small ring, leaving a light lacing.

Aroma: Balanced, composed. At a medium-high level, dessert chocolate, cocoa, coffee, a box of chocolates with alcohol, nut wafers with noble alcohol and barrel-aged coconut. In the background, low molasses, dark sponge cake and cake, and a touch of vanilla and oak. In the background, subtle red currant and cranberry.

Taste: Pleasant coffee, Kopiko candies, and noble, although quite sharp alcohol at a medium-high level stand out, countered by the medium barrel-aged sweetness of coconut and a touch of vanilla. Then dessert and dark chocolate, cocoa, molasses, a box of chocolates, and nut wafers. In the background, a touch of red currant and cranberry. Semi-sweet in the mouth, medium body, medium-low carbonation. Medium-low bitterness, mainly alcohol with light bitter chocolate, short. Dry finish with distinct alcohol, alcohol bonbon and dessert chocolate. 

Overall: Pleasantly complex, but too high alcohol interferes, although noble, it is definitely too distinct and rough.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Outstanding imperial stout. The ABV is hidden very well. Do youself a favour and buy two bottles. Have one cold and have one off the shelf.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Rich aroma of roasted malt, raisin, chocolate and bourbon barrel. Amazing mouthfeel with delicate bubbles that compliment the slightly syrupy texture. Taste is an intriguing mix of sweet chocolate, vanilla, savoury barrel flavour with lingering boozy bourbon.

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: 12 fl oz bottle at Polar, Madrid. It pours dark brown, almost black, never shiny, with a tan foamy thick-lacing head. Aroma is very intense: milk chocolate, brownie, cola gummies, blackberry jelly, espresso. Mouth is thick, slick and brick. Good structure, as for a skyscraper. Veeer-r-ry bitter. Long-lingering, bitterish, with hints of choco milkshake. Nice, yo!

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Not for the faint of heart. However if you can handle the hardass first flavour, you will experience the most complex beer you will ever taste...wow

product_name: Founders KBS (Kentucky Breakfast Stout)ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Stout - Imperial Flavored / Pastry
product_review: Opaque black colour with medium brown foam with medium retention and abundant residue. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and wood with a background of toasted malts and a touch of bourbon. Flavour mainly of chocolate and bourbon, followed by coffee, burnt malt and notes of nuts such as walnuts, hazelnut or toasted almonds and vanilla. Constant background of liquor, with a bitter aftertaste of coffee and long-lasting dark chocolate. Texture between creamy and oily, dense body and medium carbonation. The classic of aged Imperial Stouts, well-deservedly famous and a real spectacle of flavour, aroma and intensity.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Dark red colour. Powerful honey blueberry aroma. MOderate sweet honey flavor with some blueberry notes. Long finish. Creamy palate.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

product_review: Tap@MBCC 2021, Copenhagen - dark red pour with almost no head. Sweet with notes of honey, caramel, sweet spices, medium body, white choc and berry fruity finish. Lovely.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Dark brown with slightly hazy blue tones. Smells like blueberries, vanilla and honey. Sweet. Blueberries, honey and some chocolate. Long sweet. (MBCC 2021)

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Taster at MBCC 21. Dark reddish brown with little head. Berries, sweetness, honey, super Smooth.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Tap at MBCC 2021, Copenhagen. Color is clear dark red with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries red berries, blue berries, honey....

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Tall thin Bottle ordered from the Meadery, I think.  Iâ€™ve also seen it at out of Barrel and a bottle shop in Redwood City.  Pour thick deep purple, almost black.  Concentrated blueberry syrup with some vanilla and some heavy phenolics, which I assume is some peculiar honey.  Tastes like tree of some sort, maybe Eucalyptus.  Very sweet, which is essentially why it is rated high.  A bit weird.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Loved blackberry and absolutely adore Strawberry.  Hoping this would rival Strawberry, and it didn't only cause that's an all time fave.  Pours like blueberry juice.  Mostly sweet with not much tart to cut it, jammy fruit, honey, white chocolate.  Smooth and warming.  Port like qualities abound.  4.5+

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
Batch 4. Cellared for multiple years.  

Aroma is blueberry and honey with faint chocolate and a port aspect in the back half.  Pours clear garnet with no head.

Taste is boozy and fruity.  Heavy on the blueberry with vanilla sweetness and coating mouthfeel.  Very sweet.  Rounded out nicely as it warmed.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: 500 ml corked. Aroma is blueberries, chocolate, honey, red wine. Pours still, a very dark purple hue--looks nearly black--with reddish-purple highlights. Taste is highly sweet, never cloying, moderately tart, with flavors like the aroma. The chocolate is pretty subtle, nearly buried by the blueberry and honey. Velvety mouthfeel, no carbonation. Delicious.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle at Levi's mead tasting. This was my favorite of the 4 Berry White's we sampled. Sweet, earthy blueberry, hints of chocolate. Crazy good.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Thanks to Tim for this taste. Thick and heavy. Sweet blueberry flavor, and blue erry win the aroma with honey. Excellent.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review: Bottle shared by Andrew, thanks! Pours a clear purple with a red hue with no head whatsoever. Aroma has sweet blueberry with a touch of sweet honey and a hint of tartness. Flavor has a nice honey and sweet blueberry combination and a hint of flora.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited

Less sweet and and less sour around the edges, just a tad muted down and it comes out much better.

product_review: Really dark red color. Aroma has jelly beans, mostly the ones with cola taste, berry jam and other dark fruits. Taste is sweet, tart, bitter, all flavors combined really well, fruity, intense with some liquorice on the finish. Syrupy, sticky feel.

product_name: Superstition Blue Berry WhiteðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸Mead - Melomel / Fruited
product_review:
